text:
No, no, no, no.....just no. My friend and I ordered the fried oysters, seafood gumbo, crawfish pasta and the soft-shelled crab to share. We ate as much as we could, left the restaurant full and satisfied, but then spent the rest of the night sick. Very sick. Like stay-in-the-bathroom-for-hours sick. I am afraid that every time I think about fried seafood, I'll remember this experience and then promptly throw up. 

Other than the raging sickness that descended on our trip, the restaurant was just OK. Service was friendly but awkward (why did we have three servers?) and the food was good but nothing special. We certainly had better gumbo and seafood at other points in our trip (this was a pre-food poisoning opinion).

I must agree with the other reviews here.  If this company isn't a scam, it sure conducts business as if it were a scam.  
I purchased travel insurance from this company when my son was studying in China.  He contracted a stomach virus and needed brief hospitalization. 
We filed the claim and waited... and waited....
I called them up after about 6 to 8 weeks to see what was going on.  I was told that the review was in process and should be done within a week.  So, I am waiting again
After two weeks with no word I call back and then was told that my claim hadn't been looked at yet.  The customer service rep found it and says, "Well, this documentation is in Chinese.  We'll have to get this translated before we can look at it."  And I remind him that he works for an International Travel Insurance company, which means that there's a good chance supporting documentation will be in another language.  (So, if I hadn't called my claim would still be sitting in a pending pile.  This is about 2 and a half months after I submitted it.)
So, the claim is sent to translation and processed and about 4 weeks later I get a letter in the mail denying my claim in total.  The reason given was that it was a "Pre-existing Condition".  This was a one-time stomach virus.
I sent in an appeal to this decision and waited....
Four weeks goes by with no response.  So I called today to see where it's at and am told that no one has even looked at it.  The CSR tells me that she's going to expedite the appeal and will get back to me in a week or so.  I'm not holding my breath.

Waited in the drive thru line for 26 minutes and ended up having to drive off so I wouldn't be late for work. Awful. I was excited to live close to a Steak n Shake but after that experience, I am bummed that they would open up without having all their stuff figured out. I'd rather just drive to the one in Murfreesboro.

Wow!  The quality of food has gone down and the service has bottomed out! What's happened? I went in with two gentlemen with special needs.  I'd hate to think that this was the cause for the poor service..  The server dropped off the food and only came back if we flagged her down.  Miraculously once the forks hit the plates, to indicate we were done our meal, she ran up with the checks. We asked for boxes for the remaining food.. she ran off before we could ask for refills for our drinks.  Came back with ONE box and no bag.  We flag her down for the drinks. "Do you want those to go?"  First  time she actually asked us something since the food hit the table...  no,'how is your food?' No,"would you like anything else?' No, "Would you like a dessert?"  We ordered dessert....after we flagged her down again.  Same "Do you want the to go?"  My friend finally asked, "Do we have to leave?"  I mean damn!

Okay so then the server did not create a new check as we asked and just added it to one of the gentleman's checks.. we asked her to fix it.  She didn't. We go to pay and the gentleman was over charged.  The General Manger was called to try to fix the error and had a disgusted tone to his voice... and he turned out to not ask questions either... hmmm..  Crappy service and the quality of the food no longer supports the prices...  I'm truly disappointed since I used to enjoy this place.

Will NEVER go back! Myself and 2 of my co workers went after work. We each got an appetizer and wanted to just talk and relax. After we finished eating in within about 10 minutes, the waiter asked us to leave!!!! Yes, asked us to leave. It was 3pm in the afternoon, there was no wait. He suggested we "finish our talks at the bar." I am 7 months pregnant. Wow, I was floored. Shared my expereince with management, they didn't care. Was quite insulting considering the group of ladies next to us were there much longer than we were. Very rude servers!

This restaurant used to be good, but it has gone really really far downhill. The food tasted like they are serving semi-spoiled food that may have been cooked hours or days before. I actually feel physically ill and I think the health department should check this place out. My brothers food was dripping with orange grease, it was an omelet. I ordered the Toad in the Hole sandwich, which I used to love, and I had to take off the tomatoes and avocado. The tomatoes had white spots all over them and were yellow in the middle; they looked like they were maybe a day from being rotten, if not already. The avocado was covered in brown- grey spots. I honestly wanted to throw up after eating it. All in all, I would never recommend this restaurant to anyone. I don't know how it has managed to stay in business this long, and it does not deserve to stay in business. Next time you want to eat out, go somewhere else instead.

I've only gone to this Walgreens a few times. The employees seemed fine, however the Pharmacists were nasty, mean, inconsiderate and NOT VERY HELPFUL! I HAD to go there a couple of times, NO option, NEVER AGAIN. There is NO reason to speak to a customer in such a degrading way. I don't know what was going on during those months, but NEVER EVER, EVER, EVER AGAIN will I go to that pharmacy. I will change from Walgreens to CVS, Walmart, Schnucks, anywhere, there are so many that I do not need to stay with this pharmacy and no need to put up with someone's need to be disrespectful to a PAYING CUSTOMER. What these people in NEED OF POWER do not realize is that I, THE GENERAL PUBLIC IS PAYING THEIR WAGES. And if enough of me say something, that pharmacist will no longer have a paycheck. So, please be nice and have some respect for people who are paying your wages. Stop being a jerk and get off your high horse.  Two stars for the poor employees at the front desk for having to put up with the check out jerks at the pharmacy and the pharmacists who deserve NO STARS.

I used to really enjoy this place...before the high class makeover. Now they're just too good for their own good. 

We stopped by today for brunch on our way to McCall. I ordered some coffee (drip) and a slice of quiche. The coffee handed to me was luke-warm. The quiche was not even luke-warm...yet they asked me if I wanted it "heated"..."Yes, please."

To top it off, we changed our mind and ended up on the outdoor patio in spite of the fact that we ordered our food to go. They made a point to tell us "the patio is for full service customers." OK, I guess the 10% tip I left them for handing me a box wasn't good enough for the patio?

Still, I'll give them 2 stars for their location and patio. You'll just have to endure the food to get to the good stuff.

My usual Cpap supplier was absorbed by Versus. They have been absolutely horrible to deal with. Me and my husband needed the supplies we were do for the month and they are trying to send us all the supplies for a three month period. Our insurance only covers certain products per month, per 3 months, per 6 months. They kept transferring me from sales to billing then billing to sales and back and forth having to explain my story each time. I was simply due an amera view cushion and disposable filters which cost me $12.16 with insurance last month they were trying to get me pay $212+. Come to find out they had not even run it through my insurance yet. This was all over 3 different calls. So very upset and frustrated. Going to find new supplier. Update: After looking at mine and my husband's EOB from Insurance Verus had over billed us both. It it took 2 months and numerous calls to get a refund. All started first of July They said check had been sent in August then in September oh check has been on managers desk to sign. Got my husband's refund of $107 still waiting on my portion. Don't do business with this company

On April 6 I called Progressive Ins  to advise them of damages cause to my vehicle while in a parking lot on April 1, 2018. I was assigned a a adjuster. Then reassigned again to Johnathan and have correspondence with him several times but four to time restriction he  schedule and inspection with Benton who after looking at my car and leaving a message that the vehicle is a total loss, but not returning my calls. So later I receive a call from Juan and he advises me of vehicle was deemed a total loss and I would be getting the amount less the deductible. Advised of all the information he needs and next day all the paperwork. Then Benton calls me after the fact telling me that I will get a call from Juan. I advised him  I talked to Juan signed the paperwork and awaiting my check. He (Benton)was a terrible communicator throughout the process. Juan after I became frustrated he made it right.
If you want to listen to a 50 year old bum sexually harassing his employees this is where you should go.  Ask for Billy, he'll talk down to any women in there.

Rarely do I ever regret eating. Out of five people eating, nobody was very excited about the food they received. On a positive note the bloody Mary was excellent.
Brunch, is not super difficult to cook. Maybe the dishwasher was the only one in the kitchen, and he had to prepare all the meals. If that's the case hi 5 dish guy.

Maybe their food is great, but I'll never know. DO NOT USE DELIVERY. I ordered through their chosen app, Eat24. Apparently the restaurant never confirmed the order, so while I sat waiting for my order for over an hour, the restaurant never made the order. I was not contacted by either Eat24 (until well past the delivery time) or the restaurant (never contacted). So while I tried to figure out what was going on, the Eat24 people were impossible to get in touch with (sat on hold for 20+ minutes, messaged, texted, emailed, no response), the restaurant itself put me on hold and never got back to me. So, over an hour later, it's 9 PM and past the delivery times for most restaurants in the area. So much for an easy dinner.

If the service was substandard and I give a tip according to the service, that's my prerogative. When the manager stops  me and my friend before we leave and harasses me about the tip that I gave AND accuses my friend of not leaving a tip, that's a problem! I'm appalled at this behavior. By the way, my friend gave a tip and so did I. Her name was Na, she said that she was the manager and she approached us initially soliciting feedback about why I gave a small tip. I told her the woman was inattentive. She went to say that the tip that I gave was not equivalent to the service that I received. Obviously, she didn't know what inattentive meant AND she was just harassing us about this tip that I gave. The young lady guided me to the chair for my pedicure and I got services that cost $100 and so did my friend. She treated me to the outing. So when I put my feet in the sink, the water was too hot. She proceeded to turn on the cooler water and me and my friend were chatting, excited about sharing this experience. I noticed that the sink was filling up, but I thought the woman was paying attention. Needless to say the sink overflowed with my feet still in the sink. (Inattentive) A lot of the workers ran over with towels to clean up the water which spilled on the floor. She didn't engage me in any conversation at all, maybe she didn't speak English. Not sure, but I've had better service elsewhere. I really didn't appreciate the harassment of the lady named NA who said that she was the manager. That's just not cool, at all!
Came here for happy hour on cinco de mayo with friends. Workers honestly seemed annoyed at us and rude. We asked them multiple times if they were mad at us. Don't know if I would return.

I was looking forward to trying Blake's, so I stopped in with my parents for lunch. It wasn't prime time, but there was no one there, so that wasn't a great sign. I ordered a green chile lotaburger and onion rings.

I was really disappointed in the burger. I got a single patty and maybe I should've gotten a double. The patty was thin and dry, not much meat on the burger at all. The bun was huge, way too much bread. They were generous with the toppings, but a burger should feature the meat. The green chiles had a nice kick. And the onion rings were decent. Three burgers, two drinks, and two orders of rings was just over $20. Maybe a tad pricey considering the drinks and rings were size small, and my mom got the little (itsa) burger.

No issues with the service. It was okay, not especially friendly. No real response from the cashier when we mentioned it was our first time either. If I come back, I may try the breakfast burritos and hope they're better than the burger.

Had a bad experience with my wax on Tuesday with Mirna. I had a Brazilian was and she kept going over the same spots with more wax. This was my first wax back since I had to stop for a few months and I was expecting pain but I was not expecting someone to apply wax over areas where the hair has already been pulled. I've been going here for about a year and this has been the worst. Do not get a wax with her. Ask for Alicia!

Hubs and I chose this place because it popped up on a YELP list of best places to watch football. YELP is absolutely WRONG about this. Walked in at noon on NFL Sunday, and two of the three bar big screens were tuned to soccer, one of the ancillary screens is tuned to soccer, and one of the ancillary screens is tuned to women's collegiate volleyball. The few screens tuned to football were tuned to the Titans, and I totally get that in Nashville, but when our server asked what game we wanted because she was willing to change the screen from volleyball, she said they couldn't do it because they don't have Sunday Ticket. This absolutely disqualifies Burger Republic as a football watching bar. Also, just putting a bunch of screens up around the place doesn't qualify it as a sports bar. Sight lines are important. Food was solid. Service was acceptable. But don't go here thinking you're going to watch football.
Terrible service waited 15 mins before a server even came over to take our drink order. Then additional 10 mins just to get our drinks. The place was not busy either.
The Naan was super dry. The chicken masala was mediocre. Definitely not recommended given the high rating it currently has. The delivery service was ok.
Bad customer service and employees very rude and not seem to be familiar with there schedule got the at 8pm and online said it was closed at 9 and told us we were to late.

I never write a review but I felt compelled to write this. Bar was not stocked. We waited over 20 minutes for our drinks. When drinks came they were not made correctly. Bathroom was filthy. Food was delicious.

It's nice to have a shower and a free bar but the breakfast food is SHIT here. 
Staff is friendly. Decor is pleasing. Coffee machine is good WHEN IT ACTUALLY WORKS...
Very change resistant feel bland food the waiter telling each other the fuck off make for a wonderful atmosphere  one and done well not go back
The service was terrible. The food was cold and late. It's not the waiters' fault- it's the kitchens disorganization.

My husband's family has shopped here for 15+ years. My husband and I recently moved into the area and would rather give a family owned store our business. I have called twice (out of respect) to order their meat special. I called both times early in the morning and said I'd like to come pick up later in the day when it is ready. Whoever answers the phone, (seems like the same lady) makes me feel like it is a burden to order from them. She states their so busy they probably won't be able to get to it today. I understand your busy making food for businesses but then don't sell to the public. The lack of costumer service is disgraceful. I was only trying to help a business out but I see my business is not wanted nor needed. I will not return.

We came during a busy weekend of Essence Festival. There as no hostess to greet the many people waiting at the entrance. The manager was very rude to the customers who tried to explain who was next in line. The waiting list was not updated and several guest left. The food was good but the experience was less tasty

Hostess was unenthused about her job. With plenty of open tables our party of 5 was seated at a "pew style" corner booth meant for 4. Our additional person sat on the end of the table. Drinks took 10 mins after we sat down and a basket of bread was offered 1/2 way through the meal... thanks but no thanks! Tiramisu Martini without the Lady Finger left the drink "undressed" and disappointing. The waitress took our food order but didn't deliver to the table the items she wrote down. Service was slow and unattentative. No meatball with my tortellini... and no apology for it. Chicken and Pesto special was greasy with oil floating on top. Chicken Marsala is fried and very untasty. Italian restaurant without Tiramisu as a dessert.... should've been a sign the experience would be poor. Before departing a lack luster lunch, we visited the ladies room. Passing 4 employees hanging around chatting no surprise to find 2 out of 4 stalls without paper and stuff on the floor. Skip this location unless you like your spaghetti without balls!

Ray-Bans got butchered.  A pair of Wayfarer sunglasses had a clean break at the hinge.  I brought them in for repair.  The frames are melted where he attempted to reattach the hinge, and the repair isn't flush.

This is the worst tasted indian food.. they charge whole lot of money for nothing...went to celebrate my wife's birthday on Wednesday dinner. It was buffet dinner night.   They didn't have Manchurian for Manchurian dish...the taste was pathetic. Anyone who know what real indian food is, they will should avoid this place.

I've been to Bridgestone arena before and knew it would be a special experience for my daughter! So I sent my 8 year old on a fun trip to watch a Preds game with her cousins. She was so excited to go to her first hockey game!! I packed her bag (small backpack because a little girl can't remember to keep a purse on her shoulder... and frankly purses are uncomfortable) with her wallet, extra sweaters, chapstick and a pair of p.j.s just in case the game ended late. When she finally got there her aunt sent me a very happy picture of her before entering. Now once she got in was an entirely different story. At the entrance she was asked to empty her bag and throw it away. They did tell my 8 year old who was now sobbing that she could walk it all the way back to the car and come back... how nice. However, that's unrealistic for a child who has hip problems to make the treck once. It was either she throw the bag away or go home (there were 4 other kids with her so home wasn't an option). So, a very sad little girl threw her bag away and sat at a Preds game with her belongings spilling over in her lap. 

Lastly, If she brought a purse she could have walked it in. I think it's a little unfair to boys/men who wouldn't carry a purse. I think your policy is very one sided and could use relooking at. Either you make it an all around fair policy of no bags or you check bags better. There is no reason for anyone to throw their belonging away especially if it's not on your policy online! Very disappointed in how you handled things.

Walked in with 3 others in my party. Place wasn't busy at all maybe two other tables and now I see why. Food was not fresh even though we were the only ones there. Did take a long time to get it so maybe it just sat under a heat lamp and wasn't microwaved like we believed it to be. 2 out if the 4 of us got very sick

One word HORRIBLE!!!
As locals we are always looking for a new place to eat. Found this place and seeing it was pretty affordable, decided to give it a try.

The waitress was very sweet and attentive, but the food was horrible. 
We ordered the falafel appetizer and 2 sandwiches. Falafel tasted a little burnt, but ok. The sandwiches were pathetic. there were maybe 3 pieces of meat in them and barely any vegs. The flavor was mediocre and not much flavor. We ended up having to order another appetizer to fill us up.

The kicker.... while we were eating my husband saw a rat run up a pipe in the kitchen. We told the waitress and got a half assed sorry and she walked away.  No manager came to the table to apologize or order any type of discount. In fact they kept looking at us, but never approached the table.

I will never go back and will be sure to advise anyone thinking of going to stay away.
My sales clerk was rude, condescending and unhelpful.  Will not be returning.

Their delivery guy refused to drop off my order (even just at my hotel lobby) and expected me to find him in traffic.  What a joke this place is.  I tip the guy 20% and he expects me to run out into traffic to find him because he doesn't want to park, lol.
窗外施工吵了一夜难以入睡，没见过酒店这样的，和前台说了说和老板联系了，他也没办法。度假酒店这种体验也是呵呵了，一晚没睡，好心情全没有了。来的时候看见路边有挖掘机，没有开动，还傻傻的想是法制社会不会半夜施工扰民，结果TM整夜被吵到崩溃。活久见啊。问题是路已经挖开，挖掘机半夜施工估计不是第一天了，老板和前台不会是才知道。我要是提前知道这么吵，绝对不会入住这家。

Just to serve you man the fish hogie I had they put no effort to it fish taste like nothing the bread waz not fresh tomatoes taste old and the fries waz not cooked all the way threw waste of 9.18 Dnt get me wrong they used to b good but idk what happened am NT the 1 too put dwn black owned businesses put yall have 2 take pride in what yall serve us

I work in the area and BLVD has been our go-to spot for drinks after work for years. Recently, the quality of the food has tanked badly. Even the truffle fries aren't good anymore. And, on numerous occasions, we've sat down for a drink and a bite and been told 5 minutes later that it is "last call" -- I understand places may need to close early when there's not a lot of business, but BLVD's "last call" can vary from 8:30 p.m. to 9:30 p.m to 10:30 p.m. We've discovered you have to ask how soon they plan to close since it can be so random (and they won't tell you unless you ask). Last week, we asked before we sat down and the server said they'd be open another hour. Then, she was cut and the bartender "took over" our table. You guessed it: 5 minutes later: "Last Call." We asked if that meant last call for the kitchen or the bar. He said "both." So, we ordered a bottle of wine (there were 4 of us). He replied, "I said you could have one drink. I'm not opening a bottle." I reminded him that there are 4 glasses in a bottle -- and that TN law allows us to cork the bottle and take it with us. He was pissed. But, he brought the bottle, poured 4 small glasses and recorked it so tightly that we couldn't top off our glasses. Passive aggressive. Rude. I've given the Myint family my business for more than 20 years. Not any more.

I have gone out of my way to come here at least weekly. I went last week and ordered soup. There was something wrong with it. It wasn't the soup they have had in the past. It was grey and mostly salt with no other discernible spice. When I returned it they suggested that it was too spicy for me as though that was the problem. 
I loved this place but will no longer go because I truly believe there was something very much strange about the soup and possibly the salt was to cover up something dangerous.
Also, i don't know if the owners or manager changed but the people in the front are definitely not people I have ever seen there before.  I wonder if that's the problem. Do not trust.

Pretty quick delivery and food is always SO hot which is a plus! But I must say, food is a hit or miss. Fried chicken wings have some kind of cinnamon taste SOMETIMES, which is a shame because it's one of my favorite items from a Chinese restaurant. I've called and asked what seasoning they use but due to the language barrier, no success. 
I had my stepdaughter over and I promised her how good the food was..WELL, $30 later it was a miss of the night. She didn't eat her shrimp and broccoli and my daughter didn't eat her boneless spare ribs and I didn't eat mine. The ribs even had a cinnamon taste. I love this place sometimes but when it's bad, it's bad and it'll force me to try a new place now. It's too much money to have such bad food, all combinations went in the garbage. On to try a new Chinese restaurant.

Idk if they got a new cook or what but a couple months ago the food was absolutely amazing . Went recently and it was terrible. Rude waitress, gave her a 2 dollar tip because that's all she deserved. Everyone else was just sitting around laughing and joking like they weren't at work. 

Only good thing is we were seated quickly‍

This place was extremely busy for brunch on a Sunday.... we ended up waiting an hour to be sat. At the hour mark I almost suggested going somewhere else to eat but then the manager brought out samples of the "white trash hash browns". That made the wait a little more bearable. The food was good but wasn't as hot I it should have been. I would definitely not recommend waiting over an hour for the food from this place.

If I could give negative stars I would. I hired then to pack a UHaul box. I was guaranteed I would be sent movers who were experienced. I got two who had no idea what to do. I had blankets and cardboard to protect my wood furniture. They pretended to use it but did not. Upon arrival in Denver I hired college hunks there to unpack. They were horrified. All my wood furniture was damaged most completed. The blankets were just thrown in. Nothing was wrapped no card board used. Metal was jammed into my wood dining set and bedroom furniture. I tried to watch but they packed it in such a way I could not adequately check. Nor should I have to. Ruined $2700 worth of furniture. Worst part the insurance claims service is a bigger nightmare. 4 months later and they have done literally nothing. I told them both I was filing a lawsuit today. The claims processing servers told me to go away and deal with the mover directly. This college  hunks location could not care less. Never use them. Ever. You will regret it. Finally the move was done so quickly it took an hour but I had to pay for two hours. This place does not care about you. At all. Go elsewhere.

I am giving one star in order to call attention to this review. Because we live one block south of Fort Lowell and Winterhaven, every year we hear and see all the people searching for parking spaces on what are normally quiet side streets not designed to handle excessive human and automobile traffic.  
After parking, scores of people walk down THE MIDDLE OF THE STREETS on their way to the see the lights, oblivious to traffic.
PLEASE, CARRY A LIGHT. It is hazardous not to do so. PLEASE, WEAR LIGHT-COLORED CLOTHES.
The vast majority of people are conscientious about not blocking driveways when parking, but last night someone blocked ours. This is maddening, especially after I spent another anxious day visiting my mother in the hospital. 
Also, thank you to those who haven't (and will not) toss empty cups and other trash on the streets.
The Golden Rule will make everyone's visit shine like the holiday lights you come to visit. Merry Christmas, and PLEASE BE SAFE!

-Your Neighbor

My first visit was Friday 2/16/18 at Philly's 16th St. location. First impression was how messy and un-organized the prep-station was and how the employees on the food line made the food look sloppy. The young lady who made my to-go order, slopped so much juice from the condiments in my pita that it turned soggy. I just ate the filling. So I decided to try again the following week. I ordered, to-go, a salad bowl. There were 2 employees on the line. I noticed one young lady looking upset as she slopped food into the bowl of a customer before me and after she waited on that customer she left the other employee alone on the food line. So, the other employee was rushing and I didn't get the chance to get everything I wanted in my salad. The tahini sauce on my salad was so watery it looked like dirty dish water, my salad was horrible and cost me $9.67. I will not be going back. They need to re-staff, train and manage on-site.

A lot has changed since my 1st review back in 2015. A place that was always surrounded by a team of happy and smiling workers serving tasty food, has now transformed into workers who act annoyed to be there and treat us (the customers), like we are an inconvenience to them and serve not so great food. Their closing times are NEVER consistent. They basically close whenever they want! The last few times we have dined in on a weekday (hours before their new closing time of 8pm), where after receiving our meals we noticed they locked the doors. It was obvious because they only had 1 or 2 tables of customers they wanted to close early. Then we have to rush eat our food and take the rest home, because all the help were eyeing us down. They also now do this with "Takeout'. We will call to place a "pickup/takeout" order (so it's not like they don't know we are coming), when I show up around/or before 7pm and the door is locked. After knocking several times they finally come to the door to let me in, never apologizing for the inconvenience or how they got the order wrong. Then have the nerve to ask several times if/what I want to leave as a tip just for picking up "Takeout". Never heard of leaving a TIP for "Takeout" before, wow! It's obvious the workers, have completely lost their passion for the place and compassion they used to show in their food and show their customers.

We went here on a whim, because we needed to go to Target nearby and we were in the mood for Italian. On a Monday night (this was New Years Day), they were surprisingly busy. We were told the wait would be 10 minutes. Not too long of a wait; I figured I could distract my toddler for 10 minutes until we got seated and the bread basket was put in front of him.

The wait seemed a lot longer than 10 minutes. I wish I took note of the actual wait length.

I was also surprised to see that about 1/3 of the tables were empty despite the wait time.

We were seated and we ordered an appetizer and my son's meal right away. After we got our appetizer (buratta mozzarella with tomatoes, basil and onions) and our salads, we ordered our dinners (both pasta/seafood dishes). We dug into the bread basket and immediately asked for more, because my son likes to eat carbs by the fistful, and frankly I'll do just about anything to keep him happy towards the end of his day while we're trying to dine out.

Welp, things were ok until then. It took quite a long time to get our second bread basket. My son started flipping out so I took him out of the restaurant so we didn't disturb other patrons. (I realize this has nothing to do with the actual restaurant but it's still relevant.)

Right before I took my screaming son out, I told my boyfriend to ask the waitress to pack up our food to go so we could get out of there ASAP. Well, maybe a half an hour later we got our food and our check so we could leave. They kindly threw in extra salads.

We got home and I was so excited to dig into the real dinner (after putting the monster to bed). Dinner was good, but by no means was it great. I got the seafood alfredo, and my boyfriend got shrimp/scallop a la vodka. Neither of our dishes had enough sauce; both sauces seemed runny and just pooled at the bottom of our takeout containers.

Between the meh pasta dishes, the fact that my son's kid's ravioli had 5 ravioli in it (for $7, I believe...), and the incredibly slow service, we will not be going back.

Terrible customer service. I could feel the thickness of bad attitude immediately. It was cold out & I needed a warm place to wait for my Lyft sooooooo.....I waited in the non-existent line for one of the 3 non-busy employees to acknowledge me. I ordered a Pike because I didn't twist then to craft my usual espresso with care. The young man placed my coffee on the counter & walked away. 

I had to ask him, "Excuse me, are you ready for me to scan?" 

Nonverbal gesture of a head nod was given. 

I scanned and walked away disgusted. 

Counter, nasty. Floors, nasty, display case, nasty. Service, nastier. 

~Christy

I must have accidentally deleted my original review from a few years ago. Anyway, I gave it 4 Stars because it was pretty good. They used freshly brewed tea, and the drinks were usually on point. Then came the change of ownership. I have been back several times in the past 6 months, but never again. The last couple times I went, they didn't even bother to turn on half the lights, even though it was during business hours. There are usually only one or two employees, and even though the place is empty, nobody greets me when I walk in. They are usually sitting at a side table and look annoyed that I interrupted whatever they were doing on their laptops. The quality of their drinks have gone down as well. The tea always tastes watery and has no flavor. I even asked for no ice one time, and it still tasted like tinted water!  I mentioned it to the guy working, he said it was because they switched brands of tea or something like that. I asked if they could make something else, but he said "it would probably be the same, but I can remake it if you really want me to". I did. So he did. And it did. Still taste exactly like tinted water that is. Well, that was the last straw. Literally. The good news is that there are more boba places popping up in Tucson, so there is no need to cry over spilled boba.

As a local and ex employee I've always enjoyed going to tabu. Well until last week when a bartender kept taking my money off the bar pocketing portions of it. When I called him out he apologized and still did not return my money. As I returned last night after a long shift to sit back and enjoy a cocktail I was greeted by the manager who stated I had an outstanding tab. 1st, I never run tabs and only pay with cash. 2nd when I tried to explain how my money was taken and I was being double charged I was called several vulgarities, an asshole and that I was no longer to return. I was horribly embarrassed so I turned and walked away as I'm very non confrontational. On my way out this manager even crumbled paper and threw it at me. As a respected business owner myself I've never been treated this way as I'd never treat anyone this way especially a good paying customer. I'll spend my money at the nicer bars this great city has to offer. I'd highly recommend you do the same and save yourself from the nonsense and horrible, unappreciative attitudes. So long tabu.

Okay, I want to begin by saying the waitress and host were extremely nice, honest and good people.

That said, they were out of coffee cups, but they weren't busy... Many open tables.  After an extended wait for my morning coffee they finally brought it over in "to go" cups.

Along with curdled cream...

My wife got a patty melt. Instead of American cheese asked for cheddar.  When they delivered the food there was no cheese.

When it was brought back there was only a trickle of cheese dropped.  The bread was a soggy, awful mess.  Only five pieces of onion (small pieces) and the patty itself looked like it came off the kids menu, especially since the soggy bread was full size and made the patty appear even smaller.

The fries smelled of fish.  No, I'm not kidding.  Time to change the oil in the kitchen, I think.

As for my omelette, well, I can honestly say my high school cafeteria made better. 

I asked for bacon, mushroom, sausage and cheddar.  I think there was a half slice of bacon, the mushrooms were... Odd.  Cooked, but they seemed marinated in something that didn't go along with a breakfast menu.

The home style potatoes served with it, well, flavorless would be a step up.

In short, terrible, terrible meal.

Can honestly say this was both my first and last time here.

I went in and ordered a chicken Caesar salad to go and was not very pleased. I should have ordered the dressing on the side but i did not think they would put THAT much dressing on the salad. It was completely drenched and soggy and i opened it just a few minutes after getting it so it wasn't sitting for long. I couldn't eat it because the dressing was just taking over the whole salad and it did not taste good.

Dont come here if your gay or gay friendly.....they dont give me enough space to explain the injustice we were shown tonight. We were asked to be quiet or leave the comedy club...and we were not being disrespectful nor different than any one else.....im so upset since there was 8 of us there for the thanksgiving holiday.guest services argued with my Grandmother..my grandmother who is 62 years old who suggested the resort.... we will NEVER come her again #gaypride #ellendegeneres #rainbowpride #onelove #nolove #nolovegrandsierraresort #lexnightclub #nealpatrickharris

We went there after a movie the other night.  The fillings weren't bad, but the crepes were way undercooked - just warmed up enough to hold them together.  One of our party got very sick a couple of hours afterward.  It took her 2 days to get over it.  Virtually raw eggs in undercooked crepe?  It seems possible.

I have had a great experience here in the past but today I had a technician who made two of my nails bleed while cutting my cuticles. The application of polish was sloppy and so she used the cuticle cutter again to try to remove the excess polish at the end of my finger but caught too much skin while doing so. They told me that "sometimes people's cuticles bleed" but I have never had this happen in the couple of years that I've been getting my nails done. They did have me pay the cost of a color change instead of a full gel manicure but it was not a pleasant experience.

We are disappointed by our experience with United Van Lines. It took three weeks just to get a quote. We did a virtual survey and sent them pictures of what we wanted to move, and in the end they said they cannot help us move. We contacted them in May for moving ANYTIME in July, but they cannot find any movers until August. Also, we waited more than an hour for the virtual survey appointment to begin, and the agent never apologized for being late. The process dragged on for so long that we started to suspect that they did not want to help us move, even though the agent was polite and friendly over email. United Van Lines is NOT accredited by the Better Business Bureau, and now we know why. We do not recommend going with this company for your move.

Went there on Saturday night around 8:30pm, was not busy at all. We got seated then the waitress came and not even a greeting she just asked for our order right away. 
She brought the food to our table and I had to get up and go ask for the spices (chilis, salsa, etc.) 
During our meal a couple get in to the restaurant and there were told it was closed and it was like 9pm when they advertise they close at 9:30pm. Then a group of 4 came in and the same. 
They never ask how was our dinner they never refilled our drinks. 
Food was Ok SERVICE SUCKS!!!

Worst experience of my life. My bathroom was down the hall from my room and it flooded while my gf and I were there. When I went to tell the front desk they said they would send someone to fix it (never did went the weekend with out a shower and a soaked bathroom) and the TV in my room didn't work. Both occasions of asking the front desk to change rooms they were extremely rude and refused based on policy. I used to work for Hilton and I'm fully aware that was a line of lies. Not only is the staff unhelpful but you can hear through every wall and forget it if you have a wheel chair or a baby. Considering there's one elevator and your lucky if you can fit through it. I don't know how this building is allowed to be a business they should shut it down. If you're looking for the nightmare hotel in all the commercials this is it!!!!!!

Okay, LAWD JESUS where to start where to start..

It was a family members birthday and we decided to go to islands! We were a group of 15 and they were pretty accommodating, so that was nice.

As we waited to be seated, some of us were at the bar ordering drinks before dinner. I ordered 2 DBAs, and a tequila soda with lime. Got the check.. and WHAT the actual F?  $37.00?!?!? I tipped 3 dollars for a total of 40 dollars for 3 drinks! Oh hellll to the no. 

I also noticed on a sign that DBA is on happy hour for 3.50 each..so IF I am correct. 2 DBAs = $7.00. So I'm guessing my tequila soda was 30 dollars. Fair enough. ‍

When the bartender finally came around, I asked why my three drinks came out to $37.00 he said, "I'm not sure actually." Gave me and itemized receipt with the "correct," amount of now 27 dollars. Which technically is still 9 dollars per drink..still not right... I look a little closer and.. they had charged me extra tequila! 7 dollars more to be exact. Asked the bartender again.. and again he says he doesn't know why. He then figures it out, hands me a receipt for 18.00 which seems right. Perfect. 

We sit down, food comes out fast, which is great. My girlfriend sitting next to me asks me if my burger tastes weird, I said no but she asked me to try hers. The bun on her burger didn't taste right, so she requested a new one. Waiter asked what was wrong with it, and immediately got her a new plate of food. Another waiter came up and asked her what was wrong with it, and she apologizes and says her food will be out shortly. THEN a manager comes out, asks her AGAIN what was wrong with her food, she then replies, if you must know, "the bun tastes a little plastic-y," which then the manager replies, "DOES ANY ONE ELSES TASTE LIKE PLASTIC?" Way to embarrass her! Funny enough, she owns a food business in the Santa Barbara area. I just found that so Incredibly rude. 

This was a Friday, it's now a Tuesday and my refund is not in my account. I honestly don't care to deal with it, or go back. I'll just walk over to habit down the block if I'm ever craving a burger.

Website says they're open on Saturday. When we arrived this past Saturday, note on the door said "by appointment only."

Update your website before more folks drive 50 miles to visit you.

And no, I don't normally call a place before I go when their website says they're open.

Just left this place. Late night menu was very limited. We ordered a slice of pepperoni, a glass of wine, and mixed drink. The pizza tasted like it had been cooked earlier in the evening. It wasn't terrible but we have definitely had better. We didn't want to stop anywhere else so we decided we would bite the bullet and order another slice. Well low and behold they were sold out for the night. So disappointed!! We ended up at Five Points where we should have went in the first place. Pizza was delicious, as usual.

Not good. Their pizza is just average for this area. But the real disappointment comes from their lack of any customer service. They simply do not care if their customers are happy. The owners set the tone by brushing off customers as though they are nothing. The staff is even less apologetic. If I'm spending my money I'll be doing it where I'm valued as a customer.

I cannot stress enough - MAKE SURE TO CHECK UNDER THE HOOD THAT EVERYTHING IS TIGHTENED BEFORE LEAVING THE LOT!

Two weeks ago while I was in NY my car won't start and I had to get it jumped. At that time, upon opening the hood, we noticed that the cap for where the antifreeze goes was left out and lying along the side of the well. I normally don't use the car unless for longer trips outside the area. I did however noticed that the fan stayed on even after turning the car off and locking it. I thought it was just Honda's way of keeping the car cool for idling.

And so I took the car to my mechanic only to be told that I would need a  new battery (because the antifreeze wasn't cooling off the radiator as it was supposed and the fan had to stay on to cool it, therefore draining the battery) and an antifreeze flush because sediments appear to have gone into the engine. 

I have not touched or brought the car anywhere else after the service at this location. On that day I was upsold to an antifreeze top off, which I accepted. Because of this, I am very disheartened as now I had to pay $250 for a new battery and the flush when all I needed was an oil change at the time!

After weeks of back and forth contact - the correction for leaving the antifreeze cap off causing a need for an antifreeze flush and a new battery? "We would like to offer you one free Signature Service Oil Change for your vehicle to help conclude this matter." 

Unfortunately, I can't bring myself to return because I don't know what else will be left uncapped the next time... possibly the engine oil??

This is possibly a one off, but one time is one too many. Please be cautious and double check guys. Maybe if I did, I wouldn't have found a need to write this review to warn others.

2 Stars are for "some" of the staff. I booked this Hotel, Impressed by the online photos. Site indicates BeachFront Hotel. However, property sits across a busy street. And Yes. You "See" the ocean. And that's is all. Get it. Ocean View". They placed us in a room, on the 1st floor. Our View. Homeless people, cars driving by,  the sliding door was broken and did not lock. Called front desk to ask to be moved. I was nicely Greeted by. I can downgrade you to non ocean view a standard room. This really upset me. I told him, "No" absolutely No. asked to speak with a supervisor. He then said. Well he's busy. You would need to wait. So I sat on the phone and he asked. Well?? I said. Well? What? How are you going to fix this? He said no way to fix it. I have no rooms available. Lies. I looked online. Still had plenty of rooms!! Don't waste your money!!!! Way way way over priced !

Based on reviews I was expecting an amazing experience, but I was rather disappointed in the quality of the sushi. First, the restaurant is lying to you about having a "Kobe beef" sushi roll. We all know there are only 8 restaurants in the US that actually sell certified Kobe. So, they fact they choose to lie about serving real Kobe beef is disappointing to see. Second, all of the special rolls I tried were just overpowered by sauce that was smothered over the rolls. Waaaay too much. Let the fish shine, no need to hide it drenched in sauce. Lastly, the seaweed salad was downright dreadful. It tasted sour, foul and just dreadful. The doughnut dessert was amazing, but left dissatisfied and disappointed.

We just picked up dinner, they were not busy. Fresh chicken came out and we saw the employees had it it out to their friends and family for free!!! We paid and got old chicken. Chicken is dried and over cooked. I will be contacting corporate to escalate this issue!! They All need to get fired!!! That other customer that walked in after us that was clearly a family or friend go the fresh chicken and he did not pay and just walked away! Very disappointed!

Been in line so long.      I just listened to lionel Ritchie All Night Long,  which is also how long I'm likely to remain in line.   Not a single person checked out in what,  a 5 minute song?    This hoodie isn't that good.

I attended a shower at Barone's Tuscan Grill. The room was beautiful but the service was terrible. They had too many people crammed into a small room. I asked for a soft drink and it was never served. I asked the people sitting next to me if they even served soda. Apparently, you have to serve yourself. My Chicken Marsala was served last and I barely had any mashed potatoes on my plate. The last straw for me was seeing the Mother of the Bride serving coffee to her guests. What kind of place does that? I won't be recommending Barone's to any of my friends or family.

The place itself is super chill. 5/5 on decor.

Had the beef tacos... meh. The "mean green" sauce helped tons, but wouldn't go for it again. My friends didn't like their tacos either. 

If you want to order food here, order the nachos. 

Margaritas were good.

Overall, wouldn't seek out this place again. Perhaps...it needs to.. revolutionize ;)

The music was good but the food was NOT good and there were fruit fly/gnat things flying all near our food. So gross! Our waitress was very unfriendly. We hardly ever write bad reviews but it was just such an unpleasant experience. We won't come back here

This is a perfect example of a hotel owner who purchased a newish property and hired really stupid people to make repairs that are NOT up to any standard. 
The breakfast is a joke. No DIY waffle maker, nor is there any room for one! (Now you know that someone reporting that DIY Waffles were available is a BOGUS reviewer!)
The room smells like dirty feet.
There was no  shower mat available (usually a towel) for the floor when getting out of the shower. 
Sink water was low. Sink water came out seemingly dirty and full of bubbles.
Pillows smelled.
Found a booger on the cover sheet.
Outside windows were filthy.
---
You may think I am being anal, but I paid less for a hotel in Baton Rouge the night before I got to this dump, and paid half as much!
The worst thing about this place is the apparent lack of ethics: one or two, apparently, staff/owner cars occupied HANDICAPPED SPACES! In Addition someone was allowed to park in a red zone safety area which blocked easy access for a handicapped person's driver side door!! 
If that doesn't piss you off, keeping you away from this dump, you deserve to stay here.

Sat at the bar with a friend. No complaints about the service. Everyone working there was friendly and efficient. I got the fish tacos and my friend got a burger. We also ordered a side of guacamole and chips. My main criticism is of the food. Everything was just bland, bland and bland. It's not that anything was really bad, it just lacked flavor. Maybe we're just spoiled by other good restaurants in Santa Barbara. It's probably a fun place for kids but we will not be going back.

DO NOT GO HERE! Psychopath owner/average pizza......Wow, I cannot stress enough how absolutely terrible this place is! I wish I could give it negative stars. Me, my 10 year old son and 5 other of my friends all went here to grab a slice of what we have been told to be "the best pizza in town". I am from the area but, because there are so many pizza places around I have actually never been here. My friends are not from the area and really wanted to try what we have been told is "epic pizza", so we went. As we walked in, we were welcomed by the owner and 2 other employees. The initial experience seemed great! No other customers were in the shop, so we had the place to ourselves.  We ordered a bunch of food- pizzas, fries, drinks- definitely too much food but because we are all chefs, (minus the 10yr old), we had to get almost everything! Everything was going great, everyone was welcoming, outgoing, and we were all having a great time just hanging out together. Our food came out almost as fast as the bipolar mood change from the manager, Tony! One moment he was excited bragging about his establishment then out of nowhere he went completely psycho on all of us telling us to, and I quote, "Get the f*** out of my shop or I will call the cops"... (fast forward we all figure out that the one friend was having a side conversation while Tony was speaking and Tony got super offended that we weren't giving him our 100% full attention)... so he started cursing and threatening us with again I quote, "I have a baseball bat in the back if you don't get the f*** out of here"! FOR REAL?!?!! My 10yr old was hysterically crying thinking that we were going to jail and not even understanding why or what is going on. The as***** was completely oblivious to my son crying, terrified for our lives!!!! Being that we are all 30+ yrs old, everyone was just trying to calm Tony down. As for me, I was getting my son out of that place so that he didn't have to hear this man's inappropriate threats/language. As all of this is happening this guy calls the police as we are all just trying to pack up and get out of there. The police show up, ask a few questions as to what is going on, and they do not seem surprised to be there. It almost seemed like this happens often, like they were annoyed that they even had to come out. Tony was going nuts on us and to the police, so they advised that we just leave. Luckily we were able to walk away with our pizzas...so we start eating them as we walk, turns out the food was not even close to being "epic", it was good at best! Not even because of what just occurred but because it really just wasn't great! It almost seems like a scene out of a movie! I still can't believe how terrible this place/owner was. How this guy stays in business is beyond me! Yelling in front of a 10yr old was totally out of line, so needles to say I'll never be back and will never recommend.

I have been going there for a while... each time I go they jerk up the prices on their own (I guess to take out extra tip) I went today and I was very unhappy. My wait time was close to an hour and a half, when I sat down they started doing whatever they wanted to do. I had to tell the to change the shape. They are always pushy to add all this stuff to the bill. I wanted regular nail polish and they always push me to get gel or dip. They always push eyebrow waxing.. they are extremely money hungry. I will not be returning there after being a client for 5 years.

Came here because the pictures of the deep dish pizza look pretty good. The lettuce in the Caesar salad was old and kind of soggy. The anchovies on the Caesar salad weren't that fresh. The deep dish pizza I got was cold. Undercooked. Real disappointment I won't be back.
Do not get the salmon hibachi. Such a rip off.  Came dry, burnt and such a small portion. I ended up just having a whole take out container of rice to eat

Quite a disappointment.  Their website made me think it was a brick oven styled Italian restaurant.  It's not.  It's a fast food place.  No table service.  You stand on line and order your food at a counter, and you pay for it before you are served.  If you decide you want a second glass of wine you have to get back on line, order it, and pay again.  They do bring it to your table.  We had sandwiches, Meatball Parmesan and Chicken Parmesan.  The bread was on a level with (maybe a hair lower than) Subway Sandwiches.  The temperature inside was about 79º.  Uncomfortable.  The staff was pleasant and helpful, but I didn't see any reason to go back.

Made mistake of going to restroom first.  It stunk like a sewer.  Realy bad. Yuk! I have to say the restroom looked great, like newly remodeled.  My friend went in after eating.  Same response from her. Had to stay and eat because others were hungry.  Never again, even though grub was good.

I went here for dinner and it was probably no more then 4 tables with about 8 people total in the store who were already there when I arrived and eating their meals. Maybe one more person came in after me. It took 30 minutes precisely for 3 wings and a order of fries after I was told it would only be 15 minutes. After 25 minutes of waiting patiently I decided I was thirsty and respectfully went up for a drink. Would you believe after 25 minutes of waiting the server/cashier girl (1027 Kimberly) actually charged me for the drink lol I paid for it any how because I really was a little thirsty at that point but you would have at least thought for courtesy sakes that she would even offer up a drink for waiting such a long time for such a small order. I mean they could have thrown in an extra couple of wings in there or something AND the fries were cold. Now I'm not big on complaints so if I've actually taken the time out to write one just know I felt it was worth my time to write. Well....guess I know who I belong to after all and that is Chick-fil-a! I'm never going here again...

In today's competitive hospitality environment, customer experience is paramount to a restaurant's success. My mother chose Oakley's Bistro to celebrate her friend's birthday last night, booked her reservation via Open Table and when prompt indicated that it was a birthday celebration. We enjoyed drinks and dinner. At the end of the evening, we asked about whether there was a birthday treat and the waiter said "we can do a little something". What he brought back was a shock and an insult! He placed an empty plate with a single lit candle and snidely said "we don't give away free food here...." and walked away!  We were aghast and my mother embarrassed as she had selected this restaurant for her dear friend's celebration! If there wasn't a "birthday treat", the waiter could have politely said, "we don't offer anything or would you like to order something", but to be insulted is unacceptable.  I don't know why, but we rose above, left a 20% tip and politely left. However, we'll never dine again at Oakley's Bistro and we'll be sure to share our experience that left a VERY BAD TASTE! #noneedtoberude

Order placed on February 11, 2018. Four days later, on Feb. 15, received an email saying, "Your order is being processed. Please allow 2 to 4 business days processing time after which you'll receive a tracking number from us." Seemed odd to get the order confirmation four days later, but OK. 

No further communication after several days, so on Feb. 19, I emailed customer service for a shipping update. No reply for three days. 

Feb. 21, I receive this response, "Dear Customer, We apologize for the inconvenience. We will check with the shipping dept. and update you on your order, thank you." 

I wait four more days and still no reply, so I email again on Feb. 25 asking for an update. 

No reply, so on Feb. 26 I called the customer service number. The woman who answered told me that one item in my order is on back order and that's why it had not shipped. She put me on hold and came back and said the item is now and stock and my order would ship that day, and to expect an email with the tracking number. 

It is now Feb. 28 and still no tracking number and no one answers the customer service line. 

Communication and customer service is terrible. I should have been notified right away that one item I bought was on back order, so that I could decide if I wanted to wait or cancel. Had I not called, who knows when they would have told me. And now, there's still no information on when the order will arrive. 

This seems to be a common complaint with this company, so unless you like paying for something and not knowing when you'll get it, I'd shop elsewhere.
Worst McDonald's ever!! They take forever and are rude. I never write reviews so you know a sis really not about it! They all need a whole new staff training because they suck

Arrived for a 6:15 reservation, was not seated until 6:50.
Waters did not arrive until 7:15, with two cracked glasses.
Entrees did not arrive until 8:50.
3 of 8 were sent back due to 2 being heatlamp dried, 1 alfredo was swimming in milk.
By 9:20, all drinks are empty and no check... waiting.
Over priced beer and bad food.  What's going on in the kitchen?

I tried this place after moving to the neighborhood. It was puzzling- it was a good location, good prices, great environment, clean, so why is this place always so empty? After a couple visits it was starting to become pretty clear. 

You can do everything right, but if the food isn't up to par, nothing else matters. The owner cooks everything, and the guys working there seem nice enough, but if you don't know how to make the food, or at least understand how the food is supposed to be made, you're not gonna get very far.

The first time I ate there, I ordered a lamb gyro. You would think this would be no problem as so many middle eastern places have gyros, but no. I open it up to take a bite and there were pickles! He asks me what's wrong I'm like, there's pickles on it? And he's like yeah! As if that's normal. I told him I've never heard of such a thing, all my life I've never heard of pickles on a gyro. He told me there was no more lamb so I had to settle for chicken.

I decide to give them a second chance, and I order the quesadilla special. Skeptical, due to my last visit, I ask what kind of cheese is on the quesadilla. I'm told its  CHEESE WHIZ and AMERICAN. He wasn't joking. I told him just give me the cheese you use on pizza. I open it up when I get home and all the chicken is in a ball in the middle of the tortilla.

The owner might be a good businessman, have a great dining room, location, everything, but he does not understand food. ** If he would just hire a half way decent cook, this place would probably be poppin. ** A name change might be necessary though because it's hard to shake a bad reputation. I would love to be able to support their business since they're syrian and we have destroyed their country, but if the food sucks nothing else matters. Good ingredients, just doesn't know how to put it all together.

I really want this brewery to be successful. They put lots of care into the venue and are doing well on providing entertainment. Sadly, my problem with this brewery is the beer. Maybe I'm just out of touch with the market but like so many new micro breweries their selection is all IPAs and fruity or gimmicky varieties. I asked if they could produce a quality pilsner and the response is that it takes too long to brew. This is not "crafting" but rather just pumping out over hopped or flavored beers.

Awful!!! Just went here last night and need to warm everyone how BAD this place is. It is very dirty when looking around. We waited over an hour and still had no food. When we asked, they kept saying "it won't be long". Here the order was never even placed. Our waitress had major attitude also. She ended up screaming at the cooks and we could see and hear the whole thing. Please do not waste your time and money at this horrible place.

Meh. This place was better last year. The service was friendlier, the prices were lower, and the happy hour bacon was crispier.

In just a few short months, Orleans Grapevine went from a "yes" to a "er...what are my other options?"  

Also, we arrived at 4:30 and the courtyard was closed for a group arriving at...6.

I purchase a seasoned turkey breast with stuffing &gravy for Thanksgiving  dinner. Went to cook it for dinner found it was missing stuffing & gravy. So ate what we had for dinner.Called customer service and they I should have return it to the store and not have eaten the  turkey. Item #1292508  $ 29.99

This place has gone so downhill it is awful.
We went there for a birthday dinner last evening and the service was horrible  we waited for our order to be taken at least a half hour!  We never got our water refilled and were not asked if we wanted dessert but all we wanted was to get out of there!  The food was also horrible !
We remembered this as being a good place for quick Italian !  Never will we go there again! 
Should of known by all the empty tables !

I decided to get an "ultimate" wash vs. my usual "cheap a$$" wash today.  We'll, I paid $25 vs. $4 (today's special price) and got little to nothing more than than the usual cheap wash. The "wheel polish" and "machine wheel cleaning" is a joke.  No machine and no polish.  I questioned the "supervisor" and he said "sorry, we don't polish the wheels."  Excuse me.....it says right on the menu board "wheel polish and machine wheel cleaning"....  So I asked to speak to the manager.  The manager said "all the wash packages are basically the same.  You just pay extra for stuff we spray on the car in the tunnel".  OK....so, buyer be ware....if your car is basically clean....and maybe has a bit of dust on it.  This place can take care of your needs for $4 on most weekends.  But if you have any dirt or bird poop or any road grime or bugs on the grill, windshield or rims, do yourself a favor and save your money.  Do it by hand, find some other place, or at least don't let these guys sucker you into a $24.99 hand....errrrrrr wash job.  The $4 wash is basically the same.  At least, at that point, you can expect to get what you pay for.  Not much.... In the end, Ingot no apologies and nothing in return.  Only after I asked for a refund, did the manner say "sure you can have your money back"......poor quality and poor customer service.  Not going back.

The tech was very pleasant, clearly very experienced, and did an excellent job repairing our pinhole leak in a 3/4" copper line, but the resulting $521 charge was a bit exhuberant.  We had the repair done on a Sunday morning and admittedly, the service was prompt (within 2 hours of our call), so I was prepared to pay a bit more for the work, but we were clearly overcharged by about $200.

Setting the mood. I called first to ask about delivery and questions about food. The lady said best cheesy bread ever and takes some home every night. I explained that the reason for the question was because we had never been there before. We had always took the drive to 16th Street by the 500 track. She sold me. I ordered (2) Stromboli & a cheesy bread. I went in at 7:45 pm.  and did not get the order for 25 minutes. There was music playing and kind of loud almost as if they were closed having a party. One couple in the dining area with only 2 cars in the parking lot besides mine. I think that should have been my clue that this was not going to turn out good. I got home with the food and it was horrible. It looked like garlic bread out of a freezer section of a run down wal-mart. The food was cold, very sloppy put together and there was no seasoning at all on the stromboli. Will not return.

This was the worst nail fill and a gel nail I have ever had.  It has been only one week and I have all ready lost a nail.  He only put one coat of gel nail polish on and you can really tell.  Very dull looking.  He didn't fill in and then file around skin to make it look natural.  Very poor.  Will never return.
Food was good but didn't realize until after that my kid drank an expired orange juice. I'm not usually one to complain but serving something that is expired is just not okay.

Very disappointed :,( The overall atmosphere is good, but you can see where things are starting to wear down. The seats and table look old and the corners are roped or worn. Also the food is underwhelming. Me and my husband got a rainbow roll that was anemic. It was so small and mostly rice. The sushi was not very fresh either and it did not have any flavor. Also the crab and cucumber salad was literally a small bowl with a couple of clumps of imitation Brad and a couple of slices of cucumber. It is the size of those free salads you get at other places, but this one costs you $5. Lastly the pork ramen is gross and not what ramen should be. I think the restaurant is going cheap on ingredients, maybe because they have an all you can eat menu. I do not know. Personally, I want substance over quantity. This should not be a Golden Corral for sushi. I will not be coming back. There are far better place that cost less. Yuck!!!!

This is not a good Steak'n Shake. I've been here numerous times and they never have chili. I also walked inside of the store and the cook told me they were closed but the doors were open. Came to get a four dollar meal and they didn't have chili, offered to give me double fries. The fries were cold. This is like the third or fourth time that I've been to this location and they did not have chili. Just bit into my hamburger and it's cold also. I'm very disappointed. I will never be back to this location again.

After being told this location wasn't going to carry the limited time Spicy honey bbq chicken tenders, I was pleasantly surprised to see on menu tonight. But my excitement for short lived, as I was told they were out and not thawing anymore out till next day. Really?! A new limited time item and you can't keep enough thawed out till end of day. Poor planning.

If you visit Nashville, please do not come here. Although the hostesses were kind to accommodate my large party, the food and service was horrid. I'm pretty sure only one of my friends actually ate more than half of what was in their plate. It's a great location, but the food is awful.

Today myself and 6 friends went for lunch, we were seated at two separate tables as the wait time for one large enough would have been to long. Our waitress brought us water right away and came back within a reasonable time to take our order.  Our 3 friends were seated after us and their orders were taken after ours.  30 minutes later they received their meals and ours were nowhere in sight.  When I asked about how much longer for our meals we were told they were working on them.  15 minutes our meals arrived and to my disappointment mine was cold, the waffle was cold, the eggs were cold, not warm COLD. when I approached the staff about it I was told they could make me a new one but I was afraid of another 45 minute wait and very hungry so ate my cold meal which honestly probably would have been very good if it had been served with any warmth to it at all.  They did comp my meal but I was still very disappointed in the whole experience and not sure if I would go back or not.

Maybe a weekday afternoon is not the best time to come here. The pizza,   some fennel sausage concoction, had a burned crust which gave it a bitter taste. The fennel sausage was almost non-existent; our server said that extra was available (at additional cost) but at those prices, adequate sausage should have been provided. It was also dry due to lack of tomato sauce. I didn't expect it to be slopped onto the crust but the Oliver Twist portion left much to be desired. The mozzarella almost choked me going down; it wasn't sufficiently melted and took much mastication. All in all, it was a disappointing experience. All I wanted was a nice slice or two of pizza w/sliced mozzarella and a few toppings. What I got was a gentrified mini pizza that appeared to be made by a high school home ec student. The prices are justified by neither the portions nor the taste.

On a positive note, our server Daniella was a sweetheart and the gelato was tasty.

In the future I will avoid this place like an antibiotic-resistant STD and venture to South Philly for a decent pizza.

Did not listen to what I wanted.  Specifically said, "Do not cut the front, I like the length."  This was the last thing I said to her before she started. 
 She then proceeded to cut over an inch off the front of my hair, which forced me to completely change my hairstyle.  She wasn't even close to what I asked.

While the service from Sam was great, the prices are astronomical for tiny portions of poorly seasoned bland yet creative dishes.  I know that sounds odd so I will explain. The chef, while having an interesting creativity, lacks seasoning ability with simple ingredients--however, a deft hand with seasoning is a gift few have.  While I constantly bitch about heavily oversalted food, the reverse is also a problem PARTICULARLY WHEN THERE ARE NO SALT SHAKERS ON THE TABLE.  Additionally, a pinch in the cooking is worth a pound at the table.  It was an unbalanced meal with two OUTSTANDING dishes and three really mediocre ones. First the star of the meal: The bacon fat fried cornbread was an interesting twist on an old favorite.  Dense, sweet cornbread is sliced and briefly grilled to a light brown crust on both sides, drizzled with a bit of honey and slathered with butter infused with the tiniest hint of thyme.  It was fabulous, but $6 for 2 slices puts it at a premium price point for a dish with a cost of about 84 cents per portion--but in all fairness, the rent in Maplewood has to be astronomical and I know that.  Everyone has to make a living, I get that, and I know the area is pricy. (Also, we were celebrating beloved husband's birthday and they gave a complimentary glass of champagne--a split of bubbly divided between 3 glasses, but since none of us like champagne it was MORE than plenty Pro Tip: there are people who don't like caviar and champagne.  It was really sweet, but if they had asked us if we wanted it, we would have declined.) Moving along, beloved hubby had the catfish with the Asian slaw in a foamy green sauce that was visually unappealing and had no real flavor.  However, he said the catfish was good but left most of the slaw and all of the sauce.  Dearest mother in law had the smoked pork sandwich with homemade chips that were perfectly cooked and salted just right.  They were the ONLY thing served to us that had correct seasoning.  She said it was good but only ate half.  I had the fried pork shoulder with black-eyed peas and collard greens which as a 5th generation southerner I like although beloved husband calls them "boiled leaves" which is actually what they are.  They were flavorless other than vinegar and desperately needed salt and bacon/ham to balance out the vinegar and were chewy as well. For the first time in my life, I understand why hubby calls them boiled leaves because that's exactly what they tasted like. With vinegar. LOTS of vinegar. Ptooie!  I couldn't eat them. They were disgusting. Pro Tip: Cook LONGER back off the vinegar and toss in a couple smoked ham hock and a ham bone and they will be much better.  To their credit, the black-eyed peas were not canned.  They were either fresh or cooked from dried.  They also could benefit greatly from some salt, bacon and cutting way back on the hot peppers since the peppers totally overpowered the delicate taste of the black-eyed peas. They were spicy hot but no flavor from the peas--just texture which was the only way I knew I wasn't eating a dish of diced peppers.  The pork shoulder was tender and extremely fatty--I thought it was pork belly for the first 3 bites. It had a crispy crust that was ruined by plating it in the liquid from the beans making the bottom crust soggy and gross.  If I didn't love pork fat and pork belly, it would have been inedible. To someone who doesn't love pork fat, it would be revolting.  The coating, while crisp on top, again had virtually no flavor and desperately needed salt--which was nowhere to be found. Never in my life have I been to a restaurant that didn't have salt on the table. For dessert we had the bread pudding which had to be one of the best renditions I have ever tasted.  If I were basing this review on the dessert and the cornbread there would not BE enough stars. However, the one bite I had was not enough to wash away the memory of a mediocre meal.  I doubt I'd go back.  It was a lot of money for a meal that was only JUST barely passable. They need to step up their flavor game massively--as demonstrated by the empty restaurant. I made a reservation, but I sure didn't need it.  
The ambience was nice but the chair and benches are painfully uncomfortable to anyone without a Kardashian booty to pad the chair!
Also, they have unisex bathrooms--nothing is a gross as using a men's room with piss all over the seat and floor and the stench of urine permeating the air.  They really need segregated facilities--it's the number one reason I wouldn't eat there again--I can salt the food but I'm not scrubbing the piss off the floor of the bathroom. GROSS!!!
2 beers, 2 iced teas 2 orders of cornbread, a pork sandwich, 1 catfish and one pork shoulder and 1 dessert $99.29 before tip. 
Service: 5 stars
Entrees: 1 star
Dessert and Cornbread: 10 stars
Cleaning the urine-soaked disgusting bathroom: Ensures a 1-star review and never returning.

It was...fine. I was expecting a lot more given the reviews. The waiter was great but the food was not worth the price. Maybe this is a summer place and is better with the patio? I found it really weird there were no 7pm reservations available and the restaurant was empty when we got there at 7:20 for our 7:30. We had a nice bottle of wine for $35 which was the only good thing about the dinner.

Came here on Thursday when we arrived.  Great setting and great music.  Returned last night around 10p as Broadway was a mob scene!  Sat down for 15 minutes and no waitress.  I went to the bar and the bartender decided to have a full blown pick me up conversation with two young ladies so again no service!  Understaffed.  Sorry, probably will not come back until they hire additional staff and the bartender gets a girlfriend!

Not very impressed.  Ordered the Fishermans Net, shrimp were not very tasty and you had to peel it yourself.  I get it that's there thing but it should have been very tasty for the effort.  My daughters meal was very expensive for what she got.   Overall not my thing around the same price as redlobster and the food was way better there last time I was there a month ago.
Order was wrong. Barely meat on tacos. Queso fundito was just a lump of cheese. Missed items. Insisted it was right and quality was good. Horrible customer service.

Very disappointed. Lunch specials are only available for dine in so I paid $14 for takeout only to find that my chicken curry was made with tiny pieces of all dark meat and only a small amount of chicken was in the container. All of the curry pictures from the other location have white meat and I have never been served dark meat in a curry before. The curry flavor was good and there were a lot of vegetables, hence the two stars, but not worth the $14. Would try again if some changes are made.

This is a review of parking . The shuttle driver to airport was nice but left 15 min later than scheduled. I just waited 45 min for shuttle from airport back to my car and the driver said the shuttle takes 30 to arrive after you call, which no one told me before, but also it's been 45 min!Hopefully my car will be ok. Spend a few more dollars and park at any other lot near the airport. Lesson learned.

Bad customer service. Had an appointment for an oil change at 11. Waited for 1,5 hours and nothing happened. Nothing. No one even talked to me about being late. So frustrating. What a waste of my time.
Ordered patron.  The shots they give for the price are not patron. Just had a shot. Not patron. Careful what you pay for
Impossible to get in or out of this location.  Single drive through with traffic always backed up onto dale mabry.  We need another bigger location in Carrollwood/Lutz.

Their bread is great. Their ribeye and peppercorn filet mignon are both terrible. Service is average. Ambience is great - has a 1920's kind of feel.

Overall, your better off eating elsewhere for the money.

Awful. Just plain awful. Horrendous, disinterested service. Pork tasted like it was frozen and defrosted in microwave... broccoli rabb with no taste. If I had not grown up eating the original roasted pork and tasted this crap It wouldn't be one of my favorite sandwiches. I'd avoid at all cost. Rather eat a gas station hot dog then this. Tony Luke, you need to come and eat there if your still interested in your namesake.
This dealership is terrible. The service is slow, rude and never correct. I love my Passat but I'll be looking for a new car after this last experience.
