Got takeout sweet potato fries and they were burnt and inedible. I mean burnt to a crisp and black. Who would even send out inedible/ completely burnt food to a customer?? Sometimes you really should listen to reviews- a previous customer had this same complaint. 

Waffle brunch was not worth the money. Will not order from here again.
The Santa Barbara IMX studio went out of business overnight with many of us stiffed for hundreds of dollars in prepaid classes.  Stay away from the IMX chain of studios.

Went in to get a simple plug in a flat tire. Waited one hour and they hadn't even pulled my car into the garage yet. Wasn't busy, two bays were open.  Asked for my keys back and the front desk person said "come back in another time, I'll get you in and out". Thanks but no thanks. 60 minutes of my life I'll never get back.

Do not ever go to this location. I'm not sure where they find their employees here but they all look like they are on drugs and act like it. My kids love Taco Bell so we now drive across town now. They need to clean this place up big time. They are barely open now. As you can tell by pictures at 10:20 they were still not open.

This review is for the downstairs lobby bar...Been a huge fan of this place since it opened, I come all the time, and will probably still give it another chance bc I like the music venue and the overall vibe, however a few recent experiences have been disappointing. The staff is slacking. It's noticeable. Tonight the short-haired female bartender was incredibly rude. They have always had bartenders who think they're too cool for school, but this particular girl was straight up mean. Bar service in general has gone downhill in last year. Sure seems like it could use new management

FRAUDULENT CHARGE WARNING 
A shot girl practically forced a shot on me then asked for my card and ID.  Being a trusting person I willingly gave it to her- she wrote a tip for the amount charged with a fake signature on the receipt. Went to close my tab and it was "already signed". Passing this along, hoping the same doesn't happen to you

I totally agree with the reviews written by Craig M. and Matt M.  This place is an absolute disgrace.  They have the nerve to charge an $8.00 admission fee per person; parking is horrible; no space in between courts; have to cling to the wall navigating your way to a court so you don't get hit in the head with a ball; once you get to one of the six courts jammed together, there are two little rows of bleachers, each maybe 10 ft. long, that the owner seems to think can accommodate two teams' family members/friends.  I'm assuming these teams or the organizations that support them pay a rental fee for use of the courts (no actual fees listed on their webpage - you have to send an email to get that info) so why is it necessary to charge admission - greed is my guess.  I filed a formal complaint with the BBB.  This owner is a poor excuse for a businessman.  I feel bad for the families that have no other choice but to patronize this venue in order to see their kids play a basketball game.  To say it is not a family-friendly business would be an understatement.

Like so many others over these few days, I also had food poisoning (5/4 about 3 hours after eating breakfast) that was so violent, my husband had to call an ambulance from the airport terminal where we were getting ready to board, I spent 6 hours in the hospital, we missed our flight home, had to book a hotel in town, and quite a few hundred dollars later in hotel and medical bills, we're finally going home a day late.

I have eaten here over the years but I WILL NEVER step foot in this place again.

The food is good, but the drinks are absolutely terrible! Extremely watered down, containing close to no alcohol at all. If you order any of the ones with symbols syrup - sugar is the only thing you'll taste. The waitresses are nice tho!

Avoid this place. Took my mother there for her birthday to get her nails done and she ended up with an infected toe. They don't keep their station clean. Unskilled and unprofessional staff. Had to take my mom to urgent care after her pedicure.
Maybe one a half of a peanut butter cup in the top 1/3 of my peanut butter cup blast. The other 2/3 was just vanilla ice cream.

This is not Nashville Hot Chicken.

As a true fan of Nashville Hot chicken and having left numerous yelp reviews of various spots over the years, I fiannaly made a visit to Hattie B's. 
  Now I know where KFC copied thier disappointing recipie.  There is sugar or something in this.  On the positive, they have the nicest atmosphere of any of the hot chicken places I have been to, but the chicken, just did not have the true Nashville flavor.  IMHO.  Go to Prince's or Pepperfire...they are much better

The best thing they had that actually tasted great was the rice pudding. The sauces and rice were watery and sloppy looking. I went for the buffet and had my hopes up high, but as they say your more likely to become disappointed when you have high expectations. I'm definitely not taking my hungry stomach back here. The only positive thing was that the service was great and the waiters were attentive. According to a food snob who only eats things that look and taste top notch, the food quality was horrible and options were limited.
We ordered the bar burgers and wings.. 14 dollars for fries, 4 mini sliders and 5 wings.. 2 out of the 4 sliders were basically thrown together and one wing was deformed. The fries were good though.

This theatre is so dirty, like every inch of it. And the popcorn tasted old and they only filled the bag half way. The 3D seating is very tight and uncomfortable. If you're in the center of the isle forget about going to the bathroom, unless you don't mind walking over 20 people. Won't be back.

 I will say the staff here has never given me a hard time, a bad vibe or a nasty attitude. The 2 stars are for the staff.

I'm on a streak with writing bad reviews and it's making me so sad. Came here at 1:30pm today (Tuesday) the place was locked and empty. Which is disappointing because I was really excited to try this location. The Old City location is great however, I'll have to wait and try the Center City.
Place is loud don't expect conversation although people try and the it just gets louder. Ordered the lobster roll for $20 and it was complete joke. Mostly bread. Live and learn.

Came here for the buffet thinking bet you 2999 paid everything unfortunately it did not grab let's not include it read by not including lobster not included so good money go somewhere else like go to corral to not come here for the buffet
12.00 for a lb not good! Food was not hot either!!!

Our visit started with only a short wait, but it was a Tuesday.  We were seated with the rolls and butter.  Unfortunately, they did not include plates so we were forced to use our napkins to cut and butter them on.  The rolls are good.  The garden salad is tasty.  The grilled pork chop was over salted, under-cooked, lukewarm at best, and has a 1/4" of fat around the edge.  The bacon cheeseburger would be better if it had cheese you could taste and some flavor.  My son, who gets cheeseburgers everywhere, said he'd rather Wayback burgers or even McDonalds or Wendy's to these.  They automatically brought my son a tiny raspberry ice tea in a kids cup without asking (clue - if the kid is playing a teen game on a tablet and ordering from the main menu, he probably doesn't need a small cup with a lid to insult him).  The raspberry iced tea has a weird flavor, as if it were way over brewed.  The manager did offer to replace the pork chop with one not salted so much, but by that point we were pretty much sick of the place.  The server didn't ask if we wanted any extra drinks, etc throughout the meal.  She arrived at the end and asked if we wanted dessert.  When we didn't, we were given a slip of paper to pay - no folder or anything to put the credit card in.  

The wait staff stood at the edge of our table where utensils are held and chatted until they had more work to do.  The sound level in the restaurant is loud, but we still had to hear their conversations.

This really wasn't worth the money paid.  The food isn't very good and the service was lackluster.  We probably won't be back.

Definitely give them a thumbs down. Door to door salesman pitches everything you want to hear from aphids to wasps and beyond. They get you into a 1yr deal for a quarterly spray and inspection. When you call them for needed services between and after sprays you get nothing!! Poor customer service and a ton of lip service. They don't even take care of aphids as salesmen states. Would highly not recommend!

Here for the spring jam
..nothing but love.for the artists.. quality of audio crappy. . Last time here was OHIO players.. audio was great...Will not return
. As i continue to reflect in this concert billed as "Spring Jam" why didnt Touch tone spin in between sets? Maybe production staff should visit Dell East on Thursday evenings..

I was not pleased with this place at all. We ordered fried chicken, fried shrimp and fried oysters. It was so lacking in flavor that it made me nauseated. I'm in New Orleans so naturally I thought it would have the flavor of famous city it resides in. Well nope it does not! I've had better food in a hospital cafeteria than what I had with not so Please u so called restaurant. Damn near 50 dollars of tasteless food. I ordered it from the Waitr app so that is why I paid for it! If I had physically gone and got it myself I would have tasted it and left it there. Absolutely gross! It is no pleasing in Please u  restaurant
Satisfied with nails but definitely not eyebrows.  Literally took part of my brow off.  I was not charged needless to say.  Pedicure and manicure very nice.

I used to really like Ferguson Brewing but after lunch there today I've totally changed my mind.  I had the fish and chips\fried cod and it was terrible! The breading was very soggy, fish was cold, fillets were broken up into odd shaped pieces like the Busboy scraped left over fish onto my plate.  To make matters worse, the fish tasted and smelled off.  Disgusting presentation and very disappointing!

Been here a few times through the years and is OK at best. Stopped in there today and WILL BE MY LAST time. Their more price is $1.00 more then a few months ago and NOW they also add a 10% gratuity to your bill which I didn't know about there's a SMALL below eye level sign behind their register. I had left $4.00 tip on the table, 20+% which was MORE than generous considering there is NEVER any real service here no refills or anything. When I questioned what the "extra" charge was an angry/disrespectful teen "did you leave at least 10%" tip I said YES, I did actually 20+%.  Evidently they are charging 10% on top of your taxed total which seems pretty shady and then there is yet another sign as you enter the place which advises you that will charge you a 10-15% fee (snapped photo) if you have kids so wouldn't recommend to bring your children. So they charge 10% flat gratuity (for no service) PLUS if another 10-15% IF you have kids. SMH!!!!! These fees are pretty shady and the youth that work there, all pretty disrespectful. NEVER GOING AGAIN!

Really?

This place was highly advertised in the RFT so I wanted to try it out.  First, went early in the service time so it was not crowded.  Waitress had a difficult time explaining the menu and the choices available but soon we were able to take advantage of the happy hour half price entree for the shrimp but was informed that the crab legs did not qualify.  This was not explained in the ad.  We were given the usual bib but also cheap gloves.  Soon I found out why the gloves were provided.  Your meal comes in a bag dumped on your table by a very unfriendly and unhelpful "server" who did not even know what each person at the table ordered.  No utensils, not even a fork!  Ordered potatoes and corn.  The corn was ok to eat by hand but have you ever eaten red potatoes with your fingers?  Even though both my dining companion and I specified not spicy, the sauce was spicy and burned our mouths.  The service was sub-par and the dining experience even less.  Not going back here.  Joe's Crab Shack here we come next time we are craving seafood!

This place is cool for the experience but the food is really hit or miss. I personally ordered the veggie platter and found everything rather bland, I had to add salt and hot sauce to make the greens palatable. My family all said it was ok but they wouldn't be pressed to come back. The service was good considering the large party we had but the food doesn't make me want to back

We have eaten Here a lot over the years but the last two visits the sirloin steak has been a lower quality cut of meat. Reminded me of ponderosa back in the day. 
The waiter was vet good.
My family and I were ignored. Even rolled their eyes probably because she was in her phone. She continued to her conversation. So we walked out. Felt unwelcomed.

Really bad service - no one at the bar for 5 mins and then when did order speaking with servers was more important than bringing my drink - no apologies when slow service was pointed out - wasn't even busy - won't see us there again

Skip this place....seriously....turn around....keep walking....extremely slow service.   Took 30 mins to get a small bowl of gumbo, a handful of rice that's suppose to be crawfish etoufee, and several ounces of jambolaya.  SAD.   Everything taste like they came out of a can.   Extremely overpriced.  Not worth the time or money.   Plenty of other places to go in the area for same or better prices and much better food.    To be fair, the workers were very friendly but I don't think they have a clue the food they are serving are very poor and tasteless.

The building was visually pleasing and decor inside was inviting, hip and trendy. You know when you go to a craft beer/ brewery joint everything is to its highest standard type of place so coming in you had high hopes. I knew I was going to get a good artisanalish meal. 

The first time yelp reviews have failed me. This was probably the fastest sit down meal I've ever eaten, we were in and out of this place in 20 min! I kid you not. Seriously I'm spending more time writing this review. 

I ordered Albees Knees, gin with lemon, lavender honey and lavender butters. Sounds amazing, well no it's not. What's funny is that it's the most popular ordered drink, I honestly think mine was just poorly made. All I tasted was the bitters. Uhg sent it back and I didn't even order another drink because it would be made by the same bartender, so no thank you. 

For starters we ordered the mac and cheese bites and house made kim chi, we were also given their complimentary corn bread fritter drenched in their bourbon honey. I love honey and I love bourbon but these weren't good corn bread. 

We got our Mac and cheese bites in less than 5 min from ordering, it came topped with what we thought was very bland tuna salad which turns to be smoked trout. It wasn't Smokey nor should it be on top of Mac and cheese bites? The Mac and cheese bites were also bland, I don't know what type of cheese was used but it tasted like it was just béchamel and then coated with bread crumbs and fried. 

Then the house made kim chi, simply tasted like sauerkraut. Not spicy, salty, no umami just sour. But I like sauerkraut so that's a plus. Which I didn't order, I ordered kim chi..

Our mains were classic burger med rare with fries and fish and chips with Brussels sprouts. The burger patty didn't seem house made and it came out unseasoned and rare and cold, my kid said the tastiest part of that burger was the brioche bun. Although he did like the house made ketchup. 

My fish and sprouts, it wasn't bad lo. I just wish the fish wasn't borderline soggy. Like it was crunchy but when you pick it up it falls apart soggy? 

This place looks good and food presented well but it lacked flavors. Where is the salt, something? Was it a bad day? Did we order the wrong things? No it should all be good, right? The server knew we were not happy with anything we order, but what can he do? 

I wanted this to be good but this is one of those looks can be deceiving type of place. The two stars is for decor and presentation. Service was ok

I know it's a St. Louis thing, but provel cheese on pizza is disgusting! Not everyone who lives here grew up here. These places that specialize in putting this aberration of dairy on their pizza should have an option for mozzarella cheese or a warning or something.

Man, I hate that I'm disappointed. Because I love the idea of a huge arcade with a full bar where adults can feel welcome. But every time we've gone, the service has gotten worse and worse. ALL workers: greeters, wait staff, bartenders... R.U.D.E. It really is a shame. It got 3 chances, don't think I'll be back unless for a child's birthday party.

Used to be my local supermarket. That changed when they decided to increase self checkout & reduce cashiers. This was a terrible move!!  Buying produce is now a major pain in the ass as you spend your time looking up items & waiting for help.  
Think those savings will be passed on to you?

Portions keep getting smaller. For the sandwich you get half a breast they again slice in half. I think you get a much better chicken sandwich at PDQ!! if you want a chicken sandwich not breading sandwich...don't order it. Update although I've had some terrible meals here they did make my situation right right and I went back last night. They had the prime rib and it was great. Server was great. Still think there is room for improvement on food quality. They cuts they have made to keep up with the low pricing is evident.

First review I have ever written, but my experience with Gerhard's was so awful I had to warn ppl from shopping here. The rudest customer service I have ever experienced! Love to shop local, but from now on will be buying my appliances from Lowe's or Home Depot. Not sure how they are still in business with the reputation they have.

My first visit to this salon was today for an appointment I made online. When you book an appointment online with this salon, you pay upfront. Which I didn't mind, I'm a licensed cosmetologist myself and I charge a deposit to hold the spot. However, Suite Extensions charge the full price depending on Jr Stylist or Senior Stylist and service selected. I paid for a senior stylist Chanel however, when arrived I was told that she wasn't coming in today and in fact was no longer working there. Now why would that be aonline selection if this stylist was not available? Definitely not right to charge clients a higher a cost then not given what you pay for. There was no senior stylist in today, only one girl. 

I gave this place a try since I heard so many good reviews. I even sent clients here when I was not able to service them based on race reviews. I managed a hair store on south street and sent clients here also just for me to try them out and get less than great service. Not professional at all. This is an industry where service matters. You can literally go anywhere. When you want to support black businesses and this happens to smh 

 My hair was done by Siani, which I did post pics of. Once home, I had the chance to look at my hair. (Space City so I had to fix it myself). It's safe to say I didn't get my $108, senoir stylist paid hairstyle. A manager wasn't even on hand to handle this which she should have been. Her business to handle. 

Not returning! Or REFERRING if I'm unavailable

I was very disappointed with our recent take out order. The portions were small and it was expensive. We ordered 1 soup. 2 orders of fried rice, 1 noodle entrée and a small salad. It was close to $70 and the food was fair at best.

This review is in reference to the inn only. 
A very disappointing weekend stay. 
Our room was dark. Large stain on the carpet and multiple stains on a piece of upholstered furniture. 
The fan on the heating/cooling unit was so loud that is was like driving in a car with the windows down. 
Most upsetting was the mattress. In all our years of traveling, we have NEVER had to sleep on such a terrible mattress. It sounded and felt like the mattress was stuffed with straw. Both my husband and I struggled to sleep because it was so uncomfortable that it became painful. I seriously considered sleeping in my car instead!! 
The free continental breakfast consists of one croissant, juice and coffee or tea per person and has to be served in the room. Don't waste your time. Plenty of nice restaurants in the area to eat. Sadly, we didn't rest well and the stay at this inn ruined the weekend. We returned home exhausted from our inability to get a restful nights sleep. 
Our two night stay, with taxes, was just over $500.00.  Surely they can provide a more appropriate accommodation at that price point.

My husband and I ordered two salads and I guess what you would call a Margherita pizza. The salads should have consisted of at least 10 special order veggies that were 50 cents each and an additional protein of tuna that cost 3 dollars. When the order was delivered the pizza looked like something out of a bad nightmare. It was literally stale dough topped with $1.00 generic tomato sauce you can buy at a grocery and a few pieces of unmelted, unknown cheese. The salads were basically side salads that cost over 16.00 each. The pizza was so inedible my dogs wouldn't eat it.  Needless to say, we are going to bed hungry but am relieved we will not have to make an emergency trip to the E.R.

Thought the shrimp PO-boy would be good; Very disappointing.  Bread for the sandwich was not fresh, popcorn shrimp did not taste good- over cooked;  fries were not good, bbq sauce nor ketchup helped. Catfish bites were very good.  The music and the catfish bites are keeping the rating from being no stars.  Please improve the food and service.

Food at this location is hit or miss. Sometimes the food is really good and other times the chicken will be rubbery or slimy or there will only be breading and no chicken in the boneless wing. We usually only go in Thursday's for the boneless wing night. I didn't go back for almost two months after I got bad rubbery chicken a few months ago. Restaurant is constantly dirty with dishes and food left on tables after customers have left. This branch needs to take a serious step up. Definitely below normal bdubs standards

I gave  a 3 star because it's  NOT SAFE and way to expensive to get in and way to crowded..
They bus a bunch of people in everyday. There is a lot better water parks and cheaper. And they try and force you to pay high prices on food also and it has restaurant logo but food tastes nothing like restaurant they claim it is. And pizza was burnt. I live super close but I'm not going back here again!!! I feel it's not safe here way to many tubes can't see drowning child under tubes. And they let tubes stay in lazy river with no one on them..Not good at all. It hasn't happened yet but it's a matter of time. I know a child that did drowned under a blow up raft. Not safe at all. A child did almost drowned when I was there !!! If it hadn't been for lifeguard Super Sam that child would of been dead!!! This place is at mercy of lifeguards....

 I feel like they try and make you pay their high prices on food. You can't bring food or drinks in to swimming pool area. Really but you want to charge 7.00 for a hot dog band chips or 5.00 for a chicken sandwich that's being forced. How can a parent afford that with a lot of kids. That's just wrong. Parents out smart them bring your cooler with ice and put drinks and stuff for lunches and snacks than have a designated time to go out and eat lunch. I did that at a different pool when my child was little and I had neighbors kids with us. I found a picnic table and we spread everything out. And she is 26 and remembers and talks about how fun the picnic was everyday at the pool.now she does same with her daughter. I will say this they have a life guard who deserves a medal he was lighting fast and save a kids life yesterday. His name was SAM. Little boy fell off his tube in lazy river all these adults around no one noticed he came across from other side like super man and had the kid pulled out . All the adults freaked out cuz no one saw the child under water all we saw was a empty tube. And the child's parents were no where to be found.. really parents your children are your responsibility not the life guards or anyone else's.this kids was probably 4 and his buddy 5 years old ... watch your kids to a water park or pool is not your babysitter.....thank God for SAM...The sad part is they do provide free use of life jackets and some parents are to lazy to walk right over and get them and put them on the kids.when my kids would argue they didn't want to wear it,I would tell them it's simple you put it on or you go home your choice. Remember your the parents and they are the child !!! You set the rules not them!!!!!! I have to agree with other reviews this park is way over priced cheaper and better water parks like in Plainfield it's even in doors so kids don't get burnt. I only went here cuz it was free for me cuz my friend had a pass it is to packed and way to expensive.

The word appointment has a meaning, but this place doesn't seem to know the meaning of the word. Had an appointment at 9am to get 4 new tires and an oil change. Got to this place about 8:45am. They took the keys at about 9am. I left the store, went and walked around Walmart for an hour. I came back, car still sitting in the same spot. It wasn't busy at all. Maybe 1 or 2 cars were there before mine. It wasn't until I ask for my keys that they decided they were gonna bring my car back, no thanks. I'll take my money somewhere else. Tires and a oil change shouldn't take hours to complete especially with a name like Tires Plus? Made an appointment with a different store only because they carry a certain tire I want. Hopefully this next store will be more professional.
literally so slow, you would think they would be a little faster with orders. i should not be waiting 30 minutes for a drink.

Stuck between a 2 and a 3 on this one, but I am going to go ahead and give it a 2 based on the fact that it was one of the strangest dining experiences I've had. My hubby (Adam) and I were in town for the day visiting our friends. We were doing a pub crawl with them starting off at the bar next door, so we all decided to come here. I was very impressed when we walked in. The restaurant was so big, and I thought it was very unique looking. The food has to be awesome, right? My friend and I ordered the cotton candy limeade, and it was delish! The food prices were overly reasonable. I was in love (besides for the weird waiter)! I couldn't wait for the food. Right off the bat though.. our server was pretty arrogant. I think maybe he got his training at DIck's Last Resort next door lol. Adam and I ordered their Sicilian cheese bread with pepperonis as an appetizer and decided to split the spaghetti and meatsauce as our meal (which comes with a salad). The cheese bread came out with no pepperonis... we ate it anyway and it was okay. Nothing special. I told the waiter about the pepperonis when he asked how everything was, and he joked that he ate them. Anyway, the salads weren't great. We had asked our waiter what their most popular dressing is, and he said the Pesto one. It tasted like watered down Caesar. At this point, I still had high hopes for the spaghetti. How could a spaghetti factory screw up spaghetti?! I don't even  know, but they did. There was only a small amount of sauce (which was super bland), and a tiny amount of meat. Luckily, I had saved some of the marinara sauce from the pepperoni-less cheese bread and poured it over the spaghetti which made it better. After we finished our meals, Adam asked for the checks since we had the pub crawl to go to. The waiter said he would go get them. I told Adam that our meal was suppose to come with ice-cream, so when the guy came back with our checks we asked him for the ice-cream. He was shocked and surprised that we wanted ice-cream... Now in his defense, we did ask for the checks. However, it was a really odd reaction and I doubt (even if we didn't ask for checks) that we would have been given the ice-cream if we didn't ask for it.

This location is horrible. My car always has streaks on it and the express line is never fast. The staff and managers always have attitudes and make excuses. Dont waste your time or money at this location.

Just got home from a Sunday brunch and I am sad to say that we are very disappointed.  We have been to the Blue Plate several times.  We were seated in the basement (apparently new seating).  It took 10 minutes for someone to come take our order and we then sat there for 40 minutes before our food came out.  The server never once apologized for the delay and everyone around us who was seated after us, we served within 10 minutes of ordering.  It will be a while before we return if at all.

I've never been somewhere so bizarre- the place was super dirty and there were no drinks available? Just room temperature self-serve tea. We ordered a wrap and a small humus plate and it was $25- wayyy too much. The food wasn't aw- wasn't great.

BEWARE SMALL PORTIONS!!!

We decided to visit the place as I got a taste of the Beef soup and beef pancake wrap and both were delicious. First, the seating was quick, even though the restaurant was fairly full. It was Me, wife and 5 kids. We tried a variety of items as Kids love to try new items. Wife and I have visited Taiwan many times And we love the street food there. We had : onion pancake, oyster omelette, beef wrapped pancake, crispy pork roll, sweet sausage fried rice, house chow fun, salt pepper pork, braised beef noodle soup, sweet orange pork ribs, basil century egg and Taiwanese style Clams. Total Bill was $120.00 before tip. The food was really good. The Orange Ribs were as sweet as candy. All 5 kids commented too sweet. The Century eggs were very salty, but good flavor. We would eat every dish, other than the orange ribs again. 

So why the 2 Star? Portion size. I was amazed at how little was given for the price. $13 for tiny ribs that barely gave each member of our family 2 tidbits. Thats about $3 for the length of my finger. The oyster omelet had 4 oysters in it. That's like $2 per oyster. We had to cut them in half. Not one dish was over 1/2 full. The clams were delicious, but again not even 1/3 of the bowl full. We left after spending $120 and kids were still hungry.  

So if portion is not an issue, eat here. Over priced, small portions, but delicious.

This place is right down the road from our house so I was pretty excited to come by here on a Friday night a couple weeks ago.  The ice cream was good, and they even have pup cups (small vanilla soft serve with a mini milkbone) for a buck, which we ordered for our dog - naturally, he recommends it.

With that being said, unfortunately the two high schools students working the stand that night provided less than stellar service.  They close at 10 p.m., and we arrived around 9:45, which in my calculations means they're still open.  The students were cleaning frantically, apparently trying to get out of there quickly, which I understand as I was not looking to spend an eternity there myself.  We stood at the window for a few minutes before the girl working that night, who had looked at us several times already, opened the window and said "yes?"...we advised her we wanted to place an order. She told us she'd be right with us, shut the window and went back to cleaning.  Eventually, the boy working with her opened the other order-taking window and presented himself behind the cash register which I interpreted as a sign to place our order - interpretation necessary since he did not acknowledge me otherwise with either eye contact nor speech.  I quickly placed the order and we received our items quickly as well.  The girl asked my husband if he wanted whipped cream on his milkshake and he said "no, thanks," to which she responded "well, do you want whipped cream or not?."  I'm not making this up.  Once we received our order we bade the young lady a good night, which she did not reciprocate as she quickly shut the window.  We pulled out of the parking lot at 9:57 p.m. for those of you keeping track at home.

We did enjoy the ice cream, though my waffle bowl did have a flavor of essence of Fabuloso, the cleaning product of choice that evening.  Unfortunately, we will not be returning due solely to the service we received.

I like this McDonald's they usually are pretty good however the last time I went they earned 1 star, so I upgraded to 2 states since they are normally pretty good.  I went to the drive in and while I admit they were busy it does not explain why it took me 10 minutes to get thru the drive in line.  I also received the wrong item.  I ordered a Diet Coke and received Dr. Pepper.  I was not able to take it back because I was a drive in customer and had already left the store when I realized.  I don't like Dr. Pepper so the only thing I was able to do was pour it down the drain.  So I lost my $1.07 which isn't much but it's still my money.
This was not my favorite brunch spot. Bloody Mary was infused with horse radish not bacon. The biscuits and gravy were dissatisfying. Oatmeal was okay

so this place had great reviews, so I went there.  I had to pay $25  to make an appointment.  you have to make three appointments to be eligible to get your medical cannabis card.   I NEVER SAW THE DOCTOR!   (first appointment, physicians assistant.  second appointment, education, third appointment, how to fill out the forms.)  each visit $125.....does not take insurance.   when I went to the dispensary i signed something that said I had an ongoing relationship with a doctor.   wow.

Womp womp, came in for a friends birthday and felt unwelcomed by the bartender, she quickly took our orders and made are drinks as there was no one else at the bar.  I should say this was the upstairs bar and this was  the female bartender.  Maybe she was having a bad day I thought?  We took our drinks with us outside to the outside patio and after a while I glance up to see the bartender was now all smiles and laughs with her co worker.  Glad her day got better, perhaps she'll treat the next customer nicer.  So on the way out I said thanks to her have a nice day, and she completely ignored me, besides that the patio which was nicely decorated with pretty lights and plants had a nice waft of sewage coming from the street below.  Awesome establishment.  Skip it y'all!

Burgers lack any seasoning and were overwhelmingly flavorless. Nothing worse then having a burger or burgers and having zero seasoning on the meat. Also the waffle fries were soggy dripping in oil...ick.

The bright side were the nachos and the service. I really thing they need to sit down and rethink their cooking.

I ordered rapid pick up, picked up my order and got home before I discovered that they forgot to put my sandwich in the bag. I called to rectify the situation and was told that someone would deliver the sandwich to my home. I waited in my front window for 1.5 hours before I called back to inquire about the delivery. I was told that someone tried to deliver but no one answered. As mentioned previously I was sitting at the window waiting and had my cell with me the whole time and there was no knock or call.

Made the mistake of getting breakfast here with a coworker.  

Ordered French toast, got pancakes.  Twice.  
Ordered steak, egg and cheese with toast and home fries, got a watery not done looking egg and cheese omelet with salty cheesesteak meat piled on top of it not mixed together at all, and French fries instead of home fries.

Really?

I was there once, by myself, for lunch. This was over a year ago. I love smoked meats. They do their own, out in the back. I live down the street n around the corner, like a 5 minute walk, from the place. When I realized the delicious  smokey smells that were occasionally wafting my way were coming from their pit...well I had to try! 
I wanted brisket, but, not a menu item mid week. Disapointing! Keeping things light, and wanting to taste the meat, I ordered salad. With chicken. Mustave been a bad day for salad reason for 2 stars. In a salad, the lettuce quality is rather important. What I got was alotta trashy white stuff that u throw out disguised by a thin layer of dark green cilantro to cover. Not cool! Shudda been honest about that when I ordered. Fancy sauces, when the cost of a simple lunch is 15$!... ALL shud b PERFECT! Not just the meat n sauce! So a year later, this is what sticks in my mind... lousey, high dollar salad. Then there's that obnoxiously loud hip-hop u r subject to while waiting for a table and ur order. I don't think the boss was in. There were only a few young employees that I cud see. They were VERY friendly. We did talk b4 I left about these issues and they did try to make amends with an extra taco and they offered me free delivery on a future order but I never took em up on that. Thinking about giving another try but I'm out of wrk now, the hubby is now retired, and it is so costly! Maybe they got a happy hour? Wishful thinking probably. I'll keep u posted...

There are definitely better sushi places in Indy. We came here for half price sushi which is from 5 to 7 every Monday. They had a good variety on their half-price menu. The service was great and our waitress was very attentive. But the fish that they used in the sushi was bad. I had a spicy salmon roll, and the salmon was so hard I could barely bite through it. After the meal both my husband and I felt very sick and we're pretty sure that the fish that they used in their sushi rolls was old and bad. I haven't had their hibachi in years, but I wouldn't waste my time or money going for their sushi. There are far superior places in Indianapolis.

Well, I haven't lived here in years BUT even with the HUGE increase in rent right before I left and the security deposit they KEPT from me didn't fix ANY of the ONGOING problems with this shit hole!  DON'T SPEND YOUR HARD EARNED $ HERE!

We have stayed at this hotel multiple times and never had an issue. This last time will be our last. The staff was completely new and very unfriendly. Our room was more expensive and it was close to impossible to check in even though we were in a hurry.  The AC didn't work in the room either. We won't be coming back.

I placed a simple order Via grub hub.  Meat sandwich, potatoes and beans.  I got a cold meat sandwich, cold beans and the wrong side.   No one at grubhub wanted to help and I shouldn't get cold bbq delivered.  The place is less than 5 mins from where I had it delivered.    
   Perhaps it's a great place to eat at, but the delivery and quality of food and assistance is lacking.  
   Find another BBQ joint that cares about its deliveries.

We ordered tonight (9/11/18) from the West Chester location for my husband's birthday. He got a craving for late night cookies and I wanted to make his birthday dreams come true. We ordered at 10:11 pm and spent the next 90 minutes constantly refreshing the "track order" page to see when our cookies would arrive. We live in town less than a mile away from the store. At 11:41 (in that amount of time, I could have mixed and baked two full batches of cookies, by the way), we finally decide to call and see where our cookies are. A less than friendly representative on the phone tells me our location is closed for deliveries "to catch up on orders." Says we can go to the store to pick up our order ourselves if we want. Are you kidding me?! First off, we should have never been allowed to order cookies for delivery if the store wasn't delivering. Second of all, false advertising. You say you deliver until 3am?! Thirdly, no one from the store could bother to call us and let us know what was going on? Fourthly, I understand that the person we talked to on the phone had no control over the situation, but there was no apology or compassion, and we got major attitude when we asked for a refund. This is a company that doesn't care about customer service. I am not exaggerating when I say this is the worst customer service experience I have ever had with a business in West Chester, and I have lived in the borough for 9 years. We will not be ordering from here again, and good riddance.

Food was OK, I was hungry but the place is a bit dirtier than I would like for a restaurant. I definitely wouldn't eat in. The guy at the counter was like a robot, no personality, no smile nothing. He can't be the owner but than again he might be. Flies, floors dirty and the employees are sitting eating Domino's, that scares me. I would hope they were eating the food they cook. I understand we all need to have some pizza so I won't hold that against them. I won't be back.

Do not order! I literally JUST had the worst experience ever. I order my food 20 minutes later I call to see if they received my order they say yes it's being delivered then 2 HOURS later still no food. When it did arrive the food was cold and saugy. The driver has a very bad attitude and shrugged when I told him my kids have been waiting to eat & we are all very hungry.... the food wasn't even good enough to feed my dog. Now they won't even answer the phone to address the issue... very very poor service.
This place is slow!  Made an on-line appointment for 10:00 AM to repair a leak in one tire.  They did not start working on the car until noon.  Why bother making an appointment?
NO walk-in appointments. Expensive. No specials for mani-pedi. Outside of the building is nicer than the inside. Don't waste your time.

The Haven used to be really good. I have been going there since I was a child. It's just not so good anymore. The burgers are small and burnt up. I even tried ordering a burger rare and it was still well done. The fries are frozen--I think we have actually gotten an ice cold fry on our plate. The staff is unfriendly and not attentive. I added a star because the cod sandwich is good. The toasted ravioli and toasted cannelloni are also good but they order those in from Nonna's.

Maria is no longer here  and the manager here sucks.  The owner needs to teach the manager how to handles customers and not lie to them.  Just another lie from the manger who should have taken care of this a long time ago.  I should not have to call you or have you call me over and over to get this taken care of this.
I spoke to the manager several times over a few months never took care of a thing. She doesn't need to talk to me just fix the problem. That's what good CS  all about.

I tried this restaurant only because it was a block from my church and I was starving to death.  I went there on a Saturday for take-out and the line was not long.  I looked at the menu and I first decided I wanted a BLT and then I decided no, because I didn't want any bread.  So then I decided on turkey bacon and grits.  The wait wasn't long and I should have checked my food before I left.  I ordered a platter and it was $8.64.  I couldn't believe how high that was, just for three slices of turkey bacon and grits.  Lo and behold they had put cheese on the grits and I do not like cheese on grits and so I went back.  I told them I only wanted butter on my grits and the turkey bacon. I asked for butter on the side and they put the butter on the grits.  I decided they cannot follow instructions and then I left with my updated order.  The food was okay, but I will definitely not be back.  $8.64 for bacon, grits and a juice is outrageous!!!! NO WAY!!!! NO MORE!!!!!!!

One day in NOLA and my daughter wanted Crawfish so I looked to my Yelp friends for advice and discovered that J's is the place to come.  We stopped by the counter (around 11 am) and the cashier told us that the crawfish wouldn't be ready for another 20 minutes so my husband ordered catfish filets.  We turned around to walk on to see if we could find any other places with crawfish and my daughter found a place in the center of the market with crawfish.  We walked over there (not realizing it was an extension of J's Seafood dock) and asked for crawfish.  The guy muttered something and pointed to the other guy at the stand.  We walked over to him and to wait a couple of minutes to get his attention, only to be told that we had to go back to the original counter that we ordered the catfish from and then screamed at her that the crawfish was ready and "don't be chasing customers away".  (The whole back and forth is VERY confusing!!).  We waited in line AGAIN, paid for the crawfish and then had to walk back over to the counter in the center to pick them up.  My daughter and I were about 1/2 way finished eating 2 pounds of crawfish by the time my husband's catfish was finally finished.  Overall....  the entire experience was very confusing and the customer service was really bad.

Came here for lunch on opening day. I dined in by myself, ordered the Pork belly tonkatsu ramen. Also, ordered 2 of the same dishes to go. Here is a summary of my experience:

-Took a very long time to receive my food, despite the restaurant not being overly busy and had more than enough staff
-The quality of the ramen was unremarkable at best from the overly salty broth to the noodles; I'd recommend Nomiya and Kin's ramen any day over this 
-Had a surplus of staff in the kitchen and front of house, but only a few really looked like they were trained and know what they were doing
-The restaurant was completely dysfunctional; multiple parties walked out because they waited too long to receive food, drinks, etc 
-Did not seem to be a visible manager taking charge of the operation
-My take out orders took way too long and I unfortunately had to cancel after 45 min

Hopefully this was all due to opening day jitters but from my observations, they rushed into opening prematurely without proper preparation, training and leadership.

i have had nothing but problems with this company.  i had windows installed 2 years ago and 2 of them never worked. schedule appointments were cancelled or the person schedule to arrive between 3:00-5:00 never shows up or calls to explain.  i overpaid for the windows to begin with and very much regret using green star

I am going to go ahead and write this company very poor service I have T-Mobile wireless service my nephew lost his phone opened a claim with the insurance company here and open the claim on January 21st which was a Saturday I understood that nothing would be process until Monday open the claim you have to upload your license they send me the link I upload my license come Monday morning I check my email to get my tracking number for the phone well guess what it wasn't there so I called the insurance company assistant and was told by the representative that they didn't receive my documents but when I uploaded my document it was uploaded successfully on my end well here's that information when I talk to the rep on Saturday to open the claim she did not advise me that I had to scan the front and back of my license first of all never heard of that had I not called this company I wouldn't have even known that my my claim has been processed they don't reach out to you very unprofessional company and now my nephew who is away in college with no phone we have no way to contact him and they are not trying to help and expedite or get the phone done sooner they have my information so I have to call them every single day to see if my phone has been processed this company sucks

My first negative review on Yelp. While waiting for a table, my husband and I ordered a beer and vodka tonic - $19 - Ouch! The bar tender couldn't tell my husband what they had on tap, and they were out of Tito's vodka. Terrible service and ridiculous prices,  we decided to not bother eating here.

This is the worst customer service I have experienced in the South TAMPA area!!!! I preferred through Uber eats, when the food was delivered, the sealed bag with our name on it only had half of the order in it. When I contacted Big Island Poke-they told me it was the Uber drivers fault, that they delivered the wrong order.....um no. It was our order-that had not completed. We are still waiting for a refund. WE WILL NEVER ORDER FOOD HERE AGAIN. And the food we did receive was decent at best.

In the couple of times I have eaten here threes nothing to brag about. Lunch is very mediocre and the only reason they didn't receive a one star is because of our server went out of his way.

Much better options in the area.
Horrible!!!! Got put on the waiting list at 6:50pm on a Saturday. My table was ready at 9:45pm. Hostess said it would be a 45 min wait. Don't waste your time!!

Suggested my daughter and her small children go to a HALLOWEEN ALTERNATIVE EVENT on October 31 because the world is bombarding believers with Halloween, the demonic holiday.  Wow - Shocked!  My daughter and husband took two small children - 2 and 8 years old and found people in full Halloween attire!  And - half naked!  A church event  - Unbelievable.  We just moved here from out of town looking for a REAL, BIBLICALLY SOUND CHURCH - we've been to the church a couple of times and thought, hmmm maybe.  This City Jam event made the decision for us.  Halloween is NOT FOR CHRISTIANS WHO FOLLOW CHRIST, the LORD OF LIFE and CITY LIFE CHURCH is not for us!  I'm heartbroken.  Why go to church at all if churches like this exist.  Very sad.

They lost or took my key fob and told me it was there and they would find it. After looking, they couldn't find it so they told me it was my problem and that I had no proof it was in my car. Horrible service, dirty facility and terrible customer service!

I just opened an account in this branch on August 10, and in 1 week i had so many different troubles every single day! I used to use chase bank before I moved to philly and never had a problem with that at all! But td bank is the worst bank I've ever worked with!!! Finally they locked my account for no reason and i tried to call them finally I reached them and they said, it will take a couple more days to unlock it.... stay away from this shitty bank

stay away   you will thank yourself   the price they show  on line   no ,,
when you show up no that's not really the price,,, it is way way more money  , the sales guys spend more time in huddle with the sales manager than they do with you, they will hide hold your keys on your trade in, plus offer you a least 5k less than any other dealer in the indy metro area, they are why people hate car dealers,  again my cash offer, no trade, that they showed on line, was thousands more when I showed up to buy....

Absolute worse nail dip I've ever had!   Have been here many times before and Michelle did my nails and they were awesome!  Last time there was told Michelle no longer there, had another tech, 4 nails were chipped and broken within 1 week, went back and waited over 45mins for them to tell me I could wait another 30 mins or come back the next day, either way, they were not going to discount my service because it was more than 3 days and I didn't call to tell them I had a problem.   Terrible customer service I will not be back!
Terrible service. Rude staff.  Inexperienced bar staff.  No limes....seriously?  Band was ok but all in all a bad experience.   No limes that night....management must have been out of town
The service is terrible. We waited over an hour to be served our food. The food is not worth the wait and the service was worse than awful. Won't go back and I live walking distance to this place.

Went to Applebees today in Spring Hill, on Commercial Way.

Spent over $70 dollars and was told by the waitress, who was VERY APOLOGETIC and NICE, that we were not allowed to take our all you can eat meals him with us even though we had only one serving and left half of it there. 

What do they do with the food we did not take home?

I did not want the waitress to get into trouble and I paid the bill but I WILL NOT BE GOING THERE AGAIN.

Being told that we could not take our food , THAT WE PAID FOR, home was ridiculous.  I understand it was all you can eat but there were 3 of us and we all had only one serving!!!!!!!!

The waitress informed us that management was watching the cameras and was not allowing this, ????????????? NOT VERY CUSTOMER FRIENDLY AND THEY JUST LOST 3 PAYING CUSTOMERS

Ordered shrimp taco appetizer... They never brought the appetizer instead just brought entrees.. The waitress recommended roasted potatoes... after an hour of waiting for the appetizer, they brought us mashed potatoes with our entrees. We were so hungry at that point that we didn't say anything but There are so many other places that you could spend your money, and your time more effectively than this place. Food was decent but all things considered, look at how dirty the floor is... It can tell you a lot about a place and this floor screams "Go next door!"
Food took forever soup was cold. Manager was touching people's food bare handed. Food receipts on top of salad while waiting to be served. Waited forever for food that was cold

This is not my slice of pizza. I ordered a cheesesteak and garlic bread the other day. The garlic bread was butter and garlic on cheesesteak bread. The cheesesteak lacked cheese. 

On the bight size they have a super convenient location and had my food ready in like 8 minutes.

We arrived at 6pm for check-in. The lobby area was decorated nicely and provided fruit infused cold water. Shantal, receptionist at front desk was really nice and welcoming. She changed our room from a queen to a double room. We asked her to book a Whitney Plantation Tour for us. She said it wouldn't be a problem. Thankfully, there are two elevators available to guests. We had a corner room on the 4th floor next to Lafayette Park and the streetcar. You can hear the streetcar pass by but it wasn't a problem for us. There were stains on a white pillow case so I didn't use it although it was clean. The hotel is in a great location! Not to far from French Quarter or Garden District.
  On day two of our stay, the big slow elevator broke down. All guests including housekeeping were forced to use the smaller elevator. Housekeeping was complaining about the elevator because it breaks often...so beware.
  Shantal was suppose to make reservations for Whitney Plantation Tour but never confirmed our reservations. To make matters worse no one at the desk knew whether or not we had a reservation and had to give her call on her day off. She told them a tour driver would pick us up at 10:15 am. On the day of our tour, Shantal then told us the driver was picking us up at noon. Shantal told us the tour would last 4 hours and return us at the hotel around 5 pm. When we got on the tour bus, the driver told the group it was 6.5 hours tour by then we were on the highway so it was too late to do anything. Definitely make your own tour reservation DO NOT rely on Shantal.

If all you're looking for is a place to shoot guns down a range then this will suffice.  I've been here multiple times and had mixed experiences.  My last experience here will be just that.  My last.  

Everything is overpriced.  I would bet that any item you find at this place, you can find cheaper online or at another store.  I get it that most of the time smaller shops need to charge more to stay in business.  This is why I do believe in supporting local shops ( I do the same with fishing bait & tackle stores). 

Their customer service is hit or miss.  I've gone in there at times and not once been greeted or asked if I was looking for something.  I have been at the gun counter and just stood there looking at the guns.  There was some kid standing behind the counter that literally just stood there.  If you're going to hire someone to work the front and deal with customers they should be able to, at the minimum, talk.  Other times I've been greeted with a smile upon entrance and asked if I needed assistance.  I've been helped successfully in finding specific items.  Like I said, hit or miss.  

I had a set of handgun sights put on here that was very quick.  Called and he said to come in.  Took him 5 minutes to put them on.  Was charged $30+tax for this.  I figured this was fine.  I could have bought a sight remover and done it myself, but like I said I do believe in supporting local businesses. 

The last time I was here I had an inexpensive rifle that wasn't working properly. I called and spoke to the gunsmith and told him I only paid $100 for the gun and if the cost to repair it was anywhere close to this I wouldn't even bother with attempting to fix it.  He said to come in and he'll have a look and call me(he never called).  I brought it in and gave them a call 2 days later.  He said it couldn't be fixed and that he couldn't find a replacement part.  I thought OK, he'll probably charge a small fee for diagnosing it.  I go there and he hands me a bill for $35+tax that says "not able to fix, no replacement available".    So I ended up paying close to $40 to have them hold my gun for 2 days haha.  I get that he took time to see it wasn't able to be fixed, but there is a time and a place to do the right thing.  That is why I initially called and told him I only paid $100 for the gun. I just paid them 40% of what I paid for the thing to tell me that it's broken and can't be fixed.  Thanks!  I'm not a gunsmith but I took the gun apart multiple times trying to figure out the problem before bringing it in.  It takes 2 minutes, tops !  It's literally held together by one bolt screw.  He told me he worked on it for 1.5 hours.  

Maybe i'm wrong and I guess this business is pretty cutthroat, but I know I won't be returning here.  Nickel and dime'ing me out of $40 just lost them a repeat customer.  A little decency goes a long way.  I'll gladly drive the extra miles to go to Shooters World.  I've been there multiple times and never had a bad experience.  Their range is better.  They also have a nice lounge area with free beverages.

We bought the membership program for plumbing, electrical and air conditioning. They would come out periodically to check, but it was only just an excuse to try to sell us new and unnecessary parts. 

After calling to cancel the $35 per month charge, I was told I had to send a written request by email or regular mail, and it would take 30 days for it to be cancelled. Of course that means they get another payment out of me. 

30 days?  Sleezeballs.

Had a snickerdoodle cookie and wasn't impressed. I initially asked was the cookie made with cream of tartar and they aren't. That answer alone gave me the thought it won't be that great and sure enough it wasn't. The inside of the cookie was very doughy in my opinion as well.

Horrible service, servers uneducated, old restaurant,  not updated. Out of items. Worst experience ever. Pricey as well. Only went there due to some friends request. All of us agree we will never be back.

I would not recommend this establishment! Staff is quite terrible to say the least. I've seen them hit and kick each other, cussing coming from the back (I have no idea what goes on back there!) I've been yelled at by the cashier, called in and been greeted terribly on the phone. Now that's just the service. The actual pizzas are the kicker, the dough is usually not proofed (which basically means it hasn't puffed up from the yeast and that jazz) the employees just grab hand fulls of stuff and throw them on the pizza all in the middle! I use to work at a papa Murphy's and they're supposed to measure out the ingredients. That's what you pay for!! Overall this place is terrible I have met the owner once or twice she's nice and the other older lady is too but the younger staff is completely unprofessional, unsanitary, unsafe, and need to watch their mouths around customers. I would not recommend this place at all!

Unfortunately, the way this office is run is anything but professional. Scheduling with this doctor is extremely inconvenient as she is out of the office often. Or as in my case, will reschedule because she out of the office, get a confirmation about the appointment and get a call the next day asking to reschedule again because she scheduled a surgery instead. How much time am I going to have to take off work to be seen? I find that quite inconsiderate. If you have an appointment at 8:30 am, considerate it 9:30. Trying to get a prescription renewed? Good luck. Having this office coordinate with my pharmacy took weeks. No hormones for over 14 days- you bet I was all over the place. Or the new billing system a few months ago- 6 months with no notification about new billing changes and get slapped with $600 before I can be seen again since it had been so long. I never felt 100% with the answers I got from Ms. Ashley, as I tried my best to ask the questions in a way she could understand. Shouldn't it bet the other way around? She was always in a rush and 'had patients waiting'. I decided not to continue going to this office since I have had so many issues, but needed the last test results I had taken. I requested these results THREE times and still no answers today. No return calls, zero reliability, and a faulty office system. Ladies, get a different OBGYN.

Excellent location. Bars, restaurants are easy and close to walk to but that is the only pro. Parking is in a public garage so there is no security. Many business people use this hotel for meetings but have access to all floors. Hot cookie they gave us on check-in was unappealing. Room was tiny. The washroom had no fan. The toilet paper holder was broken. There was a quiet high pitched sound coming from the hallway the entire time. Housekeeping knocked at 8am when check out was at 11. The room would not heat up even when we turned the thermostat all the way up. Sometimes it blew cold air so we pulled out the filters only to find that they were completely disgusting. Very disappointing, especially for the price.

Brought my new to me 2008 Suzuki sx4 in for a general assessment and road worthy test. 

Replaced my tire rod ends, rear breaks, changed the oil, and aligned my tires.

$12xx

Completely missed that the water pump was failing, and it was noisy!! which ended up costing me another $12xx, plus hotel stay.

Forgot to put the bolts back on after checking the air filter, and possibly other bolts that ended up costing me an extra $35 in shop fees where I broke down.

Broke down meaning water pump catastrophically fails, on i10 at 75mph, taking out the water pump pulley, drive belt, belt tensioner, and serpentine belt. Apparently.

That's what pep boys in Daphne, AL got me for anyway.

It's a shame. I was ready and willing to have Midas charge me anything to keep me on the road and safe.
This place is awful! Cold food, bad tasting food. It's just a really nasty "Chinese" buffet. You can do better eating from a gas station, avoid at all costs!

This place is over rated and charged for everything ,their fajita meat was horrible and In addition to that the register lady had an ugly attitude! All I can say is that they won't be getting my services again. Everyone seems pleased with their food maybe I caught them on a bad day .

Dr. Santa is a decent doctor, but Dr. Stanko may be one of the worst doctors I've ever seen. Period. 
I went in for a skin condition and she looked at my hand for about 2 seconds and said, 'oh, it's eczema.' I never had anything of the sort and i was hoping for more information. She said that she would give me a cream and that's it. There has been no improvement in 9 months. 
During that same appointment, she recommended dysport because they were offering a special. I usually get Botox and Dr. Stanko said that there's no difference between the two, but there is a difference that I'm now aware of. I did get the dysport and once she was done, she said, 'you didn't get enough units of dysport to qualify for the special.' Then why offer it to me? I was paying $17/unit for Botox and once I realized how wildly overpriced that was, I went elsewhere and I now pay $9.50/unit. They also never mentioned the manufacturer's discount program. 
When I went back recently to have my eczema re-evaluated, as soon as I walked in, I caught a big whiff of disgusting food and coffee. The woman at the front desk was eating something that made me want to gag. I had to hold my hand over my face to speak to her. No one should ever eat at any front desk ANYWHERE. It's unprofessional and disgusting. The woman I spoke to was super rude to me. She had red short hair. She told me that I had missed appointment fees to pay. I rescheduled one appointment and the other was a legit miss. It was my first. She wanted me to pay $150+, which wasn't happening. I tried explaining what happened and she kept interrupting me and was rude and indignant. Between her disgusting plate of food and attitude, I just walked out and called UPenn - which is where everyone should go. I didn't feel like I should have to argue or be spoken over.
I don't know why these folks treat people like they are better than everyone and have no time. I wish I went to UPenn on day one because I likely wouldn't still have the problems that I do. 
I called again to see if they would print or transfer my files and they wanted to charge me another $25 or $50. I asked to speak to the manager, who they wouldn't identify by name. The manager called me and I wasn't able to pick up and she couldn't leave a VM bc i turned it off. I tried reaching her again to no avail. 
I called again today to see if they would refill the steroid cream that they gave me for the eczema while i wait for my appointment at UPenn and they refused unless I made an appointment and came in. When I needed it refilled before all of this, I called and they gave it to me with no problem. I had it later that day. Now it just seems petty and spiteful + they want to bill my insurance for nonsense.
I find these folks to be rude, uppity, unprofessional, and extremely overpriced. I'd be willing to deal with all of that if they were actually providing wonderful care - but they don't and they couldn't care less. 
UPenn's care is unrivaled and they treat people with dignity and kindness.  Stay away from this place. They will rip you off.

Update***

I went to UPenn Derm and the doctors instantly realized that Dr. Stanko committed malpractice and misdiagnosed my skin problem. UPenn gave me the correct medicine and my hand healed in 10 days. UPenn told me not to worry about transferring my files over because they don't believe in the integrity of their work anyway.

Went for dinner, were seated without issue, restaurant was empty. Sat for 10 minutes without anyone coming to say say hi or pour water. After 10 minutes and still no waiter (they were so disinterested/clueless, I was literally turning around in my seat to try to get someone's attention without effect) we got up and left. Too many good restaurants in the city to bother with that

Got to the counter and had rented at Tampa airport on mistake.  Great 
Customer service kicks in when there is a problem. Arrived 9 pm with my two girls.  They were going to charge double and I had to call customer service.  Obviously a foreign call center and she was rude.  20 miles apart and we had to get a taxi and go pick up at the other air port or our fee would be double. 
I usually use Avis and I will be going back to them.

The timings posted here and on the front door of the business are wrong. I showed up at 4 PM on a Sunday and they were closed. That is pretty unacceptable for a business that claims to be open throughout the day. Poor.

Waited at pick up wibdow for almost 8 minutes until someone finally greeted us. Pizza was ok but the wings were horrible and the 3 garlic sauces we ordered and paod for we found out after we get home were not in the box like employee said they were. Very over priced for what we got

I hate to say this..but this restaurant was terrible.  We waited 20 minutes to get a server...we finally got one and he was nice but it went downhill from there.  He was so busy we didn't get to order for 30 minutes.  The food...burrito, shrimp fajitas, fish tacos,...I'm sorry it wasn't good Mexican food at all!!  Then the margarita was $16!!  REALLY?!?  My kids wanted dessert..but he brought our bill without even asking.  Never again!

What happened to this place? Almost empty at lunch time on Monday!
Now I know why... food was uneventful and just lacked taste and appearance.
Sides were so so. 
Very disappointing... a real let down from what it was!

My husband had the washtub fries and I had the run chicken run. Service was slow and waitress didn't check on us after we got our drinks nor after we got our meal. The washtub fries were great. Chicken on my sandwich was dry and the avocado wasn't ripe and was hard. 2 bites of my sandwich and I had enough of that plate. Thank goodness the washtub fries were supersized for me and my husband to share.

So I visited this location for the 1st time. I ordered my regular Smoothie and a cup of ice water with extra ice. The employee response were not allowed to give out water. So I said how much is the water I will purchase it. She said no per the owners request we can't sell a cup of ice water.  I said that's strange I go to all the Smoothie Kings and get a FREE cup of water when I purchased $7 Smoothie. After asking for corporates # then she gave me a very small cup of ice. I'm very disappointed in the owners practices at this location. The workers were nice they just were following the policy the Owner made!!!! I WILL NEVER RETURN TO THIS LOCATION

I desparately need a car that will tow.  Thought I found one at this location but was concerned about the multiple 'no test drive' reviews on this site so I called them to ask about their procedures.  Even if it was free I wouldn't buy a car here.  Spoke to Donny himself (I assume, since he said he personally answers negative reviews) who proceeded to tell me that all those reviews are bogus, yelp is a substandard review site and that they apparently are beset by people wanting to test drive cars for no reason at all.  Big song and dance about how long they've been in business, etc., just like on his responses.  When I replied that does not interest me he let me know I was wrong.  Well, buddy, it doesn't interest me.  While plenty of businesses have been around a long time, that does not stop them from providing bad service!  I'd steer clear of this self-righteous jerk if I were you!

This is an all you can eat buffet.  I've been to Shepard's before and the food was very good.  However, they recently changed the menu and it's blasé at best.  They have shrimp (coconut, steamed), craw fish, grouper, prime rib, sausages.  It's $35 for the buffet plus an additional $10 for unlimited crab legs (it use to be included in the $35 price).  They also have a large dessert area.  I gave this place 2 stars because I found a hair in my creme brûlée.  Our serve reported the incidence to Chris who was the manager on duty.  He came over and was very apologetic or the incident.  To me the cardinal rule of dining out is NO HAIR IN FOOD!!! Not sure what could've been done for this, but I think something should've been done.  SMH!!!

Zero stars should be an option. 1 is too generous. Absolutely HORRIBLE service here. I stopped in to purchase end of the year gift cards and was treated very poorly. I asked for 12 $10 gift cards. The man at the counter asked if I meant $5. Insinuating that I couldn't afford the amount I was purchasing. I said no $10. At this point 2 other women joined him at the register and the three of them began to speak another language. He then asked if I was paying in cash. I said no why? He said card? I said yes. He then asked if I had I.D. (This is all before even starting my gift card transaction.) I said yes I have I.D. why are you asking me this? To which he replied because people are frauds. He proceeded to speak in his native language to the other two women next to him at the register. 

I asked about the DD rewards program to which none of them could explain. After 8 mins the lady finally started to ring up my gift cards. She tells me the total and to swipe my card (but doesn't check my I.D. that they so rudely asked for prior to my transactions). She handed me the gift cards and envelopes but didn't give me a bag to put them in until I asked her for it. Just rude!

I will NEVER shop at this merchant again. To assume that I could not afford my purchase or that I was a fraud is beyond insulting...prejudice to be exact.

I would have gotten Suzy Jo gift certificates however some of the recipients aren't local. Do yourself a favor and go to Wawa or Suzy Jo's

Maybe it was Christmas but, poor service, had to ask for everything.  Server actually told us, "I know what I'm doing ".  Obviously, he didn't.  My advice, don't open on Christmas, you don't do it well.

There is no selection. No eel, no baked salmon, no baked lobster or anything worth getting. It's hard to actually call this place a real sushi restaurant. All you get is some lousy fresh rolls. The selection is horrible.
Sonoran "Mexican" food for goyim. Rather tasteless. Service/server was great. Big portions. Many big tables. But the food really disappointed, and the margarita was watery

Food was "meh". Not the best burger I've ever had, but not the worst. I got the habanero mayo, which was good but there was wayyy too much sauce on the burger so it totally dominated the taste. I also ordered a fried egg with my burger, but the chef popped it and fried it before putting it on my burger. It just wasn't what we expected. Would not return if we came back to Philly

My wife and I ordered from this location via the food delivery service they use. To start, the order was incorrect and the quality of the beef was substandard containing a lot of fat and gristle. The real problem occurred about 5.5 hours after eating. Both my wife and got sick, vomiting and had to make frequent trips to the restroom with diarrhea. I contacted the location the following day to let the manager know. He told me that he would submit my complaint up the chain and I would soon be contacted regarding the incident. I have yet to be called back. I'm highly disappointed and will not eat their again.

My family took Grandma here for her birthday dinner yesterday in hopes of satisfying cravings for both sushi and pizza. The last time I had eaten here, the sushi portion was owned by Superb Sushi; apparently, it isn't anymore. I was very unimpressed by the sushi. My roll was loose and didn't pop like sushi at the actual remaining Superb Sushi on 8th street. My husband, daughter and MIL all ordered rolls as well, but for some reason they threw everything on one plate. When my MIL got up to ask for some plates, she was given a dirty look... Not cool. Then, the kids and my husband each ordered a slice of pizza and they all got burnt on the bottom which obviously led to a bitter and unpleasant burnt taste. To top it all off, the beer wasn't even very cold at all. Sad to say, but I will not be back.

I went there for the first time so they had me fill out paperwork about why I was visiting. Apparently they didn't read it. Was treated like they were trying to get me in and out as quick as possible. Hopefully don't have skin cancer!

The only reason to think about eating here is on a Sunday when Chick-Fil-A is closed. 

$7 chicken strips and an extra charge for condiments? Lol, no thanks.

We are from out of Province ,  travelling to Edmonton for appointments that covered two days ...  
The second morning , we were going to check out the mall again before we headed out of town ...it was too early .. the doors did not open until 10 :00 am  ... so we walked around outside , as it was sunny and a nice morning waiting for the doors to open ,  only to arrive back to our vehicle that had a hundred dollar ticket for parking in the lot before doors opened !!!!  Yikes!!!!   We have been travelling to Edmonton , several times a year , supported stores, malls,  businesses , hotels , recreation areas etc, ..  we were shocked!  We have talked to the ticket office,  and we are going to inform the mall office of this unfair practice . At this moment , I have no desire to ever return back to this mall ....be very careful when you park at this parking lot as to the time ,  do not go before ten a.m.!!!!

Took 2 hours for food to come, then charged us for stuff we didn't order. Note to others: tortilla chips aren't free; they're expensive. If they bring you anything, whether you ordered it or not, they'll charge you for it. Total scam.

We were very disappointed with our meal Saturday. I'm only giving 2 stars because the service was outstanding, otherwise it would be 1star. My pork chop was so so, tough and fatty, my carrots so tough I couldn't cut them with a steak knife. My husbands steak was also tough.  He actually said Outback had better steaks.  Even the creme brûlée was disappointing and I love dessert. Our server Ethan was a delight as was everyone else we interacted with. Still we most likely won't be back

I recently brought my dog for a consultation regarding a medical issue that has been going on for a few months. I was very disappointed in the tech that spoke with us to get an understanding of what was going on. I began to explain from the beginning her medical condition and he cut me off. He had a set list of questions to ask and only wanted to hear those answers and that's it. It was very upsetting because her issue has been going on for awhile, and I wanted to explain exactly what was going on but was not given the chance since he was very short with me.
Terrible food greasy disgusting place don't even know how it stay's open the Place is a toilet

All around AWFUL experience. Waited over an hour for EGGS. Couldn't get a refill without asking and our server was more concerned about smoking a cigarette than us. VERY DISAPPOINTED. Wish I could leave zero stars

Okay,  I patronized this place a couple of years ago when it was High Sierra and was less than impressed with the atmosphere, hence the single visit. The star is for the craft beer. Everything else about the place is soul-sucking. It's just a typical casino bar in a crappy casino. Service was less than stellar.  I arrived at a shift change and asked for a menu all set to have some food,  but the new staff never asked if I wanted anything to eat so I had one and left.  Look for Occidental's beer at your liquor store and forget about their "brewpub", I know I will.

Me: Good morning. Can I get a bacon, egg and cheese on Cuban bread?

Owner: No.  (Long pause)..... 
But we can make it on a bagel.

Me: Okay, no thanks. 

Why is this unacceptable?  Because they make breakfast sandwiches and they also make Cuban sandwiches. This place is never busy, so why they would let a potential customer walk out is beyond me. 

I went up the street to Bayshore Breezes and got the sandwich I wanted, and will never step foot on this shop again.

Wish I could put no stars. Nasty owner. Who tries to pick a fight with their customers?? I refuse to spend my money at a place with such a rude owner, and I'll be sure no one I know spends any money here either. Pretty soon won't have a bar to run with that kind of customer service.
