Everything else was mediocre, drinks and food and service from the bartender, but the owners attitude is exactly the reason why we will never return. She was bullying my friend just because she thought she was looking at her aggressively when she was just trying to observe what she was setting up. Luckily we had a great group of friends with us to help make our time enjoyable but it was still the worst experience ever.

I dropped my car off first thing in the morning for a simple "check engine" light appointment. I was told at the end of that day that my car had not been looked at and would not be ready until the following day. What was the point of making an appointment, if they didn't even touch my car? The next evening when I came to pick it up, after they called me to tell me it was ready, I waited for a full hour before my car was given to me. They had parked so many cars in front of it they couldn't get it out. That is an hour of my life I will never get back, all because someone called and told me to come pick up my car (...which was there for two full business days, unnecessarily. For the record, there was nothing wrong with the car. It needed no repair and no maintenance). There was a kind woman who asked how they could make it up to me, but I had to tell her that I will likely never return, so it wasn't worth her time.

For many years, RH&B was the place to go in south Jersey for great BBQ and blues. Sadly, after a recent sale, the restaurant has decided to cancel all live music. The food was decent at best, and in the absence of live music offerings  I can no longer recommend this restaurant. The only aspect I will miss are the people who worked there.

We visited this establishment for the first time on a Sunday evening... I never complain about anywhere that we visit even if it is a negative experience. But this situation really had me upset! We were in the area to see a movie at the theater and we only had approximately 40 minutes to grab a quick bite. We sat down at the bar and asked the bartender if we could order right away so that we could be on time for our movie. She said, "sure no problem." However it took us over 40 minutes to receive our food (quesadillas and egg rolls). The bartender was too busy doing shots with the DJ and sitting in the back kitchen area on her phone for at least 30 minutes of the time that we were there! She left the bar patrons for over 15 minutes at a time to sit in the back and play on her phone! We finally asked "can you please tell us why our food is taking so long? Our movie starts in 2 minutes" and she very carelessly walked away and responded, "I'll check on it." It still took another 10 minutes for our food to come out (all the while she was nowhere to be found). Needless to say we were late for our movie and extremely upset because there are several other places that we could have chose to grab a bite to eat and had plenty of time to do so. I think this establishment really needs to do a better job at screening who they hire and training their employees to properly care for their customers rather than drink and play on the job! Food was actually pretty good but service ... HORRIBLE!

I had a terrible experience here. It was my first time leasing a car and my fears about shady dealerships came true at Martin Main Line. The main problems I encountered here:

1. The agreed upon price of the car I leased was increased by $150 between the negotiation and getting to the finance office. No one told me. I noticed when I got home and re-read the lease and immediately emailed the salesperson, Mitch, who replied "I don't know what happened. I'll ask my manager". I never heard back from him despite sending a follow up email the next week.  I guess I'm naive for assuming the agreed upon price would be the price listed in the paperwork. I didn't notice the price increase in the finance office because I was rushed through signing everything on an iPad, where the manager knocked on the door about 5 times telling the finance guy to hurry up. He did not greet us once. 

2. I initially purchased Honda Care, then decided I didn't want it. I called the dealership twice, left two voice messages with two finance people, and sent two emails to salespeople I had worked with prior about how to go about cancelling it/how the refund would work. No one answered at all. I ended up cancelling through the Honda Care headquarters phone number.

These are just a few of the issues I encountered but I think they demonstrate the complete lack of customer service and professionalism this dealership displays. They do not care about the customer at all once you walk out the door and they have your money. I would never go to them again and would never recommend them to friends or family. Stay away from Martin Main Line.
No dark beer in February???  Nice looking place and nice folks...  summer beer in February was a disappointment...
So you respond without asking any questions about the incident and just "disagree" which is a testament to what people can expect.

The only reason this gets one star more than Diamond Cabaret was the atmosphere and wait staff were waaaaay better. That being said, still a shitty strip club. Unless you're a regular, be prepared to get ignored even if you go up to the stage and tip girls. They barely make the rounds and never initiate contact. Never even try to sell private dances. One girl, who claimed to be a porn start and was guest dancing there, would damage on stage, then just go to the slot machines. (By porn star i think she was paid to screw on camera once or twice, but was definitely not as famous as she thought). I just don't get these places. They let their girls sit with the same old dudes and they ignored 75% of the people there who go in with money to spend? Makes no sense. I'd avoid if possible.

I was so excited to visit due to the high reviews and recommendations. My friend and I waited 30 minutes in line for a table. I ordered regular pancakes, eggs, and bacon. 

It was extremely underwhelming. I have made better pancakes in my own kitchen. There is absolutely nothing special about Pancake Pantry. Don't believe the hype. 

PS. Someone should really be in charge of cleaning the bathroom because it's disgusting.

Everyone BUT Sherry was great. Got a bad vibe from her from the beginning She talked down to me it felt. Let me know when she's fired I'll be back. Cassidy and Emma I believe (other young receptionist) were VERY nice. My dog loves everyone but HATED her. my dog was a rescue and had a bunch of hygiene issues and Sherry judged me for his bad hygiene even though i was going there for help.

I wanted to like this place, I really did. Unfortunately my experience wasn't the best. First, the boba is very disappointing. The waitress told us it was a powder, and it was disgustingly sweet. Second, I got the salmon bowl which the salmon tasted very dry even though it was covered in mayo. My boyfriend got a sushi burrito, he said it was ok. About 20 minutes later, we both started to have a stomachache. I felt nauseous the rest of the night. I might go back and try something cooked.

Four of us went out to try this restaurant and I doubt we will go back.  Most of the food was good, but one person got the Prime Rib which he order Med Rare and which came out Medium to Medium Well.  It also had quite a bit of gristle which Prime Rib should not have so I questioned whether it was really a prime cut. We had the waiter, owner and one other person stop by to talk to us and they said that they would take care of it.  When we got the bill (which was over $300) the prime rib was still included.  Our friend did not want us to cause more of a scene so we left.

Worst pizza hut ever. Don't order from here, their customer service is awful. Ordered a pizza for delivery waited 2 hours and still did not get it. Trying calling the store 10 times and their phone doesn't work so I had no idea where my pizza was. I had to leave my event to get the pizza that was supposed to be delivered. The staff was rude. We were told our pizza had been ready an hour ago and yet it still was not delivered. So we ended up with hour old cold pizza. I had to ask for a discount as they tried to charge me full price, only gave us a few dollars off. Also I didn't see any of the staff wearing hairnets or gloves. I was disgusted. Will never ever come back. Stay away and go for dominos instead.

OPMy husband and I were in Center City  enjoying the ballet and afterward I  was craving papparedelle. I did a Google search and Lascala was recommended. I noticed as we were seated that the table didn't offer a salt or pepper shaker- which set my expeditions very high- for the chef to produce a tasteful and well balanced dish. Highly disappointed was an understatment. In hindsight I remember our server saying that LaScala was known for their pappardelle as being one of their best dishes. After taking 2 bites my immediate response was "WHY tf?" If the pasta was home made and fresh it was hard to tell since it was drenched in THE MOST TASTELESS, SALTLESS, under seasoned wine sauce EVER. Our server knew I was displeased yet didn't send over the manager...he just wanted to get by, I suppose. So in the end, I asked for a manger. Needless to say I was disappointed yet again. We live quite a distance from Center City, so each visit makes an impact. Maybe LaScala's chef was having a rough night, maybe our server was having a bad day, maybe the manager on duty didn't give two F's and over all it was our bad luck that we happened to try  LaScala on this particular evening...LaScala wont get a second chance with us. Try at your own risk.

We never had an issue until today. My husband and I love the portion sizes. However, we ordered a corn beef sandwich that comes a soup and french fries. The soup was okay but the crackers were stale. The corn beef had a bad after taste. We didn't want the food. We complained to management and they had the nerve to charge us for the two soups because we didn't want the meal.

I had their tomato pie slice, mushroom risotto and mushroom fettuccini. I was disappointed because the slice of tomato pie had the bottom part a bit burnt and the top part of the slice tasted like undercooked dough. The risotto and fettuccini could have been good but it had a real doughy or gummy texture to it, which didn't appeal to me.

I recently had lunch here with a dear friend.  I can only say that the food and staff were wonderful. However, we were subjected to listening to Fox News during our entire dining experience. There are several televisions in view and the sound was not muted. I have to admit that I was offended not only because I find Fox News offensive but that I was being delivered any political view when all I wanted was to enjoy lunch with my friend. I won't be coming back.

The food was extremely disappointing. Nothing had flavor and definitely didn't look as appetizing as the photos when it was served. I tried several sides, the fried chicken, and bread pudding. I would not go back and order any of them again. Nice historical building and the service was ok.

I would like to give this location more stars but my meal was not as good as what I have experienced at the 96th street location.  Three of us ordered the ribs which had good flavor but were tough and not meaty. This was my second try of the ribs at this location and both experiences was similar.  At the 96th street location the ribs have always been very good and have almost fallen off the bone.  

We really like the set up of the bar and outdoor seating is great. The patio is now open with live music which makes this location even better. 

i really want this location to make it - it's a great facility on the lake, but with the poor experience that I have had on both occasions, I'm not looking to rush back for the food.

The positive: overall polish job is fine. She took time to clean up my nail bed where the gel polish had spilled over and cured there. 

The negative: way too busy and crowded to be a relaxing experience. No magazines or anything while you're waiting or getting pedicure. The water for my pedicure was barely warm even after I asked her to heat it up once. The nail technician's nails were dirty underneath as were those of the tech working next to her. I understand that they keep their hands in water and cleaning up nail polish all day and this might have partly been polish residue as they often use their nails to clean up spillage into nail beds but it really turned me off. They didn't turn on my massage chair during the pedicure. I didn't see prices posted anywhere in the shop (they may have been and I just didn't notice). A gel manicure and regular pedicure cost $52 The polish selection was ok but I've seen better. I picked out a gel nail polish for my manicure from samples while I was getting a pedicure. She had that polish with the same number sitting on the table when she started my manicure. I went to wash my hands and she had pulled out another color. I was pretty itchy from the lotion that they used. I noticed a couple hours after the manicure that there is a painful split under my fingernail. Whether or not this is from their technique I obviously can't say for certain. For how busy they are, the parking lot is not adequate and I had to find street parking around the corner in the neighborhood.

When I went to the Baguette Deli, I was really excited, I had read about how good their sandwiches were. I sure wish mine had looked like that one in the photo. The sandwich I received consisted of a large amount of bread and very little meat and a lot of vegetables, very little taste. Needless to say I was disappointed.

Drive thru staff very rude...I went through the drive thru on 6-1-18 around 3:30pm. It was not busy at all. The girl did nothing but mumble words and leave me hanging not telling me to drive thru or what?! She was a young heavyset black girl. This was the worst and most inattentive person to put dealing with the public. Then when I got to the window, she yelled at me for driving to the window and not waiting for her to respond. R u kidding me?! Since when does a drive thru emoloyee yell at a customer? I told her I could not understand her and she left me sitting there with no response when I finished putting my order in. Ive never been treated so rudely at a Bread Company. She left me hanging with no reply twice when trying to order. I left & went to the Arnold location where they are ALWAYS friendly! I frequent Bread Company at least once a week. I will never go to the location again. Im in the service industry myself and this was totally unacceptable...

"you don't get what you pay for"
We order from Guiseppe's in Warminster , there food is very good however when you order take out you get ripped off!!!
I love the Pasta Di Parma however 4 out of 5 times that we order it as take out , they don't put the smoked mozzarella on the top which pretty much makes the flavor of this dish pop! I even ask them nicely to remind the chef's when I place the order, but I still get ripped off! Last night was the last straw, I could tell the person taking the take out order was annoyed when I asked him to remind the chef about the cheese. (probably one of the chef's and did it on spite) We will not be ordering take out from here anymore!

We've had 2 horrible experiences at THIS location. Never coming back. Management and staff are rude and unwilling to accommodate. We were seated outside so we asked for umbrellas (most other tables outside had umbrellas).  They said they were not able to put umbrellas over our tables (We have infants who we couldn't risk keeping in the sun) so we sat a nearby table that had an umbrella  while we waited to see if they could seat us inside. PLENTY of tables were empty but they made sure to seat a party at the table we were waiting at. The lady with the really short hair was extremely rude. They never came back to say whether or not they could accommodate us. Our group left and I can assure you, I will never go back to this location. I will say we love the Mount Juliet location. They are kind and very accommodating. We regret giving the downtown location a second chance. Great restaurant. Horrible staff downtown.

The amount of disrespect that this shop has is unbelievable. They shouldn't even be allowed to operate. None of the artist are top shelf. Fat blown out lines, wannabe traditional artists. And the one "female" "artist" they have seems to be pms'ing every day of her life. Don't waist your money in this place. Customer service was so bad that if I could leave negative stars I WOULD. STAY AWAY IF YOU CHERISH YOUR SKIN. And stay away if you don't like snobs.

This is not about the doctors, but the office in general. I had a freezing for several actinic keratosis' on a Friday. I had no reaction as of Monday which has never happened to me. I went back on Tuesday to have them frozen again sine it didn't work the first rime. They wouldn't see me, told me to wait to weeks and wanted to charge me for the copay.  Dermatologist in the state or a dime a dozen but a good one is hard to find. Don't start here.

This place really sucked ordered a 2 pieces combo,it came with a leg & thigh of chicken. I wanted 2 thighs.they told me they can't sell it that way, nor just let me  pay an up charge or buy an extra piece that I wanted.  How is it that they sell chicken? but won't allow you to buy the pieces that you want Or maybe substitute one piece. even if you offer to pay extra kind of ridiculous ,guess I'll have to settle for POPEYE'S or KFC. On top of that they had one person taking order and it took 20mins to place my order.SMH !!!

Reviewing in January 2018. I am not sure what happened to this place. I have been here twice in the last two weeks. Both times the staff seemed either overworked or just apathetic. My salad had most of the toppings wrong - it seemed like they were putting whatever they felt like in it. On top of all this the whole staff seem very grumpy. Overall the place appears disorganized- running out of utensils at lunchtime, etc. I will not be coming here again.
The wings were good. Everything else, not so much. Slow is a compliment. Terrible draft list. It's like the 'B' movie star of the wing world.

walked in to an almost completely empty store at 2 in the afternoon, no one in line, 3~ employees working. Stood at the counter for about 3-4 minutes and watched them clean their meat cutter and make multiple trips to the back without even a simple "Hello" or "Ill be right with you" just annoyed glares and no recognition like we weren't even there, or maybe even didnt want us there? Surprised at the lack of service, we left and got food somewhere else. I should/could have gotten my order taken and food ready in the time that we spent waiting for simple acknowledgement. Must be one dirty meat cutter... Get some new staff.
I've gotten rock hard pizza from here multiple times :(. Not like hard in a way that some people might prefer, but inedibly hard.

It missed a concept. Pseudo Mexican food, with tiki drinks (the only good thing) and Flamenco music. I understand fusion cuisine, but this was a weird pot. Let's say I was expecting pineapple in my Mexican food and got some weird stuff

My wife and I went here on a Saturday night.  Unlike many other restaurants in Boise/Meridian, these guys weren't busy and now I know why.  Their service was just bad and the food was just as boring and forgettable.  It's safe to say that we won't be going back.

Horrible customer service calling to make a restaurant reservation.  A mature woman abruptly said "were sold out!" and hung up on me.  She never asked the dates or the number of people in my party.  Its 3 days before Easter and I presume she was referring to Easter Sunday but never asked and hung up within seconds.  She is driving business away from the Spa and should not be in customer service!

How can a room smell bad?  Let me count the ways . . 

I booked one night here, a 'bayview' room.   On the few plus sides the room was bright, clean and cheerful. 

When we checked in the lady gave us a flyer that stated the water would be off in the hotel for four hours the following day.  She said they had sewer issues and then caught herself and said "I mean we are doing plumbing work". 

There were three disgusting odors:
1. After we showered we started noticing a sewage stench and realized it had started coming from the drains.  I had to plug the wet bar sink with a bag and shut and block the bathroom door to make the room livable.
2.  Our room was on the bay side, and a collection of rotting seaweed caused the front door area to be totally sickening.  We tried to air out the sewer smell by opening the door but it just let in another stench.
3. when we opened the harbor side door to get rid of the first two smells, cigarette smell started coming in.  Not as gross as the first two but still overpowering. 

The next day at checkout there was an unpleasant older lady that became testy not at the problems I reported but gave me the third degree to discover who had let the cat out of the bag about the sewage when I checked in.  She said it was probably the stinking seaweed because there was no sewage issue, they were just fixing "a broken water pipe".   She said "maybe the manager will call me" about the problems and of course no one did.   The plumbers were there in force as I left, perhaps to fix the sewer smell that the hotel staff was denying.  

I think it's pretty old.  There were few outlets and not all of them worked.  It was a challenge to get two phones and a laptop charged.  Also, the breakfast was the most sparse I have ever seen at a best western and they didn't even have coffee, the coffee maker was broken or something.  And, when I was in the room the chair cushion slid forward and I was horrified by the yellow stains it was hiding.  I don't know what they were but I know it looked bad. 

 The view is beautiful, but it's kind of misleading  because there are no windows on that side you have to go outside the room in the hall to see it, where the seaweed stench will soon make you sick.   The room wasn't cheap, we got a beautiful place with no problems, very comfortable and clean with an actual ocean view you could see from the inside for the same price the next night.  

 Maybe the City of Dunedin should send the health inspector over.
Nice but small aquarium. Something to do in that area however it was very hot and we had to leave sson after we got there.

I have tried to like this place.  I like the layout.  I can deal with their beer.  But, the food.  No thanks.  The best item were the tacos.  But, I wouldn't come back for them.  I had a chicken sandwich which just sucked.

I doubt I will go back because of the food.  Maybe for a beer.  I liked at least one of those.

I came in today but I was holding a piece of pizza that I just wanted to throw away and the lady behind the counter just screams at me and yells to me to take it back outside.(I came in immediately searching for a trash can) I didn't get to enjoy this bar because she embarrassed me in front of many people. I can't give it one star though because to be owned by Rob McElhenney it definitely is true to IASIP for having extremely rude employees. I deserved 5 star service because IM A FIVE STAR MAN
(I would NOT recommend coming here)

Been there 3 times and always loved the food! From the appetizers to the desserts, good qualities and bold flavours.
What didn't make the cut was the service and the hospitality... 
We waited outside the door for almost 20 minutes and once we got inside... Well, we missed the warm, friendly middleastern welcome approach.
We were rushed through our serving...
"Are you done? No? Your next course will get cold, no we cannot keep it warm for you...."
It was a bit sad.... Been rushed through a great experience.... Wondering if we got there too late but then why did you let us sit so late if you knew the experience wasn't going to be so good???

PS. Bill was ~47$ each.... We didn't order any extra drinks (brought our own wine), just the food

Ordered the Orange Chicken and Singapore noodles to takeout on a weekend night, the chicken was an undifferentiated slop of fried batter crumbs and tiny shredded fragments of chicken and the sauce was super sweet. The noodles looked like half of them had dried out a little bit.

Side orders are the worst of the worst because they are prepackaged, not home made.
Got salmonella from the slider. Two stars are for crushed ice.

I have been in there a couple of times since Raley's bought this store from Scolari's. Aisles have been cleared and linoleum that has probably been there since the place was AMA Superstores, discolored and chipped, is showing. Some prices have gone up, but that was happening even before Raley's took over, and considering that this place is similar to a warehouse store,  the rise in prices does not seem justified. I wouldn't buy meat there: too gristly.
Raley's has not yet put their stamp on the place. I think it is destined to become a Food Source. I hope Raley's is going to upgrade this store a bit. It looks awful.

Don't  go here. The salad bar here is okay, the seafood section is terrible. We kept waiting for more and fresher seafood to be brought out, that never happened. The restaurant itself needs a good cleaning from the floor to the table to the menu. Yes, the menu itself was nasty. The staff was pleasant.  The over all quality is just not there.

This was the worst Mexican restaurant I've ever ate at. I order extra steak and queso, but didn't get either. The first restaurant I been to who dont serve salsa with their dip. Also the charge $4 for pico de gallo and same for queso. I asked to substitute the green salsa and the orange kind for pico de gallo and they wouldn't. Finally it was being ran by two girls who was running in and out the rain, like kids. I will not recommend this place. I

I cannot even imagine how this mediocre excuse of a restaurant stays open. Yes, the decor is sort of clever (though tired), wait staff is friendly enough, prices are fairly cheap, portions are huge. Well, there's the problem.... you get what you pay for. But honestly, this is simply awful food with zero nuance in flavors and even less freshness. The corn chips looked as though they had been crushed at the bottom of a bag (how DOES one scoop up salsa with a 1/2 inch long chip?) But, then, the salsa was ghastly. Trader Joe's bottled salsa is better. The molé could have been made by Hershey. The margarita's are not freshly made and are clearly from a mix. There is simply nothing to commend this place. I'm now sipping Alka Seltzer, hoping for some stomach relief.

Don't bother going here.  The staff is rude and slow as Christmas!  Waited 20 minutes while they filled orders after I came in!  Finally asked for a refund and left.  Received a very sullen apology for the wait.

The tour was disappointing. They tried to get more money from you by selling upgrades of the tours, picture taking, pushing different beers at the end of the tour. Did not have enough servers pouring beer so there was a long wait.  You can definitely tell a foreign company owns this especially after talking to the tour guides. Doesn't have the pride it use to in the company. Long time employees have quit.
Workers are so rude and the girls who work here have such long hair that just goes all over the place and is pretty gross

This was my first time after walking by so many times. Unfortunately the price does not match quality. The chicken was skimpy pieces and I found a piece of plastic in my food!! Ugh waiting  30 minutes for an order placed over the phone and then getting a piece of plastic! I am so sad because the pasta was not bad despite it's sad look and the plastic.

When I first walked in I was not even greeted nor knew where to go. Stood by the register by the door only for a rude waiter to tell me to go upfront. Upfront where!? But the woman who attended me next was fantastic!

Jeremy is a real egotistical person that he has to put down other people by shaming them about  weight and fitness , perfectly in the normal weight range. Had a contract  that had no written start date . Just a verbal one . I was giving my daughter $400  for a birthday gift so she could work out as a couple work out with her boyfriend. My daughter got hurt over the weekend and was taken to the emergency room. The doctor said you're not to work out for a week and had a note. My daughter and her boyfriend call Jeremy and told him what was going on and asked to start the next Monday and he said absolutely not .He said  my daughter  is excused but the boyfriend is not. They explain to Jeremy  they joining as a couple and Wanted to start together at the same time.he said absolutely not boyfriend has to come today you can start in a week. My daughter called me very upset saying  what was going on,she knew I had been to a lot of trainers and I thought that I could call him and explain .So I call Jeremy thinking I could get him to give them a week because of the injury and he was very condescending rude try to belittle me because I was a woman told my daughter boyfriend who is the man who is the boss you gonna let two women tell you what to do that your daughter's mother called who is the man of the house. Ladies if you have 1 ounce of dignity use a reputable trainer. I'm not saying that he's not a good trainer he just does not have any People skills. This could all been avoided if he were just of been kind enough to let them start a week later to take care of an injury. After all they were joining as a couple not working out separately.After going round and round trying to explain to him  , he saying he's not giving the money back and I said  so it's all about the money and he said no I said well I have no other choice than to write a review about what happened and then he screams this that I'm threatening him and he hung up on me.Very professional. I've had lots of trainers had never had one ever act like he has .
Mochi was hard and stale. Ice cream roll was hard. I had Ferro Roche. Fruits are frozen. You better off go to Chinatown

This place HAS gone downhill since Raley's bought it, and I HAVE been there before they bought it.  Used to shop there regularly for meats and produce.  I haven't been there since February when my dog died.  I heard Raley's had bought it and it had gone downhill, so I thought I would stop in and see what had happened.

The first thing I noticed setting foot and cane inside the door was a "security guard" looming over the entrance.  I never noticed any security guards before.  I think the menacing presence of a guy with a gun (actually not sure if he had a gun but the menacing attitude was enough to imply he would have liked a gun at the very least) had a LOT to do with why the store was so empty - something I have NEVER seen on a weekday afternoon before.

The second thing was when I approached the handicapped carts.  The "security guard" approached and informed me I would need a key.  He did not volunteer anything else.  So I had to ASK - "And where would I GET a key?"  He told me I would have to hand over my ID to get a key for the handicapped cart.

I don't remember having to ask for a key before, but if I ever did, I know for a fact they did not make me hand over my ID.  There is NO FREAKING WAY I am handing ID over to a stranger.  Talk about asking to have your identity stolen!  NO STORE I have ever shopped at INCLUDING RALEY'S has ever asked for ANYTHING before I can use one of the handicapped carts, let alone my driver's license.

So I turned around and walked out.  I WILL NOT shop at a store that treats its customers like criminals.  Raley's can get stuffed.  I won't be shopping at either store from now on.  I used to shop at Raley's on a semi-regular basis, but no more.  I have no idea what their plans are for the only Sak'n Save that seems to be left in town - seems they closed the other one(s) .  Rumors say they are going to turn it into a Food Source.   Food Source sucks anyway and I NEVER shop there, so if they're turning it into a Food Source, it was going to be a goner anyway.  Yim's Asian Market, Trader Joe's, Grocery Outlet, Winco and Costco will be seeing a whole lot more of me from now on.  I've even found an alternate place to get minced lemongrass, which was one of the things I used to regularly go to Raley's to get.  

Given they've decided to treat people like they are thugs and crooks at their "low rent" locations, I don't need to go there even for that anymore, which means no more OTHER Raley's purchases either.

Pros: well lit, clean, never crowded and they have self checkout lanes. Also, none of the scary Wal-Mart crowd. 

Cons: every time I go there, the item(s) marked as "On Sale" ring up at regular price. I always notice because I only ever buy 1 or 2 things at a time. I only buy 1 or 2 things at a time because I don't trust them, so I shop elsewhere (unless I am in a hurry).

My roommate and I were visiting a friend in Philly and super excited that there were vegan options here. We called ahead of time because my roommate has a severe nut allergy that requires 0 cross contamination and complete confidence from the kitchen that her food will be safe. We asked the staff member about this and clearly stated these things and they assured us this would be a safe place for her to eat. When we arrived, our server communicated the exact opposite and said she couldn't make any promises that food would be safe for her. I got up to let her know that we wouldn't be able to stay seated and dine then and instead of listening, she backed up defensively and waved us away. I am incredibly frustrated that we were given inconsistent answers and treated disrespectfully when we tried to explain why we were leaving.

i recently tried pizanos and it was the worst pizza i have ever had in Tucson! the service was bad! they were not busy and it took 45 mins. to get my pizza to go. I  was'nt sure I would get it before closing time! I will not go back! Jerry M.

We went out of our way to try Chopstick House because of the good Yelp reviews. Orange chicken combo: the chicken tasted like it had been cooked 2-3 days ago. The orange sauce and seasonings tasted ok, but the chicken was inedible. We knew it was a risk to try an unknown place for Chinese food - but "other people" wrote good reviews.  I just want to know where these "other people" have been eating! Bless your hearts. I've never had Chinese food where I couldn't even count on the fried rice and egg drop soup to fall back on. Across the board at most every Chinese place I've visited - never had those things "messed up" quite so bad. The egg drop soup tasted like pure vegetable oil, and had some fako yellow coloring that looked disgusting. The fried rice was also not edible. Not much flavor at all, veggies not cooked - crunchy like they were raw - and totally the wrong 'consistency' for fried rice. We asked for extra 'crispy noodles' for our soup - they wanted 60 cents for a small bag of them! We didn't discover how bad the food was until we had driven 45 minutes to get home. When we called to give constructive feedback, the manager said she would consider a partial refund IF AND ONLY IF we drove the nasty food 45 minutes back to the restaurant. I really think the 5 star reviews are paid or written by employees or family members. This place is horrible!

We had an underwhelming stay at this hotel despite the nice layout of the rooms with a kitchenette and sofa. The shower was covered in hair presumably from the previous guest, specifically a large hairball in the drain. The desk staff was also very rude and unhelpful. We had welcome bags waiting for us at the desk upon checking for the wedding we were in town for and we asked them to hold them for us until we returned from lunch, but when we got back they said they were gone with no apology.
This should not be classified as an Italian restaurant -- not even Italian-American. Good Italian is tough to find in Tampa, but this is definitely the worst. It is comparable to Olive Garden.

Longtime customer who will never go back. Extremely rude cashier totally ignored us when picking up our order. Waited there long enough, even though our pizza was ready, to observe sweat from the workers faces dripping into the pizzas they were making and boxing up-completely disgusting.

If I could rate any lower I would. Six workers are wondering around the establishment while it takes an hour for me to get my food after I was the third car in line. Only God knows what took so long, after I proceeded to the window I ordered a single steak burger with a large fry. At the window they gave me a burger and a medium fry, I asked them to correct the fry size and the manager tells me I can't get a large fry with that burger. If I wanted a large they'd have to charge me for a different burger and remake my meal. If you have common sense you will stay far away from this shithole.

Charged me for repairs that they actually made worse. Gave them multiple attempts to fix it, and yet I ended up having to take my car to two different auto body shops to fix whatever they did. Ended up getting money back, but paid for my oil change, however now im starting to think that they actually didn't even change my oil, but just updated the sticker??! Won't be returning.

Major faux pas' happen at every restaurant. But it's bad business when customer service falls flat on it's face after a major misstep.

I went to the Redwood Rotisserie with a friend for lunch today. Both of us had burgers which to start with were pretty mediocre along with the small amount of fries that came with them. But that wasn't the real issue here.

As my friend started to eat his burger he got that weird look on his face...like, "waiter, there's a fly in my soup" look. Reaching in his mouth he pulled out a piece of parchment paper, packaging from either the beef patty or from the cheese slice. As he dissected the burger he found the entire piece of paper (when I worked in the meat industry we used this paper to separate fresh beef patties; the same can be found between slices of pre-cut cheese). 

We called the waitress over and showed her the problem. She was immediately apologetic and offered to have a new burger cooked. My friend declined. She said that, of course, we would not be charged for the meal. All was correctly handled up to this point.

The kicker was, when the bill came, we were charged for his soft drink. Had it been me I would have certainly comped his soft drink and MAYBE comped my meal too...but no, he was charged $2.49 for his soft drink. Needless to say neither of us will be returning.

This was my second time at this Redwood Rotisserie. My first visit would have gotten 3 1/2 stars (if i could have done that), But this visit barely makes 2 stars. Food is okay, decor is very nice (hats off to the designer), customer service pretty flat.

This is by far the worst bread co around. I will always drive further to avoid this one! They never get our orders correct for breakfast. They are usually out of everything (I can only assume because they don't plan on doing much business and don't want to waste product) that in mind it is rather annoying when I want to go purchase bread - which is like their thing only to be told I can't because they need it for sandwiches because there wasn't enough made. Generally it's a bunch of kids there running the registers and they can't really be bothered with much - which hey I get I was a teenager once but then get a different job maybe?

Long story short - save yourself the disappointment and go to a different bread co.

Wow.  The arrogance.  Who do these people think they are?  Yes, the dumplings are pretty good.  But let me warn you to be careful before going here.  I tried to call and place an order for take out.  Several calls.  Always an answering machine.  I almost did not go thinking they were closed... but no... they just do not answer their freakin phone... I order a couple of orders of dumplings at the counter and they have a no credit card policy for orders less than $25... again WTF? I pay cash.  I wait.  My dumplings arrive and I depart.  In the end, the dumplings were pretty good -- but three stars good or maybe four stars good.  Not Five stars good.  For more than a dollar per dumpling I was expecting more. Bah.

It's a good idea, but the food is always rather "meh." Just because they serve huge portions doesn't necessarily mean it's great. I am convinced the side of pasta salad is just a box of Betty Crocker's "Suddenly Salad." (If it's not, they need to change their recipe.) The homemade potato chips always have a burned quality to them. I've sent them back before and was told by a manager "That's what gives them the homemade taste." I've made potato chips at home before and I was able to finish the task without burning them.   Service is usually good, no complaint there. Metro just needs to focus on making things better. It's all just kind of forgettable.
Everything I ate here was disappointing.

Would not recommend this place.  Food was ice cold and overdone.  All I had was a biscuit with cheese, bacon and egg  TOTALLY dried out.
Overpriced .

This bar/restaurant had wonderful entertainment and our server rocked. Unfortunately, the bar tenders didn't support their servers and were everywhere but present. If I owned this business, I would be horrified at the lost revenue due to sloooowwwww service,  every other venue along the street we have stopped at, was busy. This one was NOT.   I now know why there were multiple tables for six vacant.  I'm so sorry.  So much potential. Our server rocked. His bartenders sucked. Out him behind the bar and let him get this place to where they should be. ROCKIN!!   Clean. Nice.  Great entertainment.   Needs some adjustment.  It's worth believing in....   it's going to be great.

Not knowing where to eat I just so happen to walk into this place without checking the reviews. I ordered a cheesesteak I'm not kidding when I tell you there was maybe maybe 3 ounces of steak on this all bread sandwich! It was tasty what was there but I'm not into eating a bunch of gluten so I left there hungry! First time ever leaving a restaurant hungry! I would never recommend this place to anyone!


I wasn't going to post anything but I've been back at my hotel room now for a couple of hours and I just had diarrhea. That's what you want when you want to have to get on an airplane the next day! If this reoccurs again I'm calling the Board of Health! There's absolutely no excuse for this! This is the only place I've eaten at since I got here.

HORRIBLE SERVICE. Food was good but the service was a joke. They took forever to bring the food, and besides that, they included a 20% tip in a 5 people group in the check. It also seemed that we were asking for a favor all the time when asking the waitress for something. Worst service of my life in this country.

I stayed at Quality Inn in Mount Juliet Tn, Had a horrible experience, The room was 302 ended up with bed bugs, the fridge was nasty,the internet sucked, they comp my room gave me another room that was being remodeled, had no tv, bathroom was not cleaned, not happy at all, the management never come talked to me, also i have pics of the room , bed and bug bites on my body not worth the 165 dollars at all

Years ago, I had a manager I worked for who had a large, deep scar all throughout his face. I always assumed he got it in a bar fight or something similar when he was younger. One day he told me the story behind the scar. When his mother went into labor with him, she was taken to Kennedy hospital. She had to have a C-section. The doctor cut into her belly so deep and recklessly that it cut his entire face as an unborn infant and left him scared for life. 

When I was younger, I had a terrible nose bleed that persisted for hours. My girlfriend at the time drove me to Kennedy. I sat in the ER for about 3 hours to the point where it eventually stopped on its own. I was about to leave when they called me back. The young 20-something-year-old doctor cauterized the inside of my nose even though the bleeding had stopped. Then he shoved a cylindrical object up inside my nostril and in a split second, overinflated the device. I let out a scream as the bones around my nasal cavity and eye socket cracked and my eye was pushed out of the socket and off to the side.

It was left like that for several days until I could get an appointment with a specialist in Cherry Hill to have it removed. He was shocked at how bad a job the doctor did. To this day, I have a twisted heap of scar tissue all throughout the inside of my right nostril that blocks the passage. Anytime the topic of Kennedy hospital comes up in conversation, I hear horror story after horror story from anyone who's ever been there. Unless it's a matter of life or death, I cannot overstate the importance of selecting any other hospital over this one.

Racist...we were treated horribly. Absolutely horrible. Do not eat here. The owner was not nice at all-he looked mortified when we walked in but we just assumed he had a busy day. We were wrong. He didn't even want to take the order... He literally stared at us, took a doop breath, and reluctantly wrote what we wanted. We should have left but we didn't-bad judgement. We paid and waited...half our order was wrong. Then we got it correct but it was half done. The chicken fingers were not done in the middle and the cheeseteak had hardly any meat-& i paid for extra meat. We asked to use the restroom to wash our hands and we were told there was no restroom available. Then a younger Caucasian woman walks in, asks to use the restroom without buying anything, and is immediately taken to the restroom. We left at that point. It's sad because it is a great location but disappointing because the last thing you expect coming into that establishment is racism....

This has to be the WORST McDonald's I have ever been to.  The lines are always so long (not because they are busy, but because they are that slow), and they NEVER get the orders right.  I have been there a few times over the past few weeks due to being on the run from the holidays - I received a McChicken sandwich, with my special order "PLAIN" sticker on it, that had mayonnaise and lettuce on it - didn't check until I got home, and my 6 year old son wouldn't eat it, so into the trash it went.  On December 26th, I went INTO the restaurant and ordered 2 happy meals, one with a "Cheeseburger - NO pickles, NO onions" (it was rung up correctly), one with a 4 piece nuggets, and then an additional McChicken plain.  After 13 minutes, I was given one happy meal, and another bag that had a burger, and a chicken sandwich in it, with a toy.  When I tried to tell the gentleman who handed it to me that I was supposed to have two happy meals and an extra sandwich, he literally said to me "um no."  Mind you, I had the receipt, which I showed to him, and he huffed and walked back to get the items I was missing.  Of course, when I got home after spending almost 20 minutes in the restaurant, the plain cheeseburger I ordered had both onions and pickles on it....my 3 year old wouldn't eat it, so that went into the trash as well.  Do yourself a favor and just stay home and throw your money into the trash can there, it will save you time and trouble.

It is very unfortunate how this place has somewhat of a monopoly pizza delivery service in my area. If I had the choice I would order ANYWHERE else. Their pizza never wows me and this time was no different. Marinara is obviously dumped from a can. Ordered a custom pizza (half/half) which arrived almost cold with all toppings messed up/missing. I also ordered wings and flappers were no more than an inch and a half - at $9 for a small order that is pathetic.

I made a Yelp just to write a review about this awful establishment. I went with 4 of my friends and only 1 of us was pleased with our meal. For appetizers, we ordered the ginger salad, miso soup, baby udon noodles, shrimp shumai, and gyoza. The shumai and noodles were decent. The ginger salad had a watered down dressing, and tasted as though the lettuce was dirty. The gyoza was soggy and just overall bad. For our entrees, we ordered a spicy tuna roll, a rainbow roll, chicken yakitori, and 2 salmon avocado rolls. This was the worst sushi I've ever had. My salmon avocado roll tasted like bubblegum. The spicy tuna roll didn't even remotely taste like tuna; we honestly thought it was something else. The rainbow roll wasn't very fresh. The service was decent- we ordered two salmon avocado rolls and at first only one came. It took forever to get a side order of white rice. To conclude- don't waste your time nor money here. There are plenty of other sushi restaurants nearby that are a million times better.

The worst guest services. One rude person selling tickets. Had to wait until all of the movie card tickets folks got their tickets. Same at the snack counter.
Going to movies should be stress free!!! Not at this location.

Don't waste your time here. We went in because this place has good reviews, however I would beg to differ. The beer and appetizer was the best part of the meal. The waitress bragged about how the pizza is fast fired in 90 seconds, however it simply wasn't cooked. When we notified the waitress she said that Neapolitan pizza is doughier, and it is simply a preference if we don't like it so undercooked. I looked it up and Neapolitan pizza is defined by the sourdough used, and tomatoes grown on mount Vesuvius and cheese from a water buffalo. Nowhere is it noted that Neapolitan pizza is not fully cooked and served with raw dough. Although featuring a softer and molten centre, our pizza crust was doughy and raw. Also we ordered the pistachio pesto pasta and although there were some good flavours in there it was served cold. We mentioned this also, and since the chefs are on display and our table was near the cooking area, we had to overhear the waitress telling the cooks about our complaint.  The best part of the meal was the appetizer, which was a cauliflower artichoke dip. It was great, but the entrees were terrible. Maybe the waitress should have gotten the manager because she couldn't handle our complaints and we actually paid for this terrible food. I asked her if she had ever been to "blaze pizza" which also does a fast fire pizza and she had not. Well I won't be going back to Famoso again that's for sure. It was uncomfortable in the small environment as we waited forever for our bill to arrive. We noted that the pasta was advertised as imported from Naples, however it was served so quickly. We saw the chefs scooping out pre cooked past and reheating it in the oven. At the price point I expect made to order food. This was fast food. Why import your pasta if you are simply going to reheat it? Then serve us raw pizza? Disappointing. The bill wasn't worth me getting to write this scathing review.
My HOTEL ROOM HAD TICKS!!!!! And fleas!! Bed bugs and who else knows wtf they have!! Same day I leave I have bites all over my leg and they ITCH LIKE HELL!

Boy. This restaurant has so much potential yet falls incredibly short. We went for a Sunday lunch where it was not crowded by any means. Somehow we still waited over 30 minutes to get a glass of wine and over an hour to even get an appetizer. We had to repeatedly ask for bread because quite frankly we were starving. By the time our food came (1.5 hours in) 2 meals were cold and had clearly just sat around for quite some time. I had the pan seared scallops. While this meal could have been incredible, it was probably the most lackluster scallops I've ever had. Not only was it cold, the scallops themselves were very tough, the "goat cheese" grits had no flavor and the asparagus overpowered every flavor on the plate. Another member of our party got the fried clams, and it was 100% breading. There MIGHT have been one piece that actually had clams in it, but frankly for $20 you would be better off getting chicken nuggets at jack n the box and saving your money. In another meal, the seafood just didn't taste all that fresh and the one seafood averse member of our party who ordered steak could have easily grilled up the steak at home. I am only giving this 2 stars, because the manager did try to make up for the poor experience, but it will take quite a lot for them to convince us that this restaurant is worth visiting when there are so many other great options in Santa Barbara.

Had dinner there last Saturday night with my husband and another couple.  We had a reservation at 8pm, arrived at 8:05 and had to wait for them to clear and set a table for us.  The waitress promptly opened our bottles of wine and filled our water but did not bring us menus for another 15 minutes.  We placed an appetizer order first at the waitress' suggestion and she didn't return to take our entree order until the appetizers were on the table.  She brought our entrees out and did not return to check on us until most of the table was done eating.  I ordered the Veal Saltimbocca and was given a veal dish made with marsala wine, spinach and mushrooms.  When I was finally able to ask the waitress about it, she realized she gave the Saltimbocca to someone else at my table who ate it not realizing the order was wrong.  I had only eaten about a 1/4 of the dish as I do not like marsala wine and she cleared it away and never offered to bring me what I ordered.  It was late at this point and the kitchen was closing.  One person at our table ordered dessert which was quickly brought out and she dropped the bill, explaining that she gave us the dessert for free since she messed up the entree.  We paid  the bill and sat for another 10 minutes when she came back to the table and reminded us she gave us the dessert for free and then said she forgot to charge us for the appetizers and gave us another bill.  Not sure if I'll return based on how our table was treated.  The appetizers that I ate were decent but I left hungry and annoyed.

My friends and I were so excited to try Superior Grill, but we were extremely disappointed. We had made a reservation many days in advance, but we had to wait 15 minutes to be seated. The entire restaurant is decorated in tacky and cheap decorations! Additionally, once we sat down, the waiter took a very long time to take our drink order. The food took a very long time to come and part of our order WAS MISSING! When we received the check and told the waiter that we never received part of our meal, he doubted us and said "are you sure?" The food at Superior is overpriced and not worth it! If you are looking for good Mexican food in New Orleans, go to La Casita instead! Much better service and atmosphere!!

We were driving up to STL to see family, and were staying in the Fenton area. My husband was in the mood for Italian.  The only thing I could find was this place. As we walked out, my husband said, "That wasn't very good." "You said you wanted Italian," I replied. "You didn't say GOOD Italian." It was cheap though. And afterwards we went to the bar & grill next door for drinks and they were cheap too. Easy on the pocketbook, but you get what you pay for.
Worst cheese steak ever and I'm a Philly native passing thru the airport.Bread drenched in grease with steakum meat.Stay away.

Extremely overpriced. They charged me nearly double what it cost to ship USPS. I should've just went to the post office first. Do not go here unless you can't wait in a long line. An extra 20 dollars isn't worth the no wait.

BEWARE OF LOWE'S OF EASTON, MARYLAND:  Very bad experience with my kitchen install.  The foreman was very inflexible, and called all the shots, not the designer, the manager or the corporate office.  
KITCHEN STILL NOT COMPLETED!!!!!

The newly hired designer did know what she was doing, and made promises that she could not keep.  When went things went bad, she refused to return my calls, and just went along with whatever the foreman said to her.  She made decisions without telling me which seriously impacted my kitchen design and the project overall.   

They do not care about quality, and made so many mistakes on the materials needed - I had to wait 6-8 weeks every time for the right cabinet to show up - three times this happened.   

When the kitchen plumbing started to leak after they put it back, the foreman refused to come fix it saying that I had to get my own plumber, but the corporate office would not commit to reimbursing me.  The bottom of my brand new cabinet was damaged.  

The corporate office will not do anything to fix this problem.  We will have to go to court to settle this.
No call no show. They never called to let me know they were running late/weren't coming.

I was excited when his location opened because it is right across the street from my job! During the first couple of days after their grand opening they were giving away free coffee, any size, no purchase required. This token of appreciation for their future customers made me even more excited to be a WaWa regular. That excitement came to an abrupt end today when I spent 30 minutes of my lunch hour waiting for my quesadilla to be made. Never again will I visit this WaWa for lunch. I understand that this is a busy location, but that is no excuse to have customers, a majority of them workers on their lunch break, waiting for long periods of time to have their food prepared. While waiting several other customers began to complain, one of them requested a refund as she could no longer wait because she had to get back to work. Not to mention, they only had two cashiers on the registers. WaWa get it together!

This hotel is run down & honestly disgusting.  I'm waking up feeling like I smoked an entire carton of cigarettes when I don't smoke & wasn't near anyone that smoked all night.  Had to stay here instead of the Residence Inn which didn't look much better honestly.  Marriott should be embarrassed.  Both hotels need to be gutted & have complete renovations.  I will never stay here again wedding or no wedding, I'll take the drive home.

If I could leave zero feedback I would. On January 10, 2017 I called ARS to come look at my old HVAC unit that was 17 years old and still running! Mr St. Germain insisted my old ac unit needed to be replaced due to a multitude of issues. $5,000 later he talked me into a new Bryant unit. I adjusted my schedule the next day to accommodate the workers coming between 8-10, no show, I called and then they changed it to 10-2 to install it. No show. By 2:30 I started calling ARS and demanded a refund. They passed me on to Hector the supervisor and he said they would issue a $300 refund for my inconvenience, AND extend my coverage for 2 years, saying the truck was on the way. They didn't show up until 4 PM and worked until 11:00 PM in the dark. 
Then it turns out they sent a unit that had the intake and discharge opposite to my duct work, so they had to bend the duct-work over each other doing a kluge job.
1/24/17 they had to come back and re-stall another thermostat as the one they put in was not functioning properly.
6/21/17 then the phone calls started, trying to get me to accept check-ups on my unit and extended warranty's. I lost count how many calls I fielded and told them no.

1/18/18 Winter-NO HEAT! Called again. Found no heat strip coming on with heat pump due to improper wiring. Fixed wiring and changed breakers.
1/19/18 HORRIBLE smell coming from unit. Tech came out to check, basically said, "it [the smell] will go away"  What???

7/20/18 The unit is 1 1/2 years old. NO AIR! 90 degrees outside!
Latif ,the tech comes out and diagnoses a 'possible' bad blower or 'it could be other things'. Says because I'm under warranty no charge for the  $700-$800 motor, but they would have to charge me $375 to install it, but he doesn't have one on his truck and it wouldn't be until Monday (3 days later) before he could get one. I refused to sign the paperwork and immediately called Hector, to no avail-straight to voice mail.

7/23/18 No Latif, no motor, no calls from anyone at the company

7/23/18 PM Called Hector again-no answer. Called ARS again, put me on hold, then got back and insured me Hector would return my call. No such luck. I will be calling the news channels and/or the BBB

This shitty karaoke DJ just uses the karaoke night as an opportunity for his dumbass friends to perform the same """"""""hardcore""""""" cover of Blank Space - literally every single night. This bar is Grade D Ass thanks to him.

Also he's a white dude and just says the N Word ????? Like multiple times into the Mic? Fire this dude.
Horrible food. 25 min waiting for cold and tasteless fries and burgers. In-N-out never again!

I honestly have never met such a poor group of bartenders in my life. We went here with a group - a couple of times - mostly because it was supper close to the hotel and too cold to go far.

The first night the bartender actually rolled his eyes at me when another friend showed up and I had to ask him to make another martini.  Seriously? An eye roll?  Sorry not everyone just drinks beer out a bottle. and yes / I tipped well (way too much based on that - but still over 20%)

On the 2 different nights we went there - not 1 bartender smiled or even tried to be friendly. The last eve we were there - while they say they close at 3am at 2:40 they were basically kicking us out - except for about a dozen regulars - who even had their small children running around the bar. - yes at 2:40am  

This place is seriously in need of some proper management and decent staff.
There was so much hype around this place, but it was really just "okay." Not ground breaking, but the food and atmosphere were solid

Nurse brought me into the patient room, asked a few questions and left to get the physician... It was AN HOUR before the physician came to see me. Quick exam, gave me samples of cream for dry skin under eyes and called in a prescription for a bigger tube. Received a call from my pharmacy and stated it wasn't covered under my insurance. Ok not a problem. How much is it? $9,561..... this is not a typo. I repeat $9,561 for cream!!!!!!! Insanity. $35 co pay down the drain.

Ok this is so hard for me because I am not one to whip out my phone after a meal and write a negative review....but hear it goes!!

I live right down the road from Rickshaws and was hesitant to try it because it never looks busy and I didn't want to cheat on my favorite Hinoki Sushi place, since I have always had a wonderful meal there. I was in a hurry and hungry and it is Thursday Sushi so I figured I might as well give Ricks a shot and boy was I disappointed!!!

1st, place was empty....granted it was 2 in the afternoon. 

2nd, place was a mess, sticky menus and dirty bussed bins in plan view.

3rd, language barrier, I was trying to ask questions and no one understood me.

Ok, I could go on but let me get to my dinner.  I love my normal Mickey Nigiris and Upside down Shrimp it's basically the only thing I eat and it looked fabulous in its little to go container, and I get home all hungry and excited, get my sauce ready and my chop sticks in action to take the first bite and uggggg the tuna was so fatty I couldn't even bite through it....ok no biggie, maybe it's just that one, nope all 6 where layered with fat strands....and it had a hint on fishy smell. I was so disappointed!!! You can't tell me that the girl preparing them did not take notice??? 

I will not return AT ALL....and I will never, ever cheat on my favorite spot just down the street.

In all fairness, for those who might want to give it a shot, their prices where good and here is a picture of before and after and the menu....maybe you will have a better experience then

I just walked out of this joint due to some of the worst service I've ever received. I arrived around 5:40 on one of the first beautiful spring days in St.Louis hoping to participate in some Happy Hour and Patio action. We (a party of two) walked in ahead of a party of 3 and party of 6. The hostess then told us we'd have to wait 25-30 for a table and the larger parties got seated right away. While at the bar waiting, I finally managed to order a drink by saying "excuse me I'd like to get a drink" after waiting 6-8 minutes at an empty bar. We ended up only waiting 15 minutes before another table opened up outside. So it's approximately 6 o'clock by this time, we wait another 15 before we're approached by a waiter. He asks what can I get you, my boyfriend orders a beer, the waiter then takes off to get the beer without asking if we wanted to order food or anything else. He returns, sets down the beer, SAYS NOTHING, then walks away quickly. We wait till 6:40 and no one has returned to take our food order so we say forget this, leave cash on the table for drinks and walk out. Pass out waiter on the way out and he again just ignores us. So infuriating. I've had better service at Taco Bell's.......

At first I really liked my experience with Katie and her salon, she was easy to talk to and seemed to know what she was doing. She then left me with color in my hair for over an hour to process while she left the salon to go get her kid from school. I thought that was strange, maybe mildly unprofessional but not something to complain over. After she took out my hair my balayage that was supposed to get rid of my brassiness and give me lowlights turned into me having solid white, almost blue hair. Again, I wanted to be polite give it some time for the toner to wash out and try and see if I could get used to the new doo. I contacted Katie today explaining that I didn't want to hurt her feelings but I would love to have my hair corrected. She couldn't figure out who I was at first, then told me I was being too rude for her to work with me any longer and finally started to insult my intelligence and apparently my life choices. I'm not even mad she ruined my hair, just shocked she was outrageously unprofessional and treated me like she was a high school mean girl. I work in customer service have dealt with some awful customers and I have NEVER treated one like she treated me.

A little disappointing for a JW Marriott.  I come here regularly for work, and the wifi has always been a little spotty here, but I still stayed because of the amenities.  Last time I checked into my room to find lots of trash behind the desk and TV stand, including food.  I was in a rush so did not have time to call the front desk, but even after housekeeping came the next day, it was not cleaned up.  Clearly they aren't paying a lot of attention to the housekeeping of the rooms.

The pool and gym here are one of my favorites, and I always appreciate the concierge lounge and breakfast, but food behind the furniture is where I draw the line.

They have a cute little dessert stand outside. The gelato was just okay but after leaving we realized we were overcharged for both of our gelatos... and I tipped. That's totally unacceptable and unethical. I will never return.

The line was long, the menu had a lot of options, so we stopped for some food. The line moved slowly, but not horribly. The wait for food to come out was ridiculous. We waited about 45 minutes before we got one dish from our order. It took about 15 more minutes to get the remaining 4 items. They said that 'stuff is ready at different times,' which I understand, but I'm pretty sure there would be a giant pot of grits and rice (as I write this, I realize we never got our order of dirty rice). 
The grilled soft shell crab sandwich was basically just a grilled soft shell with no meat on a big roll. 
Shrimp and grits with cheese and gravy was good, jambalaya was great, but for $4 extra for shrimp on it, I'd hope for more than 3 pieces of shrimp. Boudine 'sausage' was also good.

Worst service! Ordered delivery and was told it would be an hour because the driver didn't get in for another half hour which I was fine with. Called after hour and 15 and was told they didn't have something in my order and had to go out and get it and that it would leave soon. I said to forget about that item and they could just bring the rest. That was a 40 min ago. I live about 5 min away and it still is not here. Called and was told that he had a lot of deliveries. This is ridiculous!

Maybe it's because I'm not a morning person. But after paying for my Apple Kale Smoothie, I expected it to take the same amount of time as the other customers. I paid for my smoothie and bag of chips and a bottle of water, then proceeded to wait for my smoothie while munching on the bag of chips. I noticed the girl finished making the smoothie for the flight attendant ahead of me, then started washing the used items. I figured she was just cleaning when I realized that she had no intention of making my smoothie. She then started to clean around the cash register and restocking donuts. As I finished my bag of chips and had been waiting 5 minutes, I finally asked if my Apple Kale Smoothie was ready. The blonde girl making smoothies seemed to have heard this order for the first time and asked Marlene at the register if she had heard about this. Excuse me??

She finally made my smoothie and I assumed she was multi-tasking because she began tidying up around the register again. As soon as she came out from behind the counter and started tidying up the snack display when I snapped. The smoothie was sitting untouched in the blender. I asked whether my smoothie was ready basques my flight had started boarding. Finally, the lady manning the register finally poured it into a cup and handed it to the blonde girl to hand to me. 

I don't understand whose responsibilities are what but what happened is not ok. Unfortunately, a survey was not available to me on the receipt, otherwise I would have made sure the young blonde's behavior was not acceptable in any situation. 

In other news, my smoothie was a little sweet but tasted fine.

I moved from Ohio and the Nissan dealership in Ohio always did a great job servicing my car. My dealership in Ohio was 1 hour away from where I stayed so every time I had to take my vehicle in for any service they offered me a loaner. Unfortunately, Ed Martin wasn't generous enough to offer me that service here. My work is 1 hour away and it's hard for me to take time off to get car serviced and a loaner would've been appreciative. Anyways, I took my car in for an oil change and the employees in the service area were extremely rude. As soon as I went to the desk to pay the first thing the girl said was to buy new tires. I asked to her explain more and she said "it's in front of you read the paper you need new tires...nope never going there again!

What a terrible bait and switch situation. When things are too good to be true they probably are. Tried to sell an $11,000 system to me when he showed up like I never had a conversation with someone on the phone.  Shelling out $700 for something that was supposed be 99 with a $100 gift card back. Even spoke to a manager before I made the appointment to assure I was getting what I asked for. Going to call
Corporate later today I am hoping that that will result in a better outcome.

Not sure where to start here. My wife picked this to eat at while I was at a conference for lunch. She picked me up and we pulled up and thought...this was odd. Walking in the environment was weird. The guy who took our order was...interesting. We got the hot and cold sweats and the JB or something. Sandwiches were good. The sides...real weak. Got potato salad and I hate to cut it up the pieces were so big. My wife got pesto pasta salad and it was noodles with pesto. The biggest issues were with the establishment. My wife went to the bathroom...no toilet paper, no paper towels and NO SOAP. HOW ARE THE EMPLOYEES WASHING THEIR HANDS.  She mentioned it to the owner who handed her some napkins. We likely won't be back because it was REALLY weird and gave us an odd vibe.

By far the worst experience I have ever had at a nail salon. Their customer service is absolutely unprofessional. Walked in with a 10am appointment we were talking with one of the workers and she had the worst attitude. Im almost positive it was because of my race. Made me and my younger nieces feel so uncomfortable. If you need your nails done stay away from this place you're better off going somewhere else!

I ordered the chicken strips and a couple hours later had the worst pain I've ever felt in my stomach. Didn't sleep much and the pain was so bad that I was close to going to the ER. Not sure if it was what I ate here, but it was the only thing I had eaten recently and the pain started immediately after! Not going to any Jack In the Box again. I don't trust that the food is sanitary.

My dad worked here for 2 years and would bring us food every day its alright cause it was free but nothing i would pay for im mariah nevarez and im 8 years nicos is wayyy better and way cheaper THANKS

I have been going to this nail shop for several months, but my last experience was not a good one.  
First, my mom got a pedicure and was charged for a mani/pedi.  She's in town on vacation and that was a huge mistake on their part.  I didn't realize it until we got home.  They do not return any money and will let you know.  
Second, the guy who did my mani/pedi was so put off and was not at all interested in doing my mani/pedi.  I am paying for the service and don't want a parade, but I don't need to be treated like I'm a bother.  There are nail salons all over the place and I pass three on my way to this one.  Well, I will be looking and trying the nail salons around this one because I will not be back to Family Nail.

The place to come if you want to be met with outright aggression when trying to spend your money.
  
Was there this evening enjoying the soggy pizza. Upstairs 'bartender" completely ignored us wanting to order drinks while he sat talking to a friend. When we directly asked him if the bar was open, came over with a huge attitude. Charged $25 for a pitcher of beer and a mixed drink.  I would have called him on it, but didn't want to ruin a celebration taking place. 

Everyone has an off night, but this was over the top. It makes me wonder about the management at this place.

This was an experience.  I'll start by saying our waitress was fantastic.  She was attentive, consistent, and by far the best thing about the place.  There were large groups of people in there with kids everywhere.  I mean the kids were just running loose and sticking their hands and faces all over the buffets.  It was just chaotic, and I was stressed, so I was stress eating at a buffet.  The guy fixing the steak didn't seem to understand the definitions of cooking temps.  I mean I told him medium, and I got a piece that was well done.  So, then I tried to compensate and told him medium rare.  I got rare.  Very rare.  The thing mooed at me and then got up and walked off the plate.  Both pieces had gristle through them.  Honestly, the food is what you would expect at a buffet and/or a GC, but I've seen them in a better state than this one.  I kept looking around for the hidden cameras because I thought I was on Punked.

I would give them 0 start if posible. Very rud management. Terrible customer service and you will spend hrs and hours waiting to be attended to make the passport. They doesn t respect the appointments. They are racists and have a very bad actitud starting with the passport lady and manager who doesn t make anything to help. He just follows what this lady want to do. I'll never come back again,  there are several place to do your passport and you don't have to spend the whole day neither see this abusive people.
This is the worst service I have ever experienced.   The food was cold by the time it was served.   Food was bad.  Shake was tasteless.   Bad bad bad.  Don't go. Stay away.
You will lose more money here than just paying your ticket and going to a driving school for point removal. Extremely bad and rude service too. I would not recommend this place.

I bought a groupon and the guy doing tint there obviously didn't like the fact that I bought a Groupon. That's fine though but what's funny is he tried to take advantage of me because he must've thought I was a naive little girl and tried to charge me for windows behind the drivers seat saying that I charge extra for the back windows since there's smaller windows that require me to reshape and cut the tint to fit them. I've never ever heard of such a thing. And when I asked him to explain why he wanted to charge me extra for the back he had the nerve to catch attitude with me. Gladly, Groupon refunded me. Don't waste your time.

I definitely would not recommend coming here unless 100% necessary, especially if you need help at the pharmacy. I've lived in this neighborhood for 8 years and it's always super crowded and the pharmacists are incredibly unhelpful and grumpy whenever I visit. Just recently they gave my mom attitude when she called about her prescription being filled and they asked her why she was even prescribed it and -hung up-. What kind of customer service hangs up on someone who's just trying to get their medication? I get they're overworked, but don't put that stress on the customers.

Rude, arrogant and unapologetic when it comes to having food ready at the promised time.  Three times I have ordered from here and three times my food was not ready in time...tonight it was an hour late.  I will learn to make my own goddamned oxtail stew!  Unbelievable!!!
Lines are over 8 deep with only two lanes open yet multiple stockers in every isle.  11:12 pm

I've grown to hate this place. It seems like every time I buy something from their market, at least one of their employees gives a nasty comment or just is absolutely miserable.  It has to have happened at least 5 times now and I will not be going back to this misery hole.

I used to like this restaurant because it was easy, convenient, fairly inexpensive, and had adequate food and service. The last few times I went the music was painfully loud. I asked them to turn it down. Waiter said he would but nothing changed. Asked again he said they COULDN'T turn it down. An option is to eat in the bar with the multiple loud tv sets. This at mid afternoon when customers were sparse. Meanwhile prices have grown while quality has not. Tucson has many good restaurants. I see no reason to revisit this one.

Nice property with possibilities. Staff is where it breaks down. A lack of training is evident from the honors registration to the concierge. No real effort to focus on the customer. Be prepared to know which atrium best meets your preference. 

Restaurants weren't much better. Staff had a routine for seating which meant we were dircted to a table in nowhereland even though the restaurant had just opened and there  wasn't a  crowd. As a resort there should be more focus on understanding and helping the customer enjoy the very nice facility.

Wow. Just wow. Worst. Service. Ever. I very rarely write reviews, but I feel the need to let the public know about this place. I finally just asked for my hard drive back and let them keep the rest of the computer and my $100 deposit. The contract and rates are so obviously not in the consumer's favor and geared in their favor. You are charged to ask about anything about your computer via phone or in person.
