You are told to sign that you will pay anywhere from $75-$500 MINIMUM to fix your device without telling you in advance where you'll fall in this range. Pay them $75/hr and you are considered economy which means you'll be lucky to hear from them in a week. Paid $25 to jump to the front of the line and that took 2 days. Was specifically told that the diagnostic would be free and then when trying to pick up computer, said that was not the case and said that they never said that. Literally lied to my face!!! Just asked for my computer back and was told that would take all weekend bc there were tester parts and they couldn't be bothered before then to put my computer back together to give it back to me. 3 days. The whole experience is just awful and they're just rude. You are just treated like you are garbage and lucky for them to give you their awful service. It's almost as though they're taking advantage of everyone being in a bad position with their essential devices that run their everyday lives in their hands. They VERY obviously don't care at all about their customers or the consumers of this city. They're hardly ever open (10-4 if you're lucky and they don't just put a sign on the door that they're gone), don't answer the phone, or texts and charge you $10-25 for bothering them if they do! And the guy running the place looked like he was super high on drugs too. In today's consumer driven economy, this is just inexcusable to be treated that way. Stay FAR away from this place, keep your devices FAR away from this place. Do not go here! I got out with my drive and a $100 fee to be told there was nothing they can do and was just happy to get away from that place. I honestly believe the good reviews are fake and them or their friends posting or maybe for a previous owner. Learn from my experience (worst experience ever)!  Do not go anywhere near this place!!!!!  I feel like they need to be reported to the BBB or the Chamber or the Media or something. Be warned!

By the way, there is another Apple repair like a block down that's upstairs where I had gotten good service before. Looking over the reviews, it looks like this place is getting mixed up with the other one. I feel bad for the other guy bc he was great! Should have gone to him again. This is the shop on the first floor across the street from the Starbucks. Stay Away!

Beware!!!!!!Please don't go here I came in on Thursday about my top denture was rubbing on the top of my mouth And the dentist if that is what she is destroyed my top denture and gave me an underbite Absolutely the worst experience I've ever had. Went to go see the new Mary Poppins with my family for Christmas and the entire time a kid was in the row behind me throwing up in a popcorn bucket. We had to get up and leave cause it was so disturbing. The dumbest part to me is that the only thing they did was have someone come to clean up the puke while the movie was playing. It's dumb to spend almost $60 and not even see the end of the movie. There's absolutely no reason this should of happened. They should give a private showing to everyone in the theater so some of us that got up to leave could watch the end without having to watch the whole first half again and spend another $60. Don't know if I will ever be able to go to this theater again.

Awful service!!! This must have been my 3rd or 4th visit...previous visits were fine, but my visit this past Thursday was by far the worst. I work in the CBD and won't be going back.  The restaurant was busy, but still had a few open tables left. 

When it was my turn to order; I felt rushed. I asked our server about the crab cakes appetizer- if it had a lot of breading. She said it has a combination of both. I'm picky about my crab cakes...and I don't like a whole lot of breading bc it's mushy. I was thinking about it; and she asked if I wanted more time to order. I said no, I'll just get the tomato remoulade with shrimp appetizer. 

Then I thought about it some more- I think I'll just try the crab cakes. In less than 10 mins, I was able to get the server's attention to ask her to switch it to the crab cakes. She said I think your dish is done; and she asks me, do you still want to change it? I said yes please. Then she told the manager that I wanted to change my order. Get this...the manager comes to the table and says your order is actually at the window, do you still want the crab cakes? I said yes, then he proceeds and says it will delay her order (my coworker's) bc it's on the same ticket. I proceed and calmly say could you just bring out her order, you just said it was at the window.  He walks off and pretends like he didn't want to hear what I said and tells our server to change it. 

When the bill comes out, they charged me for the crab cakes entree $17, instead of the appetizer! They surely showed me. I just paid it and didn't bother to fight this bill.  This is the last of my $20 something dollars for lunch that they will get from me!

Plan to wait 20 minutes in the drive-thru, and that is when their system isn't down.  No exaggeration at all.  This is the 3rd time in a row that this has happened.  They are incredibly understaffed.  They could honestly use 2-3 more workers on every single shift.  Will be sending a detailed summary of each experience to corporate going forward.

Very unhappy, you lost a valued customer. We had a problem where Monro Muffler underfilled our engine by 3 quarts of oil and caused damage to the engine. Monro's insurance company said they would pay for damages if we brought to the dealer, we were frequent customers of Bergeys so we brought it here. They discovered the timing chain needed to be replaced, a chain that lasts the life of the car unless you don't change the oil or have low oil pressure the tensioner can lock and stretch the chain. Joe the service associate that took the car in specifically said I told the insurance company as little as possible and told them he couldn't tell if it was from the oil and there was no way to tell. And on top of that, was extremely rude and unprofessional to my wife bringing her to tears the way he spoke to her. My wife and I just bought a house in the area, only 26 years old and you lost a life long customer. Over the past year we spent about $7000 in repairs here, and Joe went out of his way to be unhelpful and leave us in a terrible spot. I brought it to another mechanic who was able to help us prove more it was from the oil and do what Joe told us and the insurance company they could not do. So on top of losing a service customer, I'm on the market for a new car and can tell you for sure where I will not be getting it.
The chicken was soggy and the fries were to salty. I really enjoyed by coffee though. The service was slow. I would overall say say it was an ok experience.

I tried getting into St Elmos but they were too busy and told me to try Harry & Izzy's since they serve the same food. 

I called Harry and Izzy's and got a reservation 7:15 reservation. We arrived by 6:50 and decided to sit at the bar because 7:25 rolled around and we still didn't have a table.

The bar tender was great and the shrimp cocktail was fantastic...that was the only thing good about this place. 

We ordered 3 ribeyes (2 rare and 1 med) and 1 salmon entry. It took over 45 minutes for the food to come out. When the steaks came out, there was no crust on the steak and the two rare steaks came out med to med-well. None of us finished our food because we did not find it appetizing. I never ever add additional salt to my food and I had to add some to the steak and dip in creamy horseradish to be able to eat it.

The customer service at this store is a joke. Literally, if I could post negative stars I would. I went to return an online order before the dates that it needed to be returned by and they would not refund my order in the form of my original payment. 
They would only do a store credit. I paid online with PayPal. Even if they say they don't work with PayPal they could have swiped any other credit or debit card and have had my money refunded. 
I was a retail store manager for 5 years. I know how point of sales work. They gave me a store credit for a company that I will never shop at again. The receipt should not say, 'We will refund your money in the original form of payment' if it's a lie....nor did it say anywhere 'online return only' for the items that I was returning. That is misrepresentation. It's in black and white. I spent over $175 and was returning less then $30 worth of merchandise.

All of the other restaurants nearby were crowded and I had heard such great things about Biscuut Love...Man I was really looking forward to GREAT food.  People really talked up the princess and I was highly disappointed in my food but the service was great. Maybe I should try the other location in the Gulch.

Food was excellent. Customer service and training---very poor. Waiter was very rude, not attentive to basic waiter 101 training by asking what we wanted for drinks to just plain nasty. Wait time is not accurate. Add an extra 30 minutes to the max wait time listed or you will be waiting a very long time. 2 hours to be exact on Sunday.
The  place is so dark hard to see the menu to start off with. The food is fair not really all the tasty. Waiterss we're a bit slow and the place was not even busy.

Randy H
Avon, Indiana, United States
3
Pending review
There's a whole lot of stupid going on here!!!
My experience began when I had to chase a Portillo's employee out of the handicap stall of the bathroom after waiting at least ten minutes so I could take my child who is in a wheelchair to the bathroom. I had to ask him to finish up. He didn't apologize. 

I then went to the desk to order a beer and had a dissatisfied customer standing in front of me who was irritated because he couldn't order a beer. It seemed the employee had some issue with the cash register and could not ring him up. The manager had to come over to the beer island and solve this cash register mystery. We waited a good 10 minutes before the manager came over to resolve the issue. I had to pay cash because it made it less painful but it got me my beer. 

We ordered our food and it was 32 minutes before we had it in hand. It was 9:30pm on a Saturday night and NOT busy. Several employees tried to look busy behind the counter ( even Spanky, bathroom boy) while others played on their phones. 

While receiving our food they told us they were out of chocolate cake- the same cake for which they are supposedly famous- they were out of it! My wife asked them what they were going to do about that and got a blank stare from the employee. She was offered a milkshake that had been sitting on the counter for the 20 minutes she stood there and waited for our food. She turned down that offer and demanded chocolate cake. Somehow cake magically appeared from nowhere and we got our cake. The manager had to come to the cake rescue. When the manager had to intervene, she seemed irritated with the female holding out on the cake. 

While waiting for my wife to get our food a gentleman hovered behind me for at least two or three minutes with a mop bucket. There was a some sort of spill on the floor behind me and he didn't know what to do. Finally another employee who was wiping down tables came by and he asked her, "so... should I like mop this up, or what?" And she said, Yeah, I guess." So he did. BRILLIANT!!! I was waiting for the spill to jump into the bucket for him! 

Lastly, the food was average at best. The cake was no better than that you can get at Target. Needeless to say, the manager is a saint for not flipping out completely on every employee in the place. She deserves a medal. This place deserves to be bulldozed and put out of its misery. Go elsewhere! Anywhere!

Don't trust the ratings Booking.com gives this place. I stated on the 5 point scale that it was unsatisfactory across the board and booking.com calculated that on my behalf as a 2.5.
Check out the pics I posted. This place should be condemned. I booked my stay based off of the ratings booking.com gave...
Will no longer use booking.com.
Nastiest place I've ever booked. Hair was in the sheets. Rotted bathtub and majorly infested with swarming termites. I have pictures. We didn't even stay the 2nd night and when we went down to discuss with management, he quickly released us of our stay and said he "...hated to put you up in that room but it was all he had left". I said come up and look at the infestation of termites. They have completely invaded the room. We were breathing them in and swatting them off of us, and he said, "I believe you".Horrible experience. I have pictures if you'd like to see them.

Worst Eegee's location I've been to. They were so slow that the employees were talking to each other about how bored they were, meanwhile it still took 12 minutes for us to get our own sandwich and fries. We were the only ones in there and only one guy was helping make our food. Left the place, opened my sandwich, found a black hair in the bread. Don't come here

This two-star review is more of outrage about the shocking response I got from the clerk that took my call tonight.

The majority of servers, delivery drivers, and kitchen crew are splendid. Truly. I'm a regular guest in and out. I have ordered their small Chef Salad seven times for delivery in the past. 4 out of 7 times, within minutes of eating a small salad (it's huge) portion, I was doubled over with extreme lower abdominal pain, explosive diarrhea, nausea, and headache that lasted over 48 hours. 

They didn't wash the veggies. It's a no-brainer after decades in the food service business and nearly 30 years as an RN. As Pinocchio's is open well past other businesses, I can't always get my go-to chef salad (when that's exactly what I want). I continued to give them the benefit of doubt and kept the salad among my orders. I didn't complain until a pattern of poor prep behavior was evident.

Except THIS time, I simply added in the instructions to wash the lettuce thoroughly and the, I called and told her why. Her tone was condescending, rude, and smartass. "Well, why didn't you stop asking for it? I wouldn't have (unintelligible) enough to get it again." Excuse me?!

I took to this mission that would be less like a drama queen, would be a reasonable and not a "one time only" issue/mistake on their part, would reenforce that important step in prep that protects the consumer, and allowed me to enjoy my choice knowing that I'll have their back as they have mine. 

This horrid girl infuriated me. As she would rather see business loss, potential liability, and negative press rather than slimply relay a message, I'll simply speak to the Boss and sadly put Pinnocchios Restaurant considerably lower on my list of choice delivery in Media.
Whole family got sick after eating here. The frozen yogurt was pretty but did not taste good. Would not go here again or recommend it.

I hate giving a bad review as much as I hate waisting my time eating in restaurants that has ZERO customer service. 

Okay... so the food is decent but when you get to a restaurant at 7:30, order dinner and before you even finish they are handing you a check without asking if you would like another drink or... how about deserts... Sorry, you need to either hire new staff or fire yourself if you are the owner operator. 

The sad part is, it was maybe 8:15, the place was empty and they actually told us they close at 8:30. REALLY... I would  rather travel 20 minutes to Westchase to Siam's for much better food and service next time. Very disappointed! 

Thank you for making us feel unwelcome. Note I am leaving out facts like there was so much rice on the floor under my table and I had to ask for extra napkins until I got up to get them myself. 
Myself... etc. etc.
I was completely rushed through and the lady left gel polish stuck to my hands. They "fixed" it and I walked out with polish still stuck on every finger. Crappy job

Checked in on 12/2 with a 12/5 checkout. Tuesday morning, room #803, I woke up at 4:30 AM with extreme bed bug bites all around my neck, ear, arm and lower thigh. The neck part was the worst. I go to the front desk. No manager on duty. Front desk girl calls manager and told me he would be here at 7. She said she'd comp the room after I showed her all the bites. She called security and I had to fill out a report. She put me  in 1011 in the meantime so I could shower and regroup. 7 rolls around and no manger. I go down at 8 and a new front desk person is there. He knows nothing about the issue. At 8:30 manager finally arrives but doesn't call me. I go to him. We sit in lobby. I show him pics and my neck and ear. He apologized and told me my stay would be taken care of. I asked him about all my clothes and luggage now exposed to these disgusting creatures. He told me a 3rd party would come in and evaluate it and based on that they would decide if they would replace my luggage. He did offer to dry clean all my clothes in heat. I left them out and left. 6:30 I come back and housekeeping is just now getting to my new room. I go to front desk, 2 people, neither know of my situation. Laundry finally comes. I have a $600+ bill. I checkout at 5am for an early flight. New front desk person knows nothing about my situation. My bill is now well over 1k. She said she would have the manager call me at 7. 9:30 rolls around and I call. I'm now told EVERY manager is in a meeting until noon (I'll then be on my flight). I had to go to wal-mart the night before to buy bed bug spray to spray down all my luggage and clothes. I threw out a lot, in fact. I was told by the manager this happens 2-3 times a year. This is what you can expect from this hotel? Out of respect, I was very calm and collective. I refrained from making a scene or discussing this around other guests. I had no intention of using the internet and other sources to share my story or pictures, but at this point there is no other choice. 

- Jacob

I don't usually write reviews, but we had an unusual experience that I wanted to share.  We were in Nashville with our young grandkids for the weekend, and based on the good reviews, we ordered pick-up.  The order and pick-up went smoothly and the food tasted quite good.  However, after dinner, all of us experienced extreme thirst, drinking multiple glasses of water.  The 2 year old woke up several times at night, crying for water, which never happens.  We were fine the next day.  Not sure what was in the food - msg perhaps?

Like most others, we came here after shopping at Bass Pro next door. I was very impressed with the layout and appearance of the restaurant. It's decorated very well and appeared to be clean. We came in on a Friday night, but it was pretty empty. Even though we saw plenty of open tables, we were still told it would be a 10 minute wait. Not a big deal.

The staff was very attentive and friendly. The menu seemed to offer a lot but the "Endless Fried Shrimp" sign caught my attention at the entrance so I was set on that.. This is where it all went down hill. The shrimp was butterflied and deep fried to the point where you couldn't even see or taste the shrimp at all. Every bite was like a bite of previously frozen breading. The plate came out with a pile of fries, a few shrimp on top, and cole slaw on the side. The slaw looked gross (watery and not even real cabbage) so I passed on that and the fries were mediocre - even my toddler didn't care for them. My husband had the Mahi Mahi, which he said was just OK. I tried a bite and it was bland and dry, not flavorful at all. The shrimp was the biggest disappointment though.

You know this is a pretty cool place and they work efficiently.  If the line gets long an employee comes out and takes orders from the line via remote tablet like at In and Out. 

I've had drinks here twice now, one was a black coffee and the other was an Americano. My reason for only two stars is that they serve their drinks kinda weak.  Make them stronger and it's a 5-star place.

My family and I dined here tonight after my nephew's graduation. We were a party of six. It was one of the worst experiences we ever had the moment we sat down. Our waitress name aeriella(don't know how to spell name), was the worst waitress we ever had at this restaurant. She had a bad attitude and the service was horrible. We ordered the appetizers. We all thought it was pretty good. Our waitress never came over to see if we needed anything or ask how was everything or are we doing ok. She back over when it was time to order the entree. We ordered our entrees and our table was never cleared off until it was close to the time for our food to come out. Everytime we asked her any kind of questions, she gave off a bad attitude. It's not like we were rude towards her. Now to the food. None of us enjoyed our entrees; well I didn't even get an entree because I was frustrated. I ordered a ribeye and for $30, I wasn't expecting a thin and small piece of steak. I've been to steakhouses in new york and even chophouse, so I wasn't expecting for it to be that size for that price, but I was expecting it to be a little bit thicker than what I received. I told the waitress and she gave me another attitude and asked what I wanted. As I was telling her what I wanted she was walking away before I could finish the order. I ordered the garlicky shrimp pasta and the sauce came out watery and I had two whole shrimp that was sliced in half, which made it look real curly. They must have ran out of shrimp I couldn't believe the kitchen staff could send something out like that. So, I also sent that back and didn't order anything else. Our waitress sort of snatched the plate away with an attitude. I left without eating any entrees. My family didn't even finish their food. They only ate some of it because they were hungry. When they got home, they just threw their food away. They also, felt that they would've had better at cheesecake factory. When it was time to pay for the food, our waitress was never to be found. My husband had to ask another waiter to get her. The servers that brought the food out was more polite even the waiter that went to get her. I wished we had him. The food and the service was one of the worst experiences we ever had at grandlux. Even the manager didn't come over to apologize for the inconvenience or see if we needed anything. Everyone said they will never return again. This experience ruined my nephew's night. He didn't even enjoy it.

Been living in the area for 14yr. I'm used to many cuisines Indian, Jamaican, Chinese, Thai, middle East, central American, Mexican etc if wanting American I'd go to the chains like Applebees, chili...

So decided to try Rons 2 days ago. 

Ordered two pastas and a soup. Service was good. My pasta was wayyyyy too salty.. unbearable salt. How can you screw up on a pasta dish with meat and bell peppers? 

Disappointed!

Last summer I hit a bad pothole and blew my tire out. The next day I drove it to Meineke to get it checked out because it was the closest place to my apartment. They said the tire was ruined and I needed a replacement. Let it be known I had 4 brand new Goodyear tires put on in February last year. Not knowing much about cars, I thought I'd leave it in the hands of professionals, but that was a BIG MISTAKE. They put on a cheap-o brand tire that had lower treads and was completely different from my other tires. Left it on the front! I just got done having another tire replaced (from hitting yet another pot hole) at the original place I got the new tires (Sam's club). They said they had to replace the odd tire because it was dangerous to leave it on... when they took it off, it was plugged in the weakest spot. I was charged over $200 for this cheap USED tire from this scam of a business! Unless you know what you're talking about when it comes to cars, do NOT come here because they will take advantage of you and rip you off!!!

I've been staying at the Alexander on business for the past 12 weeks. Every aspect of the stay was great, especially the staff and food at the Market Table breakfast, up until the very end. 

My company covered the cost of parking in the garage for the first few nights. After which, we could either park across the street or pay out of pocket to continue parking in the garage. I elected to remain in the garage. Apparently, the monthly garage parking fees cannot be pro-rated. Meaning if you stay in the garage May 31st through July 1st you are going to be charged for 3 months, rather than the 1 month you actually stayed there. My situation was similar. My company covered the costs up until May 30th, and I parked in the garage May 31st through mid-August. So, to my surprise, as I was preparing to check out, I was slapped with a $700 ($175/month) parking bill. Despite the fact I elected to be billed monthly. I didn't even try to dispute the last 2 weeks of August that I'm being charged for. But charging a full month for 1 day in May, where is the customer service aspect in that? Especially considering my vehicle was broken into and cost me upwards of $800 to get the window repaired and replace the lost items. To add insult to injury, I was told on two separate occasions that due to my misfortune in their garage (the break in) they would take care of the parking fee for me. Which would have been an incredible act of good faith. However, I guess the staff wasn't on the same page, because I still ended up paying the whole amount.

As I said, outside of this situation, the staff and service were amazing. But I think it's incredibly distasteful to do what they did at the very end. Talk about leaving a bad taste in your mouth.

The food is ok. It's a chain restaurant so it's on par with others like it. My issue is the service. There are two bartenders who are spending all of their time with one customer who appears to be a regular. They appear to dirge bare minimum. There has been a pile of dirty dishes sitting in front of us for 20 minutes. And the bar is a mess. These two need to be trained or fired.
Worst service ever!!!! I never got my food!!!! I called them twice for them to tell me my food already on its way for 2 hours already smfh
This place is booty! Cold dry buns, lack of seasoning, worst fries, good onion rings. Amazing creamsicle shake. Never return. I recommend the California's The Counter.

Very disappointed with takeout this week.   We ordered chicken szechuan and found very little chicken.  It would more appropriately be named carrot Szechuan.  I would expect Szechuan to have some kick but found this was bland.  House wonton was good.  I like the option of brown rice.  We have eaten in the restaurant and enjoyed it, but this takeout was a fail.

Oh, where do I begin...  Today, I returned an online purchase, that I received yesterday, to the Nordstrom Rack store in Willow Grove, PA. I didn't have to wait in line as the cashier waved the flag at her register as soon as I walked up with a sodden expression on her face to let me know she was available.  Wow, waived a flag - now I get it after my experience.      


The cashier, her name, 11843588, asked for my email address, and I told her that it's on file, she wouldn't let up and I told her that I did not give it when I was there previously and received emails. She didn't like that I wasn't obeying her authority it seemed and may have rolled her eyes.  Next, she was staring at the numbers trying to make sense of the simple receipt and the merchandise only returning two of the items and told me my refund was X.  I exclaimed that there are two more items.  She then tried to return the next item, at which point after, again, trying to make sense of the screen, tells me that the item is past 100 and some odd days return policy.  I said WHAT! I just received these items yesterday.  She doesn't know what to do now, and I am considered irate, since I raised my voice, and the manager is called. I confirmed that the manager was called, because obviously intervention was needed.  The next cashier, her name, 11779998, wearing dollar store flip flops, and, I guess, trendy frayed, purposely ripped/cut cropped jeans, t-shirt and a do-rag looking like she just cleaned toilets tells her that she will ring up the rest of my return, and gives me an attitude.  With that, the manager, Brianna (who was dressed better), comes over and tells me we don't tolerate the raising of the voice, while she and the other cashier were holding my returned merchandise hostage.  I was actually being bullied by a bunch of snowflakes (see urban dictionary) in a store for returning merchandise.  It was so difficult to keep my mouth shut just to get my refund and get the heck out of there.  You can never argue with a snowflake, it's equivalent to trying to reason with a 4 year old who wants to eat a bag of candy.  The whole experience was incredibly bizarre and out-of-line.  Did I mention that the big dummy security guard came over to try to intervene as if it were a bar room brawl. I'm thinking WHAT IS GOING ON???, AM I ON CANDID CAMERA!. I'm sure they all immediately took a break and ran back to their "safe-room" and had cupcakes and punch or crack.



I finally got out of there with my refunds and called Nordstrom to voice my complaint.  My complaint is supposed to be emailed to the district manager, but come on, what is really going to be done - they may even get a chuckle out of it. The thought process of yesteryear used to be the customer is always right.  If you have a receipt and the corresponding merchandise, HERE IS A TIP:  NOTHING SHOULD BE SAID TO THE CUSTOMER AT ALL EXCEPT, THANK YOU AND HAVE A NICE DAY!!!  GOT IT!!!



I thought Nordstrom and Nordstrom Rack were a bit classier than Walmart.  To my surprise that is absolutely not the case these days, it is a completely Ghetto check-out experience - one that will leave you puzzled.  Not only that, the store looks like a thrift store. Too bad they cannot get anyone to work there with a higher than 75 IQ with 100 being average or is it that they just don't care.  It saddens me to see the devolution of the human race and this is just a microcosm of the big picture.  I couldn't even believe what these creatures were wearing and their demeanor. 


To add icing on the cake, I then stopped at TJMaxx in Abington, PA, which is down the road and the worst dumpster of a TJMaxx store. You should have seen the bed clothes these cashiers were wearing, think faded black t-shirt, your oldest, tightest sweat pants, and pink locker room flip flops.  I couldn't believe my eyes!!!  Two more stores to cross off my list... unless of course, I'm in a better neighborhood.

I can't believe this place keeps the lights on. Always wrong food, stale food, and often, no one there to order food from. McDonald's should hear about this shithole it so proudly associates itself with. You are only as strong as yours weakest link...and this establishment shatters any suggestion that the corporation has standards.

This is a kitschy, cute bar. That's it. Do not wait in line for sugar blasted drinks.  If you do, you'll average maybe one drink an hour if you aren't bellied up to the bar. Go ANYWHERE else until the newness wears off....and it will quickly as they make you line up for 30 min- 1 hr for no reason. Hype and slow service. FAIL

I was a patient in April 2018, I spent 7 days at the hospital.  I am an RN and worked as a nurse at this hospital for 9 years.  My experience after gastric surgery was extremely poor.  I had a medication sensitivity and reduced respirations and transferred to PCU (Progressive Care Unit) and ICU.  PCU had poorly skilled nurses for the most part.  I had to get up frequently and was on O2, Several IVs, and a telemetry monitor and was told to go to the restroom by myself which was impossible.  I also had my O2 ( once back in bed) not turned back on 3 times in one night.  While in ICU a day nurse was not given info my medication sensitivity and she offered the medication (A Pump which was still on my IV Pole) to me which I strongly declined - that is why I was in ICU!!  I also had missed labs that was supposed to be drawn, Aspiration Pneumonia from the surgery, and placed on Isolation when I should not have been.  When transferred to the various units Med/Surg Gastric to PCU to ICU back to PCU, and then back to Med/Surg Gastric unit the Nursing reports that are given were very lax and therefore I was taken off pain medication and given Tylenol for 3 days and spent NPO (nothing by mouth except for ice chips for 5 days. This drastically reduced my potassium levels and had to have supplements. Truly a nightmare VERY POOR PATIENT CARE...Please don't go to this hospital!!  If you have to please have someone with you 24h/7days.

Parrots loud crying inside is so piercing while you wait.. awful sound!
Need to find somewhere else..
Car usually gets fully cleaned 50% of the time.. Something has always been skipped over or forgotten.. 
Girl who checks you in is fantastic.. but can't continue to come here..

My husband and I went for a very late dinner. We drove through the drive through because the lobby was closed and there were maybe five or six cars in line. We had to tell our order three different times, only for it to still come out wrong. We pulled up to the front, and when I walked up to the door with my bag of food, one of the guy workers, (holding an unlit cigarette by the way) yells, "we a got a fuck up!" He then tells me that they can't let me in the lobby because it closed at 11pm, and that we'd have to drive back around and wait in drive through. I asked him if he was kidding, because it was ridiculous to go wait back in a line of five or six new cars. It would have taken two minutes to fix our order, but they wouldn't. Awful customer service.

Please do NOT patronize this business. If your car needs to stay overnight and something is broken they don't cover it. If you call to question if something sounds right you'll get cussed out by the Manager Tom Likens, who called me everything but a child of God. Corporate is NO help and takes several weeks to get back to you only to say "Every Meineke store is owned independently, there is nothing we can do but apologize."  Please trust me the Manager acts like he's nice, but if you question the work done on your car he is a complete ass.
I ordered a bowl of seafood gumbo and that tiny bowl costs $8 doesn't even have a piece of seafood, no shrimp no crab nothing. Speechless.
Don't come here late at night for a to go order. The food is probably great, but I wouldn't know bc I've been waiting an hour for my take out order....

Pizza here is over-rated. I ordered their thin crust and it was extremely dry - hardly any sauce on it. Also had to wait an hour and a half for the pizza. They were upfront about the wait before we sat down, which I really appreciated it, but the food wasn't anything great - not worth the wait.

This blond girl today, 4/9/18, response to everything is "We're about to close" 
- I walk in today at 5:38PM (after I called earlier and asked if it was okay to come after work and that I would arrive about 5:40) and the girl is  looking at me crazy as I walk in. I told her I came to get sized and her response is, "What the other boutique couldn't size you?....." As if to say why should I get sized here if I'm buying from someone else... Obviously if I was going to another boutique then they would have sized me, I'm ordering from online genius. But I ignore it and tell her, well I called earlier to see if it was okay and the person on the phone said it was fine as long as I arrive before 6pm. So she's like well it's 10 dollars and 'were about to close', and I'm like okay fine. She sizes me fully dressed, 2 long sleeve shirts on, which idk if it matters or not but I didn't like that she didn't even bother to put the tape under the clothes. Now I mention that I had been there before and asked if it was possible to buy the sample dress i tried on if it fits now bcuz my wedding is in 2 months. I've lost a lot of weight and since and it almost fit the last time, just tight in the butt, I figured it probably would actually fit. She's looking at my sizing like "oh nooo it's not going to fit you" (incredibly rude, like it's not even worth trying on). I was like well it almost fit last time, but she's insisting based on her measurements that it wont fit. She's like well you can't try it on tonight we're about to close (which I didn't ask to try it on tonight). Then I say okay well can you schedule me for an appointment, she's like no we're about to close. And the other lady next to her was like 'schedule her for another day', because she could see I was interested in buying the dress. She couldn't schedule me tomorrow and wouldn't Saturday because "only new brides get Saturday appointments, not repeats." So I took my 10 dollar measurements and just walked out. I was basically telling this girl I WILL BUY THIS DRESS IF IT FITS ME just give me an opportunity to put it on my body. ALL she cared about was the fact that the shop was about to close ....20 minutes before closing time, with no one else in the store. All I can say is I am VERY GLAD I didn't buy the dress the first time since it was going to be a time crunch, because I couldn't imagine being treated like that, just so unwelcomed, after I've already given those people my money..... 

-Gave 2 stars since the first appointment was about 3 stars very average, but this girl was a 1 star, probably a zero. She's pretty lucky I forgot to get her name.

Made a reservation, wasn't that busy, got sat in the bar and basically ignored until I asked to move.   Out of the 10 or so Brazilian Steakhouses I've been to, this one was a less than desirable experience.    While Joe the manager attempted to correct it by sending over the meat patrol, the overall flow and $200.00 food bill would have been better spent at Del Frisco's.

Watched one guy making sandwiches without gloves wipe his nose 5 times and continue making sandwiches without washing his hands. Saw another employee stick his finger in his ear, clean out his ear, and then go onto making sandwiches. Food looks great, but I could not eat here.

I decided to go here after doing some research for a salon that was going to be close to all the activities I had planned for the day. The manicure and pedicure were not bad. I was disgusted by the fact the nail tech dried my feet with the same towel that was covered in nail and cuticle trimmings and don't get me started on how gross the towels were in further inspection. I also didn't really feel pampered like I do at most places but the nail tech did a good job on the Polish and shape of my nails.

But here's the true kicker at the end of it I was charged $65 and normally I always tip 20% unless I don't feel I got extraordinary service (and it doesn't take much for it to be extraordinary for me I'm simple). I decided to tip $10. I looked at my bank statement only to find that they decided $15 was more of what they'd like to see in a tip. I unfortunately don't have the receipt because I've never had this issue before but I'm very disappointed not because I can't afford the extra five dollars but because the people here took it upon themselves to take it.
Came during the lunch rush. Waited 20 minutes and never received my sandwich.  Ended up leaving due to a pre-scheduled meeting I couldn't be late for.

Tried Joella's for the first time today, and I'm sad to say, the last time too. Never have I had worse fried chicken in my life. Soggy, greasy, way too salty, no heat, no sweet. The only good part was the pickle chip on the 1/4 chicken and the side of garlic parm fries(and they were only ok by fast food standards).

This is basically the only place open 10pm on a Sunday. Unfortunately it serves Applebees-quality food at a ridiculous price and you have no choice but to shovel heaping spoonfuls of disappointment and sadness into your mouth
Way to expensive for what is offered. Paid $29 at Creamy acres night of terror for 4 attractions! And free parking. It was amazing. Don't waste your time here

Less than desirable front desk service.
Alexandrea greeted me with a frown and combative attitude. Actually arguing with me at check in, leaving her stand, and taking a break without saying a word, while I'm standing there waiting for a room.

Being a Hilton honors member, I've stayed at Hilton's all over the U.S. and this was the worst experience at check in, because of Alexandrea.
Her immature/inexperienced attitude would do better at the Holiday Inn, than the Hilton.

Unfortunately, when you call the front desk, Alexandrea was the only one answering with a smirk, then placing you on mandated 5 minute hold without asking.

With so many options for lodging in an expensive town, Alexandrea cost the Hilton a customer.
If you can get past check-in, the rest of the staff was helpful, smiled, and attentive, spectacular view.

Let's hope for your sake, Alexandrea finds a new career path, one not involving customer service.

One of the worst meals I have ever had. I asked the waiter what was good. He said the shepherds pie so I tried it. The meat and gravy were disgusting. My friend ordered the chicken enchiladas. They were dry, hardly any enchilada sauce on them. The waiter was very unfriendly. He also over charged my credit for his tip. Eat anywhere else but this place.

Don't do it! Went here on a sunny Saturday afternoon for lunch with my wife. 1 server staffed and visibly not happy about it. First really nice day of the spring, if I were the owner I would've personally come in to help out assuming folks called out. First, she was doing best she could, but food took FOREVER and when it did come had a long black hair (my wife and I have blonde hair) in my fajitas. Waitress brought out a new plate (15minutes later). No comp on bill, no apology when presented bill. Additionally, the menus and table were DIRTY to the point I had to wash my hands before touching our food, yuck! I went against me better judgement because this spot is in our neighborhood, but never again... save your cash and stay away from this place!

If you hungry, this is not the place for you. They serve very little (the kids plate was bigger than the one I ate). Meat has no flavor, the serve you in a small disposable plate. Very disappointing. I can get more food for $8.55. I came hungry and left hungry

hotel monteleoneWill make this as short as I can . 
When we checked in 

The room was ok, (just ok) bathroom was so small...... BTW we asked about the bath when we checked in cause I am a big guy , front desk girl said was normal size and nice......
We checked in , as it turns old the bath was extremely small, we unpacked, and went to dinner. When we got back we sat on the beds, and there was serious issues with the beds, it felt like you were on a nosy old wooded boat. 
We called down to front desk manager, and they moved us to another room, The new room was much better and had bathroom that was a normal size, and the beds were ok . !
But they moved us to a room by the elevators, it was beyond nosey, I assume the hotel was just so busy 
So again spoke to front desk, they had no rooms to move us to, so we just decided to leave early they said ok, and sorry no problem, they understood... that would have been ok, but here it is....... The day they we check out they added $239 dollars to the bill for and early departure fee 
I said huh? Spoke to a new manager he was Rude, did nothing and did not care ! 
We left with being billed and extra day for leaving early .. lol 
Anyway I called amex when home will dispute the charge. We get the money back ! 
But in the end the last manager was so rude and bad; I wish I had the name.... But for his great wisdom. It earned this review 
In the end- summary 
Rooms were ok. Some rooms are very nosy, due to old thin walls ( hotel was built in the 1800's ) and I guess many walls or doors have not been updated or better sound proofing , you could not sleep . Some rooms have very tiny baths, and beds that have serious issues. But the worst was the management.... I give the place 2 stars

The food at Riverview has never had great food, but my husband likes their catfish, and until tonight the service has typically been friendly, down home southern. 
But tonight the service was absolutely terrible.  I'm almost 50, and the bartender made a huge issue over my not having my license, in spite of the fact that the restaurant was essentially empty and I'm clearly middle aged.  My husband had his and said he would order the drink in that regard, to which she said, "Well, then you had better drink it." Ridiculous.  Laws are laws, but it was rude and completely unnecessary.  We won't be back.

Went there today to get a bagel and it said they closed at 3. It was around 1:50 and the door was locked and the girl working there was in there sweeping. An hour and ten minutes before closing you have the door locked and are cleaning up?? Called twice and she answered and said "sorry, were out of bagels" ???? When I went up to the door I saw several bagels on the rack.... idk if I'll be coming back

When i went in to the establishment, i was rudely greeted by a boy with brown hair and blue eyes named keoni. He had the most rude attitude towards all the waiting customers and was horseplaying in the back instead of taking orders and helping me. F@ck keoni.
The PA at the time, 2015, botched a cyst removal and did a terrible job stitching. I'm now left with an awful visible scar on my chest.

This bar was founded by Tatyana Telnikova, a Russian expatriate and cycling enthusiast. She also opened Propaganda bar on Cherokee. I actually gave that place a positive review. I think she did a much better job there. It's great. I'm giving Handlebar a somewhat negative review, but she has no need to worry. Handlebar is thriving and will continue to thrive.

It's a St. Louis powerhouse. Have you been to it yet? You will eventually.

I've been to it so many times. It's simultaneously the Grove's resident Russian restaurant as well as the local hipster bar. Every bar hop in the Grove must inevitably pass through Handlebar.

As a Russian restaurant, it's decent. It's watered down by pub fare, though, and most dishes come with goat cheese in some form. St. Louis actually has a large Bosnian community, y'know. So if you're looking for Eastern European food, you can do better (and get a shot of slivovitz while you're at it). Telnikova's other bar, Propaganda, does Russian food better. Most people who eat at Handlebar order pizza.

As a hipster bar, well, it's not Tower Grove's CBGB's. Which is to say, you can expect it to be *a lot* more crowded on the weekends, and you can expect to find the kind of people who generally avoid dive seedy dive bars like CBGB's getting white-boy wasted from the tops of their Polo shirts to the bottoms of their Sperries here. There's an outdoor patio area (which, if you're here on the weekend, is the only place there will be room to breathe) where people will be vaping and smoking cigarettes next to bonfires.

Needless to say, the bartenders are often overwhelmed and already sick of your poseur sh*t. It doesn't matter. On busy nights, there's really only time to order a Pabst and a shot of rail whiskey, anyway.

This is all a roundabout way of saying that if you're 22, this is *the* place to be. It's a great place to take shots, do bar trivia, and grind on the crowded dance floor on the weekends. If you're 22, though, you aren't reading Yelp. If you're reading Yelp, you're probably looking for a delicious Russian restaurant. This ain't it. Honestly, St. Louis ain't it. Go back up to the search bar and search "Bosnian".

If you're looking for a Russian bar, try Telnikova's other bar, Propaganda. It's great. If you're looking to chug Pabsts on a Saturday night--well, you're probably already here.

On Fat Tuesday you have a staff of 5. Are you serious?  You are on one of the most popular corner Poydras and St. Charles day of Mardi Gras and you don't properly staff your location. Come on Starbucks. They have one person on the register and on guy who looks like he is trying to look busy so he doesn't have to do work. This is ridiculous. 

The staff is moving slow as turtles no smiles no hi how are you. Heads down they have one door open and the line is out if the door. The only good thing was I got bathroom tickets. DO BETTER

Bought a new 2018 car from this place.
A few things you should know:
1) they are the stereotypical slimy car salesmen you read about 
2) they may try to alter some pricing/throw in their own financing for a rebate (same price of car just lower monthly payment) or some other tactic to make you think at first glance you've got a great deal - don't take this offer. Make sure you ask how/why the price is that way. Get the truth out of them. I got 3 price quotes and they all included rebates with nissans financing. I told them multiple times I had my own financing through my bank and would not be using them. They didn't stop giving me quotes with their financing until I told them I'd take my business elsewhere. 
3) they are willing to negotiate. Stand your ground. You can get a great deal here if you are willing to negotiate, know what you're talking about, and are patient. They are desperate to sell cars so the second you walk away they will come chasing after you.

I did my purchase via phone and email from distance. I recommend doing this as I seem to have had a better experience than most folks who've bought cars from here. 

Here's what I learned:
Find the car you want. Do your research. Call other dealers. Get quotes from them. Know what the average out the door price is for the vehicle you are wanting. 
When they make an offer, don't be afraid to give a counter offer or ask what they can do to lower the price for you. They can and they will. 
They will email you a lot, they will tell you fake pricing over the phone, all things to get you more interested and invested in them. Don't take this stuff seriously, only take seriously what's in an email. 
You'll probably have to be a little aggressive and stand your ground. They kept telling me they'd give me the lowest offer, I told them I didn't believe them because their price was higher than others, they beat another dealer for the same exact car for $750 less. They didn't make their best offer until I told them I had a better deal and that this was their last and final opportunity to gain my business. 

The main takeaways:
- do your homework before buying. The more knowledge you have the less power/manipulation they have. Know exactly what you want. 
- don't be afraid to walk away. If you're at the dealer don't let them pressure you. I talked with them for a few weeks and felt 100% more confident 
- over the phone & email because it takes away their power and ability to manipulate. if you can, do everything over the phone or email. This seems to work better at this particular dealer 

My perspective on the staff:
Overall, everyone is pretty slimy. It seems like salesmen are on thin ice and get a lot of pressure from upper management, so it's really not them who are slime balls, but their superiors. I don't mind at all having the salesmen make commission off of me because they are providing a service, but don't let them upcharge you for a car. I can't imagine what it'd be like in person, but I would assume they swarm like vultures. You'll have to be very stern about what you want - I suggest having your own financing here as they will really push for Nissan financing. 

Giving 2 stars because I did get a great car at a great price BUT the salesmen are super needy, annoying, and desperate. I'm just glad I have a car and never have to deal with them again (hopefully). If you can be patient, aren't in a rush to get a car, can get financed through your own bank, and know exactly what you want & what it's worth, give this place a chance because you probably will get a good deal.

Rude service. Arrived with friend both of us had coupons ...woman behind counter said only one of us could use because we walked in together we were counted as 1 guest. Tried to ask questions she ignores us talking and clowning around with co workers. Very rude to us and people behind us. Then to round it off slide bolt breaking in bathroom locked in for 5 minutes before I could get it unlocked. No thank you.

The server that brought out the food barely moved his arm to give me my food. He then spilled my Coke all over me. Never apologized. Then had the nerve to ask me if I wanted another Coke. My response was "Yes I would like another $3.00 Coke that is now on my lap". The other server was very short and rude, guess she was having a bad day too. I will say the food was ok but the service was horrible. I then had to return to work in wet sticky clothes, not so pleasant. There are better places to eat with better food and much better service.

The food was good for a buffet and the price was equally the same. The service through was terrible. Not one person came up to me and introduce themselves. I went to the manager and asked him for a cup of coffee. He said your server will get it for you and I said who was that. He told Misty who was my server to get me a cup of coffee. Should anyone come here make sure you get a different server.

Horrible business etiquette. I work at a business where Paradocx winery was booked as a vendor for an event we were hosting. After confirming in advance and even prepaying for the wine, they never showed up. They never called or even answered a phone call throughout the night. Talk about bad business, I would never spend my money here and would certainly never recommend anyone to give them their business.

I was so tempted to order from here, but I saw one of the staff members repeatedly grab a food item with the parchment paper (as she should) but her long lime green nails always touched the food. Then she handed utensils to a client and didn't grab them
By the handle but the part that goes in your mouth. Lastly as she ladles soup into container she grabbed the container from the inner part instead of the outer part. None of these I would have an issue with had she worn plastic gloves. I would work on these issues quickly.

This place does good cleaning but needs you to specify how u want ur pants creased. Nearly all pants, men & women, are creased in the front & back!  Plus the pair I brought in had a strong crease front & back already!  My husband used to press at a dry cleaner & thought it was ridiculous to have to give instructions for a front crease in pants.  They re-did it free, but I had to make two trips to bring them back & pick up.  Plus, I could see no way to contact a manager on website. In person, there are just young counter help.

Stopped in today. Ordered a roast turkey hoagie (small $7.50) with a glass of water. Was delivered an Italian. Explained I wanted a roast turkey with mayo and sweet peppers. It was delivered and eaten (somewhat dry). Went to pay and the bill was $12.46, was told mayo and sweet peppers were extras at $1.50@. I have never been charged extra for mayo and sweet peppers. Will never go again.
Staff is unorganized.  Rooms are mediocre.  Prices in the hotel in general are marked up and the elevators sound like the are on their last leg.  Many other options in the area to enjoy.

I took my 5lb yorkie here. The first and second time no problems. The third visit they charged me an extra $10 because they said it took them an extra person to "control him and keep him still". My baby is the most calm and sweetest little guy who is a diva and LOVES bath time and being groomed. Weird for a dog but not him. They also told me I should have him sedated! He is 9 years old. Clearly he has been groomed by many and never ever has there been a problem. They were expensive enough but $10 extra cost to control a 5lb dog!!??!! Pleeeeeeeeeeeease! WON'T BE BACK! THEN have him SEDATED? What did YOU do to my BOY is the bigger question here?

Has success killed Ralphs?  Has being at the top of the creative cuisine game gone to its head?  Or is it just the natural evolution of restaurants in my hometown?  This was once my go-to place for special occasions; no more.  But it didn't happen overnight.  It started a year ago with desserts that tasted like they'd been bought at the grocery store bakery.  Then the next time the service began to degrade.  Alot.  It was sort of like they were doing us a favor by serving us.  And then last weekend, the total collapse became final.

Our reservation for Sunday brunch was for 12:30 but being seated wasn't meant to be.  We retired to the lounge where the service was great.  The cocktails were well prepared and a nice starter.  The cocktail pianist provided especially relaxing panache to the lounge.  And the lounge, like the restaurant, has amazing ambience.  It's all about location--and the view from Ralphs is one of the best in the city.  But ambience will only get one so far in the restaurant business in NOLA, and the balance here has clearly shifted.

About 45 minutes after our reservation time we were seated.  The hostess was businesslike in fetching us from the bar and totally unapologetic for the delay.  I'm not being pissy about that, but a simple "we're so sorry for the delay, we had a late seating we were trying to manage," would have gone a long way in recognizing the inconvenience of the wait.  Actually, I suspect we'd have done better by hanging in the bar.  

The server started out okay taking drink orders and making some small talk.  She would become more difficult to find as the afternoon waned.  Not sure what was up with her, she was very pleasant and while the restaurant was moderately crowded, it did not appear that service staff were slammed.  

I get the whole leisurely New Orleans brunch pace thing, and I'm usually a fan. Spend the time with good company visiting.  But we did show up to be fed, and that process was inordinately prolonged. Once again, the dining room was not packed, it was mostly full but that should not have taxed a well organized and efficient kitchen.  After we ordered, it seemed the appetizers came out after a very long interlude.  It took even longer for the entrees to hit the table.  During those times, our server became more scarce.

The appetizers were special, as they have always been.  The fried oysters in particular stood out as did the turtle soup.  But "special" stopped there.  Nothing about the rest of the visit was special, indeed it was the polar opposite.  Some entrees were no longer available by the time we ordered; or rather they were ordered but the server returned with the bad news.

I should note that the brunch menu leaves much to be desired.  (Or perhaps I am just spoiled by the regular lunch and dinner menus; fair enough.)  But fried chicken sandwiches?  Okay, so if you offer it do it justice.  They were plain, dry as cellulite ceiling tiles, and pretty close to what you could find at neighborhood convenience stores.

But most disappointing the dish of shrimp and grits, that iconic of all brunch specials in the city.  This isn't a complicated dish.  Is it possible ours were plated in advance only to sit under some high tech plate warmer?  How else to explain the atrophied shrimp.  What once were likely some attractive medium-large shrimp had shrunk and were seemingly stuck in the now congealed grits.  Totally unappetizing.  Mediocre.  Or worse.

The desserts had not improved over the last time we ordered them.  Much like the service.

I don't mind paying a premium price at a restaurant.  I have always believed that you get what you pay for . . . but that contract works both ways.  If you charge me a premium price, provide a premium experience: 
 honor those who take the time to reserve a table, grace us with pleasant/appreciative service, provide a nice selection of food choices, pay attention to pacing of appetizers and entrees and prepare food that sets you apart.  

The final irony--I have two gift cards for Ralphs worth collectively about $150.  Not sure I'm up to using them.  Not sure a recovery plan is in place for Ralphs and even if there is, I don't know if there have the leadership to execute the plan.  Diner beware.

DO NOT USE!!! I prepaid for a ride to and from the airport and was not picked up for either ride. My flight was delayed getting into Indianapolis and when I called to see if I could get on another shuttle nobody answered. For my pickup back to the airport, I was waiting in the lobby of the hotel and the shuttle literally just drove by the stop even though I had a confirmed reservation for that time. When I called customer service they told me I'd have to wait for another shuttle. I asked told her I needed to get to the airport and she said she'd connect me with someone who could help and I was redirected to someone's voicemail. Their services are not worth it, unless you'd like to be inconvenienced and have to pay double for an uber/lyft that will actually get you where you need to go when you need it. They need to work on customer service and actually making sure they pick up the passengers who have made a reservation and paid.

Regrub is one of those places you really, really want to love. It's new, it's been trendy somewhere else (Calgary), it's colorful, its menu is full of funny names, and it's convenient to the Whyte Ave walking stretch of pavement.

I was excited to "drop a pin" into this nouveau burger experience, doubly so with a bit of the hangry. So the other half did the ordering while I soaked in the ambiançe: it's like the Teletubbies grew up to high school, got to plan a menu, decorate a space, pick a soundtrack and make social media accounts. Yeah, it's like that.

That part is all good. It's a fun, colorful space with happy, shiny staff. The fail parts are the execution of the food and the value-for-money propositions. Those could use a lot of tweaking.

She wanted the Lutter, a 4 oz Alberta Beef patty with bacon, egg, and cheddar surrounded by a bun of split glazed donuts. I liked the contrast of the sweet and savoury, whereas the 'bunny felt the donut didn't meet up to her Tim Horton'y expectations. (It tasted to me like a Krispy Kreme regular glazed donut, FYI.)

The Cheesy Jr., a 4 oz patty topped with mac n' cheese with bacon bits, arrived looking (seriously) like those Halloween caricatures of a pumpkin vomiting out its insides. Yes, there's pale creamy pasta with bits covering most of the serving tray... in a competition, this contestant would have been sent home. It's a presentation that screams "I'm so drunk I can't even bother looking for flatware. I'm using my hands and lots of paper towels." Still, it's the taste that counts (mostly) but this explosion wasn't rescued: it was under-salted and nowhere as cheesy as it *needed* to be.

My ultimate measure of a restaurant's worth to me comes down to whether it (1) delivers a food that I can't easily make at home along with (2) an experience that's memorable at (3) a rationalizable price. Regrub fails on the former; I can whip up dorm-quality meat patties & KD without any effort. The middle; okay, interesting location slash vibe slash space. The latter; meh. Everyone felt mugged.

The worst thing of all? This is *so* close to executing well. Krikey, taste the damn food on the way out of the kitchen! Tighten up food design and assembly; try to be impressing someone...

Oh, and your Instagram counter behind the till is broken. Even that narcissistic rush doesn't work. Meh.

The worst Dunkin. I don't understand how you literally have "Donuts" in your name and if you don't get there before 9 or 10 am there is absolutely no selection of them and this seems to be an every week thing! If you know you have a large volume of customers on a Saturday morning, then have more donuts...it really is that simple! I worked for a Dunkin Donuts years ago and have also been to many others that have a selection ALL DAY.

"Arrogant aggressive, Cheaters, condescending and insulting"
This was my first purchase in the Lexus brand, and it may be my last. When test driving the car I was interested in, Anthony(aka Asif) was polite and stated he could work with me on price. The minute price negotiations started he was a different person. Not only was Anthony rude to me, but treating us like we were idiots, aggressively talking down to us. I am in service industry myself, and my clients don't speak to me the way he did-- even on a bad day. We agreed on some number and I had been signing the papers all the way to closure until I realized that they increased the EMI, excluded terms & services which I was promised of initially. I felt like I am cheated on many terms. We were so insulted we walked out and ended up finding a cheaper price on the same car. After that experience, I would have happily purchased a lesser car for more money to avoid speaking to Anthony ever again- let alone spending any money with him or Mungenast. Absolutely disgusting- I won't be returning.

DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY They promise you a much lower quote to hook you and then nickel and dime you.Drive time charge total scam materials charge scam would never recommend the use of this company to anyone would do less than one star if possible

I normally give positive reviews on yelp because I think there is too much negativity in this world. However, I have not been to a McDonald's where the employees were more unpleasant, indifferent, or downright rude. Food is normal McDonald's fare, but be prepared for employees who obviously don't care about their job.

Very disappointing. First time back since their latest rebuild after the second fire.  We did come 30 minutes before close, but that shouldn't have affected their ability to deliver decent food.  My husband ordered the sampler with the pierogies, potato pancake, and cheese blintzes.  I ordered pierogies.  Everything tasted soggy like it had been deep fried an hour before we got there and sat under a heat lamp.  Won't be back as there is a far superior deli within 5 miles.  It doesn't have the wait service, which is why we decided to come back to Short Hills, but after tonight I don't care that I need to go up to a counter to get my own food.

Went on a Thursday night. Cool atmosphere, very helpful staff (probably because there were so many of them, they were wondering what to do). Food came within 5 minutes. We had the first two ramens on the menu and the gyu bao buns. The buns I thought were very tasty. My boyfriend thought they were just ok. But the ramen... I would never go back there for the ramen! First off, the broth is extremely salty (almost inedible), the noodles are meh, and the meat is unmemorable. We've been to the Ichicoro in Tampa as well and had the same impression. I have not tried any of the other menu items, but if you're a ramen house, your ramen should be on point! 
Also, charging $2 for half an egg is insane, unless the egg is exceptional, and it's not.
I would recommend if you have a craving for ramen to bet on either buya ramen on central or dosunco in Tampa.
sssssslllllowwwwwwwwwwwww.  food=average at best.  did i mention sllllllowwwwwwwwwwwwwwwww.  50 minutes for our sliders... and not overly busy.

This place used to be great, a favorite of ours we visited at least a couple times a month.  But the last few times we've been there have been a real letdown.  You used to get a good size portion of fries, heaping over the top of the cup, now they don't even fill the cup.  I shouldn't ever have to complain about how many fries I get when I pay $6 for a large fry.  I questioned the portion when they gave it to me and the guy said... "No, thats a large fry."  Seriously?  The burger patties seem to have shrunk as well, they're now far smaller than the bun.  Its almost like they're bottom line is hurting and they've decided to pare back on all the portions to make up for it.  A real disappointmenting turn of events for a place we used to love.

Stayed at TRC over Thanksgiving weekend (11/20/2018 - 11/25/2018). The staff was unwelcoming and unfriendly at best. I got the feeling of "don't bother me, I'm busy" when trying to engage them. There is a propane filling station that appears to be on the property but actually belongs to the service center next door. When asking about getting a propane fill-up, the woman had no clue, was aloof and disinterested; NOT the generally helpful, warm and welcoming staff I am accustomed too at other RV campgrounds.

Difficult to get into and out of. Ditch on one side, large trees on the other. Skinny, tight spots that must be BACKED into with NO ROOM for parking your truck once your camper is backed in.

The worst was some angry woman that just about knocked my camper door down demanding I move my truck from the empty space next to me. As she put it "That is NOT a parking space, you need to move it. We have people in and out all the time. When can I expect you to move your truck?" Very unfriendly tone of voice and on the edge of threatening. I get the empty space was not a parking spot but couldn't they be a little less threatening about it? Really made me irritated that the spot (along with about 1/4 of the park as well) remained empty for the next three days. Still empty when we pulled out on Sunday morning.

Won't be back there in the future.

While they usually do a nice job of my nails their COMMUNICATION skills are the absolute worse! They often ignore you after signing in on arrival not giving you any information about how long the wait will be -- I waited 15 mins today before somebody finally came up front so I could ask. I was told a few minutes abc it ended up being 30 more -- I would have gladly made an appointment and returned later that day. They need to learn to respect people's times and schedules and be much more efficient with customer service. This is not the first time this has happened and whenever I kindly remind them they need to offer this courtesy they just say "sorry, sorry." If you have a busy schedule as I do, call and make an appointment first.

I don't know why you people are all here lying to people. I got the fish tacos, they are absolutely disgusting. Is the fish boiled? Who boils fish for tacos? Because that is literally what this tastes like. Irrelevant, it is still Bland and tasteless. Also, I asked for flour tortillas, and I still got corn so thank you for that. And then the tortilla completely disintegrates on contact: what the heck is happening here?? Biggest waste of money ever, and into the trash it goes. I guess the hunt for good taco spots in town continues.

Everything is way way too salty!  We had the chicken rice soup, lots of chicken, but even diluted with some hot water, it was still too salty.  The French dip was tasty but again too salty.  Cannot eat this food!

Sigh. Can't we have any nice things in south jersey? No? Ugh. Ok this place NEEDS proper ventilation number one. Want a bleach burn in your lungs or your skin or sinuses? Come on down! When it gets super crowded the chloramines bind with urine, sweat and other nice things so that the chlorine is actually accentuated in the air to such a degree that without proper ventilation will poison you. Read about it before you go.

That said...can I have a 4 inch square to myself here? And "lifeguards" don't seem to mind if children fall, etc. Always a plus. Another "fight for the fun" kind of place. Sad. When I told one of the managers about the difficulty breathing and the sheer chaos, he said "what do you expect?"  I expect never to return to this dirty place.

Eclipse used to be my favorite California style pizza place in town. But I've been very disappointed my last two visits-  the margherita was a particularly poor example of the classic, and leftovers got tossed. For the price, I expect the fresh, high quality ingredients and careful oven temperature management I remember from several yrs ago.

It was five years ago I gave this place 4/5 stars but there new policy of charging $2 for ice in a drink is a complete turn off. When a group of three spends almost $500, is this additional really necessary? The steak is great but I will be choosing a different steakhouse next time based on this absurd policy.

I wanted to like this place but it felt more like a mass chain than a great local find. The staff were great and no wait. The custom omelet was not done correctly (tomatoes inside when I asked for none and an onion or two that were not part of my order). Not terrible mistakes, but the worst was that the food came out luke warm. The complimentary corn muffins also seemed old. If you're looking for standard fare, no frills, this place is fine. That said, for the quality they are too expensive for brunch/breakfast in my opinion.

I had this company come out twice in one week to do a deep clean, for which I paid $120. The microwave, windows, window tracks, and under the couch and bed were untouched. The second time they still left the windows and under the bed untouched. I was in constant communication with the company, sending pictures and details. The women also broke a full length mirror (and did not own up to it until days later). When I called to be refunded, the office manager, Michelle, refused to give even a partial refund, and hung up on me.

Simpson tea house, I really wanted to enjoy you and the experience of going to a tea house, but unfortunately it wasn't that much of a great experience in terms of service.

I came to celebrate a friend's birthday and we had a private room, which was reserved for two hours of high brow laughter with the girls. We were served scones, tea, finger sandwiches, a litty bitty medicore sad salad, soup  and I can't forget a side of attitude from the owner.

Yes the owner was upset because we were eating cake, that was brought from the outside, to basically say happy birthday to my friend. As the cake was being served, the owner marched up the stairs and low key fussed at us about the cake in a unprofessional manner. She even had my friend sign a waiver just in case any of us gets sick from the cake.

Then as we were leaving she once again continued with her negative energy as we all payed separately for our dining experience. I understand that bringing the cake in was a violation of their policies but as an adult and a professional bussiness owner, I would think that her conflict resolution skills would be a lot more better than acting out like a spoiled two year old.

Nonetheless I payed 40.00 for mediocore food. Overall the experience of seeing a tea house was nice. I did like the individual tea pots that we got served when we selected our tea and just seeing a actual tea house was nice as well. Will I come back, maybe, but I won't be rushing to this place.
this place is the WOAT! left and hair was chunky and uneven. went back to get fixed. still have a CHUNK that's uneven. just asked for "straight across". not OK. recommend great clipz over this crap.

Worst place to go ..despite whatever Groupon or desire to try this office for the first time at a discount rate for the hard working uninsured you will. Not get a break from these people I went in on a Groupon as a gift for my partner nothing was done instead the same day I ended up paying about 1500 for a procedure they were not felexable for would be a week later so they got paid pretty much for nothing there not felexable although promise the hours times this tech works are limited and place is open they took my money then after revealed a so called non refund policy there inconsiderate to hard working people a company that goes around taking 300$ or more for doing nothing just canceling are crooks and reports will be filled...DONOT try them despite all fake posts on here speaking from personal experience and displeasure and the dentist guy is a creep talks fast will try to pressure u into anything without proper explanation there on sale for a reason no one wants to go there's and will not gain clientele conducting buissness this ways..very dissapeared:( they should be ashamed of themselves

Meh. The woman that did my pedicure did a good job. The one who did my SNS nails.... was Speedy Gonzales! ... and NOT in a good way. 

Don't come Sunday mornings, cause there were only 3 attendants so as soon as it started to fill up, the quicker the service got. I understand being short staffed, but don't gyp the customer by rushing through and doing a subpar job in the process. The entire purpose of coming to a salon is to have a relaxing experience, not to take your money then shuffle you out the door. 

Plus, they didn't even apply a discount for getting both a nail & foot service. 

Needless to say, I won't be back.
I just called to ask a question and the front desk staff is extremely rude and unfriendly. I certainly wouldn't spend my money there.

I rarely write negative reviews, however when it comes to the cleanliness of the restaurant I felt it necessary. My husband and I sat outside on the patio for dinner. We asked to have it cleaned as there was not one table or chair that wasn't completely filthy. The floor had used napkins, ketchup, &  fries all over it. No one ever came out to clean any table. After finishing our meal I went in and asked to speak to the manager. When I told him what happened his reply was, "oh, nobody came outside, sorry." I said that no one had come out and we had completed our meals. It appeared he could care less. I was very disappointed in his response. While the food was fine, it will be a long time before we ever go back.If a restaurant is going to have outdoor seating for dining, it only makes sense that it is clean.

I've been here a couple of times and don't really find anything special about it. The food is hit or miss. If I could do half stars I would give it a 2.5. My wife tends to like the food, so they get a half star.

This is NOTHING more than Hipster buzz words smashed into a biodegradable container. Not much else. Two things annoyed me. The price (one small one large = $18 and don't forget the tip!) and having zero smoothie samples available. So you'll just have to take the word of some apathetic cashier. You're paying at least $8 for extremely small portion sizes and questionable ingredients. When I say "questionable" I mean when I went and purchased a smoothie with banana as an ingredient. When I looked over the counter all the banana peels had green on them. Which means the banana was under ripe and that my smoothie wasn't sweet. Which isn't a problem because I don't like things to taste hyper sweet. It meant that the smoothie was bitter with an aftertaste. This place embodies what folks don't like about new Nashville: it's lovely and pretty but there's zero substance to the food in this shoppe. You'll do better with their bowls, which is the same fruit slop as the smothies, just with nuts and pineapples in it. And the pineapples save the slop. Save your money and treat yourself to anything else on 12 south. You're welcome.

Terrible service. Ordered online and after 1.5 hrs called. They claimed that the food had just left. Got it 1/2 hr later even though we live 5 mins driving distance from there.  Food was just okay. They got the noodles wrong, green onion cake came with sweet sauce not hot sauce. Green onion cake was also the frozen kind most restaurants cutting corners is selling. Would not recommend this place and won't order from them again.
