I hope this was a fluke, but this was the dirtiest McDonald's I've ever been to! The only reason I gave it two stars instead of one is that my grilled chicken sandwich tasted fine.

We came because of the play area and because we had BOGO coupons. I wish we had just went to the park instead. We walked into the children's play area and were met with an extremely disgusting experience. All the tables were sticky, there was trash strewn about, the trash cans were all full.

I went to get napkins and all the dispensers were empty. I was going to ask for more, but wasn't helped. It seems they were incredibly understaffed. I used my own wipes to wipe down our table (you can't tell an excited three-year-old that we have to leave before he gets a chance to play).

After eating, feeling very uncomfortable in the squalor, I went to the drink machine. They had refilled the napkins, but I saw ants crawling in the sticky mess by the drink machine!

I took my baby out to the car to nurse and told my husband to meet me there when the other boys were done playing and eating their stale French fries. I couldn't stand to be in there any longer!
The employee's are very rude and the stuff they sell looks like junk.

Bailey's Range is the burger joint from the Bailey family of restaurants that include Rooster, Bailey's Chocolate Bar & L'Acadiane a Cajun themed restaurant. I have eaten at all of these but the last one with mixed reviews. 

As for Bailey's Range, at one time, might have been one of the greats in specialty burgers in STL. Now it comes across as a tired once famous movie star looking for that final performance to garner an Oscar. We ordered our burgers off the create your own menu. Mine was a smash style burger with Gouda cheese, mayo, pickle, onions, tomato, lettuce & BBQ sauce.  The burger was not really smashed it just looked like they cut the thick burger in half and cooked it. The bun was tiny but delicious. The issue with this burger had to do with that the condiments were not fresh. The pickles had a brown look to them and tasted rotten, the tomato was watery & mealy with wilted lettuce. Ultimately, the burger meat was flavorful but at these prices the entire burger should have been epic. 

As for my wife, her burger was cooked med well as ordered but again the condiments were possibly the worst. Her pickles tasted spoiled and the rest was as fresh as you can get from the dumpster. Again something that should have been epic came across like an aged Nick Norte crawling out of bottle from the night before. 

The only saving grace if there could be one were the chili cheese fries. The chili was excellent and coupled with a not terrible cheese sauce on decent fries it gave us one enjoyable part of the meal. 

For the value and the hype I would not recommend this place to anyone. Head over to the Dam on Morganford or The Mack on Macklind for some of the best burgers in town.

Avoid this company like the plague! Had a brand new system installed by them and two years later I have mold throughout my house because they screwed up the installation. The pan that collects moisture was not installed correctly so the shut off safety sensor was situated at the highest point on the pan which allowed the air conditioner to continually run while spilling water off the opposite side of the pan from the safety sensor.  So the last two years water has been pouring down inside our walls. They take no responsibility for the faulty installation even though their service tech admitted to me he had to correctly adjust the pan. Their excuse is that we did not have it regularly inspected by them and if we had this would have never happened?? No! If our pan and sensor was installed correctly the damage to my home would have never happen and our air conditioner would have shut off automatically. If you have their system get it checked out by someone else before you ruin your home.

Nasty Manager - She was treating a handicap patron terribly. It made me feel terrible for him. She needs sensitivity training and discrimination training most definitely!!! Who is next ?? Our military people? Teachers? RUDE RUDE RUDE !!! Wont EVER be going back here again.

Food was overpriced and not cooked properly. We got terribly sick from eating the seafood. It was a horrible experience and will never come back. Beware of the mofongo with octopus and the seafood mofongo.

This was my first time visiting the nail salon. When I first arrived I discussed pricing for the 2 kids with me to get both hands and feet done, the tech gave me a price and told me what the add on cost would be, I told her no problem. When it came time to check out she changed the price (more then doubled what we discussed) and she began yelling at me in front of a room full of other clients when i was trying to understand how she came up with that total. I didn't care what the price was but it's the principle of her charging more then double of what we originally discussed and then disrespecting me by yelling at me. I'm sure they were wondering why I didn't tip, they can take their tip out of the extra that they charged me, it's a shame I won't be returning because the tech that did my pedicure was really good.

This has got to be my last time in ANY Red Lobster for the rest of my natural life! The quality of the food at this location is below that of a Long John Silver. In fact, I'd eat at a Long John Silver before this Red Lobster crap! Where do I even begin with my final experience. Some business clients asked me to grab take out for their office. The food was 30 mins late thus causing my meeting with my clients to be late. The shrimp are ALL apparently popcorn shrimp these days, including the so-called jumbo shrimp. It was all undercooked. I still feel sick from the lunch there. I can't give zero stars because there's no option but I would for sure if I could. Avoid all Red Lobsters, especially this one unless you need a good colonoscopy prep! Eat at your own risk!

I will never come to this place again, horrible service! Came in and sat down at a table by the window my first time ever being there, wasn't greeted or anything sat there for
Almost 20 minutes then ask to speak to manager I then spoke to the owner who told me there is not table service which I had no idea I sat next to the bar where the bartender could have easily greeted me and my guest quickly and asked if we needed a drink but never did, I am from Las Vegas where customer service is huge my twin brother plays for the stl cardinals and I can tell you now we will never visit this place again. You would think the owner would
Apologize and ask what we needed but never did just kept repeating there is no table service. Horrible prejudice like place.
Never again.

It's real sad this is the only doughnut shop in Bellevue, because it's just not that great. Doughnuts seemed stale and less than what I normally get from DDs. I came at 9am so I expect the doughnuts to be hot and fresh but think again. I had been waiting all week to take my 4 and 5 year old to grab some doughnuts on the weekend and even they didn't finish their doughnuts which speaks volumes. I took one bit each from my blueberry and maple doughnuts and decided to save my calories. Not worth the stop should have keep driving to five daughters or foxes den. I won't make the same mistake twice.
Nasty stale crust.  Greasy cheese.  Disgusting. Too bad.  Great location. Overpriced shitty pizza

We unexpectedly stayed at this hotel for two nights. The first night was was good.  So when we had a full day in the city and realize we were too tired to drive back to destinations we decided to come back for another night. However we were sent to three different rooms. The first two rooms reeked of cigarette smoke. Old carpet. The third room we thought was better because it had no smell.  However we wear short pillows and towels. ( they refused to provide more. ) The bathroom and vanity lights did not work. And there were cigarette burns in the sheets and coverlet. We have not been in the hotel for an hour when we realize all of this. The man at the front deck was not accommodating at all.  When we ask for money back so we can find a better place to stay they refused. This place was a nightmare.  We will not be returning and would not recommend.

Lawn Love Lawn Care. They robbed senior citizens. So my parents are unable to shovel their snow. They charged 80.00 and never provided any services. I called several times and no one as of yet has resolved this matter. No worries! We will be dealing with this matter in small claims court.

This was the worst experience I've had here. No sense of urgency to ensure food order was received by kitchen. After 20 minutes of nothing we ask server what's up and she says the ticket order never went through and they are working on it. But another 20 minutes go by and other people get served. We Ask again and our order still hasn't been started. Plus, no ice. Ice maker died. Hot in restaurant because only ceiling fans. Total incompetence and No manager in sight!
Lol worst mic dicks yet spicificly asked for fresh fries and got cold ones as usual finally got the no onions right tho

I ordered from here a while ago and they were good the first time. This time around, I ordered the shrimp and chicken pasta. It was super super salty, only 4 shrimp in the whole platter and my broccoli was cold. I ordered a tilapia platter too for my mother. The cabbage was crunchy like it wasn't cooked long enough and it was way under seasoned. I got a side of old bay fries but they never came with my order. I requested a refund, fortunately I got it with no problem. I doubt I'll be ordering from here again.

These guys are not to be trusted. Like others who have reviewed their "service" I too was ripped off for almost $500. I paid the original fee and then they re-charged my credit card double the original quoted cost saying that the weight was double what was originally stated 0 which BTW was the mfg's original shipping weight. THIS COMPANY IS A FRAUD.

Too bad there aren't negative stars on this page. We ordered a pizza on line at 7:08pm and the delivery time stated 7:40pm. So we started watching a show on tv thinking that our dinner would arrive by the time we were done. One show passed, two shows passed, three shows passed. Before we knew it was 9:15pm and still no pizza. I called the store and was caught in an endless loop. Then I tried calling back and received a busy signal. It's now 10:07pm and we just finished dinner (leftovers). All I have to say is that it's a good thing I didn't pay for our "no dinner" with my credit card. This place is PATHETIC-  patron beware!

Well 5 months later i tried them again.  I ordered my lunch take out with no onions or garlic as i am alergic.  I get back to work and of course it was in there.  When i looked at the receipt to see if it was atleast written and perhaps just a chef mistake, but it was not.  So the woman owner who took my order chose to ignore my diet request and in turn i pay her and not eat lunch  if the owner does not care to do the right thing the most important part the order, then why would anybody want to patronize such a place.  There are many places in the city who care about their customers.

Go by the side to see the aquarium; the food is not worth it.
They seem to be understaffed; different people seem to have different functions and bringing and opening a bottle of wine was a bit ceremonial. Once things got going it was more or less fine. 
All the appetizers came but not the child plate ordered. We had to ask for it.
Then, in the middle of the entrees, a second order of the child's plate showed up.
Food appeared generic, buttery and heavy. Deserts were fine: molten lava chocolate and key lime pie.
Some bottles in the wine list looked interesting but did not have information on the vintage. We hit a good bottle of Burgundy, a minor consolation for a mediocre meal.
Paid $38.  Car is still dirty inside. They did the minimum work. Didn't even attempt inside back windows.

This is a cool facility built in the old train station building. It is close to the sports parks and a few other nice places. Getting checked in is hard because there is virtually no place to pull up in front and park to get your room - plus - there are stairs everywhere - you will need to pay a bellman if you have lots of bags. The employees are all nice but the facility has seen better days. On the first night I was there it was 20 degrees outside and my room had no heat. They did fix it the next day but I paid full price for partial service. The restaurant was good but the service extremely slow - it's very understaffed and wait times of an hour were common when I was there - better to walk 10 minutes to the Hard Rock Cafe. On the last day I was there, even though I had a do not disturb sign on the door, someone from housekeeping tried to come in. How hard is it to read a sign that has three words on it??? The WIFI is good. The beds are hard. How this all impacts you nobody knows - but I didn't care for it.

This place has really gone down in cleanliness and quality of food. First off they changed the restrooms to unisex and they are equally dirty. The tables in this place need a good scrubbing because a simple wiping would not get them clean. Everyone working in this place appeared to be under the age of 21 and didn't seem to care about anything. The food was subpar and yet they have the nerve to charge 18 dollars for it. The burgers were put together in a hurry and had no taste to them. The fries and cheese curds were good. Flies everywhere and I was not even in the mood for the custard after the meal. Will be going to Culver's from now on.

This was absolutely the worst experience ever. My first and my last. Took an hour to get the food then it was cold, we sent it back and got it cold AGAIN! They gave us gift cards but we gave them back and told them to just waive the check. We didn't even eat! 2 hours of sitting there I was sick to my stomach. I know it doesn't happen to everyone or everytime but read these reviews... horrible.

I'm always amazed! 
They are too busy to handle a party of ten. Every staff member looked at us like we had the plague. They were not even half full. The greeter said they were busy and we would have to wait. We were fine with that, but they kept talking to each other and looking over at us. 
So we left and we walked into Glory Days Grill Florida and they had more customers, but were happy to seat us. Service has been great! 
I wonder what the owner of Chili's would think.

This was a very disgusting hotel and I did not feel comfortable sleeping there. Rooms are very old and outdated. Staff was very unhelpful.  Also, housekeeping staff discarded my personal belongings before I checked out.

DO NOT BUY HERE! Terrible experience from my initial lease signing 3 years ago. They are great at picking up the phone to sell you a vehicle but good luck getting a response after you sign paperwork. I have experienced some of the worst customer service from Beaman. I could go on and on with how disappointed I am leasing my vehicle with this place. Please beware you will not receive the same service after you purchase your vehicle!

I have used mega bus before and this is by far the worst experience I have ever had. The bus was 20 min late also the driver just accounted that will take longer to arrive in Chicago. I have give myself 3:30 before a flight and this time will be cut very short. Also this bus does not have any electronic plugs despite what is advertised and also no WiFi. As a working professional any devices used here will be out of power especially before a long flight to Europe. 
Overall don't try to save yourself the money book a flight. Really disappointing and unprofessional
Very disappointing.. $14 for the worst hot chicken sandwich I've yet to try. If your looking for a good hot chicken this is not the place. Try bait and switch or northeast sandwich co
Express??? There was no line...it was after 1pm. Four people making food. I still waited 15 minutes for ONE item! I will NEVER be back!
If you like microwaved food, go here. It's a disgusting attempt at Tex-Mex. I imagine drunk college kids are their only repeat customers.  This place is horrible

Came here out of convenience since my usual barber is on the other side of town. Landed the owner Edson. When explaining how I wanted my hair cut he seemed pretty annoyed. I have short hair and simply asked that he take a little off the top and to make sure that the top is the same length all over. 

He instead didn't actually touch the front of my hair but made the middle shorter and the back even shorter than that. He also didn't blend the front part of my head into the side, so now I have this cool front flap that looks like a misplaced toupee. He doesn't turn your chair around either so you can see what he is doing in the mirror, which I thought was interesting. To top it off, he loaded my hair up with hair product while attempting to style my hair. Shouldn't you ask someone first before doing all of that? I immediately washed it all out. It is clear that he had one style that he gives his customers. So, now I have to visit my barber to have my front flap removed. Edson's was a waste of $30.

Second time within 3 weeks and I have to say , both times the service was slow to best for how long it takes for dinner to come out . When dinner comes to the table it's hasn't been hot more like Luke warm . Bake potatoes come out like it been still out to long . Not sure what happen to Outback as of late . Hopefully they get better or they will lose me as a customer.

Food:
We had falafel, hummus, baba ganush, salad, and 5 orders of shawarma.
The falafel was nice, crispy and airy, but alas was extremely bland. Despite being listed as being served with tahini, it did not arrive until we asked for it.
Hummus was ok, a bit watery and too creamy.
Baba ganush was good, salad too.
The shawarma was terrible - firstly,it wasn't a shawarma at all, it was not shaved off a spit. Just chopped chicken that was grilled or fried. The meat itself was dry and tasteless. You cannot get a worse specimen of the dish.

Service :
Terrible - the restaurant was Empty and yet everything took way too long. It took about 10 minutes just to get our drinks - iced tea...

The staff appeared to be on drugs - dazed and clueless.

The check:
Arrived with 18% gratuity tacked on. Turns out that on one of the back pages of the menu - the desert menu there is a notice that parties 6 and above will be charged automatically. This statement must appear on every page of the menu... 

The owner:
The real problem is that we were a party of 5... That did not prevent the despicable owner of the restaurant to instruct the server to apply the automatic tip.

When confronted, instead of apologizing and offering to refund the tip, he showed us the door poetically telling us that customers are like birds, they come and go, makes no difference to him.

So, you decide if such a loathsome human being deserves your business. There are plenty of other Mediterranean restaurants in the area that serve better food, have much better service, and don't steal from their customers.

The food was sooooo good! The drinks are strong! The band was great! But the service from the staff was terrible! If anybody hates their jobs it is this group of miserable fucks! I mean damn get a new job if you hate this one so much! Dont take the shit out on me! Our server was ok but was definitely not happy to be there maybe she was tired. The servers at the buffet were negative, talking to each other, and not welcoming at all. We went to the dinner cruise which is from 7:00-9:00PM we attempted to go to the gift shop at 8:50 before leaving the boat at 9:00PM. We attempted to enter as another customer was coming out, the lady behind the registrar screamed, "We are closed!" "That's why the door was locked!" We were so offened that she would talk to us, the customers in that manner!  My wife was so pissed! The boat had not even docked yet and you should close at 9:00 when the curise is actually over! For $166 for 2 people it is something we will never ever do again. Gina was the only person on that boat who was welcoming, actually smiled and loved her job! Every other staff person on the boat was rude!

the absolute most disgusting marriott i've ever stayed at. All i wanted to do was shower when i got off the plane and i was welcomed with hairs in every corner of the shower. i asked for my room to be re-cleaned when i checked in at 5:30pm letting them know about the hairs, walk back into my room at 11pm and my bathroom was cleaned again EXCEPT for the shower i specifically requested to be cleaned. SOOOOO gross I don't think i'll ever stay at this JW ever again

update: bathroom still not cleaned & now my toilet is making noises

I was really disappointed in the food here. The gumbo was so bland and the waiter agreed with me. The happy hour deal on oysters was worth it as they were a really good size. I wouldn't spend my time going back here. The fried oysters were way too greasy!

I feel so bad leaving this review... Two major things stood out for me that I wish hadn't: my bulldog tasted so bitter even my husband wouldn't drink it, and it turns out the dry ribs were breaded even though there was no mention of breading on the menu. I tasted the lime slush on its own and it was fine, but The drink as a combo was unfortunately undrinkable due to the bitterness, and we couldn't figure out why. The bartender was nice enough to replace it with a vodka soda so it's not his fault. Most dry ribs are keto friendly and are not breaded. Our mistake for not asking, I totally get that. The ribs were very breaded, so we couldn't eat them and just packed them up and took them home. In short, the bulldog was undrinkable and the dry ribs were breaded, which like I said was probably our fault for not asking about.

Views are cool but inside the establishment is dated and unnecessarily stuffy with staff wearing suits and ties, etc. Menu is limited and overpriced for what you get. Taste of food was ok, drinks great. You're paying for the views I suppose.

The other Heffe's is significantly better for some reason. This place is trash. Their rice is always hard and dry, service is the worst and unless you're paying for sauces or sour creme, you will be eating dry food. 

Gave it too many chances to always disappoint.

Seriously worst Starbucks experience so far. Ordered a pour over, the male cashier didn't have proper change, 3 other employees just standing there... I asked if someone else could start the pour over while he saw to the change. I was given just a regular coffee being told it was a blonde... this is ten minutes in. Then I have to wait for 1/2 and 1/2. 15 minutes in no change yet OLD COFFEE THAT turned grey when adding the cream. My son comes in to look for me because It has been so long. I tell them the coffee is old, I get told it's not, bologna, smelled old, looked old... none of them looked like they were going to do anything but let me leave with old coffee, I asked for the originals nail order of a pour over... but from how slow it had already been and how long it had already taken I asked for my money back. Girls leaning against the register... waiting for change for ten minutes! Manager aloof and childishly laughing about it with employees. 
Not good Starbucks! No wonder at all why this is rated a TWO!!!

I haven't gone to Sizzler in years because it's so underwhelming. Well, my family is all getting over a terrible cold and we didn't want to go out but we're too sick to cook much, so we decided to order through Uber Eats. We decided Sizzler was a good idea as it's pretty close and my husband really wanted a steak. I was so disappointed. I ordered the hibachi chicken. My "2 chicken breasts" were flattened out little rubbery pieces of chicken no larger than a chicken tender. They were flavorless. TV dinner quality at best. I cannot believe how much I just paid for something I could have microwaved from my freezer. Serving size, quality, taste, price, all a thumbs down. I'm now reminded why I stopped going there in the first place. I won't be back.

I had high hopes for this bar. I walked in and all my expectations were met. Beautiful bar, wonderful seats, well-composed cocktail list. The cocktails we ordered were great. Then came the cheese plate. We were looking forward to the five cheeses, accompaniments, and raisin nut bread as advertised in the menu. However, what we got was only a few thin slices of three cheeses, not five, one spoonful of jam, no other accompaniments, and crackers, not bread. Our server said it must have just been a misprint, as they only had the three cheeses. They eventually comped the plate but only after we reminded our server that we hadn't gotten most of what the menu had promised. We would come back again but definitely ask to make sure the menu is up to date.

Yikes! People go here because it's cheap. We have given this place so many chances to impress and it failed every time. Such a disappointment. Call me a sushi snob because I am and this place is horrible. The sushi is not fresh and SO generic. We are done going here and they can discount their sushi all they want but I'm not eating it.

To the next customer looking to purchase from this place:

I have been purchasing items from T/M for years. Not only clothing but shoes as well. My complaint.
Purchased a pair of summer shoes ( Margaritaville )
I've been buying these shoes for years.
Last year I purchased 3 pair 1 for me and my two boys. Well after 4 months I noticed the shoes souls coming apart from the body of shoe. Took shoes and receipt to store spoke with sales men. After showing him the shoes. His response was ( that's what shoes do ) I said after 4 months? My last pair I still have and use them for work after 3 years ! A little beat up but the souls are not coming apart.
My point ( they did nothing to correct the problem )
Forgot STORE Montgomeryville Store.
I WILL NEVER SPEND A PENNY WITH THIS COMPANY. And I will make it a point to tell others!

Worst service ever. Not enough staff food was good well the items that came out which were ordered correctly and of course they were not. Took 30 minutes waiting on checks that were incorrect. Management didn't jump in to help and seemed lost and a little rude himself. If a downtown restaurant can't handle a crowd especially when a reservation was made and they knee we were coming then they should not be in the downtown area!

My hair cut is so basic I didn't even think it could be screwed up, but what irritated me the most was a more senior stylist staring at me while I paid and not saying a thing. I get home and realized she left a centimeter width of hair between where she squared off the bottom of my hair and my back. Seriously? Was this some kind of joke? And then I notice my sideburns are uneven and there's a random divot in one of them. I used to bounce between stylists here, but they've moved on. Time for me to move on too.

We had come to mealys to purchase a few things for our home and ended up by a couch and a table of which I'm still waiting for . It's been 2 months and I've never been updated on my purchase I had to call them to inquire about it . When I called they were looking at my order and it had a bunch of stuff that I did not order then finally someone was able to tell me that they were just waiting on the table but the chairs were there . I scheduled a delivery date and they never contacted me with a time and as much as I would love to wait around I don't have all day . We finally get a phone call by the driver saying he's here ? He's at another location with the same address and we had told the sales associate about this and she made a note and it's been about an hour and 1/2 since he had called and won't respond to our calls and the other location is only 10 min away from us . So I'm not sure if this is being done out of spite but I'm pissed . My whole experience at this store was not good and from what I can see with there reviews I'm not the only one . 
I'm also only hold for 20 min already trying to contact them so they cantact there driver.

I would love to give Chow's a great review but they just don't deserve it. I've been working nearby for half of a year and I've given them plenty of chances but they just can't seem to get it right, even for a place that's basically just re-heating already cooked and prepared food that they get from their vendors (ah, yes, do you think they actually make those egg rolls or that wonton soup?).

I have in front of me their Bean Curd Szechuan Style ($8.50). The rice they've supplied to go with it is not completely cooked and a bit crunchy, and it's certainly not hot and spicy like Szechuan dishes should be, but more importantly it's adorned with frozen carrots and peas, and either white or baby portabella mushrooms (they might have been part of the frozen combination, or not). It's not authentic, and it seems to me like one step above "Chinese food out of a can". I can prepare Chinese food better than this and I'm not that good of a cook. However, there's a lot of tofu to it, and it's a fairly good value as they give you enough that you can get two meals out of it except that there's not enough rice included to balance it. That's the best I can say about it. 

Another pet-peeve/irritation of mine, but one that I really can't blame them for as it's their business and they can do whatever they wish, is that they require a $20 minimum for credit card orders. That's too much for me to pay for lunch, and I just never have cash on hand. However, Wawa just across the street will take credit cards for any amount.

I've had just about every dish that they make at this point and I can only say that I am summarily disappointed across the board.

I'll give a review based on service, not flavor. I called to order a pizza for delivery at 10:51. They close at 11. I said "hi there. I was wondering if I can place an order for delivery?"  The girl who answered the phone politely said "I would normally say yes, but we close in 9 minutes so..." I said "allllllllllllright then." It's a shame she didn't answer the phone and say yes of course I'd love to take your order. I don't care if you're closing in 9 minutes. You're not closed and you should have taken the order. I was staying in the quality inn, and I even talked to the blond female delivery driver cause I noticed about her person staying here order some pizza(and it smelled delicious). But I guess I'll eat gas station Pringles now. I would have had exact change cash plus a generous tip for the driver, but too bad. As the manager of a family owned business I know how much it sucks to get a bad yelp review, especially cause yelp agents don't care about businesses, so I'm sorry, but I was hungry, your food smelled good, and I have certain expectations for great customer service.

This is the worst McDonald's on the face of the earth. Period. I strongly wish they get their franchise pulled it's an absolute joke. Expect to wait 20 minutes at least. Expect a very rude, not trained staff, THEY DONT KNOW WHAT THEY ARE DOING. Has your staff ever been to a McDonald's before? I am a huge advocate for McDonald's and visit frequently but this one is so absolutely pitiful it makes me want to go across the street to checkers(eww).

I realize Valentines Day is very busy but to deliver 11 dead roses in dirty water is uncalled for. The delivery person should have never dropped them off.  I would rather had them a day late looking fresh and beautiful then what was received.  Spending more than $100 on flowers I would hope to get what I paid for.

Why the 2 stars? Well the Pepp use to be one of my favorite spots in Reno till they started getting rid of all their older slot machines and replacing them with newer more volatile slots that don't let you sit around on them for too long. Cocktail waitresses are always around and ready to bring you a drink of choice which is an added plus. 

Gambling aside the property is very nice and well kept with friendly staff at all levels. From the slot attendants, restaurant staff to janitors. Never encountered a foul moment with any of the staff at the Pepp.

We waited a very long time for our food last night. We didn't order appetizers, just dinner. No drinks were refilled. Several people kept coming to the table to tell us our food would be out soon. One hour later, the tasteless penne pasta arrived. It was not a difficult, complicated order. The service last night was terrible.

This was the worst steak I have ever have in my life we have gone here many time but I will promise we will not be back because how do you mess up a Serlion and a flea  the one manager was rude and raised his voice they had are steaks recooked and it took 30 min as of timer and they said it was only 5 min so beware I do not recommend this restaurant at all well at this location at least

What a disappointing visit. Tried this place for the first time Saturday morning. Service was actually quite appalling and after many patient attempts to get some, I quite frankly gave up. Poached eggs although requested medium, were almost inedible they were so undercooked. This could have been overlooked had we been able to track down any one to have them replaced. Not once did any one ask how our food was or refill coffee. After 3 physical (getting out of my chair to intercept someone) attempts to ask the abundance of staff for peanut butter and jam while our toast grew cold, we finally gave up. Finally as we were about to leave, someone presented us with the sought after condiments which were not to our liking and too late but they still charged us $4.00 for peanut butter and jam! even after I mentioned the ordeal we went through to get them and that the homemade peanut butter was gross and tasteless. I usually give places a second try, especially if they are in my neighborhood as this one is, but not sure the prices, quality and most importantly service are worth it.

You guys lost my business.  Very disappointing, you sold me a high end car, convinced me to tac on an additional warranty that would supposedly cover the stuff not normally covered! Obviously this increased my monthly payment but you made it very compelling to do so.  Then less than two yrs later (within your warranty claim) the interior carbon fiber trim starts peeling off.  You tell me it's not covered, that's cosmetic. You told me my warranty covers interior and exterior, otherwise why would I purchase an additional warranty that was already covered under factory warranty?  Ok, now lets understand I get over your worthless promise to cover my broken vehicle..i called several times regarding a fix I'm now willing to pay for and no return call.  After diligently following up with you my final answer was that it would cost me over $3K to fix interior trim...WTF.  Well you lost a customer for life and I hope many more that read this post.  FYI...traded the Jeep in to go back to a Jag!
The hour sauce didn't taste good. I found the seafood was not simmed enough into the sauce and food had not much flavoured. A bit pricy but customer service was OK. NOT GOING BACK
This was my favorite shrimp and fish taco place in philly. But they changed their taco bread and sauce and now I can't even force myself to eat there.

Seems like fancy authentic Asian restaurant, but the quality of foods are lower than how it looks. The food is authentic or tasty.
I'd give 2 stars for foods and 3 stars for interior.

El helado está rico.Peroles hace falta más detalles del menú para saber cómo pedir tu helado ,xq ganemos personas que no tenemos idea de cómo ordenar..Mi primer helado fue tan simple.No digo que no está rico pero simple
Aparte no tienen la misma amabilidad con cada cliente,el día que yo fui me tocó mirar cuando a dos diferentes clientes les dieron las gracias x asistir y al salir yo con mi familia ni siquiera adiós nos dijeron

This happened a few weeks ago however I feel like I should say something about this. On Father's Day I was with my cousins to enjoy a dinner. All I have to say is the event turned sour once a random server becomes super condescending to your 4 year old nephew. My 1 year old nephew and 4 year old nephew were making a fuss and my cousins tried their absolute best trying to calm the fussing but a random server (that wasn't serving our table... name was Ricardo I think) was being a complete condescending jackass to my nephew asking him "what's the problem buddy? I have customers complaining here". I'm not saying the diners don't have a right to complain however I don't need the snarky attitude from a server who wasn't even assisting us. Terrible experience. Not a way to resolve a problem.

Management with the long in unkept hair stood and laughed at how long the line was for flowers was on Valentine's Day. Great way to treat paying customer. Instead of laughing why don't you go help or one of the other 4 people that was standing next to you

My husband and I have used DirecTV for several years.  A few years ago we moved to a new home and had to upgrade to the wireless genies for all rooms.  We still had the old genies from our last house when the technician came to upgrade and install in our new home.  He did not take the old receivers with him after installation.  Two years later, I am looking over our ridiculously high DirecTV bill (having taken over the payment from my husband I was curious) to find out that we were still being charged for the old receivers on top of our new receivers and had been charged $21 extra per month for the last 20 months.  I called DirecTV to report the overcharge and was told I would receive a refund of $420 after I mailed back the old receivers.  I mailed them back and never received my refund.  One month and several phone calls later they are now telling me I am not entitled to the refund since I didn't notice the overcharge until now....they then offered me $40 in credit for their mistake....terrible customer service. Unacceptable behavior and just plain bad business.  DirecTV has lost my business forever.  Not to mention the service on the tv goes out every time it rains and the receivers restart themselves constantly.  Do not use DirecTV my friends.

Received an email stating order is ready to be picked up so stopped by while running errands or to find out the email wasn't correct. Annoying that I have to go back later and nothing was offered like percentage off next order, etc. don't send an order is ready email if it's not actually ready.

Disappointing and slow service!!  

Was looking forward to some fresh fish along with my wife and thought we give this place a try based on the positive Yelp.  This restaurant has an appealing decor and comfortable layout, but left with a negative impression and do not plan to return

1.  Took a while for someone to take our order

2. Middle of afternoon, but took over a half hour for food to arrive.   Delivered without explanation or apology for extended delay.   Wife ordered a side of fries, but those only came after the meal was finished.

3.  Took quite a while to find the server to give us the bill

3.  Menu says entree includes choice of soup and I had selected a cup of chowder.   When I got bill we were charged extra for the soup.  When questioned the server said the meal came with rice and you can either get rice or soup.  What???   Didn't feel like arguing after all the delays.

Food quality was ok, but lack of service won't have me returning anytime soon.   Put a damper in an otherwise pleasant afternoon in Santa Barbara

Super rude. I went to order and after putting diet coke for the 2nd meal in my order the young man taking the order  informed me they didn't have diet coke. Ok. No big deal. Diet Dr. Pepper.  Nope, don't have that either. Now keep in mind this is one of those machines with a gazillion choices, but he said they didn't have any drinks that were diet. Fine. I turn to the back and ask what would be the next choice after any diet options. The people getting the meals decide on root beer. Turn my head around and say root beer. No response. I was about 5 minutes and then ask, soooooo should I finish the rest of the order then? And he says with quite a bit of attitude "you could have finished you order whenever".  And I said oh is that so?? You didn't think a response or acknowledgement would have been good when I said root beer? And he said "I don't know, thats not my problem, but you could have finished whenever." I almost drive off, but 1. My kid wanted a stinking chocolate frosty and 2. A woman came on the speaker, I'm guessing the manager, and took the rest of my order. Then she apologized and I can hear him in the background screaming "but I'm not sorry!" So, whatever,  I pull up and another young man comes up the window and I can see the rude one was making drinks, thank goodness. So his little partner in crime apparently didn't want to give me my receipt. When I asked for it he rolled his eyes and then tried to give me a different one. He finally gave me the correct one and then said they were out of the chocolate frostys! Lol I said I want a refund. Then magically he said the manager got it to work. So my receipt says Taylor. The original one said Elliot. Who knows if they were the culprits that need to be fired. I wish all the employees were like the manager and didn't treat customers like a POS...but oh well.

Walked in, smelled strongly of throw up.. walked out. 

This place peaked long ago. Time for a management change??

I will let the one rude employee slide. Service otherwise was unremarkable. What I find utterly unacceptable is that the exit at the rear of the dining area has been blocked by a trash receptacle, blocking egress in case of a fire or other emergency. I am certain this is a violation of fire and safety codes, even by Tennessee standards.

This would be a five-star rating if it were for food, beverage, and aesthetics alone. However, every part of our visit was painfully slow. We had a reservation and the hostess was absent for several minutes and took time to "rework her board" (even telling us that is what she was doing) before acknowledging our reservation and seating us. It was probably 10 minutes before our server first touched our table and our appetizer took even longer to come out - pimento cheese on crackers... Minimal prep required. The house-made hot sauce was delicious and a great complement to my smoked mushroom Benedict. The grits I ordered as a side did not arrive until the end of our meal. We had to ask for items like a straw and second round of drinks twice. Our food was fantastic and drinks as well, just frustrating to sit in a half-empty restaurant and have to wait so long for every element of our dining experience.

Maybe it was just a bad day, but our recent experience and first time at the 29th street location was a disappointment.  Previous visits to the 22nd street location were always positive.  The waitress was pleasant.  The food, however, was not.  We were not offered the standard peppers and onions; the chips were stale and mostly small, small chips; my whole talapia was burned to a crisp; and the other meals were just passible and cold.  There were no other patrons in the restaurant.  Overall the quality did not match the prices.  "All good things must come to an end."

Last Wednesday September 26, I had my car Cadillac Escalade detailed at your place. I am very unsatisfied with the service I received:

#1. My car was soaking wet. I came home, parked it and when next morning when I was ready to go to work, I opened the door and the strong smell hit my nose. Apparently, whoever cleaned it, put so much water inside including soaking wet carpets. I had to take everything out, open the doors for the car to dry. 

#2. Sunroof was not cleaned at all.

#3. When I picked up my car, I was told that all stains came out but one on the driver seat. In fact it is not true. I found at lest couple of them on the carpets.


I went back on Thursday to let carwash know but the employees were no too friendly, so I left.

If I could give negative stars I would. Do not shop at this store!!!  I purchased a washer and dryer more than two weeks ago. The first delivery people claimed that I needed to remove the moulding on the door for them to be installed. So they left them in the garage. My handyman came and took the dryer into the room by  just removing the door. I could have done that myself. He could not finish the installation at that time so we left the washer in the garage because Best Buy was scheduled to come back. A few days later they did: two hours late. The guy said "I didn't know you had steps. I don't have the right equipment to carry the washer up the steps ". I called to return the equipment but after waiting on hold for 45 min they said  I had to go back to the Deptford store. So I drove 30 min last Wednesday and they agreed to come today (Monday) from 12-6 to pick them up. No show. So I was just told "they must have changed the schedule". Really?!!!Meanwhile I went to Home Depot after leaving Best Buy and purchased a washer and dryer that was installed without problems two days ago. They even moved Best Buy's dryer back to my garage for me. Now the pick up is scheduled for Wednesday from 10-12. A manager said he was giving me a two hour window without the usual charge and that was all he could do. Wow, big deal! We will see.

This place is so-so.  What bothers me the most is that the employees don't listen. 

Employee: what can I get you?
Me:  I want a flour, steak taco, to go. 
Employee:  is that for here or to go?
Me: to go.
Employee:  flour or corn?
Me:  flour.
Employee: what kind of meat?
Response: Steak,  Gringo style with cilantro.
Employee:  Street or Gringo Style.
Me:  Gringo with cilantro.
Employee:  did you say street style?
Me: Gringo style with cilantro.  

Guess what.  Not made "to go."

Very annoying, and it happens all the time.

Usually do not have a problem here but Father's Day 7/17 my wife went to pick up breakfast and when she got home my steak egg and cheese bagel was a steak and bacon bagel????? No egg , not worth driving back for but from now on checking food before I or she leaves. Steak and bacon are a strange combo and tasted pretty gross.

So. I just got home from work and ordered
Roma's through Postmates. I asked for Alfredo sauce on my pizza and received tomato. Which, I am ok with when it has a robust flavor. Unfortunately, it does not. It taste like my pizza is covered in black olives.

Worst Starbucks experience I've had. I was the only person in line and wasn't acknowledged for quite a while. Till person was sub par, and made me feel weird. Bar person had a headset on the entire time - which I would understand if she was talking to drive through customers - but I could tell quickly that she was talking to her coworker through it (the till girl). She made no contact with me. I've worked for SBux before and this was the worst experience I've had.

Terrible. Stay away from here. 
Stayed here over Labor Day wknd . I was going to a wedding with my boyfriend. He used to live in the area and was feeling nostalgic so
We stayed here. Payment was problematic- couldn't pay with debit card. They took all money up front at time of check in off of credit card only
Requested extra pillows blankets and soap. Finally rcd on our 2nd night. No room service was avail on Labor Day mon to change sheets and give us clean linens etc. poor security at the front door front desk area. No ice machine, no cups, no plates, no utensils , even tho this is an 'extended stay' place.

Been trying to get calls returned for over 6 months. I think I'm going to contact the news help desk. I can't believe these people. The install incorrectly and never come back to fix it. I will NEVER use not recommend them again.

Decided to take the family on what I imagined would be an adventure. Upon opening the doors, there were two giant nitrogen tanks and overflowing trash can. Every single chair and table was taken by patrons enjoying good looking ice cream bowls and extravagant shakes. Which reaffirmed my belief that this place has to be good. Upon arrival at the counter to place our order, I mentioned to the cashier it was our first time which he completely ignored and responded by simply asking what we would like to order. After a short wait we received our order and proceeded to a sticky table and enjoyed a silky smooth bowl of ice cream. The product was well delivered and met my expectations, however, the experience was below mediocre and failed in every single way. The sleek and contemporary design of the well lit space lacks cleanliness. Noticing such a large crew on site, but all gathered behind the counter and not keeping the common area or bathrooms in a clean manner is enough to ruin the experience. When charging a higher price point there should be a higher standard, not only on the product, but also on the service and premises which all together make the whole experience. I'm not saying I wouldn't try it again, however, I won't go out of my way to visit.

I love good Mexican food .... something this place does not have. To start the guacamole was bland, tasted like avocado paste out of a bag. Then I got the steak tacos Medium which were extremely undercooked, and had a terrible flavor. My friend got the chicken wing tacos in buffalo sauce which tasted nothing like buffalo sauce we both each only ate one taco only because we were starving. I wouldn't recommend anyone come here which sucks because I was excited about this place and love the decor. Service wasn't the greatest either.

Where can I even start with Dolan Mazda? I'm writing this review after having my final bad encounter with Dolan and the service staff there. First off... the reviews saying wait times are ridiculous aren't embellishing the truth. Our family vehicle was purchased from Dolan Mazda back in 2014. We paid it all off in all cash after the "team" there promised a few things to earn our business. Well, when it came time for them to keep their word and honor the deal it was a clusterf**k to say the least. In short... it took Dolan Mazda over a month to get us the all-weather mats included on our contracts. Hmmm... shoulda known something was up then but tried to give them the benefit of the doubt. Took our vehicle in for EVERY service to Dolan Mazda. Each time was a minimum 3 hour wait for a SCHEDULED SERVICE APPOINTMENT! 3 hours to change the oil?!? Whatever, we have the extended warranty and guess it's worth the wait to keep our warranty valid. Weren't we wrong! Check engine light started to come on around 30k miles. Code was for a bad sensor in the cooling system. Took the car in to have the problem fixed and serviced under warranty. After waiting around from roughly 9:30am until 4:00pm that day we received our vehicle back but the CEL was still on...? Why?!? You just had my car all day and for what? All they did was read the code and confirm that the code was for what I told them. A few weeks later we go ahead and pay out of pocket for them to fix the sensor and do the 30k mile service all in one go. Cool deal, right? WRONG! Again... 9-4 waiting around in Dolan's uncomfortable dealership. Finally we get our car back. This is in the middle of winter. Thank them reluctantly for the "hard work" and head home. Notice my CEL isn't on anymore so that's good. Wait... why won't my heater warm up? Maybe the engine is cold or something. Head home. Halfway home I'm freezing even though the heater is on full heat and recirculating the cabin air. What the actual f**k?!? Low and behold, Dolan and their "awesome" team of mechanics managed to somehow break the heating system in our vehicle during a common service. When we called to report the problem we were faced with a basic "not our fault and it's not covered" response from them. After arguing and threatening legal action they finally "Got approval from Mazda Corporate" to fix WHAT THEY BROKE on our vehicle. We had to drive back to Reno with no heater (over an hour drive for us) to drop off our vehicle and pick up the loaner car. After about a week we finally got word they found time to fix our car that they broke. Jump to this week. A few days ago we call to get an appointment for 4 new tires and an oil service. Gal on the phone as well as the parts department both get the tire information and inform we will be getting Mazda's "Buy 3 get the 4th for $1" promotional deal! Super awesome! This morning I make the hour drive up there for the service. Prepared to be there all day because that's how Dolan operates. Tell the service guy that I'm here and have an appointment for tires and an oil change.  He apparently has no information of the call and appointment information we had given up a few days prior. Okay... at this point I knew it was gonna be bad. After he is the 3rd person to take down our tire size I confirm we're getting the 3 and 4th for $1 deal, right? WRONG!!! This guy tells me "We don't honor that promotion." Really? After every single person on the phone quotes me with this deal you're gonna wait til I drive an hour out here to tell me this?!? Then I inform him I'm tired of the bad service and that last time we came in they broke our vehicle. His response... "We wouldn't do that. I don't think that happened." Well Dolan, I hope you and your service manager and customers enjoyed hearing me cuss you out and call you all out for shady business and lying and breaking customers vehicles. You don't deserve the business of the great people of Nevada. Shady business and lies is just the tip of the iceberg with you. You have officially lost any and all future business from myself and all members of my family. Get Bent, Dolan!

This was a terrible experience. We had Donna as our "consultant" in our search for bridesmaids dresses. She made zero attempt to help us pick out or try on dresses. I had to hunt her down to find a different size and she was at the front desk running numbers for dresses I did not express any interest in.  She was not pleasant or excited or anything. She had a super condescending, sassy attitude and did not pay any attention to what I told her we were interested in. If you go here AVOID DONNA.

(I never yelp, I downloaded the App just because of my experience here). Truly atrocious service. From being rudely told to wait outside in the rain for our reserved table - which was set, they just didn't want to seat us - to the server rolling his eyes and scoffing when he wrongly gave one of our party fries with cheese despite her allergy. They also complained about the tip we gave, not actually interested or apologetic for our experience. There's so many good places to around with excellent service - steer clear of Three Muses

Terrible customer service. Every time I have gone, it has been an extraordinary wait time (which in itself isn't their fault). However, I called to see what the current wait time was for bowling and they REFUSED to tell me. I understand they can't guarantee a certain wait time but when I said - "if I walked in right now, how long is it?" She said "I can't tell you that."  I said "you can't say what the wait time is as we speak?"  "No, I cant."

Worst McDonald's ever!! Longest drive thru & the staff seems distracted. I had to repeat my order three times because the guy was distracted by a coworker. Take a page from Chick-fila & get it together!

Not sure what happened to a previously good restaurant.  Just had dinner there and all 4 dinners in our party were very poorly prepared.  Quality was not good and the service was really bad.  Took our server 20 minutes to even stop by and say hello.

Just wasnt that good
 I love Indian food but this was hardly warm. Some food was labeled some wasn't. Didn't know what I was eating most of the time. Service was sub par. Sort of acted like they couldn't have cared less that you were there. Pretty sure I won't eat there again.

Beware of deceitful sales tactics. 
 
Summary

For my $20, I received two scans of dubious value, no back adjustment, and was told  another $160 was needed for Xrays and a back adjustment. Not what I was promised.

_________________________
This business was at our local Farmer's Market in Palmetto Bay, offering a free thermal scan on your neck, then offering an initial visit for $20 at their office.. 

This is what was promised:  A complete scan of the spine (thermal and some type of left to right voltage differential measurement), a consultation, an adjustment, then a 2nd scan of the spine that would (hopefully) show the improvements from the back adjustment.

According to them, a $120 value for $20.   Sounds good!

What I received was a tour of the office by  an assistant, the two scans of the spine, then a recommendation for X rays that would cost $120... A second visit to their office was needed, for another $40, when the Chiropractor would review the X rays and perform an adjustment, as needed. Then a long term plan for weekly visits.  It took me this long to realize I've been had.



So for my $20, I received two scans of dubious value, no back adjustment, and an offer to spend another $160 for Xrays and a back adjustment.

Left with my back pain intact.

I would avoid this  business.

I'm from California and I came in to actually try their best entry because of my brother's suggestion and as soon as I finished my main entry, I went to the restroom to wash my hands. By the time I came back to my table, the servers have cleaned it up for the next customer. The server smilingly said that he thought I was gone. Then the server served me my my bill without asking me if I wanted anything else. I was planning on getting dessert but I felt that they were trying to usher me out already. This is the rudest service that I've ever had.

When we moved to Ruskin 11 years ago, a neighbor said this place had the best pizza so we tried it.  It was over-priced and we didn't feel it was the best pizza we'd ever had.  Fast forward 11 years, my husband suggests we try this place again.  Instead of taking out a pizza, we decided to eat inside the restaurant. This decision pretty much sealed the deal of never eating at this restaurant again.  It was not clean.  There was also dust all over the wall behind the soda station and mold in the ice chute on the fountain station.  I'm glad I never had to use the restroom as I can only imagine.  There were signs tapped up everywhere and some tape left behind where the sign had either been removed or fell off.  The cashier and the waitress were not friendly.  Our children liked their pizzas, but don't order the pasta or garlic knots.  They were out of lasagna so I order the baked ziti with grilled chicken and my husband ordered chicken Parmesan.  The grilled chicken in my ziti was frozen not fresh and it was so dry.  My husband felt bad so he switched meals with me.  The chicken Parmesan was not much better.  Another piece of frozen chicken drenched in sauce and cheese to try and give it flavor.  The only positive was the pasta was cooked al dente and not mushy and the chicken Parmesan was not dry.  Their sauce is not much better than Ragu from the grocery store.  The garlic knots are made of pizza dough.  They are not put into a proofer to allow the dough to rise so it's a dense piece of dough with garlic flavoring slapped on it and shoved in the oven.  Disgusting not to mention still over-priced!  Next time I get in the mood for pasta, I'll just stay home as I can do a better job making pasta and garlic bread.

I wanted to go somewhere nice for my birthday, which was December 30th and my husband called to make reservations. When we get there we decided not to valet park so we just walked a block. No big deal. As soon as you walk in the hostess is there and since it was freezing everyone was crowded around there, making it hard to get in. We overhear her speaking to customers before us and she was extremely nice. Invited them to leave their coats, asked if it were a special occasion, and invited them to sit at the bar for a drink while their table was ready. I was impressed with this, until it were our turn. We got nothing except a "do you have reservations?" We were a little turned off by that treatment. I'm not sure what the issue was, maybe we didn't look as "put together" as the other people there? Anyway, we're seated at our table and the server was right over. He was really nice! We got toasted ravioli for an appetizer and they were ok. Nothing too spectacular. So then we were offered a soup or salad before our meal and we both opted for the salad. The house salad was good but please take note, there is an extra charge for this to the ring of $10 a piece. Had we had known this, we would have declined. So I had the chicken saltimbocca and it was pretty good and my husband had the chicken Parmesan. Maybe I'm spoiled at places like Zia's or elsewhere where you're given a side of pasta with your meal and at $25 a plate we hoped to have gotten a little more, but that wasn't the case. The atmosphere is really nice but a little too dark for my taste, but the food wasn't worth the $100 for 2 people and sodas to drink. I was more disappointed in how we were treated as opposed to other we observed around us. We will definitely not be back and this is mainly because of the service when we first arrived. I'd rather go somewhere else on the Hill if it were my choice.

I waited for 10 minutes at seafood counter before someone finally came to take my order. The person at the meat counter said he couldn't help me and didn't offer to call for someone.Then I went to the salad bar and there was no lettuce of any kind. This visit was too frustrating and I will not be back.

I had reservations for tonight but it was closed when I showed up, leaving me to scramble to find last minute dinner reservations for my out of town guests on a Friday night. I just looked them up online and saw they were shut down for tax reasons 8 days ago! That means they had 8 days to call me to cancel my reservation! But they didn't. So rude.

This is A HERD you in place, long wait times. Not treated as a valued customer. They are eager to schedule you for cataract surgery, however, you can never get a straight answer on your costs. Was told the fee schdule was not updated. Never got to meet Dr Robert Weinstock, I was worried about who was really going to do the surgery. In the end of it all, and poor customer service, and plenty of more bad experiences with this place, I canceled...My advice, get more than one evaluation.

Food was good but service was poor. Apparently they ask that you order before you sit but when we walked in nobody was even present to greet us. We sat ourselves and it took nearly 15 mins for us to be waited on properly. Other patrons seemed to have this issue as well. My advice to management is to have it more clearly stated on how service is given at your restaurant and also have more attentive staff on hand.

The hats are common. The owner is less than common. No personality or talent. The custom made hats are appealing only to those who lack a true sense of style and are unfamiliar with impressive hat makers.

United Van Lines set us up with their local group in our area Hollander International Storage and Moving.  We had an appointment set up to do a virtual tour of our apartment with Kevin.  We had set up the appointment with Maria and had received a confirmation email and text that the appointment was set up.  On the day of the appointment we hadn't heard anything so I called the main line.  I was told that we would receive a call or text with information at the time of our appointment.  We waited until about 10 minutes after the appointment was set to start and called the main line again.  The woman we spoke with told us she didn't have any information about Kevin and that we should give him until half an hour past our appointment time.  Once it was 35 minutes past our scheduled appointment time I called again.  The woman stated that she was unable to see any of our or Kevin's information.  She asked if we were given an email or phone number for Kevin.  I said that we had only been given his name in our confirmation email.  We were told that nothing could be done until Monday as it was the weekend and no one was available at the local office.  We will definitely be using a different moving company that respects our time.

Eh... not all it's cracked up to be. Decent food and service, but we expected more from DDD review.  I was told you have to know you want to go there to make the trip. It was not worth our trip and would more want to return to Parkway Bakery.

Do you like having servers stare at you as you wait 15 minutes for a drink? Then this is the place for you! The only saving grace to the truly heinous customer service are the tasty drinks the bartender shakes up. Who also happens to do a better job taking care of the tables than the severs do! Go to one of the many other establishments in the area... trust me

Was recommended from hotel staff at Hutton hotel. First off it was 4th of July. Was way understaffed and had no hostess. Sat at front before we realized we just needed to  go in. Had 1 waitress serving around 15 tables, definitely a slow process. Beers ordered were warm and appeared to be missing a few sips. Ordered the Nachos, "Belgian fries" and the tavern burger. 

Nachos weren't bad. I'd say above average taste and presentation. 

Belgian fries... not sure why they call them this. Are they made from Belgian potatoes and fried twice? Well I think they got the fried twice part correct. Fries were burnt and I only ate a few. 

Tavern burger. Best part of meal but overpriced. $12.50 for a burger that didn't stand out in anyway. No taste distinctions or flavors that stood out. 

Based off prices, atmosphere, and service. I'd say 1.5 or 2/5 stars.

This was my least favorite place we visited for brunch. The service was not up to par. The food was good, but what left me confused was the hostess asking about any allergies. I have a tree nut allergy so I thought "oh cool, how thoughtful was that!?" 

When I ordered a $12 dessert that was not labeled correctly I wasn't able to eat it because it had Nutella in it. Luckily, the people at my table wanted to try and it didn't go to waste. 

I let the hostess know and she said "I'll let management know" that was it. 

Not really impressed. Just a tourist review

The food was ok, obviously frozen fish, they were out of other flavors that must come pre-seasoned and the place was a disgusting mess, trash all over the floor that not one waitress bothered to pick up,,, ewww made me feel like my food was dirty too,, we will not return there.....and then our change was $59.49 and she only gave us $59.00.... she said math was her strong point, "oh do you want the .49 cents?" Wow!!

Still can't stand this location!  I have tried repeatedly to give them the benefit of the doubt only to be disappointed time and again.  I live 1.5 miles away and it literally took 2 hours for my food to arrive.  The manager had the gall to argue with me because she didn't catch my order.  Really???  The manager???  I think that explains it all, unfortunately.  I will go out of my way not to patronize this Panera again!!!!
Totally disgusting smelled like sting chemicals when you walk in had lawn equipment in the front dining room.. people with allergies stay far away from this place!!

Such a trash meal. I'm upset I wasted my time and money. Got a side of fruit, 90% of it looked like it expired a week ago. Got a shrimp po'boy that was blander than bland. The only thing they didn't mess up was my mimosa.

Would not trust this company. An arborist came out and gave us a quote back in June this year. We signed their quote and asked when they would be back to cut a Virginia Pine. About three weeks later I called because we hadn't heard anything. The arborist seemed annoyed that a set date was needed. He said they would simply come out the next time they were in our area, take the tree down and leave a bill. Huh, okaaaaay... So we waited. After a month the job was not done. To be fair, 2018 was a brutally hot Summer. So we decided not to disturb them again until the weather cooled off. Here we are Nov 30, 2018. I called two weeks ago and left a message with our quote # again asking for a follow up for the job pending. Still haven't heard back. I think it's safe to say this company is not at all professional or reliable. Pretty disappointing.

The service was great, this has nothing to do with the service at all. In fact that's the only reason I'm giving them 2 stars. I ordered the Philly cheese steak which is a Weds special. Now normally, I go to an alternate location and they're fine there, amazing even. I order one here & wow....it was terrible. Cheddar cheese? Since when? It's always been a white cheese, like mozarella or something but never cheddar. Found out that they just switched to that...well that was a bad idea. Worse cheese steak I've ever had. Even the peppers were bad. I had some that were hard and I couldn't chew them up so I had to spit them out into a napkin. I had to do this 3 separate times before I decided I can't take this anymore. I politely asked the waitress to take it off my bill because of how bad it was which she did. I don't know about their steaks at this location but if they treat them how they did this cheese steak, I definitely wouldn't expect anything good. I won't return here, I'll go to my normal Tucker's location.

Would not stay here again. The rooms and facilities are aging and over the course of a 2 day stay the WiFi was offline. The staff explained that their internet connection is very slow and if too many people try to use it that it's unavailable. I tried connecting at off-peak times without luck, am doubtful that it works at all.

I have to say I was a little disappointed. Don't get me wrong the food was clean but it was not great food. I was told by many to go to another Indian Restaurant but Yelpers you have never steered me wrong.. until this time. Decor reasonable service was good and attentive but honestly the food was forgettable. We were in the mood for a classic Indian meal and I guess this was not the place...

I am a huge pizza fan and I prefer thin crust. I read the reviews and thought this pizza would work for me.

I was so wrong, if you are not a fan of this faux pizza then stay far far away. No, it will not taste ok if you have ever had decent and real pizza.

Leave this type of pizza to the ST. Louis fans. You have to be from here.

Trust me on this.
This place appears to no longer be open for business? Website/phone number and email is out of service.

Jesus fucking Christ 
This place is a shit hole! 
The burger was greasy and not in a good way. 
As I was waiting in line I saw an employee eating the fries. Disgusting and unsanitary. The cashier wasn't friendly and just ignored me. I don't like hair in my burger either fuck.

SERIOUSLY DISGUSTING 
DO NOT EAT HERE
Brought my lady here for what looked like a decent 4 Star Chinese restaurant but when we got there it's evident how nasty/filthy it is.  Nasty old crappy sign, broken down business center, bad neighborhood, and the restaurant is dingy and old.

If the front of house is this dirty.....
I CANT IMAGINE WHAT THE KITCHEN LOOKS LIKE

We ordered appetizers and they brought out "fresh spring rolls" that were fried in 3 day old, spent, overworked fryer oil.  I didn't eat one bite it was SO DISGUSTING and simply soaked in black oil. 
----See pic---- don't get fooled by the other pics from other helpers like I did 

WE IMMEDIATELY LEFT - no entree 
I saw some other people's entrees and it looked like cheap $7 strip mall takeout 

This place is food poisoning and filth CITY


SPEND YOUR HARD EARNED MONEY SOMEWHERE THAT YOU WONT GET SICK

My partner and I were in Friday Night and there was much in house disputing going on amongst the Staff. The older Blond Woman who seemed in control ( clearly wasn't ) was very busy. My Lasagna was like a Microwavable portion I would grab at Wal-Mart. This place has much Potential if someone could get a decent Wine Collection and maybe reset the entire staff for the front of the House. We live in walking distance and really like the owners concept. Maybe after a couple weeks we shall return if the Staff changes. Good Luck and hope to see changes in the future. I see the Owners likes to respond to comments. Love to see his thoughts?? Billy@Bruce

OMG, what a total disaster! 
Don't wake up before 6:30am as you will be asked to go back to your room or sit at the bench in the garage, no kidding. No lobby, no sitting area, no coffee (until 6:30am) and absolutely no customer service. The manager says 'My job is to just enforce the rules...'. 
I've been a Platinum and a Silver member at multiple hotels chains over the years and have never seen such an out of touch group of people. I literally thought I was on Candid Camera or maybe I was only dreaming. Unfortunately, after about 30 minutes on the bench in the garage, I realized I wasn't sleeping...

Had the Reuben sandwich. 
It's cheap meat and no soul. Wouldn't recommend it all. It's too bad for me because I really love a good Reuben and I chose this over a Philly cheesesteak. I had limited time and had to choose. I chose poorly.

I went back to Swan Nails for a manicure and pedicure.  The pedicure was wonderful.

The manicure was a problem.  The man doing the manicure and I had communication issues.  I wanted a powdered polish manicure.  He thought I wanted acrylic nails, and cut all of my nails really short.  He then thought he could fix it by extending my nails with some process, and after doing this to 3 of my nails, I realized what he was doing, and asked him to remove it, and just do a gel nail manicure.  My nails are sharp and uneven at various points.  The gel is uneven and chipped within hours of leaving the salon.  It was a really disappointing experience.

The employees at this Applebee's are nice. The key problem here is the food; specifically the portions and attention to detail with what goes with the food. I am not sure if it is by direction of the manager or the cooks' own prerogative, but I consistently have received scant portions of food with a wide variety of meals I have ordered here. This photo shows a Steak Salad I ordered to go. I pulled the steak out to reheat it. I tore the salad apart looking for all the steak but only found these five small pieces. On a separate occasion I ordered the Quesadilla Burger and the size of the burger was on par with a McDonald's regular burger (sad looking thing). I have been to enough Applebee's around the country to know what are standard portions from the Applebee's chain. This Applebee's appears to intentionally reduce portions to either save money, prep time, or both.  It is especially bad with to go orders.  All this Applebee's needs to do to increase customer satisfaction and be more profitable is to bring the portions and the small accompanying food items (sauces, etc.) in line with the every other Applebee's I been to outside the state of Louisiana.  This is their key weakness and they lose a lot of return business because it.

The staff were friendly. The hotel could use some work. There was a weird smell in the hallways. It's not exactly foul or pungent just untidy. The curtains in my room are just the right length to block the vents on my room ac. So I had to tuck the curtains into the wall and cool the room or let it hang and just cool the windows. Someone didn't get the measurements right on that one. My bed felt itchy. I went to the gym (3 old cardio equipment, the treadmill is super loud , and some free weights) and a random bug that looks like a housefly bit me. I'm convinced that I'm never coming back.

I have been in this store with coupon I was sent on my email.
Twice I wanted to use my coupon when at the register I'm told the item is on sale however no signs on items that are on sale we're  . That is misrepresenting your coupon or sale procedures. From now on I will be ignoring the coupons

Kelly is the best barista at this location and I believe she's the best barista overall for Starbucks. But darcy the short hair small girl.... I can't even. One time I ordered a iced Carmel macchiato it was made totally wrong, I understand the drink is mostly milk but this particular time there was a lot more milk than usual. The drink should be brown but it looked like straight up milk and I told her there's too much milk but she went on to argue with me that it was made right. And another incident she gave me back my change and the coins fell out of her hand when I was trying to grab the bills with it but instead of putting it in my hand she just threw the rest of my change in the tip jar when I was picking up the ones that were on the counter. I don't have a problem with giving tip but don't just assume that's what I was doing. She definitely ruined my past couple experience going to my neighborhood coffee shop.

I called today to place an order. The man on the phone was impossible to understand so I when I asked him to repeat what he asked me, he simply hung up on me. Abruzzi food does not have nearly good enough to deal with rude customer service. 

Not worth the customer's time if trying to order over the phone.

Looks can be deceiving. The decor and marketing make this place look appetizing but the food was a disappointment. My chicken tenders were rubbery, and my fiancé's chicken wings were undercooked. The fries were dripping in grease, and the greens were soggy if that makes sense. I had high hopes for this place but I will not be going back!

I've been to this establishment multiple times and have never had such poor service as I experienced today. The customer service today was AWFUL!!!! 

The waiters were running around like chickens with their heads cut off. The waiter came to our table and didn't greet us. He only said "you ready to order?" After two of us ordered, one friend started placing her sushi order but was deciding between two rolls. The waiter literally ran off in the middle of her speaking and said "be back! Let me get somebody else's drink. Every minute counts!". We were baffled at this. In addition, for myself and another friend, our food was much spicier than we requested. He gave us an attitude & then sent somebody else over to the table to assist. He never once asked if we needed refills. 

Needless to say, we won't be frequenting this establishment anytime in the near future. I would suggest they get a larger staff to help during lunch.  so every customer receives good customer service.

I have seldomly dealt with a company of such incompetence and blatant disregard for the customer's time:  I tried to have them install cable and phone at my house and 4(!!!) appointments later, each one of which required a 2-hour window,  I still don't have service!  It would have required 2 more (!!) appointments and it was so frustrating that I cancelled the installation altogether and going with a different service provider.

Wound up here for Sunday brunch when the wait to sit outside at Race Street Cafe was too long. 

Pros: All drinks happened to be $4 because it was their 4 year anniversary. Lots of pet friendly outdoor seating & great views of Ben. The blood orange tequila drink was strong yet tasty.
