Cons: The beer garden menu is extremely limited for both food and drinks. Ordered the lobster roll and while it wasn't the worst I've ever had, it was far from the best. The side of fries was the most exciting thing on the plate. Sad. There is no server outside. You have to get up and order your food and drinks at the food truck. 

I think the restaurant not serving their full menu outdoors is a missed opportunity. They have the outdoor space and views going for them and the place would probably be packed if you could get a full service & full menu experience out there!

Recently I went to the new Maple Hill Restaurant in Maple Shade, NJ. Until recently I didn't even know the New Maple Hill Restaurant existed.

Atmosphere: 
When I arrived around dinner time, it wasn't too busy. The outside is a cute, building with hanging lights. It reminds me of walking into a house versus a restaurant.

The inside has a small bar and a couple of rooms. It does echo, and you can hear every person's conversation in the diner.

Coffee: 
The coffee was good and brewed hot and fresh. It wasn't anything unusual, but it was good.

Food: 
The New Maple Hill Restaurant has plenty of options from all day breakfast, sandwiches, and dinner options.  It looks like a typical diner with simple options, but there isn't anything unique or special on the menu.

I decided to order off their specials menu: Pumpkin Pancakes! When they came out, nothing about them was good. They didn't look appetizing, and they were paper thin. It was shocking they were a special because I could have cooked better pancakes myself.  I found myself hungry afterward.

Service: 
Our waitress was friendly and friendly but came around. We could have used more refills.  Our food came out relatively quickly.


Overall Thoughts/Would I come back?

I didn't enjoy my food. If I go come back, I would definitely order something else.

After spending 2 hours waiting to get my manicure done and the rough (literally) service, I finally got up and walked out half way done and in tears. This is the 4th or 5th time his has happened. I will NEVER come back to this place even if I got paid for it. Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else.

Restaurant is very unsanitary. I literally watched the young girl pick up the torilla chips with her hands after wiping down a container and not washing her hands. Then after i told her i didn't want the chips she had just scooped into the box she looked at me as if I was crazy. I fo not recommend this restaurant.

I will start by saying this food would be really good--it clearly is good quality. I ordered takeout and it was just so cold that it made the meal unejoyable.
Whenever I order takeout, I make sure to get there 5 minutes early in order to prevent taking home cold food. Because I'm not eating it right away, I want to at least take it home immediately. When I arrived it wasn't ready yet, which was fine. I waited and waited and my pickup time came and went. I waited some more and others' orders kept getting called out to be picked-up. Finally, I went to the register and asked them to check on my food. The bartender reached behind him and grabbed a bag that had been sitting there for at least 15 minutes and said "oh it must have just came up!" Now i was taking home food that had already sat around when I had gotten there early to prevent just that. 

I was very disappointed by this. I would suggest if you are going to eat there, don't do take-out. Dine in for sure.

Father's Day Special is supposedly lunch and dinner for about $25. However, some of the plates were empty, including the crab legs and oysters. There was no continuous replacement of the almost empty service plates. The food was not even phenomenal. There server didn't even come to check on us.

This location sucks. Every time they get my order wrong. Every time. It's like they do it on purpose. They take forever got my order wrong, got home and tried calling them like 5 times and nobody answered. The bread was hard like a rock there was a pound of mayo and I wanted no onions and they put onions on the outside of the burger. WTF it was so disgusting I couldn't eat. Every time at this location. I don't even want to speak to anyone there about it because they all rude and incompetent. So corporate needs to know this. Gross.

I would rename this place too - Charlie is a SNACKER

Came here when I was in Philly. It was recommended to my husband who is a vegan and by our hotel. We were pretty hungry since we just landed from California. The wait was over 30 mins so we were expecting something amazing. We ordered about 5 dishes and each was small plates and I mean SMALL (very small). Example - the Brussel sprouts were about 5 cut in half with pomegranate seeds on top. 

The place itself is small, dark and trendy.  The seating upfront where we were is good if you wanna cuddle or grab a drink on a date.(very romantic) I recommend this place as a pregammer. A place to grab a drink, a small bite or snack and go.

Filled out their form online and the agent called me back within the next day to set up a home visit to get a quote. Local (Portland, Maine) office called me up and they were hesitant to send someone out for a home visit, claiming that we were too far away from their office (we're in Milford, New Hampshire), they promised to call me back the next day. Told them that I was looking at moving at the end of August, less 2 weeks before my move I still haven't heard anything from them.

Had been to the Chili's in Downingtown about two months ago. Food was only so, so but the ladies room was filthy. Returned with six other people yesterday. Food was so slow in coming out that they actually gave a credit without asking. BUT, the restaurant was filthy. The ladies room was strewn end to end with towels and toilet paper and obviously had not been cleaned from the previous evening and someone had vomited in the men's room and they had not cleaned that either. There will be no third time at Chili's

The rules are getting out of hand. And the staff is BARELY friendly when enforcing this nonsense. We signed the waiver, stop ruining the fun. I've been here 10 mins and yelled at 3 times for standing on the same square, or the wrong color padding or the middle basketball court (what?!). IM HELPING MY 4 YEAR OLD!! smh. Then basketball courts have strange complex rules I couldn't even comprehend. This might be my last visit. Constantly being repremanded by teenage workers for helping my 4 year old is not my idea of fun.  Not to mention, it's empty in here and like usual 1/2 the place is closed off. Blah, waste of $51.

Came here on an afternoon with my wife. The place was empty and the staff was standing around chit chatting yet it took nearly 5 mins for someone to come up to us and ask "do y'all need something?" Umm.. we came to eat? We ordered dumplings, some rib eye steak, and 2 bowls of ramen (pork belly and brisket). Dumplings was good, rib eye was tough. The ramens came out barely room temps and the broth was super super salty. Definitely will not be back.
Second time I've been here and they're closed during business their stated business hours.  Going to have to find a new place for consistency.

Was craving Buffalo Wild Wings. Called to place a Togo order when I got out of class at 9pm. You can imagine I am starving at this point as it is 9pm. Tried to place it when I left school so by the time I got there it would be ready when I got there. I was on the phone for so long and put on hold no exaggeration 6 times that I was already at Buffalo Wild Wings in a parking spot before they even took my order. During that time I even tried to place an order online, to no surprise the online ordering was not working. Finally ordered my food and had to sit my car for another 15 minutes for it to be ready. Went inside to get it, paid, checked the bag for sauces and left. Got home- the receipt in the bag was correct, but IT WAS THE WRONG FOOD. And much less food at that. So here it is 10pm. I'm still hungry and enraged.
Do not waste your time here! If you are looking for cold food at a high price, then this is your place. There is a great view, but other than that, not worth it!

Service is slow , food is nothing special . Menu is really nothing to be desired of . The worse part is , i found hair in my food , the server apologized and took my Bill. When I went to leave they stopped my and told me i had to pay for my drink . I agreed , the drink was 2.25 they rang up 4.50 on the register . When I pulled out my wallet she then told me that it will be a minimum of $5 for a credit card purchase . To summarize , food suck , service is slow and very unprofessional . If this was the last place left on earth I still would never return . Worse experience ever

Normally, I have positive experiences at Scout's, but on a recent visit, that was not the case. I ordered a martini, it tasted like no martini I had ever had before. I sent it back and then ordered a cosmopolitan. Once again, the drink was terrible! My husband tasted it  and grimaced saying that is nasty tasting! I asked to speak with the manager to let her know that we had a bad experience with drinks from the bartender. I explained that I order and make those two drinks all the time and just wanted her to be aware that the drinks were not correct. She basically blew me off and said "NOT MY BARTENDER"! Hmm, not at all what I expected! I left there shaking my head, can not believe that was her response! I am angry now, just remembering that response! So disappointed!!

Gross from the service to being able to smell pee from our table. I do not recommend attempting to eat here. We were greeted by some squabble of the hostesses. One refusing to sit us because it's the others job and she wasn't coming up. We stood out in the wind for 15minutes, not waiting for an open table but waiting for the staff to have their act together. Finally seated it smelled like pee. That kind of smell you get on dirty city streets but inside the restaurant. The waitress took another 20 to ask us for drinks. We almost walked out in this twenty minute period. We ordered all different dishes but they came out tiny, cold, and dry. I got the grilled oysters and the stuffed sole fish. Oyster were the worst I've had, and I've had them every night I've been in New Orleans. The stuffed sole was dry and lacked flavor besides salt. Also, if you like frozen food you will love this place because it tastes like a microwave meal. It took an additional 40minutes for the check and the manager of the place made herself a nice steamy hot stew dish and sat near us to enjoy. I wish our food had looked a quarter of good of how hers did. Just don't go. Paying $40 per a meal for awful service and food is a scam.
The food isn't very good and the wait staff doesn't want to know about it. Also, because of the orientation of the doors, if its cold and windy outside, it's cold and windy inside.

I cannot attest to the quality of the food since I never even ordered.

But, I can say that I'll never be back. Here's what happened...

My husband and I decided to try 312 Pizza Company on a whim. He is a pizza fiend, and we were in the mood for Chicago style. It took a while to find parking, but eventually we did and headed to the restaurant.

The first thing my husband noticed when he looked at the menu was the lack of Coke and Pepsi products. For us, this was a deal breaker. 

My husband is autistic. His diet is extremely limited because of this, and it's not uncommon among autistic individuals. 

The problem wasn't the lack of these products. The restaurant looked nice, and I'm sure the food is great, but once our server confirmed the lack of name brand sodas, we apologised and said that we wouldn't be staying. We thanked the server and apologised again. And then he was rude. Flat out, stone-faced, judgementally rude. 

He rolled his eyes at us, sighed, and made the ugliest face, all because we didn't stay at a restaurant that couldn't meet out culinary needs. We never ordered a single menu item, so there is no excuse for the server's behaviour.

I hope management considers this a good teaching opportunity for the staff here. I could understand if we had ordered items and expected stuff for free. But I hadn't even sat down before we decided to leave. It's ridiculous. 

We won't be back, which is a shame, because I'd have gone sometime with friends or colleagues. Now I'll go elsewhere.

Two words:  tourist trap.  We went on an incredibly slow night.  From the very beginning we were repeatedly reminded that the help depends on tips but we couldn't even get silverware to the table despite numerous employees standing around doing what appears to be nothing.  We had to go to the bar several times to gets drinks because our waitress could t be found and apparently no one else is allowed to serve a sitting table.  The waitress got half our order wrong.  Then, after almost forty minutes, she brought us another customers steak that was over cooked.  We know this because they were sitting right beside us and were complaining that theirs was UNDERcooked and sent it back.  The waitress tried to be cordial and voluntarily explain it all away but at this I think we were all just ready to leave.  I'm not one to be overly critical but I thought it important for potential patrons to know that if you're expecting anything short of poor service, bland food, and an outrageous bill you'll be sorely disappointed.

Inconsistent experience every time. The only common experience we have are stomach aches. Last visit they screwed up my order and asked me to bring the mistake back in for a correct pizza. They didnt want to make my time and effort worth while (in the rain) which says a lot. Not sure how an online order can take 120 mins but an online take out is only 20 mins?!? 

We're switching back to frozen pizzas...
In house beer selection terrible. Only three of the ten available. Service was sub par. Food was decent. Nothing to write home about. Will not come back.

Really easy to explain

Mozzarella sticks - $11.00!! Breaded fried cheese right???
Cheeseburger -$13.00 who Pays that??
Caeser salad -$14.00 - romaine lettuce???

Ordered a pizza and left.

One of the girl employees seemed to roll her eyes every time we told her which donuts we wanted. And she couldn't wrap around her head that all the donuts were together just out in separate bags. Donuts were ok.

The worst nail shop I've ever been to, I had an appointment at six, I had to wait for more than an hour, the nail polish got wilted, they had to redo three nails because of the topcoat was old, and the prices were ridiculous, I was quoted different prices for the same service, very unhappy.

I do not recommend this place unless you have extra time and money to waste

This was an overall AWFUL experience! If I could give less than 1 star, I would. The food was a joke. Texas fries smothered in microwaved cheese sauce, calamari tacos with stringy, undercooked calamari. Burritos that you pay EXTRA for rice and beans! Don't get me started on the drinks. I had a strawberry margarita that was syrup on the rocks, my husband had a long island that was sour mix with a splash of soda. The service??  I could've walked out on my check 3 times before she asked if we were ok (I probably should have).... DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!  what a joke!!

Wow.what can I say ??went to the lunch"buffet"(and that I use that term loosely) the abundant pizza station had a whopping 2 yes 2 pizza choices????the salad bar had veggies that were screaming to be returned to the earth or the compost pile and the staff???was there one besides the guy who took the cash to "enjoy" this lunch?? It was not the godfathers of yesteryear .Remember when there was more than one and it was GOOD??? Not so much now. The interior was dark gloomy and not so clean the one employee looked like he was counting the hours till his shift was over.long story short this isn't the place for pizza anymore..
OMG people with their pathetically loud screaming kids make it impossible to enjoy this place!!!  BE CONSIDERATE OF OTHERS YOU SELF ABSORBED IDIOTS!!!!!

Called to see if they could squeeze in two pedicures in a few minutes. They said yes, in 10 minutes, so we headed over. Shortly after arriving we were given foot baths and my mother's pedicure began. After a few minutes, no one had arrived to begin mine. 20 minutes later, still no one and I realized that there were actually no techs available. I asked a woman who seemed to be in charge if I was still able to get a pedicure and she said sorry give it a few minutes. Another ten minutes before I walked out. Please do not tell people you have availability if you do not, it is dishonest!
Not for anyone under the age of 50. Smells like old lady perfume. Everything is well worn and rather cheap. Nothing high end. I would imagine you could find the same items at Goodwill.
Place cost me $200 when my daughter, who was being the DD for us and the group, got her phone stolen right out of her purse.

Today, July 13th, I scheduled an appointment with a barber which said he could fit me in between two haircuts.  The barbers name is ELLIOT. He makes me wait 30 mins and then informs me that he will make me wait an additional haircut. This has been the worst experience I've ever received at a barbershop and recommend everyone to stay away from this place.
I can't believe out of 5 Guys, not one one them had the guts to speak up an say "These buns are terrible."

Terrible experience at this location tonight. None of the employees said welcome to Moe's. They were poorly making the food and didn't seem to care about anything. They had the flat top grill off way before closing time and were using the tortilla warmer press to do the quesadillas and they came soggy and not good. The lady at the cashier was extremely rude and didn't even smile. We asked for water cups and only got one even though she knew we were a couple. Asked her for a fork cause they ran out in the outside bin and she was rude about it too and ended up just throwing a bunch in the bin and didn't even hand me one or say anything. Constantly with attitude and bad faces. The paint on the walls is coming off in some areas of the restaurant, some booth seats have big tears and holes in them. The restaurant is in bad shape and the employees form this night shift on October 9, 2018 are mediocre and rude. Not coming back or recommending this Moe's location to anyone ever.

This Olive Garden is always very busy and they strive to accommodate large parties.  But, it feels very cramped.  I'm generally not a fan of the food or the noise.  I really don't like the deceptive marketing of their game consoles.  Why do you need a game console on the table anyway?  Big button says press to play.  Little button says cancel $1.99 (or something like that).  Cost shows up on your bill.  Pay attention if your kids get snagged by the distraction.  Seems like there were free games in the past and when a big group gets chatting and having a good time, it's easy to lose track of what all the kids are doing if they seem happy and well-behaved. It's clearly set up to mislead and confuse those not really savvy to the approach.  Our waitress removed the charge (grudgingly and with a lot of unpleasant and loud complaining). Very uncomfortable.

Went for my birthday. Blahhh. It was busy but as we watched other tables being "entertained" our chef acted like he  wanted to be somewhere else. No personal attention to anyone at the table.  The soup was weak and cool. The salad was good but very watery at the end. I got the steak, medium, but was cooked well. Very chewy and dry. Chicken was dry. Shrimp was good. The waitress brought a bowl of ice cream out and kinda threw it at me and walked away. No birthday wish or singing as was done at other tables. We did not know the other people at our table but we all rolled our eyes and said..."never again".

Do not come here for the "tiki bar" experience! Service was awful, drinks are lacking any "tiki bar" flare! We ordered strawberry margaritas which were $6 on the menu, the bill comes and they are $8.50 - extra for strawberry and extra for frozen??! The waitress failed to mention any of this and when questioned said "I don't make the menu" ..well you COULD have warned us? Won't be back here or recommending this to anyone!

Years ago I had direct tv and swore I'd never go back BUT after hearing their talk about the newly designed dish and how it rarely ever loses connection (plus a good tv/ cell phone deal) I decided to try it again.  Dumbest decision!  Currently it is snowing and we have no connection!  When I had fios this was never an issue!  Once my contract ends I will leave and never look back!

Wow this place is bad. My first impression is that this would be a pleasant spot in an otherwise, what is in my opinion the most unpleasant street in the French Quarter.  They had live music that sounded more like entertainment at a nursing home, a really untalented guy (how they found him in the city of greats I have no idea), basically constantly asking for tips and in between hitting some notes on his keyboard. 
The food was the worst part, 35 minute wait time ended in terrible beignets that taste mostly like oil and an omelette that went straight to the dumpster where it belongs.  Poor quality and the worst part is that they don't even try.  In this city a place like this should not pass.

Sat at a table for 15 min and no one came. We then moved closer to the bar preferred drinks which were mixed up when we received them. We ordered food and waited over an hour but never received the food. We had to cancel our order so as not to be late for our conference. Was so disappointed as I hadn't eaten anything d/t flying all day.Terrible service!
Very slow service!  The bartenders ignore you.  Food is low end.  Took 40 minutes to get a beer.  I'd say don't bother.
Food is fine but the wait in the drive thru is so painful.  I believe this may be our last visit.  I think it'd be quicker to drive in to town for food and bring it back.

Ordered one corndog for kids first and noticed the price tag stating one for $2, two for $3 when pick up. So wanted to order one more corndog for one dollar extra. but not honored and treated in a awfully rude and  arrogant manner. Will avoid this place.

Had lunch there today. 
Lost a star for the loudness of the place--way too hard to communicate well over the other voices echoing off the floors and ceilings. 
Lost another star for the slowness of the service. The waitress came, gave us the menus, brought our ice tea, and disappeared for a long time. When she finally returned, no apology, but an excuse--she was serving outside too.  
Lost another star for the mediocre food--I had the Caesar salad with coconut chicken. Not much dressing on the salad, so there wasn't much flavor.  The coconut chicken was well cooked, but sorta flavorless. If the word coconut hadn't been in the name of the dish, I would never have guessed it was an ingredient.
All to say, I had 2 visits in one--my first and last.

I'm confused. It is 2018 yes? and, not that it should matter, but isn't goody's located in the eco conscious north end? plastic everywhere. i made the mistake of getting a small ice cream ad opposed to a cone and it was delivered in a plastic container with a plastic spoon. every dish i saw came out had varying displays of plastic containers, lids and utensils. i get the utensils but i have no way to understand how you guys still use so much plastic. booo

Was just at Walmart on CHARLOTTE and par for the corse, the service was absolutely atrocious!!!! Walmart sent my wife a coupon for a free razor. So like the good consumers that we are, we went to claim our prize. And can you believe it Walmart did not want to honor THERE coupon.  ZAMAIYA the "manager" needed to be called over to adjust the price because it was a coupon for something free.  ZAMAIYA told my wife that Walmart does not accept those coupons. Even with there logo and the words FREE RAZOR FOR YOUR DAUGHTER on the back. He/she also told her that she needed to buy one to get one for free. So my wife asked him to show her where is said that and he stated it was implied. 

So after going back and forth for a couple minutes ( my wife refusing to back down ) he just turned around and walked away. She shouted to him that , we are not done here. He finally adjusted the price then mumbled under his breath b!t&$ as he walked away. 

When it was all said and done she asked the original girl cashier what the managers name was she claimed she didn't know what her managers name was the stated that she wasn't authorized to give out that kind of information. She finally asked another employee and they gave up the highly confidential info. 

We have watched this particular "manager" treat other customers with the same kind of disrespect as he/she has shown us today and it is mind boggling how he/she even became a "manager" let a lone how he/she has kept his/her job for so long. 

P.S. the he/she part is not meant in any kind of disrespect. I'm just not sure how he/she would like to be referred too

I am usually pretty understanding when restaurant is first open, however, this time I would say it is quite unacceptable.

We waited 2.5 hours for a table, which was fine considering that they just opened not too long ago. We finally were seated right away and greeted by the host. They did not have a couple items, which again, I was okay with it too since perhaps it was not readily available. The appetizer came within 3 minutes after we ordered which kind of confused me since it was too quick to be made-we ordered Calamari. Probably one of the worst I've ever eaten since it was blend and they were quite hard to chew. After that, we waited around 45 minutes after the appetizer had come out for our main course. At this point, I was okay if the servers were running around trying to serve all the tables and foods are coming out like crazy - but not the case; everyone seemed to take their time in everything. 

I've also noticed people were putting their name and number to be added to the waitlist and were told it would be a minimal of an hour wait. However, one of the employee (still with all the uniform intact) kept going out to the mall to wait for his friends, came back to bring them to the restaurant. This happened at least 6 times and there were probably 10ish of his friends that came. The question is, how is it fair for customers to wait that long and the employee's friends can just walk in right away and mind you they are being paid stat holiday to walk out to the mall, wait for their friends, and back to work? I've been to different parts of the world but this unprofessional behaviour was a next level. 

Then finally the food came out and they were less than okay. Tried the halibut with spinach and lobster butter cream and you can still taste the freezer burn on the spinach and the food was lukewarm too. 

There are other restaurants that just first open and they still can manage their quality of food and the professionalism of the staff as well. Save your excitement and explore something else.

Brace yourself for the HOUSE OF DESPERATION.  Very unsettling and creepy casino.  Visually it can compete with some of the older casino's in Vegas.  State of the art slot machines and the ugly carpet stench of many drinks having been spilled and cleaned over time.  The casino itself is very large with several rooms for all your gambling needs, i.e. poker, black jack and slots.  The main room is the largest, busiest and the worst, Full of SMOKERS and old people sitting with their walkers, canes and wheelchairs locked into a slot trance.  HEY PEOPLE, LISTEN UP.  Casino's are geared for you to pour money INTO THEM, not the other way around.  I didn't see one happy person there.  On the up side, the crew is nice and pleasant, smiling and saying "hello" to you at every turn.  I feel sorry for the non smoking crew members inhaling all that toxic smoke for hours working there.  The place itself is located in one of the less salubrious areas of Tampa.  Will remind you of an unpleasant Mall or Airport, that's how large it is.  Depressing place because of the patrons that go there, not because of the people who work there.  I don't know what kind of life  Casino people led up until now, but whatever it was it must have left out the simpler things in life like humor, charm and personality because Seminole Hard Rock Casino is VOID of all of them.

The two waitress that were allegedly supposed took over 20 minutes just too get two jack & 'Cokes along with a menu. And then i had go find someone so that i could pay the check. So my rating stand for now. But the quality of the Bacon Cheeseburger was fantastic. So i will give it a second visit to better it rating.

NASTY.... unless you like limp veggies and lots of sauce!
Had the Chicken Asian Salad. Limp, soggy veggies that should have been crisp and fresh but they ere saturated in soy sauce,   old lettuce, and the ginger  vinaigrette dressing had NO flavor. The chicken was ok.. but with waitress forgetting our appetizer and Charlie's  COLD sweet potato fries... we won't be eating here again!
I have been a castumer for more than 20 years, nothing but bad castumer service, I don't have a different choice, if you do avoid this company.

Went here with sweetheart and daughter for dinner.  My cosmo was super, but daughter found her cocktail (house specialty) was weak and boring.  The appetizer, peirogies and caviar, was excellent!  We ordered one starter for all of us to sample, and would have eaten a second!  Now on to the entrees....Sweetheart had the fried chicken, which I thought tasted like Popeye's chicken.  Daughter and I had the scallops.  I thought they were undercooked and lacked any crispiness or interest. We had the mixed cookie plate for dessert, which I found very boring.  Were those cookies even homemade?  I would not return to The Love.  I find most Starr restaurants quite good, but The Love does not make the cut.

Holy hell. Honestly this place is so so so terrible. Came to check in at 10:30pm they didn't have our room clean. We sat in the lobby with 3 other couples waiting to have their room cleaned... at 10:30 at night. Took 50 minutes waiting in the lobby for our room to be done. Once in our room (which was literally right next to the office) the fan would not stay on which meant we got to hear every word, phone conversation, and laugh from employees sitting in the front lobby. All. Night. Long. Our second night we asked to switch rooms. When we went to the front office to get the keys we discovered the same exact situation happened again. Gave us keys, room wasn't clean, waited 40 minutes in the lobby for someone to clean it. This time at 9:20 at night. This place is sooooooo mismanaged. Employees walking around in T-shirt's, you honestly can't figure out who works here. People are constantly waiting for their rooms, it's so LOUD! And dirty. Never ever again. Do not stay here.

Ambiance was nice. Live music and great outdoor seating arrangements. But food was meh and service was yikes. Beignets were just OK and shrimp poboy was a big joke. Had beignets from Café Du Monde and Poboys from NOLA Poboys earlier. Maybe for that reason expectation level was increased a bit. But still I think their shrimp po'boy was a big joke. Putting few tiny overcooked shrimps inside a chewy bun and calling that a Po'boy is a joke indeed. And it took almost an hour to get that sad thing. Not impressed at all.

Another claim-to-lame cookie cutter same ole same ole restaurant serving up the same exact over-priced boring shit in the same exact atmosphere you've already had a million times. Only difference is it's in "hip" Donelson.

Bucks County Restaurant Week 2018 Disappointment 

My understanding of a "Restaurant Week" was to taste and enjoy a local restaurant that you've probably never tried before on a price fixe menu and the restaurant going out of their way to impress so that the customer returns. Apparently Francisco's did not get the memo.

Who: Francisco's on the Delaware
When: Sunday, April 29, 2018 7pm resv.
Where: located in Washington Crossing on the beautiful Delaware River
What: Upon our arrival, the parking lot was full and I figured, "Great, they have a great following". Busy is good in my book.

We (my husband and I) walk in and there is no host. Well that's because they are busy I thought. No issue there. He returns to seat us in the tinyest room packed with 6 tables and a fireplace. Ok, I thought, it's a small restaurant with several rooms. Once seated I then realize we are right in the walk way to the bathroom. So many visitors by our table not romantic as I had hoped.

We are offered 3 menus; $25 prix fixe, $35 prix fixe, and the regular menu. I had researched the menu situation prior and knew what I had wanted to order as did my husband. Seeing we are seafood fans, the $25 menus had what we wanted.
(Menus are in photos)

Come to find out that our jean wearing host becomes our server (which he is obviously not a server). 

So let's discuss service. Not the best but he tried.  He had trouble opening our bottle of wine with a wine key, then he up sold garlic bread but prior to the bread arriving we were given only one portion of the antipasto to share even though we each ordered off the $25 menu. 

The bread was given to another table we were told and that was the reason for the delay.

Our dry Caesar Salads came. The plates were chilled, which is great but there was hardly any dressing that you could taste or see. Yes, we ate them but come on we were hungry after the 4 olive, two bruschetta piece, two 1/2"x1/2" pieces of cheese antipasto appetizer. (All dirty plates remained on table until I put them on the corner of the table stacked.) I'm sure all the passers by to the restroom didn't mind looking at them.

Entrees are a huge disappointment. Me the Shrimp scampi, this would include 5 32-34 sized shrimp that were flavorful but there was no sauce and the linguine was dry and cooked al dente. My husband ordered the Clams in white sauce, what sauce? Again dry linguine al dente and the weird thing was that the clams were broiled and not steamed with any juice/sauce of the white wine variety. So the flavor was not up to par.

Dessert: homemade tiramisu, this was a 3"x3" square piece w lady fingers inside etc. It was tasty but not worth $10!

I could have made everything, not ironed clothes, not put makeup on, not do my hair, not drive 1/2 hour and not brought $25 in wine. 

We will not return, ever. 

This place left a bad taste in my mouth.

They just tried to cheat me. I ordered the $6 King Box that includes an entree, fries, drink, and 2 cookies. After I ordered, I was told they didn't have the cookies. I asked what they were offering instead. She said they weren't offering anything and mumbled some bs about the cost. I told her that if they didn't have something else to offer customers then I wasn't ordering anything because that's cheating people. If a place is running a special that contains certain items, they need to have those items or offer some sort of substitute. They definitely shouldn't expect me to be OK with being shorted 2 of those items. Sorry BK, I'm done with your overpriced nonsense.

It  took two hours for delivery ( 15 minutes more than outside estimate ) and the food was cold. It's too bad because the pizza would've been very good otherwise.  How do you warm up an arugula pizza???  The hoagie bread was very good but the dressing was more vinegar than anything else and hoagie was a little soggy.  Pick would probably be good but delivery doesn't cut it.

Use to frequent this place, but the last 2 times have left me disappointed.  The waiter doesn't know how to smile it seems. The food is unremarkable and the lunch portions are less than what they should be for the price. All three of us left still hungry.

Really dislike this Sushi.
Poorly made. Barely had fish, instead, had a bunch of gooey thing inside with a tiny piece of fish.
Tasteless, which is a sham.

We tried twice to find this place after it was recommended by our hotel staff. We found it the 2nd time-inside the local Moose lodge. My husband walked in to check it out and reported it smelled like cigarette smoke and feces inside the building.
Three of us stopped by for a bubble tea, which is supposed to cost 6 USD each. I got a credit charge of 26 USD. The owner just claimed that I put 20 USD tip. Insane...

TL;DR version - first time visit.  Wanted to try something new for lunch where we could get pasta and pizza.  Food was solid, but nothing special.  Service was ... well, we generally felt invisible.  No eye contact.  No check-ins.  The place was busy, but not so busy that would explain why we felt ignored.  If the food was better, I might give it another try.  Because it was just so-so, probably not.  If you are hungry, want large portions, and don't need it to be good-or-great food, this may be a perfect place.  Otherwise, I suggest considering elsewhere.

=======
This was our first visit.  I'd heard generally good things.  Yelp reviews suggested we'd have a good experience.  Place was maybe 60-70% full when we arrived.  Seated right away.  We were able to order in a reasonable amount of time.  Ordered a small pizza, three pasta dishes, and some pepperoni bread.

Pasta came with salad ... this is no side salad.  It could be a solid lunch entree salad on its own.

Pepperoni bread came out ... and it was basically half a pizza.  Maybe the description should have been obvious (shame on us).  Maybe I should second-guessed our order when the waiter said that he'd get that to go.  ("Wait what?  Maybe I'm confused about what that is.  We were thinking an appetizer."  I would have appreciated an explanation like the pepperoni bread is basically a sliced up french bread pizza.  Are you sure you want that since you're going to have french bread on the table and you've ordered a pepperoni pizza?)

All four of us thought our dishes and the bread were "just okay".  At some point, I think we were all eating it just because it was on a plate in front of us.

Portion sizes are plentiful for the money.  The taste ... not so much.

In regard to service, in our almost 75-minute visit, I think we were probably asked ONCE how we were doing.  Never got a refill.  Finally, a *different* server asked us if we wanted to-go boxes and if we were ready for the check.  I kept trying to make eye contact with our server.  It was like the server was going out of his way to avoid eye contact with us.

Been there few times, decent Indian food in Nola, but the service has become progressively very arrogant here. They are decent Indian food not exceptional. There is more hype than reality. Had reservation for 10.30 through open table, reached there at 10.37 and was rudely told that can't seat us coz the kitchen is closed. Why have reservations slots in open table for 10.30 and 11 when u can't seat the guest at 10.37 and on top of be rude to quests. Last time here, fortunately we live in Nola where there are better restaurants with more courteous service. I am foodie who never writes a review, coz I don't believe in imposing my views. But I had to write this coz of the total disregard of basic courtesy. I have been here few times, food is decent not exceptional. No more

Food is good, service terrible. If there's a white customer entire wait staff will focus on them. Had to wait 15 mins to order, no one asked if we wanted anything else.
Update from 07/19/18;
Service keeps getting worse. When we entered, 1st question was "You are here for take out,  right?". Then we had to request someone to take our order, no one came to the table. Someone did take our order and brought out the food. When we tried to order something more, were told kitchen is closed! No one bothered to ask/infirm about last order. Really bad service. Had to leave half hungry. 
Despite the food being good, I am not planning to go back.

This past Wednesday decided to try the special lobster roll platter.  Big disappointment!  Lobster had a 'fishy' taste, i.e., not fresh.  French fries lukewarm, not crispy.  Chowder thin.  Recommend UNO stick to its 'knitting.'  Pizza always good, order it frequently.  Stay away from seafood.   Oh, waitress was friendly and did her job competently.

Went Saturday night with my 4 year old. We sat waiting for service  for fifteen minutes without anyone coming over. The place was not super busy but we watched about 5 other groups get sat and waited on right away. None had kids and they were all ordering drinks. We just up and left and told the hostess who looked at us with a blank stare.... no I am sorry or let me get someone to help you .... nothing. My daughter was starving so we went elsewhere. Will be ripping up the menus in our rental building on this place  & recommending other places. Terrible experience. My daughter kept saying why is no one waiting on us mommy and even noticed them serving everyone else.

If you enjoy choking on pork bones and a DIY chow mien kit that looks like a beached jelly fish than this is the place for you. How do you mess up fried rice? The pork fried rice in combination platters does not contain any vegetables and comes with less than five pieces of pork. My portion had 2 pieces of bone in it. The chow mien was sub par and of poor execution. There was hardly any chicken compared to an entire onion and a cabbage patch. Do not eat here if you enjoy actual Chinese food. This place is a fraud and anyone that gives this place more than 3 stars is probably insane.

My pizza was so bad I had to order from somewhere else on the way home just to eat. There's barely any cheese on this thing and we ordered it with extra cheese. These guys should be ashamed. They've burned me twice now.  Never again.

Was here on a family vacation for 6 days and should've looked at Yelp reviews. My mom booked the place after seeing mixed reviews on Trip Advisor. We should've paid attention to the bad reviews. The best thing about the place is its convenient location - we walked to all our restaurants and sights including the stop for the St Charles street car to Audubon Park. The second best thing was the service from the boy who helped out at breakfast! The other thing that was alright was the included breakfast - dry-looking scrambled eggs and sausages, pancakes that don't look good, bagels and muffins. But the oatmeal is good and there are raisins and dried cranberries to go with it.

Everything else was TERRIBLE. I've never encountered such bad front desk service, manager, and housekeeping even at 3 star hotels in Southeast Asia.

1. Cleanliness of the place - when we first arrived there was a dodgy brown stain on the toilet seat. We called up housekeeping and they eventually came to wipe it down. It came off easily - suggesting the housekeeping had just been careless. The bedsheet was torn on one end and housekeeping was erratic. The first night we got back they didn't make the sofa bed for us or leave bedsheets out for us to make the bed ourselves. One of us slept on the sofa. Housekeeping came into our room when we were sleeping even though we had the "Do not disturb" sign up. A few days later, they didn't come in to clean saying we had the "Do not disturb" sign up even though we didn't.

2. Service - Front desk made things worse by being incredibly rude whenever we called. At one point we even had to speak to the manager and the front desk staff said they had "many problems" with us - no kidding. Because there are many problems with your hotel. The manager was just as rude as the front desk staff, probably setting the tone for the place.

3. Wifi - My iPhone, iPad and MacBook had difficulty connecting the first few days and when I asked at front desk (silly me for bothering them) she said that Apple products have issues with the wifi. Uhhh...

Honestly, there are many hotels in the area and I'd definitely rather stay somewhere else than put up with this for $240 USD a night. I never thought hotel rooms made much of a difference to a vacation since we're usually out and about, but this experience was stressful and unpleasant. This is the only place we've ever not left a tip at, and felt completely okay with it.

If I could rate this place a zero star, I would. This place is so disgusting & unprofessional. Came in yesterday for my mom's birthday & that was a complete disaster. First off, we went around 8pm & there were hardly anyone there but still had to wait 15 mins for a table. The table they gave us was still dirty with their nasty ass rag behind my head. As were being seated, my family & I hear an employee talking shit to another employee. Not even 5 mins later they start fighting! We're not getting waited on, was given a small table for it being 6 people & my child. We just up and left & took our self to Longhorn which I highly recommend. The staff their is much pleasant and attentive.

I found this place while traveling through IN on business. I'm a bbq fan so wanted to try it. Meat was good but sides were awful. Place has a wait so most folks must not have had real bbq. I won't be back next time in town.

I love sewing but Joann's is torture. After wading through tight aisles, I spent 20 minutes at the checkout (as in, at the register) while the one register worker was forced to juggle front end customer service AND the phone. I don't envy her position- she basically ignored me the whole time while she answered questions about felt and the line grew to 8 people before anyone helped her out. I think the management may want to consider having someone up front who isn't doing all the jobs at once. It made for a poor experience for me, the customer, and I'm guessing their employee too.

Nice guy but poor operation. Waited 10 min to get the paperwork done with a reservation. Then waited 45 min or more for a shutter when there was no one around.  No other drivers waiting. Car lot was around the corner. Should have walked if I had known. There is on premises car rental so next time I would rent from one of them.

This place was recommended to me by some friends. Upon entering no one is there to greet you and a bunch of ppl were just standing at the so called hostess stand looking around. Completely disorganized and there seem to be no system to how they were seating parties. There was an older lady with glasses that looked so overwhelmed. This was apparent in her demeanor. She didn't look like she wanted to be there and was disgustingly rude and dismissive. I approached to ask if we could get on a list (for a party of 10!!!!!!!!) but before I could say anything she told me to "MOVE! I need to get back there" with an eye roll. So I moved aside and thought once she placed the menus down she will at the very least acknowledge or assist us but no she doubled down on her bad attitude and continued to ignore us. Needless to say we will NOT be back. If this is how they treat you upon entering their doors I can't imagine how much care they put into their food. I would give this place -2 stars. Get rid of the lady with the bad attitude or maybe add additional staff so that she's not so overwhelmed!

Worst supermarket shopping experience each time I've come here. The customer service is horrible, the deli is understaffed, and often the workers there are rude and work very slowly. Orders that can be done in 2 minutes at other places take them 10 minutes. It took 10 minutes for the customer before me to get a 1 lb of shaved meat. The aisles are cramped and crowded. The parking lot is the worst and is an accident waiting to happen. I used to stop by this place to grab a carton of milk after going to the gym, but never again. I would rather drive an additional 10 minutes than come here again.

Probably the worse McDonald's I been to in years I felt compelled to write this review as I sit in the car in the parking lot, the one girl at the front register poor to horrible customer service skills and should not be dealing with Customers

Food is well above average, but the service is a major drawback.  Be warned - if you start at the bar and move to a table, you will continue to be served at your table by the bartender., and he will be swamped and will have no time for you.  Bottom line - you will be ignored and forgotten.
The service is awful. It is loud and the food is typical so So. If you take your kids eat cheap and don't expect anything more than McDonald's on steroids.

This place has gone way down hill since last time I was there. The pedicure chairs were broken. I asked for lotion after my shower and they said they would have to find some, then never brought any. Owners were nice and accommodating to a last min add on service, but receptionist was less than accommodating. Massage and facial were good mani and pedicure were standard.

Gave this place 2 shot and both times they failed.

Went 1st time last year and we had a server that was completely forgetful and disorganized. Food came out at various times and one person waited a very long time for his food. Server may have been under the influence of something as he could not recall drink refills etc. He would deliver the plate and drop them all loudly on the table. The owner approached our table at the end of the meal and asked how everything was. He seemed genuinely concerned however we lied and said everything was fine.I regretted not voicing my concerns.

This year we decided to give them another shot. Only because we figured out server was just a bad apple and the reviews for this place are basically good.

This time we waited a very long time for someone to approach our table.A guy finally arrived and he REEKED of cigarettes. It was so overpowering it was nauseating.We ordered drinks and an appetizer. Again the cigarette was so strong we settled the bills quickly and went somewhere else for dinner.  

Sorry guys we gave u a couple of shots and its not working for us.

I came here for breakfast because of the "look" of it.  Aside of the cool jazz band that was there at 10 in the morning, it was cold and rainy outside.  They do provide heaters that only work for the couple tables that are sitting in front of them.  You have to walk to get your food all the way in the back.  They have a bar area and a restaurant area (which you can only order at).  They do bring you your food while your sitting which is nice.

The food was TINY for what I paid.  I was so mad.  They charged me 50 cents for a cup of hot water.  I was pissed about that, too.  The food wasn't even that good.  Right after we were done, we immediately left and got breakfast at a better place.  Don't even waste your money or time eating here.  They even wanted tips at the counter?  Tip for what!??  Here's a tip, lower your prices and hire a chef to change your menu.

I liked the location, but the pizza and the service was awful. The dough was undercooked and grainy, leaving a bad taste in my mouth. As did the cheese; it tasted like plastic and slid right off the entire slice in one bite. Not only did I have to wait around 40 minutes to get my pizza, but I had to sit, watching all customers who came after me, get their pizzas first. The service felt dismissive and rude, not attentive at all, creating a tense and unenjoyable environment.

I went there a few months ago to look at bathroom fixtures, vanities, etc.  I made an appointment- I forget the name of the girl , possible Christine, not 100% on that. I picked out what I liked, spent about 45 minutes to an hour there, and was supposed to receive an estimate in a week or so via email (which we had previously corresponded by). Nothing! Never received an estimate - never heard a word. What a waste of time! Not to mention the girl I met with did not give me any great suggestions at all. I ended up ordering pretty much the same exact stuff from Weinstein's in Collegeville. They were so much more pleasant to deal with than the representative I had met with there. Their loss. I would never recommend them. Although on a side note- I would say avoid these places unless your situation absolutely calls for them. My bathroom remodel was not complicated at all- easily could have ordered most of the stuff online for less money. And probably would have taken a lot less time. But live and learn...

Sadly I HAVE to give Walker VW one star even though they deserve ZERO stars. I brought my car in to have a recalled item repaired. I also told them to take a LOOK at my AC as it would intermittently blow hot air. I was expecting a phone call informing me of any costs before any work was performed..so much for expectations!!
 I received a call at 4PM that day saying they ran a diagnostic check on my AC and that I needed the compressor replaced and when they replace the compressor that they also have to replace some other item, that I can't recall the name of. The cost would be 1300.00. Then they told me the total for the diagnostic check that I did not authorize which was 150.00. I asked to speak to the service manage but she had left for the day. I went in the next morning to pick up my car and complained that I was not informed of a 150.00 diagnostic fee and that I was not paying it. The service manager had the nerve to say I will remove the charge THIS TIME. Like she was doing me a favor by removing the charge. You performed unauthorized work!!! 
The story does not end there. I decided to take my car to a very trusted mechanic to check out my AC (read my other reviews to see the name, you won't be sorry ) explaining to him that Walker VW said I needed the compressor replaced and wanted to charge me $1300. He called me later that day and said your compressor is fine- you needed Freon!! This is the SECOND time Walker VW said I needed something replaced when there was nothing with it- the first time they said I had a bad Cam Scensor. 
This delearship is the most dishonest bunch I have EVER dealt with. Corporate will be informed of their devious ways. 
Do yourself a favor and NEVER EVER bring you car to Walker VW for repairs!! They are SHAMEFUL!
This place really sucks. Rude service. Crap food. Save your money and eat anywhere else. Not worth it at all. Wish I didn't give these people a dime.

After going to this salon for more than 1 year I give up. 
I prefer the dip powder and with the exception of today the last few times they had to redo my nails 2-3 times because their products left a pattern on my nails vs a smooth shine.  They even tried to say oh no it's fine, I would show him compared to their other results my were unacceptable.  Then it took 2-3 HOURS to get done! That's an extra 4-6 hours of my time!  Can you imagine!  I would have gladly been done earlier if the result was good.  I was getting my nails done on a Friday, they were busy so I'm sure it was frustrating him that he had to redo my nails,  so much so he said you should come during the week when "we not so busy". How about I made an appointment and I expect an acceptable service. 

Today was the last straw.  I travel often and the last time I got my nails done was out of town.   This salon will use the electric drill on your natural nails and swear it doesn't harm them. I don't see how that's possible.   

At an out of town salon they wrapped my nails to soak off powder then wrapped hands in a hot towel.  The powder (B.B. nails powder brand) wiped off easily with NO Drilling.  I requested a hot towel wrap, no response I asked again and finally got her attention & explained why I wanted it. Easy powder removal. 

The man told me how I didn't need it their system worked great I stated I would still like them wrapped   The women said their will be a charge, I said how much. They replied $5, I said $5 for a hot towel?  Fine I'll pay $5 for a hot towel.  The hot towel NEVER arrived!  But the drill did on my nails!

When he was nearly done with taking off my powder I said I guess I won't have that hot towel I said I pay $5 for a while ago. He went on to tell me over & over how I should buy some of their other services, different hand treatments, & not the hot towel & said it was a waste of my money.   I said but that is what I requested and it was offered for $5 additionally the other services he was trying to get me to buy would NOT be what I asked for nor serve my intended purpose.  

When will these nails salons understand customer service IS IMPORTANT!  Not only that, there are tons of you I'll just keep moving until I find a salon where they are not only competent but customer service oriented.   

Kimmy V. Who provides s review right after this initial review works at BB Nails or is an owner.  He provides reviews to offset actual customer opinions. 


The B.B. in B.B. Nails stands for 
BYE BYE!

Usually come here but the girl who works Tuesday nights with the long dark hair is completely terrible at her job. 

I came to fireside with some friends to celebrate my new house and she never once came up to us and asked us what we wanted to drink. She only kept going to a table for four young people and never to us. 

We are usually served by a red head but she wasn't there. We now will go to a different bar to celebrate things.

Customer service is rude, disrespectful and poor. Most are teens who don't care about their job and others are sad middle aged people who don't care about you or what you need. The only good part is the food, good popcorn and tasty snacks.

Last time ordering from here.  Ordered delivery. Came in a timely manner, they forgot the white rice.  When we called we got no apology, they said it would be right out.     After waiting 30 minutes again we called still no apology said its on its way.  Well we finally got the rice 1 hour after delivery when everything else was nice and cold.  We made a final call to talk to a manager and they said to call tommorow, still no apology.Although a small item to miss, a big part of the meal.  We are all human and all make mistakes, just own up to them.

I found this place on yelp and decided to give it a try since we get a discount if we check in with yelp. The first time I was there it was great, I actually thought it was one of the best in Reno till the second time we went there. We sat at the bar and at first everything seemed to be going good, the chef was good and quick and food was alright till after I ate a really nasty bad fishy tasting unagi. I literally almost threw up but I didn't complain thinking it's just that one. We decided to order the salmon skin handroll as our last since the unagi threw us off and disgusted us and the salmon skin is fried. As we're waiting, the sushi chef has the nerve to ask us if we really want the handroll and we're like "yeah" then he goes, "we charge for any leftovers" and i'm like, "ok...what about the ones I don't like"? he's goes, "it doesn't matter" and I'm like, "even the one that's bad?  and he keeps saying "it don't matter, you will have to pay full price for it" then I got upset and told him that the unagi was fishy and gross so I  said, I'm not eating that nor am I paying for it. He goes, "well, that's insulting when you're saying the food I serve you is gross". He obviously wasn't understanding me. I'm insulted at the fact that I pay good money to be serve good, fresh food and should not have to be asked if I should stop eating. It's all you can eat for a reason! we were only there for about 30 mins and it wasn't his duty to charge me for leftovers, I'm well aware of that as its stated on the menu and if anything, the waiter should be the one telling us that, not the chef! Many sushi restaurant has that stated on their menu. However, they don't enforce it. This is the first and they obviously do, if they have the chef reminding you. We felt discriminated on as well. He was so nice and so helpful to the Caucasian lady and I felt that they served that bad unagi on purpose so we won't continue to eat. They were speaking Spanish to each other then all that happened. We will never step foot there again and I will be sure to spread the love on the horrible experience I had. Be aware if you decide to stop by. I wanted to complain to the manager but I felt he was in on it. Just horrible.

Not a good experience at all. Even with  $20 off coupon my synthetic oil change was $90, and I get that the people who worked on my car don't set the price. I went to this location because it was close to my work. They were kind and respectful,  but the waiting room was pretty dirty and could use a wipe down. It was a maybe 15 minute wait, so they made good time.
The biggest problem was the next morning when there was filthy oil all over my driveway. You could tell it was old and dirty. When I called them they said bring it back , which is not close to home, and it was my day off. I wanted to take it somewhere closer but they said no. I took it back in and they said my tech didn't take some kind of plate off and it was old oil running out. I asked how to clean my driveway and he said soap and water would take it off. He was wrong. What an expensive mess.
We'll never know. Couldn't schedule an appointment or talk with anyone because "mailbox full". Went with the competition.

Went as a spur of the moment, bad decision.  The good order was botched, over charged for nasty nachos, ordered egg rolls instead of quesadillas.  I had to ask for silverware and plates.  Guess they stay in business with locals.  Disgusting food, service horrible!   Don't waste your time or money.

I admit I don't like CVS since my employer contracted with them to exclusively provide us with medication and they don't carry my medication (and apparently aren't able to even order it, even though other pharmacies can order) so now I can't even take it anymore. Aside from that, the pharmacy staff is rude and most trips take at least two trips to get what you need so it's not convenient.  You'll be waiting for someone to answer the phone, get your RX, go through the drive through or even check out up front.  No matter the time or what day, you'll be waiting a while. Also, they used to be open early and I could stop by on my way to work but then they changed their hours to open at 8am so I no longer use them.  Their loss I guess. They also don't do kid's flu shots.

I was very disappointed in Drago's, especially since it was recommended by several people. The chargrilled oysters were good but I had better while in New Orleans. Maybe they were having an off day because the table beside us complained about the oysters not being as good as they normally are. I also ordered fried oysters which took about 30 minutes to come out. The waiter said our food took so long because they were waiting on my oysters but then my food wasn't even hot when it came out. I'll give them another try next time I visit because maybe they did just have a bad day.

Possibly more later but it's 2pm and slow and I can't get my tea glass refilled to save my life.  Denny's as a change n is notorious for poor service.  It's as if it is coming any policy to ignore guests.  Until time for the check of course.

I don't know how this place has such great reviews!  To start, the atmosphere is bland at best.  Before we even were seated the waitress was over the top rude.  We almost didn't sit down because we had a bad vibe that we should have went with but we decided to try it because the reviews were so go.  From the get go the waitress informs us that they're out of some things...French toast (but they had bread and they had eggs...and Ive made French toast before), Brie, and later we found out they were out of OJ.  Ok, we can live with this but is there not a nearby market to obtain such a breakfast staple as OJ???  We ordered a crepe, the grits bowl and the chicken hash (with a side of grits).  The grape was edible, the grits bowl was not bad (thus the two stars) and the chicken hash was nearly painfully dry and bland only to be saved by applying the side of grits.  So, so far, the place is nothing to write home about that but to further the negative experience the lead waitress was constantly yelling at the other waitress telling her what to do in between rudely informing other customers that their wait could be well over a half an hour because they're running really far behind.  Um, if you're going to air your dirty laundry at least do it in a polite manner.  Next up, we ordered refill on our water and waited....and waited...and waited....and they never came.  Finally we were brought our check and again asked for water...after waiting a couple more minutes we decided is wasn't worth waiting for and left.  WAY too many options in the area to waste any time on this place.

I went here after a shower at the fox theater with a friend to get a quick dinner. I will say the chefs and saff are efficient and the food tastes halfway decent. The food is cheap, however I don't think they really put much work into making the food. I don't think I will ever come back though. They used WAY  to much butter, not enough seasoning, and not to mention their food gave me horrible food poisoning the next day. My firends and I might have gone on an off day, but ALL OF US got horrible food poisoning. No restaurant should call themselves the best if their food makes people sick, to the point of vomiting. I will not come back until they clean their act along with the actual restaurant. It feels more like a school cafeteria than anything. I would never recommend this place until they fix their problems.

Stood in line 45 minutes. The person taking the orders was also dishing up food which is why it took so long (and is that sanitary-he handled the money too). Totally unimpressed. And the reason Julia Child said it was her favorite is because she didn't want to insult any of her chef friends and they all knew she hated Mexican food. First and last time here.

The food takes forever and is not fresh AT ALL. I had bakers dozen wings and I can tell they were fried twice. The wings and meat inside were so hard and dry. I also had the Mac n cheese and greens as sides. The greens were awesome but the Mac n cheese was burnt and hard as well. I was excited to try this place because it was black owned and I read all the reviews but it did not live up to the expectations.

Server was terrible was rushing us, 5 different things we tried to order they were out if, ended up ordering two  Different appetizers. The hummus was not very good and the focaccia was cold like really cold. 
Even though they advertise pepperoni or cheese pizza by the slice we could not get it. Halfway through eating the waitress asked if we were done with ordering for they were fixing to shut down the cooking. It was not that close to closing time. Would never go there again.

So we just left from eating here and the experience from the beginning was absolutely atrocious! The waitress was unprofessional  and disinterested in her job. I had ordered the felafel sandwich wrap and the actual felafels looked like dry brown hockey pucks. I could only have a tiny nibble of those disgusting things.
 Now the sandwich with the lettuce and sauce itself was delicious. I just had to pick out the damn star of the dish the felafel. I wish I could teach them my grandmothers recipe because I feel like they could benefit from it but the waitress was not friendly and did not want to have anything to do with it.

DO NOT GO HERE!!!!!
These people do not know their asses from a hole in the wall.  Waited 15 minutes in line. Ordered and waited for 45 minutes for 4 sandwiches. At 7:30pm, they told people they were not taking orders for 10 minutes because they were "backed up". At 7:40, they told the people waiting "sorry, kitchen is closed, we ran out of bread". 

It's a shame, because the food was good.  Not great, but good.

Do yourself a favor go somewhere else. We've been to Sandbar many times before and everything was great from food to service. Today we went again with the family and place was awful. They put so much tables ( which was shaky and my husband asked for a coaster to put under a leg) around that there is no space to walk. Table was dirty and we asked 3 times to wipe it. Our waitress was a sleepy girl whom we asked 5 times for a napkins and never got ones , salsa and chips took her forever to bring( finally other waitress brought it). Drinks was brought up 30 min later with 10 min gap in between. Finally we "caught" our waitress to order the food which arrived on our table 1 hr 40 min later separately from each other. We complained to a manager. I don't think we will ever come back. For this restaurant is quantity over quality. Not the same one anymore

The food was decent. Got a delivery order and asked for extra katsu sauce because it was delicious in the past. They gave us three containers of ketchup. I called, not to complain, but just to point out I asked for katsu sauce and not ketchup. They laughed and said katsu sauce is 90% ketchup that is why it tastes like that. I heard people in the background laughing. My fiance and I really dislike the taste of ketchup, there is no possible scenario we liked a sauce that was 90% ketchup. Especially since we immediately noticed this sauce as being ketchup. Maybe Katsu is 90% ketchup and the sauce we got before was something different (although I know they called it katsu sauce) but I don't think there should be people laughing at customers like that. Granted the last Mamas we went to was in another state so idk if they do things differently. Then my fiance found a long blonde hair inside her burger (she is brunette, there is no way it was her hair and also it was underneath the toppings). The delivery was prompt and the delivery person was nice and friendly. In the end, these guys lost our business for sure just wanted to give others a heads up

ok so i'm not from nashville i'm from new york, now if u find yourself in need of food hit up popeyes and grab some sweet heat sauce and get to dippin. but if your unlucky and have to go then i suggest the Jerusalem chicken, has to be the best driest chicken ever. chicken so dry i almost put lotion on it. macaroni salad need atleast 3 cheeses but instead they serve u boiled macaroni.

Make sure to not forget anything in your room after checking out. We had forgot a very expensive $200 + item accidentally left in the room due to a hasty checkout. Called 30 minutes after leaving. Too late, housekeeping had already stolen the item and claimed it was never left. Cmon!  Housekeeping is not to be trusted.  This is the first time housekeeper has stolen anything from me. NOT HAPPY!!
Yo no recomiendo este lugar pedi tacos de cabeza y sabian a pescado tambien pedi taco arabe y tenia pollo y olia mal definitivamente nunca regresare a este lugar

My meal here was ok. It wasn't anything special and continued the disappointment I experienced with New Orleans cuisine. 

The service was very poor. There was a 40 min wait even though the restaurant was half-full and there were at least 4 waitstaff. The host pointed us to an empty table, and there was another long wait to get water. The waiter forgot our other drinks until our meals came out. 

The Mac & Cheese that came with my friend's meal was also cold, and he tells me, flavorless.

The bathroom was not in good shape.

I am confused about how so many of these below-average restaurants get good reviews.

It was not "my pleasure" to eat here today. I never had a problem with the cashiers, but today a man, who I assume was the owner was dismissive towards me. And did not treat me with that above and beyond customer service that I am use to at Chick-fil-A. I did not get this from the employees.  Maybe the owner should start practicing what he preaches. I will be taking my business to the other locations from now on.

Omg one hour and a half, yes 90 mins and the results our horrible. Never again, they stood around inside passenger door doing nothing. If a business doesn't have the help to do the business then don't open! Laziness beyond anything I've ever seen. Blue shirts stood around spinning towls, talking, This wash cost $46. Needs to close its door. And didn't touch running boards or fender wells. I'll post pics

Customer service is non-existent @ Menard's - don't bother with their landscape blocking as most are not firsts. Oh, don't call their corporate offices as no one is allowed to speak to you in CustomerSvc - ALL comms has to be done via US mail. Really! this is 2018, not 1960! - First, encounter was with person in guard's box to the yard pulled in, no response finally they came to the window stretching and yawning, guess we woke her up! Asked question one word answer "front door" continued to yawn and stretch. We apologized for waking her.  Went to landscape blocks needed six 16'x16" they are HEAVY. Blocks were not consistent in size and many were badly chipped. Needed to be sorted through to find "decent" condition for our project. Could find no help to assist-FINALLY saw someone asked for help and he said standing in the block aisle "with what"? With what? Blocks, duh, since we are standing in the aisle right next to them. Told us he would page someone to help "not his job" - no one ever showed. We abandoned the merchandise and left. Tried to reach manager via phone it is a rigorous exercise to FINALLY get extension for on-site manager. The phone rang 50-60 times before answering - hope they are not paying him more than a clerk's salary he was useless. Bottom line--- DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME AT MENARD'S

Food is good but the worst service. No wonder it closed the owner has no knowledge of how to run a food business. I once called 7 times in one day and they didn't pick up, i go in the shop and they asked me "why didn't you call us to order". SMFH, glad it's closed

First time dining at Ocean Prime; had reservation (for 2-people) week+ in advance. 

Positives: Wide menu selection, friendly waitress, and large dining area 

Negative: For the price point, wasn't expecting to dine on patio chairs; whereas it was 8 degrees outside, we froze where we were seated (heat lamps warmed our head and shoulders, but was uncomfortably cold every else on body); salads came while still eating delicious calamari, but there was a healthy 15 min gap between salads and entrees; sea scallops were burnt on bottom which left a poor taste in mouth; friendly waitress, but poor table service throughout the entire 1.5 hour dining experience. 

Ultimately, the food was underwhelming and we did not expect our overall experience to be as poor as what it was (being marketed as an upscale restaurant.)

There was a girl named Shelly with tons of facial piercings that almost took off the rear view mirror as she was wiping down the car. When addressing our concern with mgt, all they said was oh she's new. Wow, what great customer service! This place is ghetto along with most of the employees. They need to higher their standards.

If you like diner type food this is a place that you might like.  Stopped in for a quick sandwich at dinner hour, not too crowded seated in a booth.  Service was ok our waitress was leaving and introduced her daughter to us who was taking over.  Not the friendliest folks but we ordered and just waited.  For this meal we ordered a burger and grilled chicken wrap.  Pretty bland and wrap was a bit tough, guessing a bit stale.  Meh, not the greatest.
They offer kids and senior options and daily specials.  Parking lot on premises. Prices are typical for diner.

not great. that sums it up. 
i came here for lunch after an exam, hoping for some good, warm ramen to fill my stomach. let's start with seating. seating here is so limited. there is like, one table on the first floor and the rest of the seating is upstairs and outside. i don't mind sitting outside but i'd like the option to sit inside, esp since most of the space seems poorly used. 
service was soso. we got our order take and god given to us, and that was about it. we got our on napkins and spoons from other tables. 
now for the food, the most disappointing part of my visit. we ordered the crawfish spring rolls, which were very delicious. simple, and hard to mess up. my friend and i ordered ramen, and two of my other friends ordered poke. the ramen was pretty bad. the noodles were very subpar, and clearly not fresh. the broth was salty and lacked a depth of flavor, and the pork was dry, considering it was in a soup. and the egg was wayyy too over cooked for ramen. a soft boil is the way to go, but this egg was fully cooked. also, the brussel sprouts were basically shredded and raw and thrown in. they didn't even trim the bottoms off. (as seen in pic) if you want ramen in nola, hit up kin and nomiya. now for the poke. i didn't taste it, but it looked disappointing. they didn't even have the imitation crab salad, a classic topping for every poke place. they had odd ingredients, like black beans and chickpeas, which are a good source of veggies protein, but not really a poke topping. overall, not my bowl of poke. 
overall, this is not my place. i was excited when i heard this place was coming, but it is hard doing both poke and ramen well. if i want poke, i will be going to pokechan. if i want ramen, nomiya it is. this combination place is just not doing it.

Nothing special about this place- food has lost it quality, by serving cold tacos. The servers are not able to follow a simple task of checking the food before serving it to the customer. Make sure to tell your server to cut back on having your food with hair. Their priority is just to make profits without having any dignity.
Been here twice, 1st time, amazing, great food, Fantasic. 2nd time, no food available as the cook called in, which was today. I would otherwise give 5 stars.

Was staying in town for 5 days for work. My schedule added a last minute extra day to the front end so I needed a place just for an overnight sleep. I got this one for a pretty low price. 

The lady at the desk was super super nice. Cant say that enough. 

The room...... Well it was clean, I cant argue that. But it still had that odd feel to it. A bit outdated. 

The parking lot was well lit and open. But still felt a little nervous about leaving anything in the open in the back seat. 

Not a bad place if you are short on cash or need a "quick stay". 

But I most likely will look elsewhere next time.

Went to the Shitman Diner Lounge for a drink, they wanted to charge us a $10 per person cover charge.  We laughed at them and left. No band, no juggling siamese twins (I'd pay a cover for that) What a joke.

I went to this Rally's, and they had a sign outside use left lane so I pulled up left lane, and when I got to the window they told me I had to go around to the other side of the building. Apparently Rally's has a different definition of left than the rest of the world. So I went to Wendy's.

My wife and myself ate here 8-2-18. I've personally eaten at more than 75 Waffle House locations in some pretty rough but clean buildings. This one is only a couple of years old and has to be one of the worst I've been to. To start with when we placed our order the waiter took our order and then said let me get my order book and had to repeat it again. Then twice he had to come back and verify what we ordered. I ordered the steak and eggs and my wife ordered a chicken sandwich plate. My steak came to me first, cooked ok with no seasoning, but was still decent. About 5 minutes later my wife got her sandwich and then I got my eggs and hash browns. My scrambled eggs were basically unedible.
