My wife then asked for mayonnaise and the waiter told her he would like some too but they were out and had been out awhile. There is a grocery store within a 100 yards of this Waffle house and nobody has the sense to walk over and get some for their customers. We're staying for 3 months in the hotel in the same parking lot and other guest have told me that their food was garbage also. Looks like some corporate intervention is needed at this location to get them up to Waffle House quality. There is another location a couple of miles east and I would walk there before I would give this location another dime!

ambiance 7/10
service 7/10
softshell crab Po' boy   2/10 essentially felt like bread crumbs in bread sandwich.
sea food gumbo: 1/10
fried okra: 2/10
wings: looked fine. I did not have them though.
corn bread: 1/10
paralines: 2/10

Good Food. Huge portions. Slow but friendly service. However this restaurant is listed falsely on "No wait" app. It indicated "come on in" and on arrival there was quite a wait for a table. The hostess said "they no longer use the app." If this is true- they should remove the advertisements from their website and the restaurant from the app. For this reason I cannot rate higher. False advertising.
It's beyond regular. It was like everything just thrown in the bowl with separate flavors. I could've made this at home and saved $10 very disappointing that I wasted money

I am a REGULAR Dunkin go-er and this location is absolutely awful. I repeated my order 4 times, the guy taking my order was mumbling and kept saying they didn't have things I was ordering but then suddenly would say "oh yeah we do nevermind", we waited in line for 36 minutes, got to the window, the girl at the window stood and glared at us before opening the window, we finally got out food and none of it was correct. We got 3 things we didn't order and didn't get any of the 4 items we did order. They charged us incorrectly and when (god forbid) we asked for ketchup packets and politely what took so long in the drive thru line, she rolled her eyes and said "were busy". Alrighty then... won't be returning.
I love the atmosphere, but the tacos are so damn greasy.  Our order takes forever.  This time the grease was just way too much.  I won't ever go back.

The food was good but service was horrible. We had to keep asking for refills, to clean dirty dishes, etc. She kept forgetting things. I ordered a margarita. After ten mins I asked about it. She forgot, then there was no bartender. No bartender? Management doesn't know how to tend bar or at least tell people the bar is closed?  Bad experience all together.

Awful massage. There is a pleasant Asian woman who works at the Terminal A location that has no training whatsoever.  On top of that she has a weird grunt that is more habitual than actually effort being out into the massage. It is a shame because I fly here frequently and would love to have a decent massage after or before flights. She has a pony tail. 

I wish they would train her.

We visited this location while shopping in Hyde Park and it was pouring rain. There was no slip mat at the front door and I was the first person to walk in the door. I fell so hard and slipped on the wet concrete (no warning sign) and the entire store looked at me. They didn't offer to help me or at least a free coffee.

Nice/new hotel. However, seems like they're still figuring out how to operate their systems. My TV/internet/phone we're not working and engineer's response was to turn it off/on again. Shocker-that didn't work.

I ordered breakfast with the card you put on your doorknob and it was 20 mins late.

Finally, when I checked out they asked to email me the bill (fine). Despite 3 calls, I still do not have a copy of my bill. 

I will not be staying here again.

Been to Connors many time and food and service top notch. This visit I order oysters, they brought no heated butter or crackers. When I asked for it, the crackers were not enough, plus crackers were old and stale. 

My main course was 6 ounce filet and lobster tail. The steak was done perfect, just not a lot of that that was aged 35 days. Lastly the lobster tail was dry and not very good. $399 for the entire meal seemed way to high for sub par food. Service was ok but it will be a long time before we visit again. 

One last thing, the calamari is to die for so be sure to order it. The rest o the food I got was nothing special. Did not complain because in most cases the food they bring back out is even worse. They sure did let me down.

Typical franchise nothing to rave about but I will say when compared to OutHouse Steakhouse it's certainly far superior! 

There is just nothing exciting or dynamic about this place the servers merely go thru the motions as does the kitchen don't ask for anything special .  

Overall like I said it's not horrible but they certainly can try harder.

The staff was rude. The theater was very dirty   The mgt team has to retrain there employee about Custmoer services and keep the theater clean. The theater has gone down hill in the last couple of months. I will drive the extra time to go to a Regal theater in Oak Pa   The popcorn was not even fresh. I went  to the first show of the day  they are using the old popcorn from the night before   AMC as a company is a good company. But this theater and there employees SUCK

HORRIBLE food and staff!The take away food was YUCKY!!..Raw uncooked food!! Lime served with the dish was pre-used by someone else  .. Can you imagine???Absolutely DISGUSTING!! They take orders until minutes before the kitchen closing time and end up serving absolutely shitty food.
The manager is super rude and cant speak English..Responds rudely to customer concerns ..Serves terrible food and gives excuses  to customers that the poor quality is due to high number of orders..This has happened several times...Guys avoid this place!!!!..
There are a number of better Indian restarants in and around Nashville.

I get the French dip every time I'm here. Today, the French dip came on regular pieces of bread, had hardly any cheese and was lacking a lot of meat. The staff was friendly enough but how much money are they trying to save by switching to such cheap bread? Go back to the buns. The bread is a joke

Whatever you do, DO NOT GO HERE! The manager is extremely rude and the workers are scammers and liars. They told my boyfriend he needed $1500 worth of work on his car, so he took it to another professional mechanic shop for a second opinion and all he needed was a new tire. The workers at Sears lied to him and tried to scam him for $1400, when all the issues they told him that his car had were made up. Please be aware and smart and do not let these people work on your car or you will most likely be scammed out of a bunch of money and lied to. These people are not professional, rude, liars, scammers, and crooks. Do not go here!

I was expecting a good breakfast after reading reviews and speaking with others. I was disappointed with the experience I had from start to finish. The first red flag was showing up and the place was virtually empty for breakfast. The server was extremely slow the whole time and I'm not even sure he had another table. He seemed to be in the back most of the time while the rest of the staff hung up at the bar. His service was not good at all considering it was almost a $100 breakfast bill for 4 people. He seemed way to relaxed and didn't really care. The food and coffee were not hot. The food was ok but nothing special. The final disappointment was being charged $5 for a side of toast with an omelette that should have been included?! I would not recommend this place for breakfast. Maybe they are better for lunch and dinner

Tattoo artists "weren't confident enough" in their abilities for a tattoo idea. Instead offered me to go to their sister ship where one of the artists wanted to change the placement of the tattoo. I'm pretty sure I've picked that spot for a reason

The service here is horrible. I called and placed an order over the phone. The guy on the phone got my order wrong. I placed a big order for fried fish and fries. When I got their to pick up my order, I walked to the counter to pay for my order I realized the price was off so I asked to review my order and continued to explain my order was incomplete. The lady was like I will have to charge you more and you can wait for the other fish to fry, and I agreed. However, I asked that all my fish be cooked at the same time so that it is fresh. The woman refunded me all my money and was done. I didn't get upset, she explained that I was the one who ordered incorrectly and decided she was done. I guess she doesn't like her job. The food isn't good enough for attitudes like that. I will never spend my money their again.  Everyone has had better fried fish and wings before. I just drove across town to Ed's Fish & Pizza which is 100 times better than Ghot Wingz. I was living in the area so we would go often until this happened. I will never come here again. Ever

I was advised Joey's pizza had good New York style pizza. Went there on Friday with high expectations only to be disappointed. I hate the pizza when you bite the end and the entire crust slides off the  Pizza. I ended up throwing the whole thing away. Don't know if it was cooked too fast or too hot but the cheese slid right off. Will not go back

I wanted to try a new nails salon and my coworker referred me here. I walked in right before I noticed them locking the door behind me. Shortly after they started turning people away and I found out that they were expecting a wedding party. They'd promised them that they would shut down the shop when they came but they're about ten people including myself who were already in the shop. The bride began fussing and accusing the nail shop of lying about their agreement. So they pulled all of the nail techs together to get the bridal party started and called the waxing lady to do my nails. Needless to say she totally messed up my nails from the acrylic application to the filing process. When it was time to polish, a guy came to polish and basically noticed how messed up my acrylic was and had to refile all of my nails. He annoyingly kept trying to get me to spend more money on other products and services that I wasn't interested in even though I told him I didn't want anything. It was an overall annoying experience and I'm STILL not satisfied with the way that my full set turned out. Won't be going back.

Ordered three tacos chips and salsa they called and gave me such attitude saying you know this isn't the curry tacos right ? I said yes I'm aware they tried to charge me more money just to deliver two tacos which were disgusting and they said three times they'd refund me never saw anything. Everytime you go in they have an attitude and seem like they hate their job. Not worth it. I used to be a loyal customer not anymore

I've been a few times when they first opened. Food was good not great but good enough for me to return. The wait is ridiculous and that's why I stopped going for like a year.. Went today and ordered cheesesteak rolls and beef egg foo young. They changed the cheesesteak rolls. It was mushy inside and it was some type of pasty sauce and onions. Not a piece of steak at all. I cut open my 2nd roll because I wanted to examine it and again no steak. The it had a chicken bouillon flavor. So weird didn't want to finish it. The beef is the egg foo young was tough and flavorless.. The egg part was also mushy.  I normally eat at the Chinese store across from overbrook hs but they are a cash o my establishment. I didn't have any cash on me. Their food may not be halal but their food is 10x's better. Not going back to Chan halals again... waste of my time and money. Now I'm sitting here hungry.

This has more to do with their service than the food, really but it started with the food, well coffee. My wife and I found we had a couple spare minutes this morning and she us used to really like coming here so we headed over. Got seated, outside, nice morning, good company, all is well. Was not really that hungry but we decided to split a so-so sticky bun. I actually quite enjoyed that aspect. My wife got a white-chocolate raspberry mocha, I got some black coffee. Not too shabby at this point, server was great, appeared to be training someone, was knowledgeable about the choices was attentive, until...

So when my black coffee came out there were some white flakes floating on top of it, not a big deal. When our server came back to check on us, I pointed this out and asked for a new cup, again, no big deal, was not upset, just wanted coffee without the flakes. She mentioned that it was probably just coffee grounds and took it away. Again, not going to argue, but coffee grounds don't generally look like dandruff, I just want a new cup so all is good. I believe this is where the problem arose, me, not arguing, not raising a voice, simply asking for a new cup because of the white flakes (I never brought up the dandruff thought I had). 

A new cup was brought out, but we never saw the server again, not for a refill, not for a, "hey need anything else?" Not for anything except when her trainee dropped off the bill 10 minutes later. We sat there for 30 minutes after that and saw our server visit with and give refills to every other table multiple times, we did not even get a look when I tried flagging her down and said excuse me in a voice loud enough for the couple tables next to us to turn. She was not rude, she just literally acted like we were no longer there.  

I finally went inside to pay the bill and explained the situation. They did apologize and gave me a to-go cup, so that was nice, but there are a fair amount of coffee shops/breakfast joints in the area where service is better and have the same quality food. It's too bad but I liked the old set-up better anyways.

I was not greeted when I walked in. The customer service was not the best, they got my order wrong, I asked for a certain type of noodle and they gave me the wrong kind, when I asked them to fix it they made me take out the noodles myself and put the new ones in. There was also a small spider on my table as well there was also a number of flys flying around me as I ate. But the food was exceptional.

Heard good things about the food here, so had an early dinner here a few nights ago. Atmosphere was nice, an open warehouse feel to the place, with an outdoor section as well as a bar and an open view of the kitchen. The food was good but service seemed a bit off- We had at least four servers assisting us and it seemed like servers were running all over the place, as opposed to having a dedicated section of the restaurant. My boyfriend and I both ordered a small plate as appetizers and a main dish. They arrived separately in no particular order, which I felt was odd but maybe supposed to reflect the history of the cuisine itself? 

We also had to ask for each thing we needed...napkins, forks, waters, refill on waters...we never did get the fork. 

Also my boyfriend said he noticed one of the chefs failed to wash his hands as he came out of the bathroom stall...which gave me pause. Hopefully he washed when he returned to the kitchen!

I would give this place another chance just based on the food and perhaps we had an off experience with the service.

First I'll say, I've been to Anthony's many times and enjoyed the food. I've booked the dining rooms for several parties and attended functions at the main ballroom.  I also patronize their catering services during Christmas and other holidays. I've always the considered the food consistently good. I went to Anthony's on 5/9 for my wife's birthday and it was the worst dining experience of my life. Both my wife and felt ill after the meal. First the service, we waited 10 minutes for someone to show at reception. We ordered 1 daily special and 3 entree from the Signature Anthony's menu. We then waited 35 minutes for the food. We had to ask for Water and drinks refills. -this is all not that big a deal to me if the food is good. Problem it was horrible. No taste whatsoever. Everything was heavy and slopped over in disgusting cream sauces. The olive oil dip was rancid. Even the diet coke tasted foul. That evening both my wife and I felt ill with stomach in knots. The next day I'm taking antacids like candy and feel nauseous. A very, very bad meal.  Inexcusable or the price.  I've had too many good meals at Anthony's to not give one more shot -but this was really bad.

I only received one statement from Spire in the past 3 months.  I should not be the one chasing for my bill so I can it!!!! I had to call so that I know how much I owe. And when I call, they make me feel that it's my fault that I didn't get my bill!
Horrible! Run don't walk! Nasty milky gross food. We sent our dishes back immediately. The owner was as nasty as the "dishes"
The drive thru is ridiculously slow here. 4 cars in line and over 20 minutes on an afternoon-not the busiest of times. They also don't have the nitro cold brews at this location.

Used come here when Gary was running the place.  Food was always great and loved the prime rib or ribeye steak.  Stopped by for dinner before the BSU basketball game and ordered the 16 oz Ribeye steak.  Medium rare.  About 4 minutes after my salad arrived I was presented with a piece of meat about 4 inches wide and about 1 1/2 inches thick.  I questioned the waitress if this was the ribeye and not the sirloin.  She assured me that it was the 12 oz ribeye.  Cut into it and was not even rare, but raw.  Sent it back for some more cooking and came back to me almost rare but not close to medium rare.  If was gristle and fat throughout most of it and finally found about 5 oz of edible steak.  The was the worst piece of meat I have ever had.  I told the server that and and she came back with a free drink card from the manager which I won't be able to use because I am never going back.  A ribeye should look like a ribeye especially at $18.99 .

Great place, good coffee, the reason for the 1 star is the absolute rudest people!!!  I have been coming here for a week and I have not once gotten a smile but an attitude.  You feel like they know your from out of town and do as little as possible to start your day off right.  Good luck with the gal with purple hair.  She's in the wrong business!!  And for the record the cooks are very nice.  Maybe they should be serving and the people up front should be cooking. As an owner of 2 businesses I'm hoping that the owner of this business takes this review and takes a good look. I'm also in the customer relations business and I always side with the customers good or bad.  Good luck

This place is located in a charming location in the historic part of Franklin. The ambiance and decor are fun and charming. We were enthusiastically anticipating a 5-star experience. The server immediately greeted us and described the menu options in great detail. It was a good start to a 5-star experience. However, the food itself did not meet that expectation. My wife had the meat sliders. The meat was so hard that she could not eat them. She left most of the sliders uneaten. We also had fried green tomatoes. We had a difficult time finding the tomatoes in the overly thick battered crust. I had the meatloaf. It was uniquely made from a combination of beef and pork. It tasted OK, but was lacking due to being under cooked. I was not able to eat the entire serving because it was overly raw. The service continued to be outstanding, but the food ruined the experience. We were disappointed.

Overpriced, mediocre food. Slow service on a slow night. Beers are alright and "craft" cocktails are too expensive. They have a pinball table though! (Only reason I gave 2 stars) Would go back for a beer if I was going to a concert at the Rev, other than that I would not recommend.

I don't do reviews very often but this one merited it. Really overall terrible experience and we won't be back. To start with, took about 5 mins of us sitting down for anyone to even come over - which when you are starving seems like an eternity. Then we ordered and 30 mins later (I timed it) our waitress came over and explained they had some issue with the computer and they hadn't even started our meal yet. Agh! 

I will give them that they gave us a bowl of soup and some fries to tie us over so there is that. But when the food came out, it was subpar at best. I left over 1/2 of my sandwich which is really not like me at all. 

Net net food was not good even for bar food and service was sloooow. Won't be back.

Six of us over sixty came in and was told the only valuable place to sit would be on the high stools. We were discussing this possibility as one of us is over eighty. We were then told there was an opening in the vip room. There had been a cancellation. The vip room which looks like the main room had several empty tables. We got the menu which was the most confusing menu I've ever seen. I finally decided on a cesar salad and small order of the pasta.
The cesar salad is on a wooden board with five or six pieces of lettuce
with an anchovy laying on each and some kind of dressing dripped over it. (What a joke) Tasteless. The rigatoni with the pomodora sauce
was very spicy with no flavor. I will not be back.

Perhaps the worst waiting service. Taking out three simple orders. Two scramble eggs that are more burnt than scramble. Ordered banana strawberry pecan pancakes and it took them 30 minutes to make. When finally received they were burnt on one side. How can someone mess up pancakes.... the portions and quality for the price we paid is not worth it. Skip this place if you want a good place for breakfast/brunch

Yuck. You should not be afraid to go to a restaurant in between lunch and dinner but that's what we did, we showed up at 3:50 and watched as our drink  sat a bar not being served to us, rewarmed greasy wings and blue cheese dressing was flavorless that we got some spring rolls they were all right but what a disappointment and now my wife has a stomachache what a waste of a good rare out to lunch moment.

Thanksgiving at the Cracker Barrel! I placed my order nearly two hours ago and I am still here. I was initially in the lobby and I have now moved to the doorway of the kitchen. I asked four servers, a food runner, and a manager for my food to no avail. The food runner finally came back with a paper and pen and asked, "What was it that you ordered?" I couldn't believe it, but I simply wrote down my order. 20 minutes after that another manager approached me and offered to comp (refund) my meal. I might just cook or drive out to see family next year. I refuse to spend 1.5 hours at Cracker Barrel waiting for a 2 minute dip item again. I served and trained servers at multiple Cracker Barrell's for roughly six years, and I have never seen a system so disorganized and broken down on Thanksgiving.

Apps and cocktails were great, but the pasta dish was wayyy too salty.  They remade it and same issue.  Wife had the same dish and it wasn't as bad.   They took mine off the check, but no manager visit or service recovery past the waitress, who was great.  Won't be back though

On vacation in Nashville. This eatery came highly recommended. It is right near Vanderbilt University which should have been my first warning sign. We ordered breakfast and were surprised that the pancakes were the size of a saucer, not your typical pancake size, and the eggs for two of our guests were cold and needed to be sent back. When we told our waitress about the eggs being cold she had a bit of an attitude. This is what happens at a tourist trap and this is just what this restaurant is. I gave it one star because the coffee was pretty good.

This place is so poorly managed. How can you have a salad place with no topping. They ran out of most toppings before 6:00 pm. Figure it out. All I wanted was a salad and you slapdicks ruined that for me. Never coming back.

We have eaten here a few times and enjoyed it but tonight it was terrible dreadful service over rich food we were celebrating an engagement and the celebratory couple said give it up there is no way to get dessert here. We will never go back they ruined a special evening

this place sucks. they customer service skills are all wrong. they have the nerve to serve burnt aldi microwave food and then they servers are just as rude and dumb i do not recommend going here and i will not becoming coming back i spent way too much money for my daughter party to be treated like trash

I really liked this place at one time.   Now the service has suffered.  Staff is pleasant enough, but not on their game.   Seated for more than 10 minutes without even an  "I'll be right with you"  I finally stopped the hostess walking by, and asked if we had one.  We stopped for a quick bite before heading to theater.  Normally go to Meadows, which is awesome!  We were late for our show.   No sense of urgency at all.

The food here is so average it's not worth the money. Go next door to IHOP... prices are pricey for a Diner....
I got the all American Burger and it Didn't taste like ANYTHING... the patty was not seasoned and it didn't even come with any condiments or fries!!!!! Just a 50 cent bag of chips... no pickle.. 
Hubby got the French toast breakfast,,, and the toast well... it tasted like white bread with eggs whisked in... disgusting.. 
the portions are rather big but it doesn't make up for the fact that everything lacks flavor.. never coming back here

The food here was great and my friends enjoyed their drinks..when they came 20 minutes after ordering them! We made a reservation for 11 people on a Tuesday evening, so we thought we might be given good service for reserving a nice spot in the back a month in advance. The service we got at this restaurant was awful which sucks because the food was amazing. Our servers name was Casey, and she didn't smile a single time while serving us. As a party of 11, she hardly came around to check in on us to see if we needed anything. When it came time for the bill she wouldn't split it up for us and then disappeared for another 20 minutes for us to figure out who pays what. Eventually we got up and tracked her down to made her take down all of our orders a second time so she could make up each of our bill. We were sick of only seeing her every half hour and we were ready to leave! It almost ruined the night but once we got out we went to some better bars! Please improve the customer service because the food is delicious.

We ordered chicken and tri-tip sandwiches. I really disliked them. They were soggy which I do not think was intended. I did not like spicing on chicken--might have been dill. That might be popular in Brazil but I don't know. Not good. Tri-tip tasted like old roast beef. I do not think that the positive reviews I read could have eaten what I was served. It was not good. Mushroom fennel soup had nice aroma but was served in tall coffee mug and no soup spoon provided so had to sip and was too warm so would burn tongue. My friend thought it tasted like dirt. I really did not enjoy this meal. On top of that, half the tables had "reserved" signs on them. Once I tasted the food, I could not believe they would have return customers so think they put them there to either make place look busy or ease work of wait staff. If you don't have enough staff, just let us know then we order food which must be done prior to sitting down. I did not order their drinks but hopefully they are good because otherwise I have no idea how this place stays in business. Some reviews commented about unfriendly wait staff but ours were fine.

This outback by far has the worst service of any outback I have been to. Living in the fishhawk area with limited restaurants we give it a try over and over, but tonight will be the very last time. On  a Monday with the restaurant half full we waited 1 hr and half for our dinner. It took 40 minutes to get cheese fries as other tables were served theres before us. A blonde manager case over and apologized when she finally brought ours. Well all would be said and done but that was the beginning over our problems we waiting another 35 minutes for our food as a table of 6 that sat down 30 minutes after us received there meals. We still didn't receive our meal asked for a manager, after 10 minutes she didn't come. We wasted over 1 hr and 45 minute with no food. Unacceptable. Worst customer service I've ever received !
Apparently Monday isn't the best day to eat here. Ordered a double around 11:30 and the bun was stale as heck and hard as a rock. Cold hard fries topped it off. Head to McDonalds across the street!

Maybe it was because we were there at 4:00, but the food was mediocre, at best. I had the shrimp & grits and it was ok, but would have been better if it didn't taste left over from lunch. My friend had the gumbo and crab cakes and she wasn't impressed either.

We tried this place for the first time. Small and quaint which was nice. Service was very slow due to not enough staff. Our waiter was also the bartender and I even asked him if he was cooking too! 
Hard to get drink refills or chip refills. I got the combo plate with cheese enchilada and taco with beans and rice. It was average. 
Honestly, I probably would not come back.

Poor bedside manner from some resident students. I remember the last time I was here to get the test results and another resident student talked to me as if I'm dumb, but the way she was giving me the test results was unprofessional. She said something something "thing." I'm sorry, but aren't you a medical student? Aren't you supposed to know the terminology for what you're talking about. However, the nurse was very accommodating and nice during my recent visit. She made me feel comfortable and she was very knowledgeable about my concerns.

If you are 20, want a constant party in the rooms, want to drink all night in your hotel room, then this is the place for you. If you want to put 20 people in a room for 2 - stay here - management is ok with it. If this place was a $49 a night motel it would make sense. On the other hand, if you prefer respectful service and have moderate expectations that at $400-$500 a night a hotel will not be a fraternity house, stay somewhere else.

Filed a claim with this company for a furnace leaking CO2 into our house last friday, they claim 8 hrs to respond to emergencies, when you call they then say 24 to 48 hrs.  I never heard back period.  Called them on Tues after no furnace for the whole weekend and Temps in the 20's all weekend.  They claimed they had called one of their service companies and it must be his fault.   Ended up calling my own guy and getting the parts ordered, after reading all the other reviews I realized how awful they treat the people who buy their "warranties".  Do not use this company.

Wish I could give 0 stars!!! Came in and stood at the deli waiting to buy some salad, young man was helping a customer so I figured I was next. An older white couple came up behind us and the young lady behind the counter stopped what she was doing to help them. I guess I wasn't important enough or my skin is to dark for her to stop to help me and my daughter. I'm so tired of being treated like a second class person but thank you Safeway I will never shop at this or any other location ever.

Cute place if you are in the park looking for a quick snack.  However, if you have access to another place I'd pick something different.  The menu is small and I'm pretty sure the staff hates their job.  We popped in for breakfast before a trip to the zoo and were really disappointed.  The food was just okay, the staff wasn't friendly, and it was over priced.

Save your time/and go elsewhere. I was open to this different type off boil and was eager to give it a shot and like it. Different flavors to my crawfish sounds wonderful. But I can guarantee I'll not be going back here. I'd be willing to give that style a try again elsewhere, however. 

The prices are just absurd. I understand seafood is based upon market value but trying to sell crawfish at $8/lb and certain crab offerings at over $50 for the smallest order. Flat out robbery. Not to mention if you want sausage with your order it will run you an extra $4. Now that doesn't seem bad, but when they only serve you 4 pieces of sausage that combined equal half a sausage, you can't help but just laugh. 

On the bright side...the wall. There's an awesome swamp mural on the inside wall that uses black light to add some neat accents to it. Tonya the waitress was great and if it wasn't for her this place would have only gotten 1 star.

Could this have been any worse? No. I don't think so. 

It took over two hours to get our food. Not exxagerating. Arrived at 7 and the food didn't come out until 9. The waitress kept making crappy excuses and refusing to say what was going on or why the food was taking so long. 

When the food finally did come out, it was wholly unremarkable and utterly disappointing. The crawfish pasta and barbecue shrimp and grits were both so overly spiced, that it gave all of New Orleans a bad name. Don't get me wrong -- we LOVE cajun food. But there was an ammonia flavor that made the crawfish pasta inedible, and the barbecue shrimp was otherwise tasteless. 

To add insult to injury, the bar had the movie "Bridesmaids" playing, and literally the MOMENT the food was laid in front of us ravenous souls (remember -- TWO HOURS), the bridal fitting scene came on. If you don't know why this scene would be PROFOUNDLY inappropriate for a restaurant to be showing, Google it immediately. 

So yeah... 1 star.

This is most definitely the worst restaurant I've ever been to. The service was absolutely horrible, we had to wait an hour for our food. And that was just our first round of food we wanted. The food was way too small and salty. The waiters were very rude to us and told us to keep waiting when we asked where our food was. This was after we waited for 30 minutes. While we waited for our food, we noticed that multiple people  were storming out of the restaurant in anger. The overall experience was just horrible. I would never recommend this restaurant to anyone ever, unless I didn't like them.

Wow. How disappointing and rude this place consistently is. Let me say this. The food is really remarkable. But there are other choices and nicer restaurants who care about hospitality than this place. I have been coming for years, but I finally threw in the towel tonight. The gentleman taking our order was so condescending, it was hard to overcome the harsh severity visit. He took my order (Greek salad with warm chicken) and I added a small side of hummus. He said "it doesn't come with any bread." So then, trying to be accommodating, I offered, "that's ok, I'll use the garlic knot which comes with my Greek salad." Silence. "The salad comes with a wheat pita or garlic knot?" I asked. Even more than sarcastically, he rudely said, "Yeah, if you want." I was offended but I didn't react. I still tipped a little (for the kitchen) but I hate to say it- this is not the first time this staff has been rude to me. Historically, the curt attitude is consistently a problem here. The rudeness has to stop!! The elderly lady who was ordering after me was basically "talked over"- the young man knew someone behind her in line so he didn't engage her or thank her or welcome her. That was the part that stung the most for me. Nashville is a hospitality town. The team here has never been warm and fuzzy, so if you go looking to be treated kindly- find one of the Tazikis in town and skip this "no soup for you" type of place that really needs to step up or close down. Try kindness, it's contagious. But try any other place in town before you come to this mess of a place.

This hotel gets a 5 for location (a few blocks from Bourbon Street) and the friendly and helpful hotel staff.

The 2 stars are for the actual rooms. They are dingy - the sheets were old and the bathroom smelled like urine and wasn't cleaned well.

My husband and I checked out and went across the street to the JW Marriott, which was gorgeous with newly renovated (and clean) rooms with a great executive lounge. It was also cheaper than the Saint!

They installed my ac unit in January. Now it's blowing hot air. Their website says 24 hour emergency service 7 days a week. lol. False advertising. They said they'll come tomorrow and look at it. I hope my puppy doesn't die in my hot house. Choose a company that cares about their customers and doesn't lie about their services.

Horrible customer service. I have never felt so unwelcome in an environment before. The cashier at the register was extremely rude, and we left without any of or items. I will not be returning, and I'm discontinuing my membership. I've had better experiences at Walmart.

I've been coming to the Haddonfield location for years. I've never been disappointed by the food however recently they have hired new employees and the customer service is awful. They are not kind while taking your order and there are no smiles. I said thank you when I was handed my food and the employee just turned away without acknowledging me at all. I hope management will recognize this issue and have the employees complete some customer service training.

Very very disappointed! My husband and I visited for the first time tonight. Fish and chips were burnt and greasy. Salad was not fresh. My husband ask to speak to the manager yet he was too busy to come see us. We will Not patronize again. Sad. Good luck on your success in our area. Expectations are high.

I've never left a review before, but this is necessary. Pay attention to these reviews. I wish I would have read them before placing my order. I was quoted a two and a half order wait time, and it's been an hour after that and I'm still waiting. When I try to call the restaurant, they pick up the phone and immediately hang up. I ordered through Grubhub, and they are currently working on resolving the issue. Don't waste your time.

While I have shopped here in the past some I have always ended up at Edwards or other places for quality and pricing plus the subtle air of snobbiess here and the firm ordered client is very wealthy and dressed impeccably, if you are single working class you aren't their preferred client. However today was beyond inexcusable.  I often might be coming in before or after a workout so in workout gear.  Today I came in and was simply looking to see what items on sale (again or their ideal client as looking at sales instead of all full price). After wandering around a bit I had items in my basket and was checking out. Someone came and told me I couldn't buy a basket as it was for someone else. This basket didn't have a hold sign on it anywhere.  I was told it was a regular who was eating at he bistro and had other items on hold (again no sign). Ironically he other items I had well well more than the original price all combined.  I left because the firm attitude I got was you aren't our ideal customer and F$&@ you.  So I won't spend my money here. I encourage you to follow the lead and spend where they are kind and treat all customers equally. This is not an all customers are equal place

This experience is the worst experience I've EVER had!! We were packed like sardines! My wife is 5'4" and the stupid leaning chair in front of her was banging into her bad knee! I'm 6'4" and the person in front of me kept complaining that she couldn't recline! So of course she kept leaning forwards and smashing the chair against my knees! The kid behind me was kicking my chair and when I left, laughed at me. I REALLY tried my hardest to stay quiet and enjoy Avengers infinity wars. Thank you Regal! We've decided to never return to your theatre ever again! We will also go out of our way to tell everyone that we can, NOT to go to your theatre...

Employees walked around and one was on their phone while boxing up my order. I was quite annoyed because I don't want people touching their phone when they are touching my food. Plenty of germs when they do something like that. 

Food was not bad, but could've been ore flavorful in regards to the special chicken orders.

Awful experience.

The food is not fresh.
I went up to the counter to order. I watched in horror as the server/counter person put all of my food in the microwave oven.

Nothing was fresh. Everything was just sitting there, cold and had to be reheated. It tasted over done, with the meat being tough.
The brisket was 50% gristle and had absolutely no meat flavor. It was nothing but greasy flavor!

Mine and my husband's lunch came out to over $40.00.
I couldn't believe how expensive everything was.
I would have understood if the food was delicious, but it really was awful.

Not authentic barbeque...Terrible experience.

I ordered a new sideboard and two chair drop leaf table dining set from Bob's. I was given an initial delivery window of 3:15-7:15 and then it changed from 4:15-8:15, I was given the link to track the truck the delivery and every time I opened it the time just got further and further pushed back and the truck did not come until 8:20pm. After unloading the table and getting it together they guys started on the sideboard and realized it was damaged and had to rebox and put back on the truck. The delivery men were very unprofessional, with sagging pants and on their phones the whole time. Very unsatisfied with the entire delivery process.

Delivery of this paper is spioradic, at best. You just never know if your paper will be delivered from day to day. And sometimes,our paper ends up in the bushes, but they sure want their money , which the cost is ridiculous. Plus part of our subscription payment includes almost $50.00 for transportation fees. No use in contacting customer service. If u place a vacation hold, the paper still gets delivered but somehow stops upon your return. Awful service, to say the least.

My mom made a reservation for this past Saturday for my stepdad's 65th birthday celebration.   The reservation was made through OpenTable who had texted us that day to confirm the reservation.  When we got to the restaurant, there was a sign saying it was closed until further notice as they had no water.  I saw on OpenTable that this similar issue happened to others a few days prior.  If you are going to close down for an emergency, you should not allow people to be able to book reservations and anyone that does end up booking a reservation through a third party website should be notified immediately.  Completely unacceptable.

What a nightmare my experience has been with this office. The doctors are wonderful, the staff is horrific. This is not my first complaint, this is an ongoing situation that includes documenting false information in my child's record. The receptionist, biller and referral people are RUDE and nasty and lied. Don't give these people your money - the doctors need to find better staff!

I had scheduled an appointment for a Mani/Pedi with Gina. That morning my 4 year old woke up with a fever and I was unable to keep the appointment. I called and left a voicemail stating why I needed to cancel. I rescheduled online and when I went in, I was approached by a woman who simply said, "Do you have an appointment?" (Not a hint of friendliness). She told me to have a seat so she "could get things ready". She returned to me and stated that I needed to pay a no show fee of $15 for my missed appointment (no where did I see that policy posted). I informed her that I didn't "no show" for her appointment, but that my daughter had woken up with a fever that day and so I had left a message and rescheduled. She said that I wasted her time by not coming to my first appointment. I explained to her again what happened. She began to raise her voice (in front of customers) stating that I wasted her time. I asked to speak with a manager and she stated that she runs her own business. I would not recommend Gina at Divinity Salon to anyone. She showed no understanding, no grace and no kindness.
This place is SLOW!!  Food is good not sure if it's that good for the wait.  It needs better management

I would give this place zero stars if I could. We came in and sat down figuring we would be helped. For a solid ten minutes we were completely ignored. Folks were there working, they saw us sitting and yet still ignored. China Wok is down the street and they are amazing!

I am a long time Starbucks customer and I usually go 5-7 times a week. I use the mobile app almost every time and they still manage to get it wrong. I rarely get an acknowledged when I come in and I always always say "thank you and have a good day." I would say 1 in 20 times someone looks up with a half interest and then goes back to what they are doing. I go anywhere from 6am to 3pm and it's always the same. There was one guy working the register Sunday who was very personable.... hire more of him! I would almost rather pay the 20% upcharge at the airport just because they are friendly and always get my drink right!

Went here around lunch time. Super busy. We sat at the bar. Overwhelming smell of chicken stock.. wouldn't normally bother anyone but I am a vegetarian and that particular smell is horrid to me. Anyway, we ordered our ramen. I was excited bc they offered veggie ramen w veggie broth. We also tried the shrimp on a stick. The shrimp app was really good. Perfectly cooked too. Our soups came and I took a small spoonful before adding any extra seasonings. It was ok.. I added some diff things and went to dig in... and that's when I noticed a short black hair in it. That kind of thing really grosses me out. I pointed it out to the waitress who apologized and offered to get me a new bowl but what point would that make? It's the same soup. So I decline, she took the soup off the bill. My poor bf felt so bad about having to eat his soup while I sat w nothing. I pretty much begged him to finish it. Wish I didn't find that hair, I was looking forward to the ramen.

Yeah it's alright, kind of expensive for a sandwhich. Also they have this 15% fee so they can pay their workers that you can opt out of, but it's not like anyone is going to say "I'm not paying for your wage, I'm already giving you a tip". Also the atmosphere feels kind of stiff and pretentious. This place just rubs me wrong.
Overpriced used vehicles with missing bolts and screws. I would recommend another place.

The place was one of our favorites until they decided last year to go bigger and moved a few doors down. Last night 4 of us decided to try it again and both bar service and dining service were equally terrible. A 40 minute wait for our food, and 3 meals served and a 5 minute wait for the 4th to arrive. I had to go to the bar to get a soda refill and another drink for my wife as our waiter was spending his time socializing...especially at one of his tables of 4 girls. Three bartenders and only 1 cash register so bartenders were queued up to make change. This place could be so much better. Maybe it being in a convenient location for tourists staying across the street at Safety Harbor Resort and Spa will keep it in business without needing repeat customers.

$17 for Sunday lunch - verdict: overpriced and bland. 

We came here for all you can eat and left sorely disappointed. The rolls had too much rice and the rice wasn't even sushi rice. We also got salmon, mackerel, red clam, and salmon roe. The salmon is usually my favorite but i regretted getting that here. I could tell right off the bat by the color (pale orange) that the quality wasn't good. The mackerel was better but by better I mean barely average. 

We resorted to getting hot foods and got the hibachi steak and stir fried udon. Both came out watery and the steak was burnt to a crisp. The best part of the meal, honestly, were the sesame balls at the end which came out hot, crisp, and chewy and washed away the unsavory taste of fish from my mouth. Wouldn't come here again.

We stopped here our last night in New Orleans. Courtney our waitress was great! Food was good for the most part. 


The negative part of our visit was dealing with Kim the manager when our order was incorrect. The nasty attitude that came with her as the host informed her our order was incorrect was the downhill of customer service we received. 

If you happen to get an incorrect order don't expect for management to be much help or polite.

Fast service but one dinner forgotten. Spring rolls cold. Egg drop soup very greasy flavor. 
Not worth price ordered. 
We did delivery through HubStub. First time using this app and eatery. Not impressed at all !!
Not cheap either.
Paid 50 dollars for the worst hair cut of my life, no wash or style. Do not recommend

I wanted to try this place as it had seemed similar to The Boiling Crab I was use to in California however, this place was disappointing. Firstly, the seafood sat in a paste rather than a sauce. Secondly, service was slow for the business not to be busy. Lastly, I have the worst explosive diarrhea from this place. Between 2 days, this is the only thing that I had eaten and I'm literally on the brinks to tears because of how bad my stomach hurts. 

Definitely a waste of $110 but at least I learned a lesson to never come back.

I tried going here last Friday. Went in at 8:40 p.m. It was full. They supposedly don't close until 9:00. As we were perusing the menu, some employee came up and shooed us out. Said repeatedly, "I'm sorry, we're closed." No explanation. (Out of food? No tables available?) Just kept waving her arms and shooing us out. Not too happy about that, They will never get my business, I guess. They are $3 more expensive than Ikkyu's ramen, anyway! 

So I went to K Japanese Restaurant and had some excellent tonkotsu ramen there. Was pleasantly surprised and very pleased. It was really delicious.

Maybe one day in the very far off future, I'll forgive them enough to try again to give them my money.

I just didn't get it.  We came here as part of a little bar hop on Saturday night, and it was easily the worst spot in terms of almost everything.  It started with having to pay a cover ... really?  All of the bars before HandleBar didn't charge one, and this one was the least worthy of a cover.  Nonetheless, we gave it a shot.

We shouldn't have and should've known from the couple of songs we heard as we entered that it wouldn't be good.  I'm not sure who was DJing, but he was trying way too hard.  Songs I knew were practically unrecognizable, and I've never heard so many songs that, while decent songs, were not dance songs that he was trying to make dance songs.  It just didn't work, and the dead periods of people not dancing should have been a signal, but he remained in his own world.

I have fun even when dancing to songs I don't particularly know or know at all; here, because of the poor mixing and DJing, I was bored.  That's a problem.  Maybe this was just that night, but I likely won't be back to find out.

We had a horrible dinner and experience here. First of all the restaurant was not full at all when we stopped there Monday. We were seated and sat for at least 20 minutes and no one came to wait on us. Another couple came in after we had been there and got waited on ahead of us. We stopped one of the servers who pretended not to understand English (how can you work in Exton, Pa and not understand clear English?) but finally we got a server. The food was just awful. I've never had food that salty in my life. I told the waiter it was horribly salty and he shook his head and left. Also the waiter who gave us our food was wearing a hoodie. That was so inappropriate to wear outside clothing serving food. Our food also was served on ice cold plates. Who puts hot food on cold plates? The double cooked chicken was horrible and tasted like a mouthful of SALT. The shrimp fried rice wasn't salty but not great  either because there were clumps of white rice throughout. The veggie rolls were the only thing we didn't dislike. I can't believe CNN endorses this place because It was the worst meal I ever had out. We were so angry we didn't walk out when they took so long to wait on us. I am from out of town and am so glad they don't have this restaurant where I live.

Not a fan of casinos, I call them, "Can See No Reason to go there!" Get it CASINO reason to go... but their pool, arcade, suites and restaurants are top notch!  But I think they are ridiculously over priced on everything in the building so that's why the low score.  Locals should get a better deal!

I got #2 the Alaskan crabs legs platter w shrimp & mussels. VERY salty. The shrimp was disgusting, no type of seasoning or flavor same for the potatoes that came with. The crabs & mussels were pretty much good but the crabs were definitely cold in certain places. If i knew i was just going to eat the crabs and mussels, I would have never spent 35$ on the entire platter!!

I purchased some items from this company. First time my shipment was delayed but after several calls I finally got my product.
Second purchase was a regret. I got my body cream with the seal already broken and I tried to reach them to let them know I cannot use a product which had a broken seal. They denied and said I would have to send pictures to prove it. I did send pictures but no one replied my mails. I called them some days later..it was difficult trying to reach them.
I finally spoke to a lady who said she would send me an authorization mail to return the product. A few days later I called again because she didn't send me the mail. She finally sent it and when I read the mail, they wanted me to pay for shipping the defective item to them and also pay an additional $8.95 for them to ship me a replacement. When I told the lady that it's not my responsibility to pay for their mistake she was very rude. She said I can as well keep the product if I do not want to pay for shipping.
I regret buying from this company. I wish I had read the reviews of others I would not have been in this mess.
Please stay away unless you have enough money to throw around.

Worst service ever!  It's S&S so I don't expect a lot in the first place. But getting service is the bare minimum they could have done. They seemed like they didn't have enough people working and were very slow. Our waitress disappeared and only showed up to give us our food. I waived her down to order shakes and then didn't see her for the next 30 minutes when we decided to leave cash on the table for our first bill. I would have asked someone else for help but no one was getting helped. The entire restaurant was full of people looking for their server. We were here for an hour and never got our shakes!  I hope this review helps them get their stuff together or prevents other people from making the same mistake we did.

Ok - the French Riviera this ain't. I adore breakfast food and Riviera ( for all of the hype) could not fry an egg correctly or even make good coffee. 
     Maybe it will improve, but I think people without tastebuds have been frequenting for some time.

Lived in Tucson my entire life and had never been to Caruso's. We decided to try it the other night and was not impressed. First off you have to walk down the street that is littered with homeless people begging for money or food just to get to the door. Once inside, it is dark and very outdated. The food is ok but overpriced. Service was good. After eating, you have to walk back through all the homeless people begging for your leftovers. We will not be back.

Logans continue to serve uncooked food this was 
The 2nd time I've been sick here todays was the 
Salmon with raw broccoli
Very disappointing seem to be prepetully temporary closed. The excuse was maintained at first now what excessive heat possibly.

Not an honorable business!  Sold gift certificates for spa services that included massage and then lost ability to do this right after the holidays and wont work out a reasonable resolution!  The answer is not coming in and buying hundreds of dollars of product instead!!!! this is bait and switch!

My daughter was in desperate need for a pair of sunglasses once we arrived in New Orleans and since California Drawstrings was on the same street as out hotel, we stopped in and quickly found a pair for $20. Although my daughter usually doesn't pay $20 for sunglasses, it was the best we could do on short notice and so she purchased them. Unfortunately, the sunglasses broke 2 days later. My daughter was not happy since she paid $20 and only got 2 days of wear out of them so we decided to see if the store could help us out. We were on our way to the beach that day and working sunglasses are a must for the beach. We asked if we could just replace or repair the glasses but the lady pretended she could not remember us and said they were "cheap sunglasses and not meant for rough wear". My daughter is 17 not 7- there was no rough wear. They were rude and unhelpful. It was unacceptable that their reason for not being able to help us was that their own merchandise is cheap. A $20 pair of sunglasses should last longer than 2 days. To summarize this store was overpriced and the staff is unhelpful.

We were super excited to begin our trip to Nashville for the weekend for the Kenny Chesney concert. We had chose this hotel because of its closeness to the stadium which it is indeed SO close. When first arriving the staff was amazing, the hotel atmosphere was decent and we had smooth sailing through check in. When we got into our room it was a typical hotel room with no problems except for the carpet not being new. When checking out the pool area, the pool shaped as a guitar was really awesome! It is inside and it is heated. When actually going down to the pool we had visible saw a cockroach the size of a large finger and immediately got out. Other couples had said that they saw more than one during their stay. We had complained to the staff and they offered us a $30 discount on our $600 hotel that we paid for 2 nights and a pantry ticket that is worth 5 dollars. We did not think this was suitable for a cockroach being in the hotel so they gave us 15% off our stay. Since we saw the cockroach the night before we left we just left immediately the next day. Throughout our trip Equan (man at the front desk) was very nice! I would highly encourage you to meet this man. The second night of our stay during the night hours , the staff was RUDE. We asked for menus and asked to buy some water and during the whole process the man could not be bothered with even ringing us up. He even gave it to us at not the full price because he didn't want to be bothered with using the credit card machine so he just took the cash that we had. When walking away he kept saying "bye" with such an attitude like we were giving him a hard time. All of the women who worked at the front desk were also very sweet. Check out was quick and easy.
Caught a woman smoking a cigarette in the lobby.. mind U the lobby was close but still smoking inside the restaurant..

Call me heart broken!!!! Muriel's of my dreams has passed... I travel to Nola several times a year and Muriel's is always top on my fav places.  Unfortunately my dinner last night was sooooo bad I doubt I can recover.  

We were called to a bar side table no linen ok I thought not what want but go with it this is going to be good.  Server of team 17 came to the table and mumbled something ask 5 times for a drink order before she would bring a menu after I told her we needed to select wine after we decided what to eat... when asked about the Reds she said "I don't know but this one seems to be ordered a lot".  We waited nearly 30 mins between our soup and the app then our main course sat on a tray behind us for 12 mins.  My baby drum which is my all time fav was dry cold and burnt as well as the Sauce needed hydrated it was so salty.  Had to ask her to clear nearly every plate .. Desert was served had to ask for silverware and no mention of coffee or another glass of wine.   

Insult to injury she took CC and ran it 5 times setting off my fraud alert after clearing it with bank she ran it again and simply left it on table.  No apology not thank you nothing.

Just changed the name but I feel as though nothing else has changed....I want to like this place so bad- the food and coffee has always been good but the service is another story. No matter the time of day it always takes forever to get served no matter how many people are in line. It would be in their best interest to hire another staff to help during busy hours and that might make things a little bit easier.

This place is absolutely terrible!!!! Never go here! My first time there was a bad experience and I decided to give it another shot thinking it may have just been a one time thing. I was wrong and my second experience was worse. I ordered a burrito with only rice, beans and meat without the veggies which would seem simple enough. NOT... I took the burrito from the cashier at the drive thru window and went home to enjoy my burrito. Once I took the first bite I realized that there was nothing wrapped in the tortilla other than plain meat and they had forgotten to add beans and rice! I was in complete shock to think that someone could forget to add the basics of a burrito! I had to drive all the way back to try to get my order fixed which was super inconvenient. What's worse is that I arrived to find the door locked a few minutes before they were supposed to actually close (It was a late night meal). I went through the drive thru in hopes that they would help me there but they didn't. The person inside saw me at the window and did not acknowledge me even though they weren't officially closed. Long story short I called several times with no answer and knocked on the drive thru window at the same time. After a million calls they finally picked up the phone, came to the window and "fixed" my order. They still didn't make the bean, rice and meat burrito correctly. Just a huge joke.

BEWARE! Franklin American Mortgage (FMA) outsources their marketing to an outdated services bureau. They require direct mail to do simple things like pay monthly bills in two bi-weekly installments. Working on attempt #4 to get them to apply the full mortgage payment of escrow to cover "their risk" for me making my monthly payment over two payments each month. They've sat on a 2K plus payment for two years and lost my paperwork twice.

A very poor example of a local Philadelphia bar. We thought there was hope then the owner said they were closed at 9:05PM for a celebration eagles Super Bowl beer. No respect!!!!!! Fly Eagles fly!!! We will find "that"Brewerytown spot!

Was there for lunch this past Sunday. Placed order and after waiting an hour four our food, decided we'd waited long enough and got up and left. Our order was anything but out of the ordinary....... a bowl of gumbo, a bowl of oatmeal with fresh fruit and a chicken salad sandwich. We weren't the only ones having a problem. There were two other diners that also were fed up with the wait and left after waiting a little longer than we had. If I could rate the restaurant ZERO stars, I would.

The food is decent (hit or miss) but the management leaves a lot to be desired! The owner is rude and does not cater to the customer's needs. I'm not sure why it should take 1 1/2 hrs to get 3 salads delivered! Did I mention they were being delivered 1/4 mile away. I called to ask where our food was and she said "it's on it's way - GOODBYE" and hung up. My office has given this place ample opportunities but it's always the same story. The owner will actually argue with you over the phone! Sorry - but they won't be receiving our business anymore

Below average for me. I got Mongolian beef no rice extras veggies and it had no flavor. I had chewy meat drenched with soy glaze. I got a regular size that was supposed to come with 7oz of protein it was more like 4. I had way too many mushroom. I ordered to go had no fork or napkins in my bag. That is $12 i wish i had back.

my friend and i went to lunch on sept 4 2018. we ordered nachos and quesidellas.   well the nachos came out cold and cheese was melted disgustingly so we sent it back.  the waitress then gave us cheese steak rolls which are normally great. they were slit open and burnt. i had a conversation with the manager and she was rude and did nothing for us like comp some of our meal. we paid 27.00 for less than perfect food and it was a waste of time and money. i feel they need a new chef too. will not go there again and they should have given us money off our bill but they are too cheap for that kind of respect for my friend and i.

Have you ever eaten food from one of those sketchy Freddy Krueger looking gas stations in the middle of BFE New Jersey? You know the places where you just know you can't make it out of there without at least a touch of something that will make your belly swim around the stink tank for a couple of days? Well if you want that same experience but without the drive or risk of loss of life this place has got you covered. 

Completely average, yet very dry, cheesesteak with a very nice wait staff that refused to provide us any water with our meal. Enjoy!

Over 13 deep in the curbside pickup. The waitress tells us that they are 60 minutes behind and that they were calling all their customers. We never received a phone call, so now we sit and wait.......never again outback

Smallest portions ever! Spent $230+ on 2 people (only 2 glasses of red wine, the rest was food). We are still hungry!Food was good but not Volver good for the pricing they are charging. Instagram pictures are completely misleading. The portions are ridiculously small compared to the yummy looking close up shots they post on social media. The food isn't even that great! Its OK. Sooo not worth the price. Nobody is inside this place either! I wonder why! Skip this place and save your money for somewhere better. Feel very ripped off!

Terribly managed and dirty. Got undercooked chicken once that made me sick. Came another time (today) and my wife got a long black hair in her meal. They are also frequently out of basic toppings like raw onion. This franchise is a great concept with a lot of potential, but needs new management.

I was not blown away by the taste how the photos were depicted. And the ice cream was blah. The cake was dry. I took my clients here for desserts. The cake needs to be moist and the ice cream needs to be creamier and smooth and needs more sweetness.

Was visiting Philly for the weekend with a few friends. We were told this was a fun place to go to. We all walked in and one of our friends got stopped and asked why he did not pay the cover, he said he did not realize there was one and offered to pay it. They decided that was not good enough and grabbed him to physically remove him from the bar, he left with no resistance. It was unclear if there was even a line for a cover and the rest of us were not asked to pay it. After removing our friend from the bar he asked why they removed him and that he had no problem paying the cover, the bouncers then physically threatened him if he did not leave the area.

This restaurant is poorly run from a business standpoint.  They turned away 3 different parties (10 customers) close to an hour before actual closing at 3pm just because all the tables were occupied and not because they ran out of food which might be more understandable.  

If they want to close by 3pm, they should change their closing time to 2pm and still take customers until 2pm rather than turn customers away between 2-3pm.  It just leaves a bad impression on customers and builds a poor reputation.

They are always rude and unprofessional. Who answers the drive thru "help you?" With an attitude mind you. Except for a few that have been there for years who really are friendly. They like to close whenever they want too. I've pulled up at 8:30 with them being closed already.
Ok we stopped here on a Thursday the day the Bolts were playing in the playoffs. The service was horrible and the food was equally bad. Enough said try another spot close by!

So far,  very under impressed with this property.  Here for a conference.  Try to order room service at 9pm and told it will be at least an hour wait.   Worst part is when I talked to the manager was told that they are NOT understaffed.  This means they plan on service this poor. You expect more for $300/ night.

I was in the Music City for a business meeting and this place is located across the street from the Inn at Opryland which is the hotel I stayed at. A friend and I went for lunch on a Saturday.  It was pretty busy and there was a 15-20 min wait. We gave my name and sat in the bar for a bit until they called us. Once we heard our name, we got up immediately and approached the counter where we checked in. Turned out someone else claimed our reservation! So we had to wait longer. We finally got a table and ordered. I got a ceasar salad with fried chicken. The salad came absolutely swimming in dressing. It was wilted from moisture and all I could taste was dressing. The chicken was excellent.  I could have sent it back for a redo but I was totally over the place by then. Totally not worth the wait or the money.

Kellys was great. Not now! It has changed hands and lost its spark and costs more.  They now have a very ugly dog as the logo they did away with the whimsical stuff like unique salt and pepper shakers. And they changed Kellys breakfast special and deleted the pancakes and OJ. To get the original Kellys special is $7 more.  Now it is about  $20 for what was $10.  Why change an iconic landmark for the worse.  Terrible decisions. I use to rave about Kellys not anymore. There's lots of other options where food is just as good and costs much less.  It's always a shame to see am owner try to inflict on customers what they like versus giving the customer what they like.

This McDonald's is a disgrace, I was in there July 4,2018 around 11pm I walked in and after ordering the very large group of black youths (30 or more)surrounded me and started yelling gay slurs and harassing me.i asked for help from the girls behind the counter as I was waiting 20 minutes and no way out for me to leave, they ignored me. No manager showed herself till the incident was over. I called the police as I was being threatened. The out of control young adults  robbed my iPhone and ran out mocking and celebrating. I spoke to McDonald corporate office and GM they did nothing to help or compensate me in anyway! The Gm spent more time telling me he was a minister and how his car was broken into near that same store days before.
This store and McDonald needs to be held responsible for actions that occur in there store.#mcDonalds #dotherightthing

On Saturday after a round of golf, I along with my father and brother found our way into Rusty's close to the golf course. We've been hearing good things about the restaurant, so my brother ordered a personal small plain cheese pizza and my Dad and I ordered a medium sausage and mushroom pizza. The pizza my Dad and I ordered was cooked on a perforated pan (which is a shortcut to getting a good crust) and it was really cooked unevenly. And another thing: The pizza my brother ordered was so small, it was just about the size of one slice and the pizza my Dad and I ordered wasn't enough for one person, let alone two people. In short, we were not very impressed with Rusty's, we had better pizza at "Pizza My Heart" and even "Round Table" pizza was superior. We won't be going back to Rusty's anytime soon.

Richard Parsial and Elijah provided me with the worst customer service I have Ever experienced. I was quoted $120 by Elijah and later he told me it would actually be $160!! After repeating the $120 quote multiple times he said he couldn't do anything. So I asked to speak with a supervisor and then I was transferred to Richard. Richard said he was sorry and he could only offer me 3 months of HBO for free. I then told Richard I would like to talk to his manager and he hung up on me. In my opinion that is completely unprofessional and disrespectful. No customer should have to go through such an experience. I hope management investigates into this case and takes action. I also believe Richard and Elijah should be trained on customer service and the services they offer.

I came into the restaurant because I was looking for the pizza shop but the cashier advised me that it was closed. I took a chance at ordering from somewhere new and even though the takeout service was great and the food looked amazing, the falafel and the lemon potatoes were so salty I could finish my meal. 

I'm hopeful that the chef's will be less generous with the salt for the next batch.

Great price for freshly prepared food and the portions were so big, I was able to split the sandwich and potatoes with my guy. 

The regular pita was super soft and they made the sandwich with the right proportions that it wasn't soggy after carrying it to 5th and South.

Do not stay here!
We were a bit hesitant in staying here from other reviews but we decided to give it a chance because I had a coupon and we were only going to stay one night. I have to say the front desk staff was nice. He took us to 3 different rooms before we agreed to take one because the other rooms were damp/moldy smelling. This was the complaint of others too. He explained that they had some trouble with the indoor pool when they switched to the saline type and some how that caused the dampness in the rooms. I can't see how that would happen but the pool was out of commission while we were there. We went out to dinner then came back to shower and go to bed. Well, there were no fans in the bathroom and there was mold on the ceiling in the bathroom and near the sink there was also mold there that apparently someone had applied the clear caulking over. So that had to have been there for awhile. The shower water stream was so weak it took forever to take a shower.
There was a breakfast in the morning with bland tasting egg patties, chicken patties, biscuits and waffles for the hot items, then had the other usual continental foods. 
My husband was the only one who ate the chicken, I assume it was bad because he threw up about 30min later.
The coupon wasn't worth it. We should have heeded the warnings of others.
I know I will in the future.

They ruined the poutine, it used to be amazing and then for some inexplicable reason they abandoned the tater tots!!!! And don't even get me started on those awful wooden forks. They ruined the only reason I went there. For shame.

I stopped here to have lunch with my family.  The waitress brought us room temp tap water in a cup with no ice & no straw.  I had to ask 3xs for a straw.  We ordered & I wanted pork fried rice instead of reg fried rice, the waitress took issue with that.  I told her I didn't care about an up-charge that was fine, I just wanted pork fried instead.  Then I requested my spring roll not to b Shrimp bc I'm allergic & she was strange about that.  We got our food n ate.  I was not impressed the food was ok.  The pork in my rice was fatty & just not good. My veg spring roll had nothing in it no veggies.  Everyone's food was mediocre.  Next thing we know a party of 10 walk in & guess what they get..... lunch special menus.  We were not given that menu or option to view it when we were seated.  Had I paid less for my mediocre food & service I might have not been so upset.  When we asked the waitress about why we were not given lunch menus she said " you need to ask for it".  Since when is it my job & not the waiters job to ask them about specials.  Any other place will inform you about special either for lunch or of that day.  I will not be going back here & I don't nor will I recommend it to anyone.

Where to start. I had a friend tell me that Glory Days made the best monte cristo theyd ever had. Then I was informed they had chicken and waffles. Even though their inspection report was not that great... I decided to risk it. When I arrived, I was greeted by a young hostess. She was kind. I was walked to a small carpeted area in the back that wreaked musty smells of grease and dirt. The menu was heart attack food at its best. Against my better judgment I ordered a monte cristo and waffles & chicken to go. When the food came out it looked alright. The cristo sandwich is served with fried chips. The chips were crispy but tasted old as hell. Maybe bad grease or bad potatoes. The sandwich had more bread and grease than actual cheese and meat. It was $11.99 and not really worth it. It also came with a side of raspberry jelly. The jelly tasted off. I love raspberry jelly. This jelly had a funky tangy sour taste. It reminded me of old rotten fruit. They may need to replace that jelly. Just saying. I ate half a sandwich and gave the rest away. No thanks.  The chicken and waffles was subpar. Its basically 4 or 5 chicken tenders served with 2 waffles that are broken up into triangles. They drizzle syrup on the chicken and you're given syrup for the waffles.  I've had real fried chicken and waffles at Roscoes in Los Angeles. This was not that. 
I would leave one star but the waiter was really generous. So the waiter gets a star. 
This place has potential. Get rid of the carpet or shampoo it because it STINKS. Replace your raspberry jelly. Put more meat on your monte cristo. Oh and why was the cristo on 5 grain bread. Eww. The texture was way odd. Serve chicken and waffles with actual fried chicken..not tenders. Also the waffles were not good. I will not be back.

Would've loved to try the food but didn't get to. 

My friend called to make reservations and was told that she didn't need to worry about making one, it wouldn't be that busy (even though it was a Friday evening). Our party showed up and, sure enough, it was incredibly busy. 

Awkwardly stood by the door for a few minutes as we weren't sure if we needed to wait to be seated and most tables were full. Finally managed to stop a waitress (who was just going to walk by us?). She told us it would be a thirty minute wait (also have a hard time believing that as there was no one else waiting to be seated, but whatever). Another waitress heard us talking and said there was on open table towards the back we could sit at, it just needed to be cleaned. Then they both walked away to attend some other tables. 

... So was there a wait? Should we sit down at the table? Should we wait for someone to clean it first? 

We ultimately ate somewhere else. Would not have minded waiting as I understand it was busy. Just frustrating that we attempted to make a reservation to avoid waiting and then the staff was unhelpful when we arrived. Maybe will try again another time as those who were eating seemed to enjoy their meals.

If you like cold food please go & enjoy yourself.   Worse service & food.    They don't deserve a star at all.   Save your money & eat that two year old can of Campbell's tomato soup.   You will be better off trust me!

The food is fine, the ambiance is good.  That being said, the service is wretched.  I stayed at the Marriott where the restaurant resides, on 8/22-8/26.  We had three bad experiences all related to service over that time.  From slow service, to really rude service, to just simply incapable service. We even tried to get a quick meal the 4th time, and gave up after 45 minutes.
