We asked the bartender on our way out what the deal was, and she explained that if she served us, that she would have to serve everyone around us..... kind of sums up the whole place.

STAY AWAY!! This is the absolute WORST Wingstop around, and the owner has been told directly. He doesn't care. He shouldn't run a business. 1. The employees are shitty. Rude. 2. The food is never actually hot. Always cold. 3. The fries are soggy, no matter how you order them. Well done or not. 4. They like to randomly close early, and claim employees just walk out. 5. Tonight we call, and they are out of traditional wings. We gave in, and ordered boneless. They call right back, and say "we are also out of fries" like what??? LOL. This place is a joke. Save your money.

this is my second review of this restaurant. and i just had to take the time to review it and it's been awhile since i've been there and i highly doubt that i will go back and this is why i'm putting this in bold letters. upon my immediately arrival to this restaurant i brought acquaintance of mine, that we used to always go out and dine together so when she had recommendations and i did i would always pass them along and vice versa. this was one of my suggestions. bad mistake i brought my service dog as usual as he follows me everywhere. i immediately asked for the first lady that had greeted me on my prior visit with such warmth and treated my service dog as one of hers as well and was greeted with the most rudest, poor excuse of a server i've ever met. not only did she treat me and my dinner guest as inconveniences but i could hear her whispering to her fellow employees that my service dog was probably fake and other little nasty comments. i was two seconds away from slapping all my documentation interface proving that he is real that i have for my dr and all the tags that he has on his body but i chose to hold my composure and show her that i was more then a lady then  she would ever be. i was raised with much more respect than that people that bring in these fake service dogs piss me off so much that those of us that really have a disability and need them get looked at crazy and get the nasty snotty comments from immature non educated people like my server was. little did she realize my dinner guest had not seen my service dog in years as he has known her since he was 6 weeks old and he is now 12. so never judge the outside of a person. but once he got his missing out of the way he set politely by my side in his bed and patiently waited for us to finish. our meals were absolutely disgusting and did the waitress yeah she was a waitress not a server tell us that the lasagna could serve two people no she did not. but it was slapped on a plate and looked like slop. my pizza was burnt and look nothing like the first post that i showed you. this review definitely got a 1 and please know if i had a choice to give it a negative something it would have because not only was i treated and my dinner guest treated with the utmost disrespect i would never show my face in this place ever ever ever again.  funny people show many faces, i'm pretty sure sure she showed her face to get her job. then her true colors came out. i wonder how many times true colors really do shine.

I used to love Hatt Places but this hotel is terrible! Where to begin?!

The "cage free eggs" come from a bag and are microwaved to become warm, and then placed in a ditch oven to appear homemade. They tasted and looked disgusting. Sort of like they came from a bag. 

Next the room was dirty and old. Dust balls in the corner and surrounding the edges of table legs. 

Next, the tv is from like 1996 and most of the few channels available were unable to be watched because thy were so fuzzy! 

Next, the WiFi sucks

Next, the bathroom is so small you can't sit on the toilet and close the door. 

Next, the shower is old and small and the ceiling is seriously low and dirty. You feel like you're in a prison in there. 

Next the mini fridge doesn't have a freezer component. 

Next a glass of wine (maybe 4-5oz pour costs $10. 

I will definitely never stay here again. I travel weekly for work and basically live in hotels. 

I am absolutely shocked that a Brentwood, TN hotel looks like this. I can't believe a Hyatt looks like this. 

Terrible!

Giving 2 stars for price only
They have no handicapped parking. Horrible customer service. I've stayed at many embassy suites and this one seems to be on the same level as a motel 6.
The worst! Filled with homeless people. So, they treat everyone like homeless. Very rude service! Even if you're a paying customer.

After reading great reviews, I decided to try their chicken pita sandwich. First of all, it took over 45 minutes to make JUST my sandwich, it didn't even come with a salad. The chicken was super tough, bland and tasteless, just gross. I can't believe the reviews for this place! It was over $10 just for the sandwich. Bad day or just bad?

Lifelong customer of Ya Ya's and entered with a simple bogo "any" chicken dinner coupon w/a friend. Was told coupon was only for 2piece dinner- by staff. There were no stipulation fine print that states you could not do a 4piece, no sign in store, so I simply asked for a managers opinion. The staff stated they understood and told me a owner was only one present, even better I thought. Well... the "owner" walks into the front order area from the dining room and immediately asks "is there a problem" like he was bouncing at a nightclub or something- total tough guy approach- ridiculous customer service. I asked about the coupon and its lack of clarity on the 4piece, "owner/bouncer" had no logical answer at all and just wanted to argue, now in front of 5 more customers, some holding same coupons.... Will never return unfortunately- sad to see a owner act like a bouncer and lose a lifelong customer at a chicken place of all places...............

Eat at Moto if you like eating long dark hair with your salad: the most convulsing eating experience ever!  I have a shaved head - no hair! The long dark hair was never mine, nor my wife's - she's a blonde. But don't worry, staff will quickly comp your salad if you discover a hair in it. Hell, they offered free deserts post meal: we passed, thanks!  Did race have anything to do the hair?  Related service was poor and not up to established standards. Never again!

Worst "Mexican food" I've had in a while.

How is this rated so highly?!?! Am I missing something?! I made sure I checked the Yelp before hand...these people must have pretty low standards.
Facts:
Chili verde pork was bland.
Chips were cold and unsalted.  
Margaritas were overly sweet and not enough booze.
Enchiladas - sauce was FLAVORLESS.
Rice - also FLAVORLESS.
Could not make me a ground beef chimichanga?  Never had this problem before anywhere else.???
Subbed in shredded beef, at least that had flavor- but the chimi was over cooked and the tortilla was burnt on the outside.
Served with the TINIEST portion of sour cream and flavorless guac possible.  
Only thing decent was the beans.
Would NOT DINE HERE AGAIN EVER.

This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel. The first time we stayed here back in June we had three rooms and all were awesome and the service was amazing, we thought this was our new favorite hotel! We just checked in today for our second stay and we have two rooms. We booked rooms with balcony's and the front desk said we would have the balcony's we paid for. We got to our rooms and neither had balcony's and the rooms were a quarter of the size of the rooms from before. And NO BALCONY!! Also the bathroom in both rooms look like they haven't been cleaned in a week, there was stuff on the floors and showers. We called and they said to call back in the morning? For 564 a night.. then one of the handles of the toilets is literally hanging off and barely works. Last time we stayed there was robes in the rooms and this this there was not and after calling the front desk the lady said she wasn't sure if the robes came with the rooms or not. There is also no fridge you can use and no fans in the bathrooms. The bathroom walls and glass and completely see through so make sure you're comfortable with the person you're staying with! We had to learn the hard way the first time! There is no fitted sheets in the beds (one mattress has a stain) also which is a extremely weird as the sheet slides off while you're sleeping and you are laying on a mattress pad. Also if you need ice don't expect them to bring it to you for at least an hour. We will never stay here again after spending a few thousand on the rooms for the weekend and getting terrible service. Also the bartenders we have came across this stay were extremely rude. Save your money for a luxury hotel because this is not it. Also forgot to add both rooms have had workers come in without knocking and saying sorry they didn't think the room was occupied. I feel extremely uncomfortable with that. Update- the bathrooms have still have not been cleaned and the ceiling in one room is leaking and soaked!
The Crab claws and Red Fish were delightful, however the fish basket (catfish fingers) were bland. Our Serve was Nelly (probably not spelled right) and she was amazing, super friendly and engaging!

Worst restaurant meal ever! My Grouper sandwich was acceptable, neither better or worse than other places. The bun and dressing were straight out of the supermarket. BUT, my wife's shrimp po-boy was completely inedible. When we complained to the waiter, he said he couldn't do anything. So we complained to the manager who very reluctantly adjusted our $ 60 bill by $ 5. We waited for a table for at least 45 min on a Thursday. Many tables were open, but apparently they didn't staff them What a waste of time and money. Never going there again.

Disappointed this time. Loved this place, and have come for many years. Today the service wasn't great. Yes I understand it was busy but the waitress got our drinks and we ordered.  Then we didnt see her again until we're almost completely done the meal. Still thirsty;-(. Sorry we weren't a bigger party

we came here based on a recommendation.  we arrived and got seated pretty fast.  it took about 10 minutes before anyone even took our order. and she was rushing us through the order taking process so fast that my gf didn't even get to finish talking before she started to ask me what i wanted.  once the order got put in, it took about 30 minutes before the food came out.  i got the eggs Benedict, which was trash.  it was missing one full egg and was only egg white on muffin and the other egg was way over cooked.  and then had the most amount sauce that any Benedict should have.  no one ever came to check on us and see how the food is/was, no one came to ask if we needed refills, which we did.

once we were done eating we stacked our plates neatly and waited and waited and waited a little more for our check.  nothing.  got looked over and walked past multiple times. finally our server came back after what was probably her break sipping her drink and asked if we were ready for our check.  hrmm what ever gave you that idea?  that service was hands down the worst I've ever had in a very long time.

I'm a bit of a donut connoisseur, but im not a donut snob.

The donuts here were not great. They were just okay. I would put them in the "specialty topping" category of donuts, which groups them with donut chains like Voodoo or Psycho Donuts (donut with toppings like bacon,  oreo crumbs, etc)

Also, the biscuits weren't that flavorful and my fiance thought the same.

I went out of my way to check this place out, but now i'm here telling you that you don't have to do the same and i would recommend you PASS on this place.

I was going to give this a two star rating, but i really would never come back here and would probably prefer any other donut alternative. Sorry! Again, this rating is purely against the food + uniqueness + taste + my chances of coming back.

to inquire about amenity, I called the front desk at 9:39 a.m. on Oct 31, 2018. 

The women's response is "I don't know.", which sounded shockingly unprofessional. 

She should have at least put me on hold to inquire some senior people when she did not know. I am not sure if she had an attitude or was not properly trained. 

This is the predominant reason for me to end up avoiding this place  for my trip to Nashville, as I feel her level professionalism may likely be an indicator of the service level of Hyatt Place Nashville/Brentwood

Food took about 45 minutes. Also the order was not correct. Worst part was i got food poisoning. Do not get the seafood Benedict! Worst way to spend your jazz fest. Avoid this place, or do not order anything with seafood.

The food was extremely delicious. Unfortunately the service was very very poor. We received one refill on our drinks which was brought to us by one of the managers rather than our server. We waited 10 minutes for our server to pick up our credit card and then another 10 for her to bring it back.

Very disappointed. Went there today for a slice of triple berry cake....bugs were flying in the case with the cakes. Decided I'll get ice cream instead, the girl waiting on me, had very long hair and nails, no gloves, long sleeves, she leaned over into the case to scoop the ice cream, her hair was hanging down over all the other containers, her sleeves were in the ice cream container that she was scooping mine from. I told her don't worry about it and went to Baskin Robbins!!!!!
Rude customer service. Doors for the dining room were locked during business hours with no explanation or signs.

Went in to have some dinner on December 15th.  We were sat down at booth with only 4 of us.  Waited for 20 minutes nobody even came over an asked us if we wanted drinks.  There were waiters and waitresses walking around and it was not real busy as there were open tables.  Nobody said a word to us, ended up leaving.

Went in again to try again on Jan 1, did get some service this time however whatever they clean their floor with is the wrong cleaner and they could have a law suit on their hands.  Walking on the floor I had to walk very carefully as my shoes were slipping very easily, I had to stand with my feet very close together in order from them not to spread apart.  My son got up to use the restroom and fell because of the floor.  Luckily he was not injured.  I had to wait a few minutes for a manger to mention the slippery floor.  When mentioned she claimed that yes it is a problem and asked if I wanted to fill out an accident report.  I would have if I already did not have a prior engagement.

I love the wing lovers meal.  It is what I eat at El Pollo Loco.  Rarely is it not available.today I'm sick, and that is what sounded good.  Not only did the restaurant say no they couldn't have it today, but when I asked again. They said enfatically NO!  If there is an item guest enjoy then the restaurant should plan on having enough to provide to their guests.  Off to KFC I go.

Zero would be a better rating. In 56 years I have not seen such a scam job as this. They wanted to charge me double the price of a new air-conditioning system and told me I needed to replace all of my duct work. The tech showed me pictures of areas where my ductwork was ripped or torn, and I just had it all repaired two months ago. I would not be surprised if she went up there and tore it herself. Anyone who says their quote is only good if you buy today and install the next day because they miraculously had just one more spot open "tomorrow" is a good indicator of a scam job. They promote all of these guarantees in order to justify their price, but from reading these reviews it is obvious they have no intention of following their own guarantee. The back-and-forth "negotiation" with her boss on speakerphone was unbelievable. Stay away. You can do much much better by going to recommendations from the app Next Door. I am flabbergasted that Home Depot would affiliate themselves with this company in order to boost their credit services and have written to Home Depot about my experience.

Oops this establishment has declined quite a bit.  We have visited the arcade over the years with different owners.

The staff is always great.

 Ownership should make the following improvements:  1.  the equipment is just horrible.  It is almost frustrating with the poor reliability.
2.  The big wheel is the only legit point getter. But the spinner is just plain worn out.
3.  There are paper tickets and electronic tickets that can't be combined.
4.  The games with grabbers are really bad.
5.  The ball dropping games also stink.
6.  The bowling game is a huge mistake
7.  Also the points seemed to be a bit confusing and one of our players felt lied to.

Simon should seriously expect more from this arcade.

Prior to arriving at their beach front restaurant for lunch, drinks, and sunshine I emailed the address provided on their eventbrite advertisement. I simply asked "if entry fee needed to be paid if we arrive prior to 3:00p.m." (the ad stated $10 entry for an event at 3:00p.m.) The employee responded "no ma'am, wrist bands could be picked up upon entry" Upon arrival I was told if we didn't pay $25 each we wouldn't be allowed to stay for the event and to enter it would be $10  to stay until 6:00p.m. even though it was 1:15p.m. I explained the situation about my email correspondence and the employee (Devone) stated if we had gotten there at 1:00p.m. we could have gained free entry. Confused and wanting to obtain a correct answer I went inside to speak to a manager. Kenneth at the front desk met us with an immediate rude demeanor. When I explained why id like to speak to a manger he snatched my phone with the emailed on it stated "The manager won't want to come out to see this email I need to take it back to "her." He returned stating the person who emailed me assumed I was staying the night at the hotel and not just a customer of the restaurant. I reaffirmed and pointed out in the email I never stating that I was staying the night at the hotel and would like to speak to manager about this issue since we are paying customers of restaurant and have visited this establishment many times. Kenneth stated entry is NEVER free at ANY TIME and that I was lying about the previous time I gained free entry. He refused to ask the manager to come out and speak to me because determined my issue insignificant to their business. If proper information was given we would have gotten there before 1, or paid the $40 in advance, but based on misinformation we were charged $100 with not so much as a sorry for the misundertsanding. Plenty of other beach bars in Florida who honor their words and treat all customers equally. I'll spend my vacation else where next time.
Horrible customer service. Lie and try and cheat you out of a fair deal. Care more about making a profit than a fair deal based on KBB value. Will not recommend to anyone on social media or anywhere

I came here for lunch on New Years day with my family.  It was an extremely disappointing experience.  We arrive shortly before noon, less than 30 minutes after they opened.  It was not busy at all.  We stood at the front door for about five minutes waiting for a hostess.  There was a woman on the phone but although she saw us she did not acknowledge us at all.  There were a hand full of employees standing at the bar just chatting.  They kept looking in our direction but no one offered to seat us.  After waiting I asked if we should just seat ourselves (first time visitor) and the bar tender very rudely responded that we need to wait for the hostess.  When the hostess finally acknowledged us she told us that the kitchen was "broken" and that they could only serve a handful of items off the menu.  We decided to stay and ordered some sandwiches, nachos, and salads.  Pretty limited offerings.  Half of the food was brought out and then there was about a five minute wait for the rest of the food to be brought out.  The food was mediocre and although our waitress was nice and apologetic, the service was very slow considering the restaurant was nearly empty.  Overall, extremely disappointing.

I swear to god they have messed up my coffee 5 times in a row it's like a joke to me now lol idk WHY i dont learn my lesson. I have never had one good experience here. The customer service sucks and you can just tell that the employees don't give a crap about their jobs. It's pretty sad that this location is 5 min from my home but i will definetly be going elsewhere now.

There was such high hopes for this establishment.  After speaking with Keagen  (the manager on duty) it was discovered that this place does not run well.  
The Bartender only focuses on patrons at the bar and the Server is given the task of taking orders, making drinks and delivering the food.  

Food: Small portions for the price you pay. 
Drinks: Bartender made my drink and gave it to another customer as he "forgot" who he was making the drink for.

It appears that everyone is busy doing something but nothing at all.  

You never know who you are servicing and today was was a huge let down.   I hope that the future brings better training and management. 

Good luck.

I have read the reviews for this Dunkin before, I knew they were bad. However I was driving by and when the mood for a donut hits you, you stop. I guess i figured that a few glazed donuts would be fine, how hard is it to screw up a plain ol' glazed donut. Well they must be masters because they were the worst glazed donuts I have ever had. It was like they were already a few days old and dry but the glaze at one point had just been water... no sticky white goo enrobing tender circles. It was pathetic. How they have been open this long with how terrible they are is beyond me.

Put up a freaking sign on the drive thru entrance if there will be a minimum of 10mins wait so it will give customers a chance to get out! Don't keep people trapped in your drive thru and waste time waiting!

So, I have this friend. He's one of the best people I know. But, he has one flaw. No matter what the reality is, if he makes his mind up on something he will dig his heels in and refuse to admit that he might be wrong.

That's how I feel about your food Yards. It's just not good. Miso soup? Who are you trying to be? Those wings? Honestly, just stop. Against my better judgement I stopped back in...I wound up trying your food for a 4th time. It just makes me so sad. 

To all you yelpers out there. You should and must support this establishment. Please, drink the beer...the brewer is a master at his craft. The chef??? Well, let's just say he's trying. Albeit too hard.

Gross as all life. Please do not believe the hype. The chicken is NOT seasoned. They didn't include the spice seasoning on our food, nor the side condiments we asked for. Sides are terrible. If you want a pound of sugar in your potato salad, go here. Spaghetti? Gross. Mac and cheese had more pepper than the chicken we received. Worst ever!! Truly had to redeem ourselves after wasting time here.

Made a take out order and requested extra eel sauce. They charged me for the eel sauce (no other sushi place I've been to has ever done this) I didn't think much of it until I got home and saw they didn't even put any eel sauce on my sushi so there wasn't even any extra sauce to charge me for. Once I actually started eating the sushi I discovered it was dripping wet. DISGUSTING. I called and complained and the manager said they would refund the 50 whopping cents for the eel sauce but that's it. After tip and all, I ended up paying 23 dollars for three rolls of wet sushi. NEVER GOING BACK.

I was so disappointed with my food last night. The wedge salad was my starter and it good but what was to follow was probably the worse meal I have had in a while. The chicken piccata had a light egg omelette on it and the corn hash underneath was weird, the mash potatoes had no flavor. So bad. The hanger steak had to much liquid smoke or something on it that took away all the flavor of the meat. The salad on the steak plate was good. The staff friendly and the waiter did not ask because I think he knew- both plates went back barely touched and he didn't ask. But the bill was $70. My kids and I left hungry sad to say.

Disappointing. I was so looking forward to trying the Chadds Ford Tavern but unfortunately it was obvious from the moment we walked in the door this was not going to be all we had hoped for. We had a reservation and arrived about 5 minutes ahead. The hostess was rude. She didn't greet us and I felt we were not welcome and that we were inconveniencing her. We were sat at a high top in the back bar which is not ideal for dinner but we had no choice. Sadly, our server was just as miserable. The food is expensive, which we knew going in. I don't mind paying for a good meal, especially when the atmosphere is enjoyable, but I do have a problem playing for hastily re-fired food served by people that seem to think you're lucky to even get that. I did speak with the manager that  confirmed the dish was indeed a re-fire. Not acceptable from a place that's putting themselves out there as a five star establishment. We do not plan on going back.

We must be absolute gluttons for punishment.  Either that or our pictures are on the wall with a sign reading "Ignore and give horrible service to."  So three of us went in there to grab a quick bite.  Feeling like something different, I ordered the margarita which was decent but came out with no salt on the glass.  50 MINUTES LATER, our two orders of snack size wings and the appetizer tacos had not yet arrived.  We asked the waitress just to bring the check and wrap our food.  A person, I'm guessing the manager, came over and wrote my name on a piece of paper and said that the next time we come in there would be a store credit for us since we had already paid the bill.  I do not know if we will return to see if they honor what they say.  But seriously, we ordered basically 3 appetizers and it took almost an hour?  That was ridiculous.

The owner with the locks , acts like he is too good to speak to new people. I remember the OLD walts on Pine, he was more humble. The wings are dried out, lacking the original recipe. Not worth it anymore.

They had the most disgusting veggie hoagie that I have ever tasted. Yuck!! I complained that the vegetables tasted like they came from the can and the person at the counter could careless. I will NEVER buy anything from this store again...if anyone wants a GOOD veggie hoagie go to Antonio's in south Philly.

Went through drive thru for two drinks. Ordered a large diet cherry limeade and a small strawberry lemonade. Received drinks and drive off. When I tasted the diet cherry limeade it was awful! Tasted of chemicals and soda water. There were no limes in it either (minor detail). So I called and spoke to manager. I informed him the syrup must be out on diet soda and the drink tasted of chemicals so they might want to check it out. He said ok and hung up. Where's the "can we fix it for you" or a simple sorry? I wasn't demanding or mean. I was just trying to prevent another customer from getting a gross drink.  A little customer service goes a long way.

Came across Miucha on yelp and decided to try this new boba place. The menu is very different from traditional boba places, with a cool hang out/first date vibe. However, the drinks were disappointing. My friend got traditional milk tea w boba- it tasted very bland and diluted. I got the rose oolong tea with boba and sea salt foam. The foam was so salty and didn't mix well with the drink, so there was a layer of leftover foam that I couldn't stomach. Great place for instagram pics though!

The service at this sports bar has always been slow and they get the orders wrong a good percentage of the time. I have ignored it until now as they are close and food is good. This weekend's experience left a sour taste in my mouth. I ordered nachos but asked for the peppers and onions to be left off. When food arrived the nachos were wrong. I told our waitress who apologized, said that this was her last night working for the company as they were very unprofessional, and she then said since I am taking the food back and having them make you a whole new plate would you like me to add ground beef. I said sure thinking it was Bully's way of turning a bad experience into a good one. I then waited 15 minutes for new plate to arrive. By that time my daughter was finished with her food. When they brought the check I was SHOCKED that they charged me for the ground beef. THEY USED HAVING TO CORRECT THEIR ERROR TO UPSELL! Not very classy Bully's.
Food was okay. Place is pretty small too. Both chicken dishes we ordered were a bit rubbery but the waffles were delicious.

It is unbelievable how BAD the customer service at this store is. All I wanted was a screen door with a doggy door. You would think I ordered the a customer house from another country. First we go in to get the screen door, that was in the beginning of December. First they tell us we have to have someone come out and measure. Of course we can't pay for everything...ooooo noooo.. of course you have come back once the measurements are done. But wait... to get the measurements you have to pay a fee. Ok, finally the guy comes and measures. Now we finally have time to make it back and pay for the door. Great! OoO they have to order the door, that takes almost a month, finally the door the comes, now we wait for the installer to have time. It is now February 22nd, over 2 months!!! The guy (who was an hour late to install the door) opens the box, and bam! The door has a 2 inch gouge in it. Are you kidding me?!?!? 2 and half months and I still don't have a door. The solution... we have to wait for them to order another door... 3 weeks.. It is ridiculous how incompetent home depot has become. There was a time you could go here and get great advice and help. Now your lucky if the person you deal with knows their own name.

Spoke to a salesman over the phone and was given a quote on my trade. I then went in to purchase a new Corvette and was told my trade was worth $1000 less. Bait & switch. I left and went to Ferman in Brandon and was offered $1000 more than the original offer by Maher.

Man. So I think other breweries are upping their game.  Used to be a huge fan of this place, but as soon as they got bigger the little things slide. Restrooms for instance are about the same as the reid park public ones.  Service. It's either decent. Or hella bad.  Seems if you are not pounding beer after beer all the white chick servers avoid you. Which is all I saw working there last night.  Now what used to be my fave is the beer...sadly it's just ok. I'm not impressed anymore.  Prices are in line but damn. We as a city have some solid beer being crafted and this place seems tired.  I don't really care about the awards the beer used to win...I care about the awards it should be winning and changing. Very sad as this place is owned by some heavy rollers.  And they may fall into the nimbus ...oh brother where art thou ...nimbus vanishing

ANSOLUTELY worst experience ever.. I need a nail repaired & a young nail tech actually hollered at me for touching the ends of the torn nail.. she thought I was going to allow her to complete my mails after continuing to chastising me as though I were a child.. In fact I'm a middle aged professional.. will never return!!

This New England location appears to be permanently closed due to structural damage that the owners refused to fix. That's what I gathered from a City of Philadelphia Department of Licenses and Inspections sign on the front door several months ago. Sorry, folks, but we liked it too.

The manager values technicality over customer service. We will never go back, the manager said that 20 dollars is more important than repeat business and the owner would be fine with that. I know it sounds silly but we have gone to this restaurant 30-40 times in the past years and always recommend and bring people in with us. There is just no customer loyalty anymore.

Came here to get a friend something for health and protection only to be left feeling like i walked into a tourist trap. I explained what I was looking for to the cashier (middle aged man with a lump on his cheek) and his side kick (younger guy who looked like he could care less, and was supposedly the "reader" for the day) only to be told they need the name and birthday and to just order something online and handed me a business card. Really??? I came from California and wasted my time coming here to be made to feel foolish and left on my own to figure something out or order online? Damn....the older guy was more into sitting on his ass bopping to his 80's music than helping customers, I came in looking for an experience and help for a friend, what an incredible waste of time....only reason for the 2 stars is they seem to have supplies, just don't ask for help with any of it.

I used to come here just about every day for lunch because the food was good and fairly quickly prepared. My most recent experience left a horrible taste in my mouth (both literally and figuratively). I waited over 35 minutes for a stir-fry and when I got it the package was half-empty and everything inside was completely burnt. Will not be coming back here - several better and quicker options nearby.

I'm still in shock at how we were treated at this restaurant. We had an 8pm reservation and when we got to the restaurant we did not see the sign that said wait outside. It was a pretty small sign. We walked in and the waitress approached us and instead of welcoming us to the restaurant she got pretty nasty with us saying that we needed to stay outside to wait for the hostess. We went outside the hostess came and she made up for the rude waitress but told us we had to wait even though our table was ready because they were too busy to handle us. 

I can get over all of this but once we sat down things hit rock bottom. 

Our waiter arrived and made a joke saying I'm the lucky one who has to serve you guys. Well at least we thought it was a joke. Everytime we asked for something straws, a ginger ale he had a snarky comment. We were ruining the environment, annoyed looks that we were asking for things (is this not your job?). But he actually scoffed and rolled his eyes at me because I specifically asked him if they could add a side of fries to my tacos and he said yes but then brings me out the pomme frites on the  menu which is covered with feta. I can't eat cheese  and I knew the fries on the menu had this which is why I specifically asked if they could just make me a side. When I told him the mistake you would have thought I cursed at him. He snatched up the fries rolled his eyes and said whatever. YOU ARE IN CUSTOMER SERVICE AND TIPPED BASED! Act accordingly! 

So as you might have guess we tipped but not my standard 18-20% The manager came over and asked us how the service was and we told her it was atrocious and we asked her to sit with us so we could tell her what happened and she just said oh it was the service? Shrugged and said have a good night and walked away!!! 

She didnt even care to listen to what happened. 

Needless to say never going back!

Not impressed. Called to place an order for delivery and was told I had to order through a delivery app so I ordered through the Caviar app. I ordered duck over rice with greens. Received a few pieces of bone with skin on it, fat with skin on it and a couple of tiny pieces of duck which were extremely nasty. Came with dry white rice and some kind of half cooked green vegetables. I also had pan seared pork dumplings which had no distinct taste, just really bland.  What a waste of money. I will not be ordering from here again.

I wanted so much to like this place from the start as I am a huge fan of their former beer partner. It just didn't work.  So after the transformation, I was hoping for a positive change. Unfortunately, the place is still unimpressive. Not worth it.

I was just in this restaurant this weekend. I ordered food twice within 30 mins. Just chicken wings and they were DELICIOUS. HOWEVER, when I went in the second time to pick up my second order of wings, I witnessed one of the employees take a napkin to wipe her nose, took the same napkin she used to wipe her nose and used it to dry out a bowl and then put it away. And did it right out front in plain sight where the registers are. I will not be eating here ever again.

We (me, my wife and our 16 y.o. daughter) had a late lunch at Circle 7 yesterday.  The place was not crowded and we were seated promptly by a pleasent hostess.  

The booth was comfortable and we found the taps at every table very interesting - especially fun for those who like beer.  The interior is filled with largeflat screen TV's everywhere you look. I will admit I personally do not like this in any restaurant.  The place has a strong sports bar and restaurant vibe.  

The menu was fairly typical for this kind of a place.  My daughter ordered the Tuna Taco's which came with rice and beans and my wife and I split the Brisket Natchos.  The natchos were a 5 on a 10 point scale and the tuna a 7.  The brisket on the natchos was fatty and was not cooked for service.  The portion of chips was generous but the rest of the ingredients were skimpy.  They need to up their game - smoke the brisket or cook it rare and prep it on a flattop for service the way you would for a great philly cheese.  The tuna tacos were decent - nothing to get excited about but certainly acceptable.  We'd wished we had gone to Nacho Mama's.

The service was good and our waited was very nice.  

The bill was $28.73 before tax.

Will we return - probably not.

Would I recommend this restaurant - perhaps for someone who wants to tap their own beer watch a plethora of TV's and eat acceptable food.  Otherwise - I would suggest you try someplace else where the food and atmosphere are both better.

I tried to order a Great Pumpkin in a smaller size, but was told it only comes in regular or bigger. Then they only fill it up 75%. When I complained, he said it's a specialty, and that's why. I said it doesn't make sense to charge for a regular then give smaller quantities. He acted like somehow I was dumb for thinking a regular size cup should have a regular amount of custard in it. There are actually better places to get custard in our region, like Andy's, that don't treat customers like idiots over "specialty" custards that are really no different.
The line outside is nothing compared to the wait for our food!  I'll let you know how it is, if we ever get it. Hangry!

The green beans were obviously canned, and, even worse, something in the dish tasted rotten, like it was going bad.  I think it was the coconut milk. 
Being too much of a wimp to say anything, I ate it anyway, and felt lucky to not get sick.

Red King 2 is ktv restaurant, meaning if you buy certain amount of food you get access to their karaoke room for free. However, their food is either too salty or too spicy. I can't really taste too much beyond that. Disappointment. One of the cooks was smoking outside when our group was walking in. We saw him wiping his hands on his apron. I hope he washed his hands when he returned to the kitchen. Probably won't go back unless we really really need a karaoke room.

I have bern going here for about 3mnths and i just wish they were nicer and better customer service i spend about $100 everytime i go and just alwaya seem so rude this last time i went i got my nails done by a new girl which ia fine if she was npt digging out her own product and my nails did not break of and lift next day mind you i got them done Sunday by Monday afternoon they were breaking not only that but because they are closed on Tuesday now i have to wait until Wednesday to go back so they can see what has happen...also another time i was there my cc was not working on there machinevso i paid cash and the tech started talking about me to others in there language not ok and not professional at all...after this i will never be back and i hope that they fix this problems

Thought the place had great ambience. However asked Kate the hostess if we could move to the next table that came open just as we were sat, for a better view of the musicians. Was told no. 7 or 8 min later when seating 2 new guests, offered them up the requested table along with another and asked for thier preference, right in front of me. Felt like I didn't deserve the accommodation. 

Also asked if I could put an order for more food, but since I didn't ask my server, was not helped. Just paid check and left.  Went from "cool place" to "rude staff" in 25 minutes.
Will skip next time in the neighborhood.

Madeline and female bartender were great though.  Bummer their support staff was off-putting.

On 8/4/2018 I brought my cat in who was severely dehydrated upon arrival they took her back to be examined $85 exam.About 30 minutes passed and the nurse calls us to the back room and presents us with a quote of $3,292  to treat my cat after we advised her that amount was to much and we did not have that amount of money if they could please work with us on a lower amount and try to at least get our cat stable to where she was not dying or suffering (we do understand this is still a business), after waiting another 2 hours the doctor Dr.Tucker entered the room with our cat in hand and said here is your cat and here is the condition she is in as if to apply pressure to us to pay that huge amount she was really pushing for care credit and just placed her on the exam table and  in a very rude tone stated that is the amount that is due for treatment  and we once again explained to her that was a very high amount to run test on her if she could please just at least get her stable and we would take her to the vet to do the blood work and urinalysis (due to it being Saturday the vet was closed) she then just walked out of the room and left our cat on the table who was severely dehydrated our cat was on the table for 4 hours before anyone returned to speak to us and every time someone would come in they would just speak in regards to the money not once did anyone say anything in regards to our cat or even show a kind gesture towards our cat or even check on our cat who laid there no water nothing. After sitting there for hours finally they give us a different quote of $554.00 dollars which was just to give her IVYs and keep her over night we payed this amount and still our cat lay there not being treated for another 30 minutes. We left our cat there at 5pm and received a phone call at 2am from a different Dr. pm shift stating our cat was doing better but still was having some complications but she was seeing improvement this Dr. was kind and actually sounded like she cared  at 5:30 am when I arrived to pick up my cat Dr.Tucker the same dr who was very rude and unkind to us at the initial exam stated our cat had not made any improvement (our cat was actually moving its head and tail and looked at you when you called her name and was meowing) when we initially brought her in she wasn't doing any of that)but apparently that was no improvement in her eyes she stated that we should just euthanize her as I sat there crying and attempted to discuss what we should do with my family because she was our family cat and is like family to us Dr.Tucker then states can you please hurry up I have other patients I need to see and walked out of the exam room. This clinic does not care about our pets they just care about the amount of money you are willing to pay they take advantage of the love you have for your pet what they are to them is not pets...money. I'm sure she was pushing Euthanization to charge and additional fee for that.  SVH and Dr. Tucker shame on you for treating a animal like she was nothing as a vet you should have more sympathy it's easy to become cold and un compassionate when dealing with situations over and over that  it becomes routine at that point you should really reconsider a new line of work.  In the rush of trying to save our baby girl I did not read all the horrible reviews this place has. I LIKE MANY OTHERS ALSO WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE. Our cats name is Fiona and she is the best companion listener and friend to us she was more then a cat she grew  with us and is part of our family she counted on us and unfortunately we failed her by taking her to you. Oh yeah and the cat you wanted to euthanize is walking by the way and doing better no thanks to you.

Nice looking bar; however, the service was horrible. Our waitress was nice but clearly overwhelmed despite it not being very busy.  She complained about how many tables she had and took 30 minutes for our first drink order.  The food was okay, but for a $17 cheeseburger I would expect something better than a stale bun and burnt cheese.

I would go again to sit at the bar and have a drink but would not recommend for a sit down meal.

They had horrible services! Waited to be seated for 20 mins when there was tables already there to be seated. They were talking in their language which I understood saying that we were inpatient. So I explained that people have been waiting for 20 mins.

First of all, the salsa has an odd flavor which was fairly strong. We decided we thought it was garlic. The chicken enchilada Suizas was not good at all. I do not like dark meat chicken and fat chunks in my enchiladas and overall it was bland. One of our party got a salad with grilled chicken and she said it was pretty good. There was a heavy smoke flavor on the chicken but overall she would order it again. I'm not sure what the other 2 people got but both of them said they would not go back.

We spent almost $600 and they wouldn't allow us Landry select points. The food was mediocre even the bone in rib eye. Trust us we have been to all of the steakhouses in Philly and this is one of the worst. As a new Landry select member you would think they would make an exception since we didn't know "all their rules" as they never responded to our email when we asked. Thus we will never venture into another Landry's establishment and this is probably reason #1269 as to why this place and other Landry restaurants in Philly are SUB PAR. Wake up Landry, you all have to wake up before you start closing your doors. Del Frisco's, Butcher & Singer and Barclay Prime are the top 3, in that order. Morton's is a no no and we would rack them as "unranked" like a crappy NCAA basketball team

Let me start by telling you that if it wasn't for the service, I would have scored them less. Chicken salad was mediocre. BLT chicken salad was served in a cold limp wheat toast. Since when is toast limp? Bacon was sub par and the lettuce leaves had black spots on them. Grape salad sounded innocent enough, well it is grapes with a whipped sweet cream and crunchy topping. It was strange and not a good strange. The cookie was half frozen.... not a good experience. But wonderful staff

I came here on Saturday when it was beautiful out with my friend. We went to the hostess and put my name down, along with my phone number to be seated for a table for 2. The hostess said it shouldn't be long so don't go too far. We said we would be right outside due to the high traffic of people coming in and out. 

My girlfriend and I were chatting for about 30 minutes when we noticed people who were coming in after us were being seated. I walked up to the hostess and asked how much longer for Brianna. She scanned the paper, as if I never put my name dow, and I pointed saying where it was and that it was crossed off. She got nervous and said she called me but I didn't answer. I then showed her my phone's recent calls and that I had no missed calls.  

I asked if they could accommodate us next due to the mistake and she said no and that I would have to wait 30 more minutes for a table. Ive worked in the service industry for 10+ years and would have never shoved a customer to the bottom of the waiting list. TERRIBLE customer service.

I will never attempt to eat here ever again and I will make sure my local friends know about my experience as well.

Dierbergs Markets it's very Racist grocery store I've been visiting all they locations all them Same Racist Front cashier self check out she is very rude with me yelling me inside the store.  In this location.

If there was an option to give them a 0 rating I would. God help you if your roadside assistance rep calls this company. My husband was stuck on the side of the road for almost 3 hours because this company kept lying to our insurance company and telling them they were a few miles out. BE HONEST!!! This tow truck company lies to take the calls. Then the rude employee who I spoke to had the nerve to get nasty with me when I had the insurance company connect me with him directly. 
I believe the excuse was "we just finished a holiday weekend where many places were closed until this morning" WHAT???!!! What does that have to do with you accepting the call and not being able to handle it! This company should not be in business!

Aperenlty these people don't k ow the difference between potatoes wedges and mashed potatoes!
The mashed taters here are gross... how disappointing... girl at drive thru was sweet the one she asked to put wedges in my order was rude. And probably did it on purpose! Well this is my last time at your KFC

This shop blew a sale with their nit-picky inspection report.  Mind you, good idea to have any used item inspected if possible, but also keep in mind that used items are just that - USED.  To expect a 16 year old motorcycle to work as new isn't realistic and in this case, unhelpful.  Item by item, tires cracked.  Fair, it's Tucson after all.  Steering - some play, prob forks.  OK, 16 year old and play might be expected, but to then say "prob forks" is a judgement, not an assessment.  Did the shop take them apart and check them out?  NOT!  Throttle action - hangs up.  OK, bike hasn't been used for a while, but no mention of whether this is a serious issue or simply inconvenient quirk.  Afterword, said "just needs to be driven a bit."  Battery - 12.6 volts low test bad.  Excuse me, but isn't 12.6 volts OK?  Old oil change?  Judgement, not fact - fact was oil changed within the last week.  Brakes - fluid need flush - fact, done within the last week.  Misses at idle - you expect a 16 year old bike to run like out of the factory?  Coolant flush needed - fact, done within the last week.  Clutch - cable maxed out - finally, some real issue pointed out.  When mechanic finished driving it around the block, "nice bike! Runs great!"  Where was that on inspection report?  My judgement about this shop is SKIP it, no one needs nit-picky.  IMHO, the mechanic who inspected this isn't a seasoned veteran who can judge what is necessary from what is fluff.

Bought a BLT today, and comes with mayo, avocado, etc.  One full sandwich costs $13+.  I made 10 of them of the exact same quality, with thick cut bacon, etc. for the same price this evening.  This place is WAY too expensive!  A 5 egg "the works" omelette cost around $15.  I can make one of the same quality and same ingredients for around $4.  WAY TOO EXPENSIVE!

Denny's is better!

I have lived in Fairmount since 2003. My experiences here have always been mediocre at best, so although my family and I eat out 1-2 times a week, we have not been here for 5 or 6 years.

My wife and I both had a chance to get out of work a little early on a summer Friday, so I said "let's give the London a shot, it has been a while". My wife was surprised at my suggestion, but agreed. 

We picked up our 2 girls, 5 and 8, and made our way there around 5 PM. We were seated in the dining room sunroom area. There were maybe 4-6 total people inside, all in the bar area. 

The server was nice, polite and seemed a bit new or unsure of himself. From here I will go to list form:

1. Glass in sunroom is in bad shape, seemed dirty
2. Server could not answer questions about the beer list and did not offer to get the answers
3. Their produce had not arrived, so no French fries to go with chicken fingers
4. Asked how many fingers came with order, 3 per the server, 2 came out. They did bring a 3rd once asked and the were pretty fresh/good
5. Was told they had broccoli to replace fries, only to have broccoli rabe arrive to the table
6. The bathroom is disgusting and in borderline disrepair
7. Hamburger was ordered medium well, came out barely medium
8. Lobster roll was tiny (smaller than a hotdog), rubbery and generally lacked flavor ($20)
9. Side salads (we were forced to order because there were limited produce options) came out with the wrong dressing and were not fresh
10. After our initial order, the server never again asked if we needed or wanted anything else. 

The manager came over apologized and took the fingers off of the bill. 

We finished up around 6 and during that time 1 other table had been seated, a family with 2 kids younger than mine. 

I want every restaurant in Fairmount to be successful, it is great to have options. Until something changes here, I recommend spending your limited time and $ in the other established or new places in our area that deliver a more consistent experience.  

Once again, my wife was right and it will be another 6 years before we eat here again.
First time ordering here, ordered jerk chicken wings. Thought I heard them putting them in microwave, food came soggy and cold.

Customer Service at the back is horrible

I went there to buy blue crabs early on Sunday morning.  Had to asked like four guys to see if there were any more blue crabs in the back since the ones outside were all dead.  None of those guys speak English so each time I asked, they just pointed their finger to another guy.  The guy named Piah (or something like that) first said no more, but then said ok.  After waited about ten minutes while they keep on filling the display with ice and completely ignored me, the Piah guy decided to help me since I didn't go away as he wished.  He was very angry that he had to help me.  I told him I wanted 24 crabs, so he went and filled a paper bag with 24 crabs and threw it down in front of me and ask Good? in Chinese.  While my Mom and I try to decide if that was enough or do we needed more, he became more angry and very rude.  He told my Mom in Chinese to take it or leave it.  When we told him we want six more crabs, he was about to explode.  He acted like we were there to get it for free even though it was $4.92 per lb.  He proceeded to get us six more crabs and basically throw the first bag on the counter instead of handing it to me and threw the second bag into my cart.  He looks like he was about to kill me and all was because I show up there to ask to buy crab too early.  He just wanted to fill the ice and put out the fish on the display.  If I didn't tell people that I will cook them crab yesterday, I would have taken those two crab bags and threw them back at him.  Came up to pay and ask the cashier to speak to the manager or the owner.  The cashier said the owner is cooking and is too busy to come out to see me.  Cashier was nice about it, but all those guys back there are horrible.  Cashier said they had a lot of complaints about this guy and that he is new.  If you don't speak their Chinese language, they treat you like dirt and acted like we came there to bother them.  I don't know where the owner found these guys, but they obviously hated working there and it shows in their attitude.  

Be warned if you want to get any service in the seafood or meat department at this MD store.  The MD in Pinellas Park is a lot friendlier.  I will try to very best not to ever return to this store.  If I need to buy something from them, I rather drive all the way to Pinellas Park to get it.  Wish I know other places that sell blue crab.

Faulty advertising and bad customer service. As someone who has done many different VIP experiences for various artists through multiple companies, I was very disappointed by CID Entertainment. I purchased the Machine Heart VIP Upgrade package for Kelsea Ballerini with the understanding that it did not include a meet-and-greet, but that it DID include an "unapologetically pre-show experience," as advertised on their website. This would be my fourth time attending Kelsea Ballerini VIP at various tours of hers, and in all previous VIP experiences she attended the pre-show to interact with fans, play a few songs, and do a Q&A, which was an awesome overall experience I'll never forget. Nowhere on CID's website did it say Kelsea would NOT be in attendance at this event, nor was it mentioned on the email I received giving details about the "Unapologetically Pre-Show" which was not in fact a show at all. Essentially, CID is charging 79 dollars for fans to stand in a room and look at pictures of Kelsea Ballerini, and when I contacted them to express my disappointment I received little sympathy or assistance in return. I hope Kelsea chooses another company to work with in the future, because this one is making her look bad and frustrating her fans.

If I could give 0 stars, I would give this place just that.  Mediocre food but the service, oh man, the service is consistently TERRIBLE!!!  My family has walked out several times after being seated and unattended to at all for 20+ minutes on a few occasions.  The kicker is all the times we have gone and received horrible service, they are hardly busy - practically empty.  Sometimes they don't even write your order down only to horribly screw it up, poor communication with customers and staff.  I don't know how this place is still there in business.  Awful!

Do yourself a favor and do NOT book here. The staff is rude, not accommodating and it's a cluster of a resort.  Worst experience we have had. 

Our family rarely gets the opportunity to get everyone together and the holiday for the fourth was one occasion. My dad booked rooms and we thought what a great time it would be. Well it started a week before. They couldn't find the reservations so my dad had to drive over and sit and wait while they figured it all out. Then we get there. They tried charging a 40 resort fee Per room even though we already paid through Expedia. Then we were told we could not reserve beach chairs until 9am on the day you want them. However they rented to some guests the night before even though we were downstairs at 7am waiting.  The elevator to the 6th floor was broken so we had to go up to five on one then walk a flight of stairs or go to end of property to get the next elevator.  Even though it's supposed to be a resort it's not a private beach and they have a shallow lagoon area where they allow boats and jet skis to  come into the shallow water and anchor while playing loud vulgar rap music. Not good for kids trying to swim. Then we were told no coolers were allowed but when we complained about the boats they tell us it's a public beach - how can they allow anyone to come in a boat, use their beach and bring their own coolers but for those that paid 250 a night that we can't?  At night they have live music but they also charge a cover and let anyone else in - this is not a resort, it's a hotel with a night club basically. I called weeks ahead for reservations for their buffet and were told they had no reservations available or room for our party but was able to book four separate reservations at prime time through open table. The staff is rude and not friendly at all and the management is even worse. They have no clue how to run a resort and it's a total cluster. Do yourself a favor and book anywhere but here - especially if you have kids and want a relaxing time.

I wish I could leave 0 stars. This place is absolutely terrible. Crazy loud, way too crowded. Waited an HOUR (no exaggeration) for a gin and tonic that had literally (no exaggeration) a half ounce of gin. I'm a bartender and when I looked at the bartender like "wtf?" she shrugged her shoulders and walked away. 
- Loud club music (not country music)
- crazy lony waits for terrible drinks
- uncomfortably warm inside

I used to like this place it's gone down fast. The soup is very salty the rice tastes like it was left over and the plantains were frozen in the middle and it's Tuesday. They close Sun/Mon. Not happy. I past a dozen places and thought I would have something closer to home. Waste of money spoke to the owner and said it must've been my taste buds since I'm not feeling well. He was willing to credit. Wow! Bad business! Stay away! They won't last

The people are rude when you call and the customer service is non-existent. DON'T EVER USE FRANKLIN AMERICAN MORTGAGE!! They told us that we are in a flood zone & need to purchase a flood insurance policy. In order for us to get a policy, we need an elevation certificate done by a certified land surveyor. Had problems finding a surveyor with the time to do it and then more time taken by the insurance company. Through this entire process I called the mortgage company with updates, telling them we were working on it and letting them know about all of the problems. Well, I found out today that they purchased a policy against our escrow account on 10/28. I had spoken to them on 10/29 and not a word was said about this and they gave me an extension to purchase the policy! The letter I received today is dated 11/7, so 10 DAYS AFTER they purchased this policy and I only received it today, which is 1 WEEK after they dated the letter. It took me 8 days to receive the original letter! Oh, and their policy is over $2100 more than the one we purchased!!

The wait time was great! The server was great! The food was horrible!  I had the ribeye with broccoli and asparagus which came out cold by the time I got the new vegetable I add finish my steak. My party also ordered the fried shrimp basket and the shrimp and batter tasted strange. The only one that was happy with my son who got grilled chicken breast pretty sad for the price.

would have to say this is most disgusting place ever 2 and a 1/2 weeks ago I came here with my brother I ordered a guacamole Burger my brother ordered another hamburger by the time we got it our food was cold as can be I ate my hamburger because I was so hungry and/or because this place was the only space open at that time a night which was 930 while 3 days later I got an alert on my Yelp review of a manager kind lady contacted me I talked to her she sent me some vouchers in the mail which was very appreciated it and I went in there tonight with my dad my brother Lorne by daz never been there but I use one my free vouchers for the Burger and I had it to the guy the guy was not very happy at me but OAA and so I we are seeing at our table my brother and I got our food 1st and we just waiting on my dad's hamburger and it was done but the guy a that kit red starred was helping some other people and doing the red shirt and talking and shed chatting with them why my dad's food was ready behind them just getting cold and what really ticks me off this they gave us fries up my dad ordered the fries were called they try to pass it off to us when we went back and asked them for fresh fries the young kid was countered not happy but he came back and gave his fresh price war 6 parents ever I will not be coming back here again even though I have 3 more free vouchers I won't use those I would just got a in-and-out Burger and I hope the manager calls me back she has my phone number on my Yelp page  Below is a picture of the crew that was working tonight and slow war screw ever these guys were talking a LA goofing around not really caring customer service they sucked

I walked into this restaurant raving to my boyfriend about the salad and breadsticks and how excited I was for him to try it. We walked in and saw there might be a wait, but didn't mind. It was about 9:30pm on Satruday September 8th. I walked in excited and the host walks up, doesn't even say hello, immitadiatly greets me with the rudest additude and goes "How many?" And I said 2 please! And without even looking up she says, "Its a 30 minute wait." I said okay thats fine. And she says "name?" And my boyfriend gave his name. James. She was so rude and it was so off putting that both of our moods instantly changed. As a host you are the first face a customer sees. I immediately thought if she is acting like this how will the service be? So I walked back up and gave her the buzzer and my boyfriend and I left off to find a restaurant where we will be treated well and respected upon walking in. We want to feel like those at the restaurant we are eating in want us to be there. Maybe she was having a bad day, but she should NOT be working the front desk her attitude was unprofessional and ridiculous. I will never go back to the Olive Garden Springfeild location.

I've eaten their food 4 times -- 2 dine ins, 2 take outs.
Each time it took at least 30 minutes and up to 1 hour for food to show up, despite the place being almost empty.
Resulted in 4 episodes of diarrhea.
One time the waitress (or owner) sneezed while carrying my bowl of noodles, and she had the guts to calmly set it on my table without saying a word.

One of the worst stays I have ever experienced. Most shocking part, is literally no one cared enough to respond. I checked in late one evening, the day before my wedding, as my first look was there. I was staying in a suite, and paid a pretty price for it. The person checking me in was a little out of it, but nice enough. Once I was checked in, and was told my room is on the 6th floor and tricky to find, she asked if I'd be willing to ask the bell man for help...  he was extremely rude and wouldn't help then told me I can take the cart but needed to return it back to him... The restaurant was god awful, I couldn't even eat. Ordered chicken and green beans. The beans were still frozen, the chicken and potatoes were so dry and salty, it was horrible. The following day, the AC stopped working, as I was getting ready for my wedding!!!! When I called to let them know they were annoyed that I called. Then hours later nothing changed. I called again(3x) until they finally sent someone up. Who was as rude as everyone else I had come into contact with. I reached out 2-3 times to discuss my experience with management and no one bothered responding.. I don't write many reviews, but this definitely deserved one. If you can, stay somewhere else... literally anywhere else.
The owner is beyond rude and has no customer service skills. Food and coffee were decent but I had a terrible experience here.

After reading the reviews, I was excited to visit this restaurant. The food is very average.  Nothing that we had was even close to great. The service was good, but we were two of the four people there (not busy).  Surely not worth the drive from Brewerytown.  I don't recommend this place nor will I return.

The only good thing I can say about this location is it is conveniently located to my home. The lack of attention to detail with orders is stunning. EVERY order comes out incorrect: "Green tea no milk no sugar" comes out as coffee double double. "Medium decaf one sugar" comes out as black coffee. A request for decaf coffee is almost always met with a reply "we don't have decaf right now, can you wait 10 minutes?" I've politely asked countless times to please pay more attention to the orders. But nothing changes...except that now I won't go back there anymore.

This is the worst company I have ever dealt with. I will never use them for my prescriptions again. Not just one bad experience, but many. They said they sent my prescription but I never received it and they still insisted I pay for it or they would not pay for other medications until they got the money to the tune of $ 495.00, for nothing. My advice to everyone, use your regular pharmacy, these people are ruthless, they don't care about the customer. The worst customer service. Don't give them your credit card they will bill you without consent and good luck getting a credit.

We went there with a group who had previously notified the bar that we were coming and wanted to sit outside. 
We arrived to an already frustrated server. We asked if they had any umbrellas. They had three but every one was broken. One was set up but later collapsed almost taking the ear off of me. I removed it from the table and set it aside. The server was pissed about that. She didn't see the near miss accident tho. Our vodka tonics came as club soda and vodka. We got some resistance to getting them replaced. 
Our food was a Greek salad which was ok. We also ordered the calamari which was breaded with a super salty mix. We had to peel off the coating in order to eat it. 
We won't be back after experiencing a failure in service and palatable food. 
The server did not charge us for the first drinks and she pointed this out to us.

Consistently gets orders wrong on takeout. Three times in a row. Wrong, missing items. Ordered a full salad with lots of toppings yesterday and arrived home to a salad fit 25 percent of what it should have been. A rip off.

Yelp does not usually send me in the wrong direction. I have traveled many times believing and trusting in Yelp reviews. This is one of the very few times yelp has misdirected and lied to me. I do not know how this place has so many 5 star reviews. I ordered the stuffed shrimp as an appetizer and  boudin balls, they were both just OK.  It wasn't 5 star worthy at all. I also had the blackened red fish which taste more like a cheap swai fish. Whatever pudding textured sauce, stuff under the fish did nothing to enhance the flavor, it really had no flavor whatsoever. I started to add seasoning to the red fish which was bland and not very flavorful eirher. I ordered a side of seafood dressing which taste like molasses cookies, I didn't taste any seafood in the seafood dressing it was horrible. The sides that you get are on a small saucer so I have red beans and rice and greens enough of it to feed a 3 yr old. I didn't go home hungry because I got two appetizers not because my plate was so full. The service was okay but everything else the food was just not anywhere near what I was expecting. I really do not know how this place got all these 5 stars w 2000 reviews. I just don't understand, how this is even possible because I was so very underwhelmed by this food. I give the food 1 star.

A better name would be Imperfect Plumbing! They charge double the price of other plumbers in the area. The kid that came out to give us a bid threw prices up in the air without even considering the job. He wanted over $450.00 to put in a faucet! That didn't include the price of the faucet! It's about an hour to an hour and a half job to install a faucet. Most plumbers charge from $75.00 to $100.00 an hour! A total rip off! Way overpriced!! There are some excellent plumbers you can find that charge fairly and are honest! Look elsewhere!

I was pumped to find a Thai restaurant in Brownsburg.   Quick review:   Food was average.   I ordered the Pad See Ewe and added two extra vegetables   The entree was already supposed to have vegetables so I expected much more than what I received.  The biggest reason for not rating higher was price.  $16 for one entree to go seemed a bit much.   I was hoping to leave another half star but Yelp wont allow.

New to the area and was glad to find a Chinese place right behind my house..what a nightmare it was. I ordered online and was told to pickup in 20 min. When I arrived there was a line of people so when I finally got to the counter 20 min later I figured they would surely have my order ready. Nope didn't even start it. I watched as the lady took out frozen sweet and sour chicken that I ordered and put it in the microwave...I continued to wait for my found an another 20 min went by. They asked me several times to clarify my order and were just very unprofessional. After easily a 45 min wait I gave up and just left the store. What a joke. Never again.
I'm never talked to when I'm in this store. I think the staff is rude. If I was customer serviced more I would spend way more money than I do. I don't think I'll be shopping here anymore

The worst experience I've ever had. It took 30 min for the waiter to even acknowledge us, actually they never acknowledged us we ask a bust girl for a waitress, and when she finally came to our table she had a bad attitude. My Wife, and I left and decided to go somewhere else. This place is very poorly managed, too many bust staff, and not enough waitstaff. If I could give 0 stars I would. I'll never step foot in this place again. They will probably go out of business in less than 5 years unless the management is changed.

Staff quickly took our order. I asked for eggs Benedict, but asked to omit the ham. They did bring my order without the meat, but also they didn't put hollandaise sauce on it. I asked the waiter to please bring it back and add hollandaise, which he did.  

My lady friend ordered crab Benedict. When I asked her opinion of her breakfast, she said "it was nasty".  There was a piece in hers that she had pulled out of her mouth which had crab leg shell. She asked for a spicy Bloody Mary, but it wasn't spicy at all, and she had to add hot sauce to it.

My male friend commented that his had browns weren't crispy whatsoever and we're more like potato mush.  He pulled out something he almost broke his tooth on which when we all examined it we determined it was a bone shard. 

My dish was pretty tasty, once they brought it back and added the hollandaise sauce. The hash browns had a nice flavor but definitely should have been a little crisper. There was also one giant hunk of hash browns within that pile on my dish that was rock-hard in a clump and I swear I almost broke a tooth when I tried to chew it before I realized it was a hard clump. 

From where I sat beside the kitchen door, in my view was a garbage can leaving up against the area where the cashier is. The floor under and around that garbage pail, and the wall behind it, looked like it hasn't seen a mop or been wiped down in literal eternity. It was revolting to have that within my line of sight as I was eating food. If they leave where I can see in that condition, I could only imagine the status of the kitchen. 

Won't be back ever, nope, that's a wrap.

When we walked into the hotel, the middle of the floor was taken up due to renovations, and a crew was working rather loudly. We had to wait in line for at least 15 minutes before we were checked in. The lady at the desk was very friendly, and did make a point of giving us a room on the second floor. When we went to our room, however, it was dirty so we had to go back downstairs and get a different room. We were given a room on the third floor & told it was an "upgrade" but it was no different from any of the other rooms. When we woke up the next morning, I discovered a ton of ants in the bathroom. When I reported this to the front desk she just said, "oh ok I'll have someone spray it"; no one apologized or anything. The fitness room & breakfast were good, but overall I was very displeased as I've stayed in IHG hotels before & have never had so many issues.

Let me tell you just one of the many tricks Express Scripts does to avoid shipping medications and putting patients in danger.  Notify the patient his medication is due to ship on said date.  Then when said date comes, they send you another notice, "they are waiting for doctor's approval" before they can ship your medication.  They will not tell you before, they will tell you, when they know it's too late and will never ship on time because of the time lost to get approval and get the slow wheels turning again.  Avoid them if you can, but most of us are forced into this insurance.

Had Friends install a kitchen faucet.  Evidently not installed properly so faucet started spinning since it was loose.  I called Tom & asked if someone could tighten the faucet...he said sure, for $75.  Had several jobs done by this company--they obviously don't care about repeat customer.  Too many good cos out there to put up with lousy service.

We came in to buy tacos tonight. Apparently the "kitchen closes" (like it's a bar or something that does anything other than serve food) if you come in five minutes before the place closes. How long does it take to make tacos anyways? Those of us (AKA most people) who have ever worked in the food service industry have zero sympathy for having to keep a kitchen open until, ya know, the restaurant closes.

I ordered delivery through GrubHub and my order came hot and fresh about 35 minutes sooner than GrubHub expected which is a major plus. The only negative on delivery was the nasty comment that "Ew....You look like you're having a rough day." Yes, I'm at home sick from the flu and it's none of your business to comment on me coming to the door in pajamas and a sweatshirt. You got a 25% tip regardless of whether you were tardy or not. It was extremely unprofessional. 

I ordered a Chicken Parmesan Platter which came nice and hot, but it was made with prefrozen chicken fingers. It's hard to justify a $16.95 price tag with 2 prefrozen chicken fingers, sauce, cheese and a handful of pasta. The garlic roll was quite good, but the salad was included with the chicken parm on delivery so the heat completely wilted the salad and rendered it inedible. 

I'd order from Lovecchio's again, but only as take out.

My husband and I will not be returning to Fireside. I sent an email to the owner letting him know our last experience there. It wasn't good at all, several things were wrong. I just emailed him to let him know and believe me, was not asking for anything in return. 
He emailed me back saying he would be happy to give us a gift certificate, but never heard back from him regarding the certificate. Don't make promises you can't keep. Was really disappointed.

I think I overhyped myself that's why I was so disappointed. Ambiance was okay. You wait in a long line and order to go. Then you pay and pick up some items. That was the confusing part. But basically, everything was really ordered to go. There were tables inside so you can sit and enjoy your food. You kinda have to fight for a seat. 
I ordered a pound of shrimp and a cup of gumbo. The gumbo was a bit different than what I'm used to. I didn't enjoy it as much. The shrimp was really plain. It was prbl the most disappointing part. 
My friend ordered the crab legs and it was okay. He also ordered the crawfish and that was actually really decent. They only have one type of seasoning and one spice level, so I wasn't used to that. I won't be coming back and I most likely won't be recommending this place to others

I recently experienced some of the worst customer service here. I typically dine here multiple times a year and have been doing so for several years now. It's sad to see the service dwindling. I've been noticing the lack of happy atmosphere, but still kept hoping it would get better. Then I recently went there for Sunday brunch..

Yes, it was busy - to be expected. My boyfriend and I went to the bar. We were in no rush but there were open stools. We sat there for about 10 minutes when finally a waitress came by and said "I'll be back with some waters." Another 5 minutes go by. "Here, anything else for you to drink?" I ask for my favorite shake. She literally rolled her eyes, said "one second, I'll be right back."
