As she walked away I hear her say to another waitress, "I don't have time to make damn shakes." She then returned and said, "We're short right now and I just don't have the time to make a shake." And she walked away! 

I've never had a waitress be so rude! I understand it's stressful being short staffed, but a kind apology and a simple, "I can get that for you, I just want to let you know it may take a little extra time at the moment" would have been just fine. My boyfriend and I were so taken aback. We just got up and left. So sad to see such a well known place go so downhill.

If your car is towed to this shop, feel free to shop around. The want to look professional but they are not. My car was towed to this shop after hours, the shop open at 7 and they called me at 10 AM  to tell me they haven't even looked at it. They told me that it will cost me $202 to plug the machine to see what the car has and they won't be able to tell me anything until next day! A total ripoff. I took it to another shop, they charged me much less and told me what the issue was the same day!
This place is a filth bucket that needs to be condemned! The a/c did not work properly so had to eat while perspiration came through my pores.

We stayed at this hotel back when it was the Fess Parker resort and had had a wonderful time.  Despite the incredibly high prices Hilton now charges, nostalgia took us back for our 32nd wedding anniversary. Big mistake.
Our stay started out okay. The hotel staff greeted us reasonably promptly. Our room was large and clean. Parts of the hotel, however, seemed dated and a bit dingy.
There was at least one wedding taking place Friday night, which generated a lot of noise until quite late.
But it was the next morning that was the problem. There was a fundraising walk taking place in Santa Barbara, which ended at the hotel lobby. We were awakened at about 8:30 am or so by a bunch of high school cheerleaders standing more or less below our room drumming and cheering the walkers. The drumming was so loud that even with the patio door closed it was deafening. We could not go back to sleep. We could barely hear one another.
I called down to the management office to find our what was going on. The manager blatantly lied. She claimed she did not know what was taking place and that any noise was coming from off hotel property. A few minutes later I went down to the lobby to discover that walkers were streaming through the lobby and confirmed that the drummers were on hotel property. Why I was told such a blatant lie is a mystery.
Ruined our stay. We left early and the one decent thing the Hilton did was to waive the charge for the second night.
Still, we won't go back.

Was staying at hotel across street, got in late(11pm) and hadn't had dinner yet. Hotel restaurant was closed already and other restaurants within walking distance were closed as well. Hotel staff suggested the Taco Bell across street was open late.

Walked across street to Taco Bell. Sit down area was closed but drive-thru was still open and doing business.

Walked over to Drive-thru to place order. No one at the order location box would respond. Walked over to pickup window.

A Taco Bell employee opens the window and says, "We don't serve walk ups".

Explained that I was staying at hotel across street and showed him I had cash (to pay for my meal). He repeats same line and just stands there with the window open.

I plead my case about I hadn't had dinner yet and was just trying to get a late night meal. He just stands there and repeats the same line again about not serving walk ups.

I don't know what this guy's problem was. If they're afraid of getting robbed, I showed him I had cash and fact he's standing there with the window wide OPEN, that doesn't appear to be the case.

There was NO ONE in line behind me and NO signs that they don't serve walk ups.

I saw there was another review about terrible service at this Taco Bell. Maybe YUM Brands (owner of Taco Bell) should consider revoking this franchise's license...

They missed picking up our garbage.  I called them and they told me they would pick it up the next day.  I left the garbage out and once again it was not picked up.  Contacted customer service again, waited on hold for over 30 minutes only to have the customer service rep disconnect the call.  Done with this company.  Complete incompetence.  You've been warned.

We enrolled our child in the 3 yr. old program at Primrose and she had a wonderful experience.  She came home each day excited to share what she had learned.  That all changed when she entered the 4 yr. old program.  Several weeks into the year, we knew that something was wrong.  She was no longer excited at the end of the day and when asked what she had learned, her reply was "nothing".  We communicated our concerns to the directors and after several weeks of insistence, the directors finally investigated the classroom.  What they found was that the teacher, who had been hired just a few weeks before the year began, who had a degree in Apparel Design and Fashion Merchandising and not Early Childhood Education, was teaching material that was a full year ahead of the age group of her class.  Without our insistence, the directors would not have been aware.  There was obviously, no governance or oversight of the classroom.  So that our child was in fact "learning nothing" and had not learned for the previous three months.  Needless to say, this set the tone for the remainder of the year.  We were overwhelmed at the end of each day with the offenses that our child had committed, such as throwing mulch on the playground or getting up to hug the teacher. Never, were we informed of any areas of positive accomplishments, When we finally withdrew our child from the program, she had begun referring to herself as one of the "bad kids" at the school.  Parents, grandparents, please advocate for your children and do not expose them to the type of treatment and lack of care and concern that we experienced from the "teachers" and "directors" of this school.

This location is horrible I hate coming here but is on my way home. Service is to slow I understand is fast food but there is nothing about fast in this location I'm not sure if is that busy or just short staff or bad management.

First time here now been open for about a month maybe longer.. absolute garbage.. drinks were not very good unless you order the most expensive ones on the menu.. ordered pop corn shrimp and  If I was lucky about 5 shrimp in my whole order, calamari was okay but again not very great..  best thing on the menu that we tried was honestly the ceasar salad and well let's be real that's hard to screw up.. service was great, quality not so much.. will not be coming back here

Needed Emergency assistance with plumbing issue.  Called at 10 pm and was told they will call me back with an estimated arrival time.  2.5 hours later, I call them back asking for an ETA.  "Someone will call me with that", they said.  Another hour goes by and I call again only to listen to their commercial while waiting on hold for someone to answer my call.  The commercial talks about "quick" emergency service 24 hours a day.  Not for me!  11 hours later I get a call asking if they can come over.  The answer was no, because I already found another company that wanted my service.  Will not be calling ARS again

Beware of mold!!!  

If I could give this place less than 1 Star, I would!!!!!

We used to always go to the Mona's on Carrollton, but haven't been since they closed that location.... We always loved it before, so we assumed our experience at the Frenchmen location would be just as good...

BOY!!! Were we wrong!!!!! What a mistake to eat her!!!!

Where to begin, it wasn't too busy when we came in... but busy enough for a few people to be running around.I dont remember our waitress' name.... she was blonde...friendly (when she actually came to check on us) but talking very loud and inappropriately with other coworkers, and we could hear everything that was being said!!!!! Not very professional... but  they do sit at an empty table and yap or play on their phones, so it's no fine dining establishment!

We had to wave our waitress over a few times just to get her attention. She seemed to let our order sit for awhile,because by the time we got it, it wasn't very hot. We then had to ask her for napkins,since we had none. We were going to let it all slide, until only my husband pointed out the pita chips in our soups were spotted with MOLD on them!!!!! So disgusting!!!!!

MOLD!!!!! ON OUR FOOD!!!!!!!!!



We will not be back!!!!!!!

The steaks were both very over cooked BOTH times they cooked it, however since I had to take the replacement orders to go, I didn't find out they got it wrong a second time until I got home.  The broccoli looked like someone sprinkled it with water and put it in the microwave for 30 seconds.  It was under done, rubbery and dry.  I thought I was getting a loaded baked potato but it was really mashed potatoes and not very good.  It's sad because the last time I ordered this same thing, it was good.  The waiter was nice.  The manager was nice and took off half the charges which at the time I thought was ok until I went to eat at home and realized it was no better than the original order.  IMO I should have paid for my adult beverage (which was REALLY good) and tip because he did try to be a good waiter there just wasn't any decent food other than the chips.

This place was close by and I really didn't feel like cooking. Anyway, we ordered the lemon grass noodle sauté, sweet and sour chicken, and the vegetable egg rolls. I do not think it's worth going into detail. One word sums it up. Bland.
Not impressed.  Got a banana split and it was just ok, nothing more.  Very overpriced for what we got.  We went out of our way to find this place....we will find someplace else next time.

Very. Disappointing. Meal. (2.5 stars)

Read the reviews before dining and thought it'll be worth the experience. Completely wrong. 

Server was somewhat knowledgeable when asking him questions about the food but my boyfriend and I pretty much answered our own questions. 

Cleanliness- the menus were all paper and it looked very unprofessional due to all the wrinkles and sauce spill. The wine glass were very dusty. The spoon for our fried rice had a hair/fuzzy on it.

Food- Sad to say, the lobster fried rice was the best part of our dinner. The wagyu beef and west coast uni was good and kinda what we expected. The king salmon ($9) and otoro ($16) was such a disappointment. Both did not taste like the fish we wanted. The quality and presentation didn't match up to what we wanted. We eat sushi very often so we know what it look like and should taste like. That was not worth the money at all. We also had the chicken and shrimp dumplings, it was okay, very strong shrimp taste. But wasn't hot when it came out. 

Price- Too expensive for bad quality fish.

Where do I even begin with this place.  Just trying to find a spot to park your car so you can go into the place is a mess.  Service has taken up all the customer parking spaces.  It's a madhouse at this dealership.

In order to get me in the door they gave me a very good quote on a 2018 Honda.  When I arrived they told me that they didn't have anymore 2018's but they had 2019's.  The 2019's were only $7000 more.  Bait and switch.

Their Sales Manager Mark was extremely rude and argumentative.  I actually felt bad for their saleperson who was extremely professional throughout the process.  I was ready to punch the guy in his face, it was about as unprofessional as I've seen from a salesperson.  It got to the point where I had to tell the Sales Manager to go take a walk, his services were no longer needed we were fine dealing with the lower sales guy and my wife said she'd refused to do business with them.  

If you're going to go buy a car, find somewhere else.

After waiting for 30 minutes for my coffee, employee "Grace", tells me oh the lady who took your order made your coffee wrong. I said ok ? I continued to wait for approx 5 min while looking over to another young man on the line I asked, I am just waiting for a regular black coffee w a turbo shot. The nice young man said oh its been sitting right here for a while Grace just hadnt poured it yet. Grace was very rude ignored both my wife and I. Grace didnt even announce when orders were ready or what they were causing mass confusion with the customers.

If you want to be over charged or scammed into paying for services your insurance covers this is the place to visit. They act very stupid and dumb shocked when you catch them in the act. They don't seem apologetic and give attitude as a way of deflecting the problem to you. Unfair billing practices!!!! Never again.
Did I personally do something to Scotty?   At this point I must have accidentally insulted his mother or something.  This is terrible service from a once great establishment.

Now closed. They just shut the doors, disconnected the phone and left no information about what happened. Those who had deposits for events are SOOOO stuck. 
Go through open table and you get this message: Permanently Closed - 39 West American Bistro

Once I actually got my food it was good but it took over an hour and half to travel 2 miles so I will probably never order delivery again and if my friends ever want to order it I will tell them last time it took almost 2 hours and we probably shouldn't

The room was ok, (just ok) bathroom was so small...... BTW we asked about the bath when we checked in because I am a big guy , front desk girl said was normal size and nice......
We checked in , as it turns old the bath was extremely small, we unpacked, and went to dinner. When we got back we sat on the beds, and there was serious issues with the beds, it felt like you were on a nosy old wooded boat.   Walls are thin, hard to sleep you hear everything !!!
We called down to front desk manager, and they moved us to another room, The new room was much better and had bathroom that was a normal size, and the beds were ok . !
But they moved us to a room by the elevators, it was beyond nosey, I assume the hotel was just so busy 
So again spoke to front desk, they had no rooms to move us to, so we just decided to leave early they said ok, and sorry no problem, they understood... that would have been ok, but here it is....... The day they we check out they added $239 dollars to the bill for and early departure fee 
I said huh? Spoke to a new manager he was Rude, did nothing and did not care ! 
We left with being billed and extra day for leaving early .. lol 
Anyway I called amex when home will dispute the charge. We get the money back ! 
But in the end the last manager was so rude and bad; I wish I had the name.... But for his great wisdom. It earned this review 
In the end- summary 
Rooms were ok. Some rooms are very nosy, due to old thin walls ( hotel was built in the 1800's ) and I guess many walls or doors have not been updated or better sound proofing , we could not sleep rooms to noset. Some rooms have very tiny baths, and beds that have serious issues. But the worst was the management.... I give the place 3 stars

Zero Stars. Again.

Another incredibly terrible experience with Express Scripts. Over the course of a week, I had the prescription needed sent by doctor directly to them and then was told repeatedly that the order would be processed and expressed shipped in order to get a certain date, as I am going out of county and need this medication prior to leaving. After 4 days of calling Express Scripts because the online account does not reflect this shipping/processing date and 4 times being told- Yes, 100%, it is confirmed to be shipped this Tuesday with overnight delivery and the pharmacy back end has confirmed it's shipping date as well, I was told "No. There's nothing we can do about it. It won't be mailed for another 24-48 hours because there is a temperature sensitive item being shipped." Infuriating. I have received this medication for the past 2 years with NO time sensitive warnings, it's always been left on my porch no matter the weather. When I asked what they would do to remedy this issue, they stated the couldn't do anything to rush the order. They then referred me to local pharmacy- I'm now in the middle of trying to see if my prescription will be covered through a walk-in pharm (insurance has the ability to deny this for this medication) and attempt to coordinate all of this through the pharm and doctor office, who now has to send over ANOTHER script for this medication as it can't transfer from Express Scripts.
How many terrible reviews does it take for change to happen at Express Scripts? I'll be making a formal complaint with the company later today (or tomorrow if today get's taken up with figuring out getting the medication from the pharmacy) and will be contacting Duke University to alert them to the continual absymal service I continue to receive.

Not sure where to begin...unfortunately everything from the beginning to the end was quite a disappointment. We went to this restaurant on the last day of our trip to New Orleans hoping for a last good meal with delicious, local seafood. We loved all the meals in the many other restaurants we visited, so we skipped our research this time. Now we know that we should have checked yelp ratings before. This restaurant has 3 stars for a reason. Food was just average and served with missing items. The hostess and manager were very nice, but our waitress did not seem happy to serve us and her personality consisted of artificial charisma. The manager did try to fix some of the issues but, unfortunately, were not enough to improve the experience

DON'T DO IT!!!!! The music venue is totally worth the ticket. However, as charming as the restaurant is, I was by myself on a Wednesday night and sat for over an hour waiting on tacos and slaw. Had to ask the manager to please get my beer for me after ordering it 20 minutes earlier. I had to get the meal to go as I was working the next day. Scarfed it down in my Uber ride back to the hotel as I was ravenous!While the beer was comped, I was still asked to pay for the meal. That was insulting. Please note that this is my first negative review ever posted after years on yelp.

Horrible service and food I used to go here a lot until I had I bad experience with my quesadilla order. I recently started coming back and last night i came in for taco Tuesday. I bought several tacos and a order of churros but when I got home the churros where completely burnt, so I placed a second order for more tacos today and I told them about my incident with the burnt churros and instead of making it right the manager Marin decided that he would rather argue with me than assist, I will never go back in there and you shouldn't waste your time either.

This place is soo overrated. It was a Friday night so waited a really looong time to be seated but it seemed like we were the only ones waiting because everyone who walked in got a table right away. After about 30 mins we were sat down and our waiter Joseph who an absolute doll brought us water and was attentive to us through our our visit. We ordered the pot stickers which I did not enjoy the pork was too mushy. It was like the consistency of tuna out of a can. We also ordered the beef chow mein it was okay. There was no flavor different between the noodles and the beef. We also ordered a spicy tuna roll which was soso. The last dish that saved the night was the general chicken and broccoli! It was very flavorful and delicious.

UPDATE:  DO NOT become a member of this gym!!!  I finally came in to fully cancel my membership, which I had on hold for a while.  They said they needed to look up my account to do so and scanned my card, later telling me actually a manager had to be present so that front desk person I spoke to couldn't actually cancel my account anyway.  Was not able to get a hold of a manager for quite a while, turns out for those 6 weeks they had begun charging me full membership again because scanning my card reactivated my membership!  So then I had to call corporate to refund my card (good luck finding that number, it's very buried), even a gym manager can't fix that kind of mistake and literally said I'd have to speak to corporate.  So front desk staff does not seem to know what can reactivate a membership on hold nor do they have the ability to cancel accounts, which is a hassle because a manager must be present to do so.  So be aware if you sign up here it will be damn near impossible to cancel or adjust any false charges.  I fully expect they'll continue to try to charge me even though they swear I'm cancelled, in which case screw them, they can take it up with my credit card company because I'll refute the charges.

It was nice experience of getting the car and I was really happy until I got the bill... I was charged with different kinds of "misc" and "other" charges that basically double my initial two-day rate for the car. When I called Hertz, they say that this location is some kind of a licensed dealer under Hertz and they can do whatever. Never again going to rent at this location and I suggest you to stay away from them unless you want to be ripped off

If you want to deal with children selling you guns, go here. I have no experience with the Lakeland store, but this place is no bueno. 
The prices are good, but customer service just plain sucks. 
These kids just joke around and look at you weird and laugh. It's like being in High School all over again. No way would I give them a good review.
Oh, and an hourly gun range fee when I can go to a closer one and pay less for a whole day. Ugh.

Don't hate me, Yelp! This is one of those restaurants that is trying hard to fit into the hipster scene but just doesn't blend in. For me, the food was the culprit. If I see one more menu item with the word "fermented" in the description I'm going to lose it. Just no. Especially if you're a picky eater.

We were having so much fun until our waiter crossed the line and became extremely inappropriate comments, advances, and asked us to get high with him. He then was so distracted with all of that he switched our bills and we ended up charging us more on our bills. This was not resolved and tip was reflected. I think this could have been an amazing time if we had had a better server.

They TRIPLE CHARGED MY CREDIT CARD!  I made a large over $200 purchase and the sales clerk told me I could get 10% off with a coupon that she sent to me by text.  My cell phone has no data plan, so she told me to go to a wifi spot and download the coupon, then bring the coupon code back to the store.  They could then issue me a credit to my credit card for 10%, which was going to mean a credit for about $26.  I said sure!  Came back next day with coupon code and downloaded coupon, but of course there was a different sales clerk on duty who didn't know how to issue me the credit.  She called the store manager over, who also didn't know what he was doing.  The clerk had to enter each of my many items back into the system, as if I was returning them (I wasn't).  But what ended up happening was my credit card was charged again for the same amount.  The third time happened, when she figured out how to get 10% off for each of my purchases, then that grand total hit my credit card.  They told me to contact my bank and do chargebacks.  But the triple charge blew their mind.  They issued me credit for the second amount because it matched the original, but they have to 'investigate' the corrected amount before they will credit the second charge and it will take 30 days.  I've spoken to so many bank people, including ones who barely spoke English!  WARNING: IF YOU HAVE TO RETURN SOMETHING FOR CREDIT, OR IF YOU HAVE A COUPON, BE VERY CAREFUL!  THESE PEOPLE AND THE 'MANAGER' (Mr. Emmit) DO NOT KNOW WHAT THEY ARE DOING! Not only has THEIR ERROR tied up my credit line, but I'm probably taking a hit on my credit score too, as it looks like I made 3 large purchases, when I only made one.

Last day in New Orleans. We planned on having breakfast at this cafe. 
I had an egg white omelette with mushrooms and feta cheese. She brought it with regular eggs first, then had it replaced with the correct order. 
I also substituted my sides with fruits. You can guess how the grapes came in at the very bottom of the cup. Ugh!
My husband had scrambled eggs with potatoes and sliced tomatoes.  the potatoes were covering a layer of over cooked burned potatoes that looked to be leftovers from the morning. Yuck!
Not worth he $25 at all!!!!

What follows is a review of the 15 S 36th St, Philadelphia, PA 19104 Enterprise Rent-A-Car branch not the company as a whole.  So take it with a grain of salt if you are using another branch.

Worst experience with Enterprise I've ever had.  I'd suggest you rent a car at the airport location for staff that "treat customers the way they should be treated."  What follows is my very long story, but I hope it saves some of you from similar experiences.

My story is marked with periods of incompetence and scattered bits of dishonesty.  I rented a mini van for a trip with grandma and the kids to Florida.  The rental bit went fairly smoothly, but while I was driving down 95 in Florida a motorist's tire kicked up a stone and chipped the windshield.  Ironically, Enterprise made a followup call on my rental not more than 30 minutes after. He asked if there were any problems with the rental. I told him that I just got a chip in the windshield from a motorist and asked if it would be a problem.  He assured me, "No that won't be a problem." I guess I should've asked if I'd be charged for the repair instead.  When I returned the vehicle they thanked me for pointing out the damage and said that I'd forfeit my $150 deposit because I returned the car damaged.

They explained that they'd have to have their vendor (Safelite Auto Glass) come out and determine whether they'd need to fix or replace the glass.  Some weeks passed and NO ONE called me to give me any details about the incident. No one called to let me know that Safelite had come out and repaired or replaced the glass.  No one called to let me know if I would receive all or part of my deposit back.

They treated me as if I was just a number, not a person.  There was no communication.  Even after calling and talking with several staff members who always seemed clueless to my situation (as if it was the first they heard of it).  When I had asked for the manager to call me back. I never received a phone call.  

Fast forward 4 weeks. I received an email stating that I had incurred a parking violation 5 hours after I returned the car.  

After several more phone calls and some attention to detail I learned that they incorrectly marked that I returned the vehicle about a half hour after they closed on the day I returned the rental.  In one of my more than a dozen calls I made I asked for the employee to find out when exactly I had returned the vehicle and she said that she couldn't determine exactly but it looked like it was late morning.  She assured me that she could not update my receipt or rental agreement with the correct time.

She also said that her station would have to contact the citations department to accept responsibility for the ticket and she assured me that I would not be charged for it.

Fast forward to today. Charge in the full amount of the parking ticket appears on my banking statement. I call the branch they say i need to talk to the citations department.  I call the citations department and they say THE BRANCH needs to call THEM.  I asked the person if they have a note or any information from the branch about this citation.  She says they don't.  So when they assured me they would contact the citations department they were either lying or incompetent.  Both are serious offenses toward "treating the customer as they should be treated".

My bank has the best solution. File a dispute for the charge and card will be deactivated and new card issued. Unfortunately that's a bit of an inconvenience, but its the best solution that's been presented.

My experience with Enterprise on the whole has been very positive, but this branch was the best bad example of incompetence and poor customer service I've ever experienced (even outside the car rental field).  

I'd suggest you rent your vehicle from any branch that's convenient to you except if it's this branch then I'd suggest you go out of your way to avoid this branch.

After calling the citations department and getting the District Manager's number I was able to get some resolutions. She was extremely helpful and very apologetic.  

She explained that my citation was refunded the previous day (and posted to my account that day) and refunded me my deposit and told them that I didn't owe Enterprise for any damages.


Just when I breathed a sigh of relief after a month I was sent a bill for $108 and change for windshield repair services.

My fiancé says to just pay it, but I feel that since the district manager assured me I don't owe Enterprise anything I'll use my time to waste theirs fighting it on principal alone.

Went there for an oil change, was easy enough. A few days later my 2014 car started acting weird so I brought it back and after 8 hours of it there without a call and t getting close to closing time I called to get an update. They sounded flustered and told me to pick it up but wouldn't say what was wrong. I went up and a tech in the back who rudely said"I know you're a woman so you don't understand any of this" which may be true, but still rude, explained I had an O2 sensor out and some other sensors out. He said it could be up to a grand. Luckily, I still have warranty on my car so I went to my dealership where I should have gone in the first place and they said only the spark plugs were out and an easy fix which was covered. Just annoyed I wasted so much time and was given false information. Definitely don't go to sketchy car places next to a taco bell

If I could give zero stars, I would. They are not upfront about pricing. He sent my blood tests to "sunset labs llc". They charged my insurance 79,000 dollars (yes that's right and yes I have proof) for some blood work. Most of the tests consisted of a drug screen. The lab then sent me a bill for over $700. I called the lab and they wrote the charges off. What type of lab does that unless they're in each other's pockets? Nepute is unprofessional and a scam artist. Take your business to a company that is upfront about pricing.

While I enjoyed my ramen quality wise I was quite disappointing at the service. My only time having come here I was hopeful as I had heard nothing but amazing opinions. Unfortunately for me while I left with a smile I'm still not ready to make it a point to return. 

I was not feeling well and really wanted some ramen. I had not been here yet & decided to call in an order. The girl on the phone was nice also helpful. When I arrived just over 10 minutes past my phone call order, leaving my toddler and fiancee in the car to wait, only because this should not take to long right? Wrong. There was 3-4 tables total in the entire establishment with people seated. I stood in open view at the front desk where you would assume a hostess would be. No one greeted me. The bartender even looked at me several times and said nothing. Finally I assumed "Ok, maybe this is a seat yourself type of place?". I then walked up to the bartender and asked him where I would pick up a togo order? His reply was "Oh, right here". This after several minutes of being looked at standing at the front was quite irritating. I suppose it doesn't make sense that if he was the person in charge to be serving the tables & doing togo, and not slammed busy (which I would have totally understood if that was the case and felt bad for him) would not even greet me nor ask if I could be helped. I waited another 5ish minutes for my order. Paid my bill and left pretty disgruntled to be honest. Hoping others don't have the same issue.

I've been a couple times to get a good review. Always like to give three chances before i review. Nice establishment and good area. They have a couple good people that do good nails. Got the dip before .. if was off in a week.  Another time i asked for white polish that wouldn't change yellow because i was going on vacation. Before i could even leave for vacation they were yellow.  No one really knows how to do designs how I've asked and when i don't like them.. they still charge me for it. Also the last time i went; didn't like the fact I had gift certificates there from a contest at work; they only let me use one stating I could only use one at a time. When they were purchased that was asked and they said it would be ok. Once there they denied me. I don't know what the difference is in two $10 gift cards and one $20 gift card? That completely rubbed me the wrong way. And for that they have lost not just my business, but the business of the other ladies in my office. Don't like being told one thing and then another because of the day. Not cool.

Lackluster experience here that left me cold.  Saw a doctor on first visit who spent only a couple of minutes with me and didn't go into any real discussion of my issue which is causing considerable pain and lack of mobility.  He recommended a follow up appointment in a few weeks and when I went in for that I saw an associate who recommended a very different procedure than first doctor or my chiropractor had been speaking of.  I relayed this experience to my chiropractor who'd recommended this practice and asked for them to explain the vast difference in opinions.  To date nobody from this practice has contacted me to discuss how I essentially wasted months and received no treatment or relief.  Patients may want to be wary of them.  My insurance got billed for two visits and I got nothing but aggravation from them.

My overall impression of this practice is that the patient is merely a cog in the works and no care or time is spent with them as they hurry to get to the next appointment so they can bill more.  The receptionist has blue and pink hair.  The office is in a rather run down area outside of Dover DE.  I have since spoken to a few other people who have not had the best experience there and, like me, have decided to seek another opinion / practice.  Others may have had a different experience with this practice but sadly I have nothing good to relate about them.

I have not used West Coast Fence. My neighbor did. I found them rude and disrespectful of me and my property. I am presently looking for a fence company. Judging from my experience and other reviews I have read, it will not be these guys.
